description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching, as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. With the incredible launch of our ad-supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers. Netflix is seeking an Account Manager who will be an exceptional addition to our growing Netflix Ads team.  The Account Manager will be responsible for leading the pre-to-post-sale campaign execution workflow as a strategic partner to Netflix Agency Sales Partner(s). Our Account Managers will partner with clients and sales on RFP responses, media plan generation, campaign execution, and monitoring delivery performance to ensure flawless execution and excellent client service. Key Responsibilities: Partner with aligned Agency Sales Partners to understand client goals and objectives in order to deliver excellent customer service Host weekly Pipeline & Pacing meetings with Agency Sales Partners to align on upcoming launches and active campaign performance Build Media Plans and contribute to RFP responses around campaign packaging, pricing, targeting, etc. Host campaign kick-off meetings and partner with the client on gathering campaign launch assets Partner with cross-functional teams on the production of custom creative assets Work closely with Ad Operations for flawless order implementation and technical troubleshooting Responsible for overseeing the delivery performance of Ad Campaigns and partnering with clients on necessary campaign optimization tactics Provide clients with necessary campaign performance including post-campaign wrap reports Ability to navigate campaign escalations and contribute to long-term solutions to prevent similar issues in the future Maintain an in-depth understanding of our ad products, sponsorship offerings, targeting capabilities, and ad policies Contribute to monthly billing & invoicing  process with clients and finance Establish strong working relationships with client and agency partners We’re Looking for: 4 years of experience in Account Management and/or Sales Planning functions in the digital media industry, with a focus on video advertising Experience working in Sales Operation systems (CRM, OMS, Ad Servers) Knowledge of digital media sales and marketplaces including Direct IO, Programmatic Guaranteed, and PMP advertising Excellent verbal and written communication skills Fluency in English and Spanish Strong analytical and strategic thinking abilities with the ability to make data digestible for cross-functional stakeholders Proven project management skills with the ability to multitask and manage requests from various stakeholders. Familiarity with Advertising Research and Verification vendors like Nielsen, ComScore, Moat, Integral Ad Science, DoubleVerify, Kantar, etc. If you have a passion for entertainment and a desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment, we would love to hear from you. Come join us and help us entertain the world! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.
search_text:
Madrid, Spain Products & Technology Advertising Account Manager ES Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching, as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. With the incredible launch of our ad-supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers.  Netflix is seeking an Account Manager who will be an exceptional addition to our growing Netflix Ads team.  The Account Manager will be responsible for leading the pre-to-post-sale campaign execution workflow as a strategic partner to Netflix Agency Sales Partner(s). Our Account Managers will partner with clients and sales on RFP responses, media plan generation, campaign execution, and monitoring delivery performance to ensure flawless execution and excellent client service.   Key Responsibilities:
  • Partner with aligned Agency Sales Partners to understand client goals and objectives in order to deliver excellent customer service
  • Host weekly Pipeline & Pacing meetings with Agency Sales Partners to align on upcoming launches and active campaign performance 
  • Build Media Plans and contribute to RFP responses around campaign packaging, pricing, targeting, etc. 
  • Host campaign kick-off meetings and partner with the client on gathering campaign launch assets 
  • Partner with cross-functional teams on the production of custom creative assets  
  • Work closely with Ad Operations for flawless order implementation and technical troubleshooting
  • Responsible for overseeing the delivery performance of Ad Campaigns and partnering with clients on necessary campaign optimization tactics 
  • Provide clients with necessary campaign performance including post-campaign wrap reports 
  • Ability to navigate campaign escalations and contribute to long-term solutions to prevent similar issues in the future
  • Maintain an in-depth understanding of our ad products, sponsorship offerings, targeting capabilities, and ad policies 
  • Contribute to monthly billing & invoicing  process with clients and finance 
  • Establish strong working relationships with client and agency partners
    • We’re Looking for:
  • 4 years of experience in Account Management and/or Sales Planning functions in the digital media industry, with a focus on video advertising
  • Experience working in Sales Operation systems (CRM, OMS, Ad Servers) 
  • Knowledge of digital media sales and marketplaces including Direct IO, Programmatic Guaranteed, and PMP advertising
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
  • Fluency in English and Spanish
  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking abilities with the ability to make data digestible for cross-functional stakeholders
  • Proven project management skills with the ability to multitask and manage requests from various stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with Advertising Research and Verification vendors like Nielsen, ComScore, Moat, Integral Ad Science, DoubleVerify, Kantar, etc. 
    • If you have a passion for entertainment and a desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment, we would love to hear from you. Come join us and help us entertain the world! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity This is a great opportunity to join a team that is handling publicity campaigns as well as corporate messaging for the world's leading entertainment-on-demand service, with a chance to work on projects from the brightest creatives and talents around the world. The PR Specialist will be based in our Warsaw office and will work as part of the CEE PR team. The role will report to the PR Senior Director, CEE. The Role The PR Specialist will work across films, series, documentaries and unscripted titles. They will formulate and execute publicity campaigns for the growing content slate as well as be able to handle corporate communications ranging from crisis management to corporate storytelling. We are looking for someone who has experience in delivering strong PR campaigns, who will have a creative approach and will work well within a wider cross-functional team. The successful candidate has a great knowledge of the Romanian media landscape (experience in other CEE countries is a plus). We are looking for someone who is a do-er and loves the thrill of seeing impactful coverage! The person will be able to communicate priorities and present clear goals to stakeholders and form and maintain strong relationships with media and influencers as well as talent representatives and talent. As the successful candidate, you will: Have at least 5+ years of experience working in PR, ideally in entertainment, tech, music sports or related industries Have excellent verbal and written skills in English and Romanian is essential (one more Eastern European language is a plus) Possess a keen understanding of new and traditional media Be able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under deadline and thrive in a high energy, fast-paced environment Be skilled in cultivating relationships with journalists, influencers as well as talent representatives and talent Be able and willing to think on an international level Have a love of entertainment and storytelling Be curious and eager to learn, have sound judgment, and be unafraid to challenge prevailing assumptions Be nimble and objective in assessing your work, be willing to admit mistakes quickly, and to give and receive constructive feedback For more about Netflix please read our long term view and culture memo . A commitment to embrace and advocate for inclusion is essential. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Next Games, a Netflix Game Studio, is a Helsinki-based studio dedicated to crafting fans-first interactive experiences that combine the stories from popular movies and shows with engaging game mechanics. Our values, Caring, Courage, and Curiosity, drive our commitment to our players and each other, with a focus on fun gameplay free from the constraints of free-to-play. If working on globally recognised entertainment IPs, or helping develop the next blockbuster game IP; that’ll be available on the world's biggest streaming platform Netflix, sounds like your cup of tea, Next Games can provide that opportunity. We are looking for a Senior Server Engineer to join our studio in Helsinki. This role offers an opportunity to work with a very senior team set to create the next success story in mobile gaming. Together with other skilled members in the team, you will get to work on the platform which enables millions of players around the world to enjoy the games we here at Next Games are creating. You will have one of the world's most solid tech stacks at Netflix in your toolbelt. You are curious about what’s new and how things could work, and you have a drive for exceeding your own limits and improving yourself and the team. You are proactive and take pride in building robust and maintainable services. At Next Games, you get to work on challenging technical tasks and modern cloud technologies. Our team is relatively small, which means that we have very little bureaucracy and that you have the opportunity to take on a wide variety of tasks. Responsibilities Learn and work with the latest cloud technologies Be part of developing and operating a game server platform hosting millions of players Do requirement analysis and design new features Collaborate with other teams and be part of creating great games And more! Experience Experienced in back-end development Experience in one or more of the public clouds (Azure, AWS, GCP) Experience and interest in cloud technologies such as Kubernetes Experience in developing and operating live cloud backend(s) Great C# programming skills and knowledge of .NET runtime Great troubleshooting and communication skills Understanding of modern software development practices Fluency in English What we value Team players Solid communication skills Attention to detail Ability to give and take feedback Enthusiasm to take part in designs Passion for creating robust server platform for great games We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We’ve recently introduced a new ad-supported plan, offering a more affordable price point for customers. To support this exciting new area of the business, we are building out the Financial Planning & Analysis team to lead the budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning for this exciting new initiative. We are currently looking for a Manager to lead Financial Planning & Analysis for our Ads business in the LatAm region. In this role you will have the opportunity to learn and grow quickly in this space, collaborating closely with a highly cross-functional and global team. This role will work closely with the Netflix Ads LatAm leadership team to oversee short and long-term planning for ads revenue and expenses across Sales, Operations, Measurement, and other supporting functions. Furthermore, you'll collaborate with the global Ads finance and strategy team in Los Angeles, consolidating the complete financial outlook for the business. The ideal candidate is a selfless, curious, passionate leader with exceptional analytical, financial modeling, and communication skills.  We are looking for someone who can drive financial planning with a strategic lens. This role demands comfort with ambiguity, collaborative problem-solving, and the capability to manage complex work streams with multiple stakeholders. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The position reports to the regional FP&A leader located in LatAm and coordinates closely with the global head of Ads FP&A located in Los Angeles. Responsibilities will include: Oversee short and long-term financial and headcount planning covering the full ads business P&L (i.e. revenue through expenses) for the LatAm region. Coordination with Ads Strategy, Planning & Analysis colleagues to model and consolidate the financial impact of product, plan, and pricing changes. Perform ad hoc financial analyses to deliver insights, and facilitate trade-off discussions, scenario plans, opportunity size, etc. Create insightful presentations to summarize analyses and facilitate decision-making. Ownership of our financial projections and assumptions in planning systems including Anaplan, Workday, Essbase, Tableau Develop KPIs, metrics, and dashboards to track the ongoing impact of Ads business. Creation, standardization, and automation of management reporting in dashboards, reports, & templates. Building strong relationships with a wide group of stakeholders (Ad Sales & Ops, Data Science, Accounting, Talent Acquisition/HR, etc.). and being able to effectively communicate financial tracking/impact. Qualifications 8+ years of experience in a fast-paced, highly analytical environment. Prior experience in advertising FP&A, management consulting, and strategic finance in tech or high-growth startups is preferred. Experience building & refining financial reporting processes, with high ambiguity and shifting requirements. Strong modeling skills and comfort with manipulating large datasets in Excel, Google Sheets, Tableau, and other data visualization tools. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, able to work autonomously, and perform tasks with a wide range of difficulties. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build successful relationships and partners at all levels. Very strong project management, planning, & organizational skills, including the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, and deliver work under tight timelines. A strong attention to detail with strong judgment on when to apply the 80/20 rule to address problems. Familiarity with financial systems such as Workday, Essbase, Anaplan, sales incentive compensation, and general knowledge of the streaming advertising and ad tech ecosystem is a plus, though not required.

description: Netflix is building the world’s leading entertainment service, offering great TV shows, movies and games that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight members around the world. We’re seeking an experienced content designer to support our consumer messaging ecosystem, delivering the right messages at the right time, to nurture Netflix’s relationship with members. The Role As we grow globally, we have increasing opportunities to communicate with and delight our members and prospective members in new ways. This team focuses on innovating on the platforms, systems and channels that let us reach our members around the world. Despite the term “messaging”, this role’s impact lies not in crafting compelling messages (though we believe this is at the heart of our craft), but in the product thinking, systems thinking, and strategic prowess to be able to connect the dots across multiple complex product domains. We’re looking for a highly ambitious, collaborative, and experienced Content Designer who will help shape Netflix’s messaging experiences for our members. This includes creating best practices that scale, innovating on our messaging design system, and creating a holistic vision for how Netflix communicates across platforms and channels. You will also partner closely with product designers and cross-functional peers working across our various product teams to deliver a delightful, engaging, and highly relevant messaging experience for our Netflix members. About Our Team Our team designs the inbound and outbound messaging experiences for Netflix across multiple channels, specifically email, push, and in-app notifications. We build the platform tooling used to create messages, inform the algorithmic inputs that let us communicate with members at the right time and place, and design the modular frameworks that shape the look and feel of our messages. These experiences span our entire product and help shape Netflix’s relationship with members. You’ll be one of the design leads who crafts these experiences and shapes the future of messaging across our product. To do so, you’ll work in tight partnership with product leads, designers, engineers, data scientists, product marketing specialists, research and more. About You You have demonstrated experience working across complex product domains to apply the principles of content design/content strategy, UX writing and design systems. You have the ability to multitask in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. You’re a storyteller at heart who can craft and orchestrate cohesive narratives across touchpoints, both in the product and internally to drive alignment. You’re a systems thinker who’s familiar with the development of information architecture, design systems and language frameworks that scale. You’re self-motivated, proactive, highly organized, and have a steadfast attention to detail. You’re a product thinker who’s comfortable with innovating and finding creative solutions. You work collaboratively to drive alignment and prioritization, while partnering with cross-functional peers across design, engineering and product, to define a strong UX. You thrive in ambiguity and are comfortable distilling complex business and user needs into actionable strategies and outcomes. You communicate productively with visual thinkers and are comfortable presenting and advocating for your point of view in a candid, feedback-driven culture. Qualifications 8+ years of relevant Content Design experience: UX writing, content design/content strategy, design systems, technical writing, taxonomy, and IA. Experience synthesizing business requirements and user needs into actionable plans and design solutions. Experience working on consumer messaging systems and platforms - such as CRM systems or platform tools, building content frameworks and templates, specializing in working on global brands/experiences. Ability to think critically about user journeys and content flows, and to connect the dots between them. Ability to navigate ambiguity and traverse altitudes from strategic visioning to tactical execution. Mastery of AP style and the confidence to know when to break the rules. Highly collaborative, organized and self-directed, able to effectively prioritize and respond accordingly to the shifting needs of the team. This full-time, salaried position reports to the Member XD Content Design Manager. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000-$515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 230M+ paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. The Consumer Engineering team builds the industry-leading Netflix iOS, Android, and TV apps. We work with our design and product partners to rapidly experiment with new product ideas . We’re looking for a Software Engineer to drive innovations in the member experience space. This is a high-impact role that enables delivering delightful experiences to Netflix subscribers on the iOS app. Our responsibilities include working on large-scale A/B tests of features - ranging from highly visible product experiences to core infrastructure that enables existing and future innovations. We care deeply about UI performance, quality, and accessibility of the Netflix iOS app. To bring new kinds of engaging and cinematic experiences to life, we partner closely with many cross-functional teams including product management, experience design, and creative production. You will excel if you are product-minded, detail-oriented, and can drive scalable technical solutions that mesh with our business goals. We have a unique culture that allows you to do your best work and grow. About the Role Collaborate with developers and product teams to build delightful, performant, and accessible user experiences. Contribute to product features, core infrastructure and A/B tests using advanced UIKit, Core Animation, and Foundation APIs in Swift. Architect maintainable, performant iOS client code with effective documentation that can be leveraged by other developers. Write automated tests with XCTest and XCUITest frameworks to deliver high quality code. Partner closely with product management to scope projects, with designers to refine UI specifications or collaborate with partner engineering teams on shared infrastructure. What Sets You Apart Curious about a broad range of new or unfamiliar technologies, the consumer base, and product vision. Seek different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to continuously grow and improve. Maintain strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication. Take a thoughtful, practical approach to problem solving that considers tradeoffs and avoids over-engineering. Comfortable asking questions and seeking knowledge in unfamiliar or ambiguous situations. Endeavor to elevate the knowledge, skills, abilities of yourself and others that is conducive to fostering an inclusive, collaborative environment. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $700,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. In addition to great shows and movies, our membership also includes exclusive access to a growing portfolio of high-quality games. The games platform team is looking for a Technical Program Manager to strengthen our game software development kit (SDK) and game services capabilities in Netflix’s relatively nascent opportunity in games. The game SDK and services Technical Program Manager will partner closely with product and engineering to drive impactful cross-functional programs both within the games org and across the company. The role requires strong coordination and collaboration with multiple engineering teams in our core games platform team, Netflix Game Studios organization, design, data science, security and others. This role has the direct opportunity to impact the quality, engagement, and satisfaction of our game development partners - and ultimately our members' satisfaction with Netflix games on our product. Responsibilities Leading multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with product, engineering, design, and data science. Provide deep domain expertise to form technical strategies with engineering partners. Drive engagement with internal partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with measurable milestones, effectively optimize scope and schedule, manage cross-functional dependencies, and proactively manage risks. Craft clear communication of progress toward goals, reporting status to stakeholders and leadership. Requirements 10+ years of technical program management experience Deep understanding and experience with game development SDKs and Services Direct experience with game or game platform development is beneficial (TPM, product, development, etc.) Highly skilled, experienced, and enjoys orchestrating multi-organizational impacting software programs with many moving parts Proven experience creating partnerships with cross-functional teams, driving large-scale technical strategies, debating technical approaches, and building long-term scalable solutions Able to identify gaps in solutions  and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and scaling 1-100, quickly bringing organization and direction Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values Location of work: Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering both candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California, and fully remote candidates (remote in the US with travel to Netflix HQ). The expectation is that candidates will work during core Pacific Standard Time business hours. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is releasing content at a pace and scale unlike any studio or broadcast channel in history: all around the world, at the same time for over 265 million members. With so many different titles to choose from across such a range of tastes and cultural standards, our members need the information and context to be able to tell at a glance that what they’re watching is appropriate for their household. We are looking for an experienced and passionate strategist for the Policy division of our Ratings team. The Ratings Team is a center of excellence for maturity ratings and advisories, working closely with Product, Content, and Public Policy teams at Netflix to empower members with trustworthy ratings guidance to make informed viewing choices for themselves and their families. In this role, you will have the opportunity to help rate and classify Netflix’s rapidly growing catalog of content. It will require an understanding of global rating requirements, critical thinking and thorough analysis, policy development, operational aptitude to enforce those policies, clear written and verbal communication, and deep-level movie and television expertise. The work you do in this role will directly affect how our members decide what to watch. Within the Product Metadata and Ratings team, you will serve as a trusted consultant to Content, working with our metadata, innovation, and classification teams to provide accurate global maturity ratings and advisories for our titles. You will collaborate with Public Policy and Comms to ensure that ratings and advisories are locally relevant. In the broader Product organization, you will partner with Globalization, Product Creative Studio, Operations, Consumer Insights, and Engineering to execute our overall maturity ratings strategy. Key Responsibilities Provide maturity ratings and advisory guidance to Content teams throughout the development of a title - from script to post-launch Engage with external ratings boards and filmmakers/show executives, especially on high-profile titles, and provide detailed notes to help Content teams reach desired ratings Communicate ratings information and rationale to Content teams, Public Policy, and Comms Audit titles for accurate maturity ratings, content advisories, and local sensitivities Develop, maintain, and explain ratings guidelines to our stakeholders Consult with Content Analysts on the factors that impact a title’s rating Lead cross-functional education, research, and innovation projects Manage escalations related to ratings and advisories and articulate tradeoffs between different courses of action for team and company leadership Advise on the appropriateness of trailers, imagery, and other supplemental materials appearing on-platform Identify opportunities to increase efficiencies of current workflows and propose alternative solutions Qualifications 5+ years in relevant fields such as global Content Classification, Standards & Practices, Trust & Safety, Content Moderation, Content Strategy, and Policy/Legal Operations 3+ years experience in highly cross-functional global roles gaining buy-in, alignment, and context from a variety of stakeholders Critical thinking, creative problem-solving skills Experience analyzing, adapting, and adopting government regulations Knowledge of, and adherence to, global ratings boards’ standards and requirements Strong judgment and decisiveness when dealing with timely, deadline-driven, content-related issues and concerns Excellent verbal and written communication with experience explaining complex ideas to stakeholders Experience crafting policy proposals that require research, data support, rationale, and cross-functional feedback Experience with algorithm-assisted and vendor-supported workflows Excellent project/program management skills, and/or a proven track record for operational excellence Proficiency in the Google Suite, AirTable, or other database/ reporting/ tracking tools Experience working with non-western cultures and knowledge of cultural content concerns Proficiency in languages other than English is a plus Experience managing content in languages other than English is a plus Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $210,000 - $500,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . description: Netflix, a global leader in Internet entertainment services, entertains over 260 million members across 190 countries. Our members enjoy an extensive range of TV series, documentaries, and feature films across multiple genres and languages. With no commercials or commitments, our members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. As a Full-Stack Engineering Manager at Netflix, your role will be multifaceted. You will be responsible for creating a strong vision, formulating a strategic roadmap, and leading a team of top-tier software engineers. Your main task will involve overseeing the development and optimization of sophisticated full-stack workflows for all things revenue & financial reporting. You will also be instrumental in managing and mitigating technical challenges that arise from the ever-increasing volume and complexity of our productions, all the while ensuring the precision and timeliness of our financial data. Your Responsibilities: Drive success in a lean organization structure, emphasizing individual responsibility and minimal processes. Identify and foster the development of innovative solutions that enhance our understanding of Revenue Financial data. Oversee the team's design and development of scalable, highly available, and user-friendly solutions on AWS, using technologies like React, Node.js , and Java. Champion product quality through the team, emphasizing enhanced observability, alerting, dashboarding, and the development of cutting-edge tools. Embody and champion the Netflix culture. Lead the team of engineers to build efficient tools that accurately track all aspects of Revenue Infrastructure Engineering Ensure the design and implementation of intuitive user interfaces in alignment with best practices in UI/UX. Guide the team in developing and implementing interactive UI components, data visualization tools, and real-time analytics dashboards. Enforce coding standards and conduct regular code reviews to ensure the application's robustness and reliability. Promote and enforce best practices in full-stack development within the team, including responsive design and accessibility standards. About You: You're an experienced Engineering Manager with a strong background in overseeing financial applications development and a passion for leading teams to create engaging and user-friendly interfaces. You have a robust understanding of the full web stack, including front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and popular frameworks like React, Vue.js , or Angular, along with back-end technologies like Node.js , Java, databases, HTTP protocol, cloud applications, and integration. You're skilled at architecture, understanding the trade-offs involved in building high-scale architectures. You have a proven track record of managing successful teams and are dedicated to mentoring, teaching, and reviewing to help your engineers grow. You believe in high standards of execution and feature velocity and aren't afraid to dive in and take ownership of problems. You're also a thoughtful interviewer, dedicated to raising the bar of excellence with each new hire. You value data accuracy and understand the nuances of projects in flight. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Role: Netflix is seeking a Communications Manager to join the EMEA regional PR team.  This team shapes the story of Netflix in EMEA, working across both internal and external communications.  Our ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker, strong communicator, creative campaigner, and relationship builder, who can be a trusted partner and adviser to teams across multiple disciplines. Strong writing skills, a willingness to learn rapidly and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced culture are key. The position will play a critical role on a small team, so the responsibility is wide-ranging  and tasks can shift day to day. Overall responsibilities and expectations for the position include but are not limited to: Partner closely with teams across the business, with a focus on the policy and finance organizations to shape our corporate narrative in EMEA. Manage and maintain exceptional relationships with business, financial and trade media as well as key industry influencers - becoming a great Netflix advocate with these audiences. Devise and implement campaigns across the region that help define the Netflix narrative with the media, our industry, partners and third parties. Determine strategic and opportunistic PR initiatives, events and conferences and develop programs that will reinforce the Netflix brand. Handle crisis-response issues timely, calmly and brilliantly. Make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity, and think strategically. Be a trusted advisor and partner to the EMEA senior management team, particularly the EMEA CFO, EMEA General Counsel, and EMEA head of Public Policy. Serve as an external spokesperson for the company. Qualifications: 7+ years of experience in communications, preferably within media, government, policy,  entertainment and/or technology industries. A good understanding of the EMEA and Brussels media landscape and the confidence to build strong relationships with journalists. Excellent communication skills and the ability to write quickly and concisely about complex policy, financial, and legal topics. Skilled in executive communications and partnership. Excellent relationship building skills. Strong project management. Ability to work proactively, independently and juggle multiple tasks at once. Meticulous organizational skills, good judgment of brand and comms risks, and effective time management. Have a point of view, and be able to offer their unique perspective and voice. The role will frequent travel to Brussels and periodic travel to other locations across EMEA. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

  • Devise and implement campaigns across the region that help define the Netflix narrative with the media, our industry, partners and third parties. 
  • Determine strategic and opportunistic PR initiatives, events and conferences and develop programs that will reinforce the Netflix brand. 
  • Handle crisis-response issues timely, calmly and brilliantly.
  • Make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity, and think strategically.
  • Be a trusted advisor and partner to the EMEA senior management team, particularly the EMEA CFO, EMEA General Counsel, and EMEA head of Public Policy. 
  • Serve as an external spokesperson for the company. 
    • Qualifications:
  • 7+ years of experience in communications, preferably within media, government, policy,  entertainment and/or technology industries. 
  • A good understanding of the EMEA and Brussels media landscape and the confidence to build strong relationships with journalists. 
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to write quickly and concisely about complex policy, financial, and legal topics.
  • Skilled in executive communications and partnership.
  • Excellent relationship building skills.
  • Strong project management.
  • Ability to work proactively, independently and juggle multiple tasks at once.
  • Meticulous organizational skills, good judgment of brand and comms risks, and effective time management.
  • Have a point of view, and be able to offer their unique perspective and voice.

    • The role will frequent travel to Brussels and periodic travel to other locations across EMEA.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 240 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is also one of the largest studios in the world and empowers storytellers from all over the globe to tell the stories you fall in love with. Producing content globally, at this scale is a unique challenge; this is where our organization comes in. Studio Foundations Engineering plays a pivotal role in Netflix's content creation and delivery journey. The seamless magic of your favorite show starting with a click is the result of thousands of intricate processes and workflows behind the scenes that are enabled by our tools. We empower Netflix studios to bring creative excellence to life, build tools to bring operational excellence and accomplish economies of scale. Our solutions aim to elevate the ROI of the $15 billion dollars spent on content creation through cost/time efficiency, and data-driven decision-making. We also provide technology to manage end-user access and build tools that help with resourcing workflows resulting in the production and delivery of the highest-quality content. We are seeking an individual possessing a platform-minded approach to construct backend services that cater to the escalating demands of Netflix Original Movie Production. The role involves substantial ownership and responsibility, encompassing the development of platforms that support hundreds of clients and services throughout the entire production lifecycle, from pitch to play. What's Different About Us? Huge Impact - you will directly impact the workflows that impact billions of dollars worth of content spend Speed - we move quickly, iterate rapidly, and learn constantly Unique Culture - we live by our values You’ll want to work with us if you like: To take up challenges and seek opportunities for continuous improvements to deliver top-tier solutions. To work with users and engineers to define what they want, and what we can deliver. To implement new features in systems from initial design to delivery. Tomorrow’s technology. You are encouraged to use your passion for technology to find new and efficient ways to solve challenges. We would love to work with you if: You're an expert-level programmer and kept up to date with the evolution of the Object-Oriented languages (Java preferred) and related frameworks. You understand the challenges of large-scale distributed computing and the know-how to code for high availability, fault tolerance, throughput, and performance. You have experience with Concurrent, Event-driven systems. You have expertise in building highly scalable, distributed, loosely coupled systems. You are strongly motivated to pick up new domains and ship high-quality, well-tested code. You are a proactive and effective communicator, adept at working with various teams and leading initiatives with little to no direct supervision. You truly believe that diversity is key to a team’s health and success. Bonus Points if: You understand build/bake/deploy systems for cloud applications. You have development experience with Spring and you’re familiar with Graph APIs. You have experience building tools or modeling data for movie industry applications. Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California (with occasional travel to other offices). Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. Netflix is looking for finance professionals to join our team. This role will support the FP&A team and manage data-entry, validation, and reconciliation to build accurate financial forecasts. This role will also contribute to reporting and financial analysis that are used to inform important business decisions. We currently have opportunities available on the following teams: - Content FP&A All roles are based in our Manila office. Depending on business needs and candidate background, there may be future opportunities to rotate across business functions (e.g., marketing FP&A) as needs open up. Responsibilities: Execute and manage data entry for forecasting and analysis Perform data validation and reconciliation analysis Supporting near-term and long-term P&L forecasts Supporting key portions of the company's free cash flow forecast Contribute to presentations and memos that can support financial and business decisions Prior experience in financial planning & analysis or accounting is preferred. Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of performing financial analysis and knowledge of the forecast submission process. This person must thrive in a fast-paced environment and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, and able to work effectively autonomously. Requirements: 2+ years of experience conducting quantitative and qualitative financial analysis Proficiency with spreadsheet-based tools like Google Sheets or Excel Experience with managing and analyzing large, complex data sets Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Sound working knowledge of the related accounting guidance preferred Bachelor's degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature, preferably Business, Economics, or Mathematics We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Role Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Content Risk Management Team supports our Content Organisation functions globally. This APAC-based role will lead the Production Security discipline in APAC and report to the Senior Manager, Content Risk Management APAC. Partnering with Physical Production, Content Security, Post Production, Business and Legal Affairs, and Content, the role will be instrumental in leading risk assessment and security design for our Netflix branded original content production in the APAC region. Responsibilities Support and execute the strategy for production security in the APAC region in alignment with assessed risk and business objectives Lead the development/ review of risk assessments, security plans, vendor management, coordination of local support, and incident response Develop and communicate specialised guidance for higher-profile/risk production activities, IP, and locations Utilise forward-looking analysis of dynamic global, regional, and local security events/trends to keep APAC production operations resilient Collect and analyse local intelligence and risk signals to support production planning and security design Lead relationship management with relevant law enforcement, emergency response, and trusted security networks Brief a wide range of internal and external stakeholders on security plans and impactful developments Works collaboratively with Production Safety functions in minimising operational risk Qualifications 5-10 years of relevant experience, which can include security, intelligence, military, media production, or NGO Advanced degree in relevant subject matter or demonstrated equivalent experience preferred Experience with production, talent relations, or content creation is a plus Strong written and oral communication Proficiency in a regional language preferred Ability to Interpret regional security signals and data, and conduct risk assessments Maintain an awareness of risk trends affecting the global entertainment sector Communicate relevant analysis and forecasting to key stakeholders Interact with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders Travel regionally (approximately 25%-50%) and internationally as required We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. description: About Netflix Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. As a global company, Netflix’s customers come from diverse backgrounds. And each of these backgrounds allow them to experience joy from Netflix in their own unique way. Ultimately, this joy is rooted in our customers’ ability to trust Netflix. At Netflix, we earn this trust through our actions every day. And we work hard to continue to build this trust with our customers throughout the world. With the growth of Netflix consumer products to include new verticals such as Games, Live and Ads, we are evolving our solutions to support the unique needs of additional consumer facing solutions, reflecting unique requirements for transported data and integrations. The Team The Security and Privacy Technical Program Management team is a force multiplier for the security organization; we partner closely with engineering and product teams across Netflix to deliver impactful and scalable security initiatives. We collaborate with leaders inside and outside the organization to align on strategic goals and vision to further the security roadmaps for our partnering teams in a business-driven way. We then work with the right stakeholders to establish and drive initiatives that move the needle on this. The Opportunity You will drive large, at-scale security initiatives across multiple products and central engineering orgs with stakeholders ranging from senior leadership, product managers, engineering managers, and developers. It is a great opportunity to help mature the security posture in the most rapidly growing parts of our business and gain intimate knowledge of Netflix’s products and services. These are highly visible and cross-functional efforts that require technical thought leadership across Netflix’s engineering and product organizations. We are leaning into the “T” (Technical) for this role. By technical, we mean that the ideal candidate has a strong understanding of the overall security domain and the ability to gain a technical understanding of programs across their lifecycle. TPMs must be skilled at both strategy and execution as well as have depth in their technical domain. As we expand from SVOD into Live events, onboard you will lead the Live security and Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) prevention programs that are business critical and have a unique set of challenges to navigate through. Both programs are closely related and focus around preserving the high availability of our streaming service. You will be responsible for crafting and executing the overall program. This includes translating the vision into a program strategy, leading critical initiatives, building the technical execution plan, stakeholder management, and overseeing the development of quarterly roadmaps. You will be successful in the role if… You are passionate about leading by influence and advocating for change. You have a demonstrated ability to establish a vision and to execute on it. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience. You are able to triage multiple initiatives to make a judgment to tackle the right problems at the right time. You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh-in on product vs technology tradeoffs. You have familiarity with consumer product security principles and best practices, and have developed and driven security initiatives such as DDoS and fraud prevention, to name a few. A few reasons why we love this work and think you will too: You will have the opportunity to facilitate impactful security work for the Netflix business and engineering ecosystem. You will be working with an industry leading security team with many opportunities to improve existing projects and identify new ones. You will have the opportunity to research new ideas and share them across the community. You enjoy learning and working closely with domain experts in diverse areas such as microservices architecture, data science and engineering, content delivery networks, and a production studio. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Company Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity We are looking for an experienced and seasoned Marketing Operations Manager to join our UCAN Marketing Operations & Production team, overseeing title-level campaign production, creative operations, and project management across our UCAN Series slate. Marketing Operations & Production is a center of excellence for creative operations, cross-functional project management, and marketing production, that works closely with Marketing, Communications, & Product groups at Netflix to connect our stories with millions of people worldwide. The Role In this role, you will be a key cross-functional partner, responsible for managing the end-to-end project management of a campaign, production budgets for promotional assets, and partnering with creative, media, social, publicity, and other cross-functional teams. search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and Publicity Creative Marketing Production Marketing Operations Manager - UCAN The Company Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity We are looking for an experienced and seasoned Marketing Operations Manager to join our UCAN Marketing Operations & Production team, overseeing title-level campaign production, creative operations, and project management across our UCAN Series slate. Marketing Operations & Production is a center of excellence for creative operations, cross-functional project management, and marketing production, that works closely with Marketing, Communications, & Product groups at Netflix to connect our stories with millions of people worldwide.  The Role In this role, you will be a key cross-functional partner, responsible for managing the end-to-end project management of a campaign, production budgets for promotional assets, and partnering with creative, media, social, publicity, and other cross-functional teams. This means that you are a nimble, solutions-oriented, entrepreneurial, and creative operations expert. You thrive in a fast-paced environment that requires you to bridge competing priorities amongst global and local cross-functional stakeholders -- ensuring all assets are delivered on time, and on budget. Responsibilities include:
  • Oversee a slate of Netflix UCAN titles by managing end-to-end campaign operational scope including: overseeing relevant budgets, creative development operational management, asset planning and production, and campaign fulfillment/delivery  
  • Budget  and track spend for UCAN title marketing launches across the entire lifecycle of a campaign (from Creative Development to Delivery)
  • Define and manage milestones across an entire campaign lifecycle including: creative development timelines, advise on executive review timing, aggregate stakeholder delivery deadlines, production deadlines due dates and backout timings for asset rollouts (i.e. media deliveries, debuts, etc.) 
  • Manage creative agency NDAs, MSAs, SOWs and creative agency onboarding as needed 
  • Track creative agency deliverables against the SOW and escalate to primary stakeholders of any potential lock date delays and budget overages.
  • Ensure that time-sensitive bottlenecks are eliminated and advise on delivery & budget risks to enable the creation and production of high quality creative at a high velocity. 
  • Lead and manage cross-functional communications and workflows, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and global dissemination of campaign milestones, assets and deliverables.
  • Partner with a team of operational producers responsible for managing finishing, localization, and trafficking of promotional materials. These include online and offline AV, key art and out-of-home, digital, and social creative assets.
  • Manage day-to-day escalations and troubleshooting of creative development and production issues.
  • Use data to inform production best practices, eliminating inefficiencies throughout our operational pipelines
    • Qualifications
  • 8+ years of creative project management and creative production experience, preferably at an entertainment studio, network, or agency 
  • Proven track record of managing large cross functional teams through successful marketing campaigns
  • Expert knowledge of marketing campaign and localization workflows, deeply understanding the creative and production process for video (trailers, tv spots, social creative, etc), print/OOH and digital materials
  • Fluent in Video and Digital types and formats while understanding the fundamentals of asset management, servicing and ad trafficking
  • High competency and proven track record of project management for high profile global campaigns
  • Knowledgeable of the ever-evolving advertising landscape
  • Experience managing a high volume of creative and campaign types with geographically dispersed teams
  • Strategic thought partner and strong team player
    • Personality Attributes
  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like:
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of entertainment marketing
  • You are a natural-born communicator, connecting the dots when others cannot, and have an ability to simplify complex issues and questions
  • Has a marketers background and mindset
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity
  • You’re comfortable living in the gray and can navigate comfortably in ambiguity 
  • You have a track record of successful cross-functional work and lead deftly across the many aspects of campaign development
  • A collaborative spirit who possesses a strong creative and strategic sensibility and who can expertly influence key stakeholders and foster deep relationships across the business
  • A competent professional who can effectively liaise and build trust and partnership with their cross functional counterparts
  • You approach all challenges and obstacles with a solutions-oriented mindset
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed, and always up for a challenge!
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are looking for a Legal Director to join the Product & Tech Legal Team to partner with our Data & Insights Group. The role reports directly to the Senior Director of Studio Product & Technology Legal based in Los Angeles, and you will be based in Los Angeles or Los Gatos. To entertain the world is no small task, so we rely on really smart people who know a lot about how technology and data can create great content and high-quality member experiences and insights. The Netflix Product Counsel is an integrated part of this innovations team, partnering with our product managers, stakeholders, designers, engineers, and data scientists across the entire innovations lifecycle from ideation to launch. They are essential contributors often extending beyond legal advice. The Netflix Product Counsel understands how to inspire these business teams towards innovation because they have that important mix of courage, judgment, curiosity, and great instinct. The Director, Product & Technology Legal is a multi-faceted role requiring a breadth of product experience, an instinct for innovation, and the wisdom to discern practical real-world risks from theoretical ones. You will have a particular interest in leveraging data in innovative ways to fuel products and generate insights. You are a diplomat, with the skills to bring folks together to collaborate and share information and ideas, and you thrive in a loosely coupled world where we lean into integrity and judgment over rigid rules and inflexible processes. You will be both a specialist in the science and a generalist in your counseling, with the ability to digest competing legal and policy viewpoints in a manner that masterfully advances the business objectives, always with a view toward the overall company strategy. Responsibilities Support our data scientists and consumer insights team in the many ways they leverage data and insights to improve our models, tools  and enhance the member experience. Provide practical product counseling to enable rapid development of innovative products, coordinating closely with subject matter legal experts and distilling real world advice. In other words, you will be a legal generalist with a business instinct. This is not a compliance role. Understand the studio world and content production, with some familiarity with business affairs. Fluent in product and engineering principles with the ability to “speak science” as well as the skills to simplify these principles for others to understand. Qualifications We think the right candidate will have 10+ years of legal experience in the entertainment and/or technology industries in a strategic leadership capacity, either through a law firm and/or an in-house role, with subject-matter experience in data science. Strong track record demonstrating a collaborative approach, effective communication skills, and excellent legal/business judgment. Strategic and creative thinker who thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, undeterred by ambiguity. Demonstrated curiosity and ability to quickly master new areas of technology. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $280,000 - $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
