description: It’s an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue to shape the future of global entertainment. As Netflix expands globally, we look for the best and brightest talent to scale with and contribute to our growth. We are seeking an Internal Auditor to join our growing team in support of Netflix’s studio and corporate operations based in Los Angeles. Reporting to the Manager of Internal Audit, the ideal candidate will have hands-on experience identifying and assessing operational, compliance, and financial risks across a variety of business functions, evaluating the design of processes and controls, and executing large-scale and complex projects. In addition, the candidate will need to exhibit strong technical and communication skills necessary to navigate a complex environment and cultivate strong partnerships with key stakeholders. Responsibilities: Execute operational and advisory engagements including understanding business processes and underlying systems, conducting interviews and process walkthroughs, and performing audit procedures to assess operational efficiency and effectiveness. Plan and execute SOX testing and documentation activities. Perform production audits for Netflix productions worldwide in the following areas: policy & procedure compliance, cost reporting, FCPA compliance, local regulatory and legal compliance, and fraud detection. Work collaboratively across the business to drive value through participation in special projects and ad hoc requests. Work closely with cross-functional partners and leadership to develop proactive solutions, communicate potential impacts, and ensure business objectives are met. Interpret the significance of audit insights, make practical recommendations, and collaborate with stakeholders on remediation action plans. Build effective working relationships and trust with business partners across the organization. Effectively manage relationships with the Internal Audit co-sourcing partners (as applicable) to ensure cohesive and collaborative execution. Qualifications: 4+ years of operational and/or advisory internal audit experience preferably with a minimum of 2 years of public accounting experience. Relevant academic degree with at least one relevant professional qualification (in accounting, audit, business, or technology). Certified Public Accountant or Certified Internal Auditor preferred. Strong technical skills and working knowledge of GAAP, SOX compliance, COSO, ITGC, and internal auditing standards. Prior experience with cloud-based systems, data analytics audit tools, and/or third-party vendor solutions. Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as presentation skills. Proven prioritization and multitasking skills. Ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously within deadlines. Experience in the Technology and/or Media industry. Knowledge of studio/production accounting and related financial functions is a plus. Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders. Must be able to work independently in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. You embrace and advocate the Netflix culture and our long-term view . Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 240 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is also one of the largest studios in the world and empowers storytellers from all over the globe to tell the stories you fall in love with. Producing content globally, at this scale is a unique challenge; this is where our organization comes in. Studio Foundations Engineering plays a pivotal role in Netflix's content creation and delivery journey. The seamless magic of your favorite show starting with a click is the result of thousands of intricate processes and workflows behind the scenes that are enabled by our tools. We empower Netflix studios to bring creative excellence to life, build tools to bring operational excellence and accomplish economies of scale. Our solutions aim to elevate the ROI of the $15 billion dollars spent on content creation through cost/time efficiency, and data-driven decision-making. We also provide technology to manage end-user access and build tools that help with resourcing workflows resulting in the production and delivery of the highest-quality content. We are seeking an individual possessing a platform-minded approach to construct backend services that cater to the escalating demands of Netflix Original Movie Production. This role plays a vital part in the development of platforms that support hundreds of clients and services throughout the entire production lifecycle, from pitch to play. What's Different About Us? Huge Impact - you will directly impact the workflows that impact billions of dollars worth of content spend Speed - we move quickly, iterate rapidly, and learn constantly Unique Culture - we live by our values You’ll want to work with us if you like: To take up challenges and seek opportunities for continuous improvements to deliver top-tier solutions. To work with users and engineers to define what they want, and what we can deliver. To implement new features in systems from initial design to delivery. Tomorrow’s technology. You are encouraged to use your passion for technology to find new and efficient ways to solve challenges. We would love to work with you if: You are a skilled programmer with a strong understanding of Object-Oriented languages (Java preferred) and related frameworks. You have experience with large-scale distributed computing. You have experience with Event-driven systems. You have experience in building highly scalable, distributed, loosely coupled systems. You are strongly motivated to pick up new domains and ship high-quality, well-tested code. You are a proactive and effective communicator, adept at working with various teams and leading initiatives with little to no direct supervision. You truly believe that diversity is key to a team’s health and success. Bonus Points if: You understand build/bake/deploy systems for cloud applications. You have development experience with Spring and you’re familiar with Graph APIs. You have experience building tools or modeling data for movie industry applications. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: As Netflix’s global member base grows from 250+ million members, the ability to operate at scale without compromising on quality is paramount to our success. Netflix is looking for a skilled Project Coordinator to join its Scaled Launch Operations team in Mumbai. This team will be part of a broader operational hub strategy and manages the launch readiness process, focusing on the on-service promotion of our content, by combining rigorous project management and risk mitigation with a strategic, member-first mindset. This is an exciting opportunity for a Project Coordinator with a passion for operations in service of delivering promotional material for Netflix titles to our global members, at scale. If you are analytically minded and your attention to detail is unmatched, you excel at challenging the status quo and influencing change, you thrive in a global team, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgement in the face of ambiguity, then this role is for you. The Project Coordinator will align with multiple cross-functionals across the globe, track multiple assets, assign to required teams, monitor finalized asset delivery all the while ensuring their accuracy and that they are available for member consumption. You will manage a large volume of titles across the global slate, have effective communication, manage dependencies with moving launch targets, predicting and mitigating risks and pivot as required with short turnaround time. What You’ll Do: You will own and be accountable for some of the critical workflows, which affect  how the Member views the titles from across the globe.  While multiple teams (internal and external) are responsible for creating and delivering assets, you will be responsible for ensuring those assets are coming in at the right time to support the predetermined launch date that all of your stakeholders are aligned to. You will help shape and redesign existing workflows to help accelerate the efficiency of our operations in line with key business objectives for our group. Partner with internal and external teams (vendors) to ensure operational momentum and seamlessness across launches. Exercise sound judgement and risk mitigation to create/modify delivery and launch plans including use cases that fall outside the norm. Partner with our Technology, Engineering, Partnerships, and Quality Control teams within Global Product Creative Operations, to guide tooling, workflow, and vendor needs to help scale operations. What You’ll Need: The candidate must have 5+ years of experience in project management / coordination roles Ability to handle a fast-paced environment and the ability to keep multiple priorities moving at the same time Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a self starter mentality An analytical and innovative mindset with a passion for operational excellence Attention to detail while executing on work across several tools and systems The ability to build deep cross-functional relationships An optimistic, solutions-driven attitude in the most challenging situations Fluency in an additional language is a bonus The ability to adapt to the Netflix culture and values We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We bring new stories to over 200 million people in over 190 countries worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. A key growth factor is our ability to empower Netflix personnel to utilize in-house-built cutting-edge technology that maximizes studio/production efficiencies to facilitate the creation of the world’s best streaming content. Like all great companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. What is special about Netflix, among other things, is our Culture. The Team Content and Business Product Success uniquely sits between the teams developing the software products for Netflix Studio and the Studio employees & external partners who utilize these products. We are a Success Team that actively engages with cross-functional teams from both organizations on a daily basis to help drive change management, lead user education, assist with go-to-market launch campaigns, positively influence product adoption, and partner in closing feedback loops to both end-user stakeholders and the Product teams. Our main goal is to empower all users (internal & external) of Netflix technology to do their jobs faster, easier, and smarter while gaining value toward their business goals. What we learn from doing this turns into feedback shared with the product teams that influences product development. If you are an early tech adopter and enjoy creating new pathways to help others do their best work and drive change/innovation, this is the space for you. The Role The Content & Business Customer Success Manager is a trusted advisor for building relationships, designing and delivering tailored learning experiences for end users, driving product adoption, and enhancing their engagement with Netflix-built apps. We are responsible for developing user communication & education strategies and implementation of blended scalable learning solutions for Netflix-built apps. SMs foster relationships with specific user groups across various business functions, gather & interpret product feedback, and provide actionable insights on how the products are received to our Product partners that manage roadmaps. While the core of our UCAN team is based in Los Angeles, this role requires global thinking and proactive regional collaboration to reach internal and external users around the world. The ideal candidate should be passionate about learning with the ability to empower users to extract value from software as well as have a keen understanding of complex, interconnected product workflows. Responsibilities Actively develop innovative solutions to boost user engagement with applications and serve as a user advocate within the Product organization. Collaborate with stakeholder groups, direct users, and insights teams such as Support, Studio Insights, and Data Management to define user learning goals and communication objectives. Collaborate with Success teammates to drive product engagement, adoption, and value to users. Create communications strategy for new feature releases, ensuring that teams/users are aware of the impact on their workflows. Design, develop, maintain, and implement innovative and forward-thinking learning strategies that are integrated with a product’s go-to-market strategy, including the delivery of tailored and scalable blended learning experiences for a product’s global audience. Maintain a comprehensive collection of subject matter resources for a range of products. Facilitate instructor-led training sessions for a portfolio of products. Establish clear and consistent pathways for driving change management alongside product/feature launches that result in users (internal and external) adopting and gaining value from the product. Partner with Product, Support, and Insights teams to analyze, identify, and communicate actionable items from feedback collected that are most impactful to inform product development. Build strong relationships and trust with Studio business partners, SMEs, and users to effectively advocate for them to product development teams. Engage with data to deliver storytelling on behalf of users to Product and Business stakeholders that demonstrate how products are being received and contribute to Product decisions. Qualifications Our ideal candidate will have the following experience, but don’t feel that you must have it all before you apply: Will thrive in our culture Has 3-5 years of Learning and Development or Customer/User Success experience. Ability to design blended learning programs (set goals, create and deliver curriculum & all materials, gather data, measure effectiveness) Superb content creation skills for all learning materials (video, simulations, documentation) Experienced in delivering both in-person and online programs with strong facilitation skills. Experience in evaluating programs and putting in place effective measures to assess impacts on end users. Aptitude for analyzing data, finding the story within, and using it to drive decisions. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including an affinity for simplifying complex workflows and motivating users to engage with new technologies. Communicates well and leads comfortably in large and small group settings. Is passionate about learning new ideas/technology and driving change management by helping others overcome legacy thinking. Flexibility amid an ever-changing and growing environment and ability to create clarity amid ambiguity. Is willing and able to run lean with a DIY mentality that inspires others around them to do the same. Has experience with G Suite and is comfortable learning & using a set of productivity tooling. Does this sound interesting but overwhelming? Please don’t self-select; let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you! Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000 - $515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: It’s a fantastic time to join Netflix as we continue transforming entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service, with 222 million+ paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.We are looking to build a Consumer Products team to help amplify impact and conversation through our fandom and love around titles, developing new channels for consumers and communities to interact with Netflix. We are pursuing a Softlines Category Specialist for Consumer Products Mexico to drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways for fans to interact with our most popular content and, in effect, drive long-term revenue. THE ROLE The Softlines Category Specialist (SCS) is responsible for developing and executing against a long-term business strategy for Mexico in the Softlines sub-categories: such as Apparel, Fashion Accessories, Health & Beauty and Home Goods. As part of the Mexico team, the SCS will be responsible for growing the CP business in line with divisional strategies and guidelines whilst leveraging a strong knowledge of the market according needs and opportunities. You will be responsible for identifying the best licensees to partner with, gain mkt support, drive innovation and quality product ranges, provide input into deals, accurately forecast and promote the retail sell-in of core ranges. Key Responsabilities With direction from the Licensing manager in Mexico, develop a clear growth strategy for each subcategory of business (including targets) and benchmark progress. Identify opportunities and fill gaps by IP, product sub-category, consumer & market channel. Negotiate the best deals and manage the process from contract to product development and execution. Execute new business development pitches and identify scalable opportunities that generate impact and conversation (GAPs for new business opportunities). Collaborate closely with Merchandise Strategy teams to develop and update strategies for Global and local titles in Mexico and Nola. Maintain and update internal systems and docs with category licensing plans and activity. Collaborate with licensing partners to obtain placement updates. Assist Licensing Manager Mexico with compiling licensing recaps following product launches. Handle daily tactical business needs in the back office, managing operational tools such as deal memos, contracts, NDA's obtaining approvals with producers and partners. Work closely with Finance and ops teams with the annual operating plan, quarterly forecasting, and budget process as directed. Facilitate receipt of forecasts and send royalty payment reminders as needed. Partner with Creative teams to keep product development on track to attain commercial objectives. Develop a detailed post-mortem agenda for the main licensed programs. Provide support to the Licensing manager in coordinating sales/retailers presentations for business purposes. Collaborate with agencies in developing sales briefs and product pitches for selling the programs. Qualifications 7+ years of experience in the licensing industry at similar positions (or Category Management). Effective multi-tasker with excellent planning and prioritization skills, capable of creating, driving, and executing initiatives to tight deadlines. Impeccable written and spoken English and Spanish communication skills. Background in building brands across various channels of distribution. Proven track record delivering growth and solid analytical/financial skills. Proven ability pitching and negotiating skills with the ability to close deals. Self-motivated professional with ability to work independently and take charge. Strong people person able to influence others. Ability to customize / create sales presentations and other materials as needed. Communicates with impact: Develops and delivers compelling presentations, possesses an instinct on how to communicate and when to communicate to drive business results; Strong verbal and written communication skills; Able to rationalize complex decisions and communicate to stakeholders. Strong understanding of digital, social, and brick-and-mortar marketing and retail landscape. Proven track record of working in a fast-paced corporate environment.

Mexico City, Mexico Marketing and Publicity Consumer Products Softlines Category Specialist - Consumer Products Mexico It’s a fantastic time to join Netflix as we continue transforming entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service, with 222 million+ paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.We are looking to build a Consumer Products team to help amplify impact and conversation through our fandom and love around titles, developing new channels for consumers and communities to interact with Netflix. We are pursuing a Softlines Category Specialist for Consumer Products Mexico to drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways for fans to interact with our most popular content and, in effect, drive long-term revenue. THE ROLE The Softlines Category Specialist (SCS) is responsible for developing and executing against a long-term business strategy for Mexico in the Softlines sub-categories: such as Apparel, Fashion Accessories, Health & Beauty and Home Goods. As part of the Mexico team, the SCS will be responsible for growing the CP business in line with divisional strategies and guidelines whilst leveraging a strong knowledge of the market according needs and opportunities. You will be responsible for identifying the best licensees to partner with, gain mkt support, drive innovation and quality product ranges, provide input into deals, accurately forecast and promote the retail sell-in of core ranges.  Key Responsabilities
  • With direction from the Licensing manager in Mexico, develop a clear growth strategy for each subcategory of business (including targets) and benchmark progress.
  • Identify opportunities and fill gaps by IP, product sub-category, consumer & market channel.
  • Negotiate the best deals and manage the process from contract to product development and execution.
  • Execute new business development pitches and identify scalable opportunities that generate impact and conversation (GAPs for new business opportunities). Collaborate closely with Merchandise Strategy teams to develop and update strategies for Global and local titles in Mexico and Nola.
  • Maintain and update internal systems and docs with category licensing plans and activity.
  • Collaborate with licensing partners to obtain placement updates.
  • Assist Licensing Manager Mexico with compiling licensing recaps following product launches. Handle daily tactical business needs in the back office, managing operational tools such as deal memos, contracts, NDA's obtaining approvals with producers and partners.
  • Work closely with Finance and ops teams with the annual operating plan, quarterly forecasting, and budget process as directed. Facilitate receipt of forecasts and send royalty payment reminders as needed.
  • Partner with Creative teams to keep product development on track to attain commercial objectives. Develop a detailed post-mortem agenda for the main licensed programs.
  • Provide support to the Licensing manager in coordinating sales/retailers presentations for business purposes. 
  • Collaborate with agencies in developing sales briefs and product pitches for selling the programs.
    • Qualifications
  • 7+ years of experience in the licensing industry at similar positions (or Category Management). 
  • Effective multi-tasker with excellent planning and prioritization skills, capable of creating, driving, and executing initiatives to tight deadlines.
  • Impeccable written and spoken English and Spanish communication skills.
  • Background in building brands across various channels of distribution.
  • Proven track record delivering growth and solid analytical/financial skills.
  • Proven ability pitching and negotiating skills with the ability to close deals.
  • Self-motivated professional with ability to work independently and take charge.
  • Strong people person able to influence others.
  • Ability to customize / create sales presentations and other materials as needed.
  • Communicates with impact: Develops and delivers compelling presentations, possesses an instinct on how to communicate and when to communicate to drive business results; Strong verbal and written communication skills; Able to rationalize complex decisions and communicate to stakeholders.
  • Strong understanding of digital, social, and brick-and-mortar marketing and retail landscape.
  • Proven track record of working in a fast-paced corporate environment.

  • Effective multi-tasker with excellent planning and prioritization skills, capable of creating, driving, and executing initiatives to tight deadlines.
  • Impeccable written and spoken English and Spanish communication skills.
  • Background in building brands across various channels of distribution.
  • Proven track record delivering growth and solid analytical/financial skills.
  • Proven ability pitching and negotiating skills with the ability to close deals.
  • Self-motivated professional with ability to work independently and take charge.
  • Strong people person able to influence others.
  • Ability to customize / create sales presentations and other materials as needed.
  • Communicates with impact: Develops and delivers compelling presentations, possesses an instinct on how to communicate and when to communicate to drive business results; Strong verbal and written communication skills; Able to rationalize complex decisions and communicate to stakeholders.
  • Strong understanding of digital, social, and brick-and-mortar marketing and retail landscape.
  • Proven track record of working in a fast-paced corporate environment.

description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with 260+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. We are pursuing consumer products because we believe it will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content and in effect, drive long-term value. We want merchandise, interactive games, and experiences to help promote our titles and build them into title brands, or franchises, so they become part of the zeitgeist for longer periods of time. That’s where you come in. We’re seeking a Retail & Licensing Specialist to support our consumer products growth ambitions in the UK. In this role, you'll have the thrilling opportunity to showcase fan-favorite titles like Stranger Things, Squid Game, and Bridgerton in ways that captivate audiences like never before. Reporting directly to the country lead, you'll be at the helm of shaping Netflix's presence at retail. From developing innovative concepts to executing impactful strategies, you'll be instrumental in solidifying Netflix's position as a leader in the UK retail landscape. Job Description Strategic Development: Develop and implement strategic plans for retail expansion and growth, fostering strong relationships with retailers to drive mutual success. Account Management: Proactively engage retailers with upcoming Netflix content and products, equipping them with the necessary resources to enhance sales performance and drive revenue. Revenue Growth: Utilise data-driven insights and category analysis to identify and capitalize on key revenue opportunities throughout the year. Planning & Trade Marketing: Lead the planning and execution of market launch programs, collaborating with retailers and licensees to create impactful cross-category retail activations. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Foster knowledge sharing and partnership by integrating best practices from other regions (UCAN, LATAM, APAC, EMEA) into local market strategies, driving continuous improvement and innovation. What We Need From You Demonstrated, 8+ years of experience in building and owning the end-to-end licensing function at a reputable entertainment brand (entertainment studio, retailer, licensee, agency) Knowledge of the UK licensing landscape with strong contacts and network within the UK licensing & retail landscape Retail Business knowledge across different local/regional tiers ( mass-market, Speciality, and online) and channels (knowledge of operational/omnichannel approach) Trade marketing and retail activations experience Passionate and curious about retail, marketing, and content Extremely organized, effective communicator, and thrive in a fast-paced environment Agile, goal-oriented, driven to succeed, and always up for a challenge Data performance analysis A natural and deep affection for film, television, and or brands Bachelor’s or advanced degree (preferred) Deep engagement competency and ability to work with multiple, disparate stakeholders to achieve the best outcome for Netflix. You can read more about our company culture here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Emerging Creative specializes in interaction, animation, cinematic UX, and engaging content-forward interfaces. Our goal is performant, intuitive & delightful user experiences that immerse users in an effortless flow, effectively convey information, and foster meaningful connections between Netflix, members (and soon-to-be members), and B2B partners around the globe. As strategic creative partners, we work with a range of Product teams to create, build, and implement UX concepts using motion, sound, video & visual design. We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to join the team! As ECXD Designer you will be responsible for UX/UI strategy with a focus on user interface design and brand expression across our full suite of consumer products including web, mobile, and TV. Working horizontally and collaboratively across a range of member and nonmember surfaces to envision and build product experiences that advance business goals, and the aesthetics and usability of the Netflix Product Excperience. Deliverables include UX concepts for testing and future-forward ideas communicated through a variety of artifacts like qual stimuli, wireframes, mockups, videos, high-fidelity prototypes, novel promotional asset concepts, and compelling business storytelling. Responsible For Establishing and leading UX visual design of the team’s portfolio. Acting as informed captain on complex multi-disciplinary projects, leading creative development and aligning multiple disciplines to project goals and creative direction. Partnering with cross-functional stakeholders to interpret goals into creative strategies for the team. Creating, iterating on, and supporting the testing of new UX designs. Translating business requirements to functional and engaging user interfaces. Based on feasibility requirements, ensuring an appropriate level of effort and complexity in the work. Incorporating user & market research into design and articulating strategy behind proposed solutions. Collaborating with XFN partners including UX designers, dev teams, researchers, writers, product managers, and other product partners. Continuously establishing and optimizing new partnerships and workflows. Collaborating with Design Systems to understand, apply, and evolve Netflix’s Brand Language to our product experience, responsibly applying and evolving established design Staying updated on the latest industry trends and techniques, and sharing knowledge with the team as a specialist in visual design. Must Have Ability to cultivate and craft beautiful, visionary product UX concepts grounded in user needs. Attention to detail and a passion for upholding an exceptional quality bar. Strong cross-discipline partnership and collaboration skills, with the ability to see the big picture strategically, bring pieces together, and drive clarity through ambiguity. Experience working with multidisciplinary teams including video, audio, and motion graphics on a variety of creative artifacts. Strong understanding of design systems and user-centered design principles. Excellent communication and presentation skills, able to articulate design decisions and high-level strategy clearly with an informed perspective. Proactive and self-starting, able to uncover (and propose ideas to solve) challenges and opportunities independently. Ability to participate in and influence driving impactful design solutions through all phases of a product development lifecycle. Bonus UX prototyping Product Marketing Expertise B2B business communications and Brand partnerships Content Promotion Creative UX motion design skills Strategic UX product planning and roadmap development Why work at Netflix? If you want to have a large impact at a growing company and work with a high-performance team. Work with talented colleagues on challenging problems that affect 250+ million members across the globe. We value high performance, freedom, and responsibility. We don't focus on rules, processes, or procedures. We are candid and transparent and seek excellence in all that we do. We tackle hard problems that others have yet to be able to solve. We produce great content, build systems at scale, and use data to push the business forward. We connect people with visual storytelling globally. Pay Transparency Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $200,000-$700,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here .Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity Are you a skilled social media manager who feels passionately about bringing brand strategy to life in creative ways? If yes, then keep reading! The social team at Netflix is made up of experts who understand the language of the internet and how to connect with audiences in a way that’s relatable and fan-first, never cringe. Social Managers are the voice of our brand for millions of followers around the world — helping our business priorities break through on social, to generate interest and ultimately conversation. We’re looking for an Integrated Marketing Social Manager role to build out editorial brand campaigns on our social channels that feel authentic and impactful for the audience. This role will develop social strategy for key brand partners, woven into experiential and live opportunities as well as bespoke activations on owned social channels. The right fit should have a social background, integrated marketing or brand partnership experience, and excellent editorial judgment to balance the needs of our business with how to reach the right audience with the right branded content. Key Responsibilities: Serve as the connective tissue with Integrated marketing to build new social sponsorship and integration opportunities that feel authentic to our channels and Netflix voice. Develop bespoke social media packages for potential and locked brand partners, inclusive of production budgets, editorial calendar, distribution strategy, and CTA / product positioning, with consideration for branded content guidelines and restrictions on owned/earned social, target audience, and overall campaign goals. Serve as a cross-functional thought partner for Integrated Marketing, Ad Sales, and Marketing Partnerships teams - providing sound creative recommendations to ensure we’re delivering social creative for brands and partners that are in line with the editorial quality of our channels. Coordinate with all relevant internal and external stakeholders to share social insights and data reporting by campaign for future learnings and improvement areas. Work with the Integrated Marketing team to understand the full spectrum of their priorities and initiatives, and cascade that information back to global/regional social teams for better upstream alignment. Background and Specific Skills: Knowledge of what works across various social platforms and experience in multi-channel distribution efforts. Integrated marketing and brand partnership experience, specifically related to digital and social-forward branded content campaigns. Extensive knowledge of paid/branded content placement on social including platform tools (Meta handshake), guidelines for FTC disclosures, and monetization rules and restrictions. Entrepreneurial spirit and highly collaborative - loves working with others, isn’t afraid to lead or follow. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience working on broad, multiple-platform brand campaigns and delivering nuanced, insight-based social strategies. Must be able to prioritize and handle several projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment while adhering to shifting deadlines. Able to build strong relationships and work across many internal cross-functional teams. High tolerance for change, and the capacity to accomplish enormous amounts of work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. Respect, understanding, and enthusiasm for Netflix culture. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. With this international expansion and a move into Korean originals, it's a great time to join Netflix. The Opportunity We are seeking a Post Production Coordinator to support the series/film Originals Post Production team in Korea. This position would organize vital post information and workflows with an increasingly growing slate of Original Shows from pre-production through archive & wrap using internal tools, as well as working closely with our cross-functional teams within Netflix. A successful candidate will be passionate, self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and communication.  The role will be focused on supporting English and Korean content that is usually produced throughout international territories with local talent and producers. Responsibilities Liaise with post-production teams and partner with IT Production Support to ensure successful onboarding of shows and personnel into Netflix systems Track and manage post schedules, keeping stakeholders apprised of the status Maintain and curate preferred vendor lists for dailies, sound and finishing Research and maintain preferred freelance post-crew Set up and manage dailies and cut viewing access for shows Audit completion/delivery of post-production materials during prep, production, archive, and wrap 5 years as a Post Production Supervisor (드라마 내부조감독), full-cycle Assistant Director, Script Supervisor, Assistant Editor, DI Producer, Assistant Colorist, and  DIT working in scripted series or feature film projects Experience working in post-production roles in Korea and across Asia Ability to handle a fast-paced environment supervising several projects at various points of production (from development through delivery) Qualifications Strong knowledge of current trends and workflows for both UHD/4K and HDR Knowledge of post production finishing formats and codecs Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters Ability and willingness to travel for official work Team-player who operates in a fast paced team-oriented setting Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of the current post process Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Mail Proficient in digital dailies delivery tools and production tools Experience with Avid Media Composer, Davinci Resolve, and professional camera formats - advantageous but not required. Studio or media-focused experience required Fluency in English and Korean required We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners producing and managing our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content production, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage the entertainment at scale. You’ll have a direct impact on how the Netflix studio creates and produces shows, such as “The Witcher”, “The Crown” and “Stranger Things” on a global scale. With an increasing slate of original content being produced every year, our products manage billions of dollars worth of content-spend. This role is based in Warsaw and our teams work in a hybrid-working model. Your Day-to-Day Work cross-functionally to build new services, tools, and data models to operationalize our workflows at scale. Participate in product reviews and team meetings, providing technical insight. Help scope, estimate, and prioritize between conflicting needs. Evaluate new technologies and approaches to streamline and improve our rapid application development tooling and conventions. Regularly learn new systems and tools as the Netflix platform and ecosystem evolve. Participate in our on-call rotation and contribute to incident reviews. You may enjoy working with us if you: Are self-driven and highly motivated to deliver top-tier solutions with minimal guidance. You also recognize when you're wrong, learning from your mistakes and moving past them. Love brainstorming with fellow Backend and UI engineers, product designers, and product managers, and directly with our users, to understand what they want, figure out what they really need, and finally, what we should build. Strive to embrace best practices and are always searching for opportunities to continually improve. We would love to work with you if: You have experience building media creative apps and/or media workflow You are passionate about user experience and have an eye for improving UIs You are adept at building enterprise applications with HTML/JavaScript/TypeScript/CSS. We currently build our user experiences with GraphQL, Node.js , and Electron frameworks, and the ability to adapt to changing technology is important. You have previous experience working with designers/PMs You have previous experience in the Media and Entertainment industry. Does this sound interesting? We’d love to talk to you! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix continues to grow and expand, we are looking for a talented team member to join the EMEA Tax Team in Amsterdam. The position will be responsible for preparing and reviewing various indirect tax returns and will work on process and data improvements. The position will report to the Manager, EMEA Indirect Tax. The candidate will be working closely with the rest of the tax and finance teams in Amsterdam as well as various other stakeholders, both in EMEA and other regions. The Role The ideal candidate has a strong fit with the Netflix values and culture, can collaborate well across the organization and has a hands-on mentality. We’re looking for someone with a tax and accounting background that can assist with our reporting and compliance obligations for our EMEA entities. The main responsibilities are: Ensure accurate and timely submission of Indirect tax returns (mainly VAT, but including WHT, property tax and DST) Monitoring tax accounts positions and performing account reconciliations for EMEA entities Assist with day-to-day Indirect tax queries from other departments and tax authorities. Support projects from Indirect tax compliance perspective e.g. new businesses set-up, changes in legislations, automation, etc.. Identifying and providing recommendations to streamline/automate the indirect tax processes This role is based out of Netflix’s EMEA headquarter in Amsterdam. Relevant experience in the areas mentioned will be key when applying for the role. We are looking for someone who is: A self-starter, who is able to work effectively and autonomously A great communicator who can build strong working relationships with external advisors and internal teams Accustomed to multitasking, prioritizing and meeting tight deadlines Proactive, hands-on and innovative Curious and enthusiastic, unafraid to ask questions and challenge the status quo Accurate and detail-oriented Flexible to collaborate with our International offices across multiple time zones Education and Experience 4+ years of experience in dealing with month-end close and indirect tax compliance A combination of in-house experience and public accounting or consultancy experience is preferred Experience working with international accounting and indirect tax requirements Undergraduate or Advanced degree in Tax, Finance or Accounting Advanced MS Excel and Google Sheets experience with the ability to navigate large data sets Demonstrated ability to drive process improvements and automation Fluent in English, other regional languages are helpful Experience with Workday Financials or other (cloud-based) ERP systems Experience in the entertainment/tech industry is a plus We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and gaming across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are Netflix’s Corporate Development team. Our focus is on sourcing, evaluating, and executing M&A activity on behalf of Netflix and analyzing other strategic opportunities for the company. On this team, we work with all the business units to identify opportunities and assets that can help us achieve our goal to entertain the world. In this role you’ll have the opportunity to: 1. Drive our M&A strategy and execution as part of the Corporate Development team. 2. Work with key business unit leaders and senior management on M&A. 3. Identify and analyze greenfield business opportunities for the company. This role will report directly to the VP, Corporate Development and will sit in our Los Angeles office. Responsibilities: Analyze M&A opportunities: Help ideate M&A opportunities for the company and provide initial evaluation of inbound M&A 		and investment opportunities In conjunction with team members and business unit partners, provide analysis to evaluate a variety of deals and present recommendation to senior management Draft and author memos summarizing deal recommendations Deal execution and integration: Independently capable of leading business, financial, legal and regulatory diligence Coordinate the due diligence process, managing multiple parties including internal business leaders, third-party diligence providers and seller counsel and management Negotiate key deal terms and manage deal process including key stakeholders, cross-functional partners and third party advisors Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in M&A in investment banking and/or corporate development. Strong financial acumen and analytical skills, critical thinking, communication and judgment are a must. A self-starter with the ability to drive day-to-day deal execution from start to finish and collaborate effectively with Corporate Development team members and other stakeholders. Must be able to prioritize and handle multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment while adhering to shifting deadlines. Highly organized and strategic with the experience to implement best practices to ensure the team operates in a highly efficient manner. High tolerance for change, and the capacity to accomplish enormous amounts of work in an ever-changing environment. Clear written and verbal communication. Respect, understanding and enthusiasm for Netflix culture. Attention to detail and ability to work independently in a fast-paced work environment; The ideal candidate will be capable and comfortable working in a deadline-driven setting. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $210,000 - $500,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here .

description: Join our team at Netflix Series Animation as an HRBP (Human Resources Business Partner), Content and Production. As an HRBP, you'll be a navigator guiding our people managers and individual contributors through the exciting landscape of talent management. From onboarding to performance management, development to team health, and culture - you're the trusty compass pointing the way! A critical focus area for the HRBP is to enhance manager capability, empowering them to be more self-reliant. This role involves driving manager education on crucial people programs, tools, and processes. But that's not all! You'll also work in partnership with the Sr. HRBP  to create a talent strategy. This isn't your average strategy; it's a roadmap that highlights growth and scalability opportunities while reflecting the unique Netflix culture and aiming for optimal org health. What you will do: Embrace a proactive approach, showing a willingness to engage directly with our Content and Production managers and individual contributors to understand the needs of our diverse employee population Contribute and execute the implementation of company wide talent programs and initiatives  (360s, compensation reviews, leadership development, etc) Work in collaboration with our Global Business Practices “GBP’s” (Talent Acquisition, Inclusion & Diversity, Talent Management, and Talent Employee Operations) to ensure a consistent and cohesive employee experience Ability to interface at all levels of the organization, including executive levels, demonstrating excellent organizational and interpersonal skills in line with Netflix's culture Lead employee relations matters, providing guidance and support to managers and employees. Ensure accuracy of org data in Workday, facilitating seamless reporting and analysis Effectively integrate inclusion and diversity practices into all aspects of the organization Display the ability to think big, in line with Netflix's culture of innovation, yet not be afraid to "roll up your sleeves" and tackle ground-level work Partner with the Workplace/Community & Experiences team on projects that enhance our workplace culture and environment at Vine Studios What we are looking for: Bachelor’s degree or higher, in HR or related field with 5-7 years of relevant experience partnering with managers on full employment lifecycle touchpoints; ideally in a creative or production environment Strong business and HR acumen, including strong problem-solving skills, high judgment, critical thinking and analysis; animation background a plus Strong communication skills; excellent spoken and written English Software desired: Workday, Adobe, Google Suite, specifically Slides/Sheets; presentation deck knowledge a plus Experience working in a highly matrixed organization, creative/production environments a plus Project management and execution skills Coaching and consulting skills Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $80,000 - $280,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing further into exciting new innovations in personalization and discovery, experimentation and decision-making, understanding our members and our titles, backend and infrastructure, and more, all driven by research at the frontiers of ML and its many intersections with adjacent fields. The Machine Learning and Inference Research team is a dedicated research team designed to build up Netflix’s technical capabilities by diving deep and exploring research questions aligned with the biggest challenges at Netflix while partnering with teams across the business to bring these capabilities to life. As a member of the Machine Learning and Inference Research team, you will have the opportunity to drive and execute bleeding-edge research while working in close partnership both with other researchers in the team and with partners in a wide range of teams across product, growth, and content. You will leverage your expertise in the frontiers of ML to influence the direction of company roadmaps and to work collaboratively cross-functionally to prototype, test, and implement your research to deliver improvements to the member experience and drive change across the company.  Additionally, you will be actively engaged with the broader ML research community through conferences, publications, organizational activities, and academic collaborations. We are looking for an experienced researcher with broad expertise in machine learning who can establish and execute a strong research agenda, disseminate knowledge, get others behind their ideas, and foster an open environment of collaboration, innovation, and intellectual excitement. What you bring Ph.D. in a relevant area, with multiple years of post-Ph.D. experience in industry and/or academia. Experience in applying research (preferably yours) to transform real business problems in collaboration with engineering and business teams. Ample research experience, in industry and/or academia, including as evidenced in publications. A track record of bringing clarity to and leading ambitious research projects inspired by real-world challenges. Regarded as a role model both because of your technical expertise as well as the impact you drive. Consistently sought out by stakeholders for collaboration, guidance, problem-solving, and decision-making. Excellent judgment in identifying and framing ambiguous research and business problems and the links between the two. Passion for collaboration and building strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders to tackle big, cross-functional problems. Exceptional communication with technical, non-technical, and mixed audiences. Self-motivated with an ability to thrive and to lead with minimal oversight and process. Uplevels the greater org through sharing knowledge and guiding thought on the adoption of new methods. Actively mentors others and is sought out as a mentor. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $400,000 - $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Los Gatos, California Data Science and Engineering Research Scientist (L6) - Machine Learning and Inference Research Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing further into exciting new innovations in personalization and discovery, experimentation and decision-making, understanding our members and our titles, backend and infrastructure, and more, all driven by research at the frontiers of ML and its many intersections with adjacent fields. The Machine Learning and Inference Research team is a dedicated research team designed to build up Netflix’s technical capabilities by diving deep and exploring research questions aligned with the biggest challenges at Netflix while partnering with teams across the business to bring these capabilities to life. As a member of the Machine Learning and Inference Research team, you will have the opportunity to drive and execute bleeding-edge research while working in close partnership both with other researchers in the team and with partners in a wide range of teams across product, growth, and content. You will leverage your expertise in the frontiers of ML to influence the direction of company roadmaps and to work collaboratively cross-functionally to prototype, test, and implement your research to deliver improvements to the member experience and drive change across the company.  Additionally, you will be actively engaged with the broader ML research community through conferences, publications, organizational activities, and academic collaborations. We are looking for an experienced researcher with broad expertise in machine learning who can establish and execute a strong research agenda, disseminate knowledge, get others behind their ideas, and foster an open environment of collaboration, innovation, and intellectual excitement. What you bring
  • Ph.D. in a relevant area, with multiple years of post-Ph.D. experience in industry and/or academia.
  • Experience in applying research (preferably yours) to transform real business problems in collaboration with engineering and business teams.
  • Ample research experience, in industry and/or academia, including as evidenced in publications.
  • A track record of bringing clarity to and leading ambitious research projects inspired by real-world challenges.
  • Regarded as a role model both because of your technical expertise as well as the impact you drive. Consistently sought out by stakeholders for collaboration, guidance, problem-solving, and decision-making.
  • Excellent judgment in identifying and framing ambiguous research and business problems and the links between the two.
  • Passion for collaboration and building strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders to tackle big, cross-functional problems.
  • Exceptional communication with technical, non-technical, and mixed audiences.
  • Self-motivated with an ability to thrive and to lead with minimal oversight and process.
  • Uplevels the greater org through sharing knowledge and guiding thought on the adoption of new methods. Actively mentors others and is sought out as a mentor.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 220 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. The Finance Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) Content team is looking for a Senior Manager to join its India team. FS&A Content is the team that leads the charge on co-developing the strategy and planning behind our content buying and original content decisions for local language film and TV series and its development. The team works cross-functionally to translate the incredible amount of data at Netflix into financial decisions regarding the production and acquisition of shows and films. The team also evaluates the general programming and content strategy, in addition to leading competitive analysis. We partner closely with the senior leadership of Netflix who depend heavily on the strategic insights we provide to inform critical business decisions. This person will have a high degree of visibility with India senior management which uses the team’s strategic input to inform important decisions on our India content strategy and planning. The role involves close engagement and coordination with members of the FS&A team in both Asia Pacific and the US and will report to the Director Finance & Strategy, India in Mumbai. Responsibilities Lead development of local content strategy to improve our value proposition of our members and members to be in partnership with the Content teams Lead deal analysis and valuation of new projects in partnership with the Content and other cross-functional teams Develop a deep understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities to better inform our future strategic choices. Compiling thoughtful post-mortem analyses to determine areas for optimization improvement and  innovation. Work cross-functionally with other teams including regional / global Strategy, FP&A, Production Finance Product, Consumer Insights, and Data Science Qualifications 10 to 12 years of experience in a top management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity, hedge fund, and/or media/entertainment/tech company in a strategy/business development/analytical role. Significant experience in influencing Senior Management and Executive stakeholders on areas of strategy creation, planning and enabling execution Highly analytical and experienced in leading complex quantitative and qualitative analysis. Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages. and be a strong, effective communicator. Experienced in building and managing high-performing teams Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Passion and familiarity with India local language content and entertainment is a strong plus
