description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Are you passionate about entertainment? Are you deeply knowledgeable about the world of film? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment? Are you keen to jump in and take on tasks big and small to get the job done? If these resonate with you, then this is a great opportunity to join a team that is spearheading publicity campaigns for films from the brightest filmmaking talent. The Publicity Coordinator will work as part of the newly established UK + EMEA Film PR team, based in London with a degree of international travel required.  The role will report to the Senior Manager / Pod Lead and will work closely with the pod’s Manager and Specialist. Read our culture memo to learn more about how we work at Netflix. Candidates would see this as an opportunity towards managing publicity campaigns. THE OPPORTUNITY It’s the chance to support the UK + EMEA Publicity team’s film initiative, who work alongside our global partners. Together, the team is changing the perception of Netflix films and how they should be enjoyed and celebrated, both externally with consumers and within the industry amongst filmmaking talent. It’s a chance to be a part of a growing, dynamic, exciting and fast-paced team who are passionate about film, innovation and creativity. The Coordinator will play a key role in supporting the publicity team working on the Netflix scripted  and documentary film slate, including both our UK and global titles that span across all genres. The UK + EMEA Film PR team is responsible for formulating and implementing strategy across Europe, the Middle East and Africa and executing impactful campaigns in the UK and Ireland. In this expansive role you will provide a critical link working with local country teams across EMEA, and globally, in promoting film content on the service as well as delivering innovative, culturally relevant and creative publicity campaigns in the UK. Tasks are focused on extensive and timely logistics. They will include but are not limited to: Working with coordinators cross-departmentally to set best practices that enable us to move quicker, bigger and better Leading on talent logistics such as booking travel and negotiating glam; updating itineraries; supporting junket, premiere, press day and film festivals activity Tracking budgets, raising POs and managing invoices Assisting with meeting schedules and facilitation, including help putting together presentations and coordinating audiovisual needs Tracking top press coverage on key titles; updating various lists, documents and charts on the department’s google drive; and other duties as assigned Liaising with various external stakeholders such as global PR agencies, press, talent reps, plus internal executives and country publicists Handling incoming press requests as/when needed including assigning screeners/setting up screenings; responding to enquiries; servicing assets The successful candidate has/is: At least 3 years of entertainment publicity experience at an agency or studio Confident and concise communicator who is not scared to speak up and express ideas thoughtfully Organised, excellent attention to detail and proactive Scrappy, resourceful and relentless in trying to find a solution before escalating issues Able to anticipate potential problems and knows when to ask for help Aware that the world of publicity is not a 9-5 job Able to effectively manage your own time and heavy workload, all while maintaining a cool head under pressure Able to demonstrate good judgement and maturity Able to pivot and adapt to shifting priorities without missing a beat Open to receiving feedback and adapting A positive contributor to the overall publicity team Able to function effectively as a part of a loosely coupled but highly-aligned team A basic understanding of the UK & EMEA media landscape Additional European languages a plus We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

  • Leading on talent logistics such as booking travel and negotiating glam; updating itineraries; supporting junket, premiere, press day and film festivals activity
  • Tracking budgets, raising POs and managing invoices
  • Assisting with meeting schedules and facilitation, including help putting together presentations and coordinating audiovisual needs
  • Tracking top press coverage on key titles; updating various lists, documents and charts on the department’s google drive; and other duties as assigned

  • Able to anticipate potential problems and knows when to ask for help 
  • Aware that the world of publicity is not a 9-5 job 
  • Able to effectively manage your own time and heavy workload, all while maintaining a cool head under pressure
  • Able to demonstrate good judgement and maturity
  • Able to pivot and adapt to shifting priorities without missing a beat
  • Open to receiving feedback and adapting
  • A positive contributor to the overall publicity team
  • Able to function effectively as a part of a loosely coupled but highly-aligned team 
  • A basic understanding of the UK & EMEA media landscape
  • Additional European languages a plus

description: The Opportunity Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching, as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. To support this growth, we are looking for an Event Specialist for the UK who will be based out of our office in London. The Role This UK Event Specialist will play a key role in strategizing, executing and managing external and some large scale internal events as part of the publicity and marketing team. They will be a member of a broader, seasoned group of events professionals who are based across the local offices in EMEA. This role will be responsible for collaborating, supporting and delivering the events for the UK and will report into the Event Lead UK. The primary focus of this role will be a combination of managing your own small to mid-sized events, supporting event managers on large-scale events and keeping the entire UK Events Team organised across all UK events. More broadly the goal of the team is to drive conversation around Netflix titles, talent and the brand through curated external events and experiences. The specialist will work with other events team members and the cross functional team that is helping to create, shape, execute and manage campaigns for our content, meaning that they will have to be in sync and show a curiosity about promotional efforts and contribute to building campaigns with new and innovative event ideas.  This is also a hands-on role and one that requires end to end project management of some events, whilst also working as a support on other events. This will involve varying tasks such as leading cross functional project taskforce groups, managing agency pitches, ideating event creative, overseeing guest communications, formulating budgets, handling event admin and much more. Success in the role is someone who can simplify even the most challenging of situations, leaving partners and talent impressed and feeling like their event is in very safe and trusted hands. Candidate Profile Has a minimum of 7 years of experience in an events role, at an agency, entertainment studio, network or with a global brand. Has demonstrable experience with handling event production including high end builds, management of F&B, guest lists, event seating plus more. A solid understanding of the UK market, press and entertainment landscape. An effective communicator - someone who can articulate what they are trying to achieve, positively influence others to their way of thinking and is confident to share their POV with stakeholders at all levels of the organisation. Has demonstrable experience of in-person and virtual event production and is curious to continually innovate in this space to take our events to the next level. Is so highly organized that even Marie Kondo would be proud. They can handle a vast amount of work and are open to learning new skills. Thrives in a fast-paced and collaborative environment, comfortable in managing multiple projects concurrently and not afraid to get stuck into the work, regardless of the task. Fluency in English. A proactive self-starter who exhibits good judgment, great teamwork, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, inclusion , integrity, passion, and curiosity. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Location: Los Gatos, CA or US Remote only. Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 250 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. This scale and experience requires a large engineering organization that collectively works together to give customers the end product they love to use. Productivity Engineering is the organization tasked with making Netflix engineers more effective by building and supporting the infrastructure to create, build, test, deploy, run, and Observe the Netflix stack. As Netflix grows, so does the complexity behind our engineering systems. Our challenge is deceivingly simple: keep the developer experience amazing even as complexity increases. Our work impacts virtually every engineer at Netflix and enables other platform teams to innovate faster. We are looking for a talented engineering leader to join our team. We are seeking a Senior Engineering Manager to lead Netflix’s observability efforts. As the “eyes and ears” of Netflix engineering, this team is responsible for implementing infrastructure and tools to enable visibility into the health of hundreds of applications that power Netflix. Thanks to the critical work of this team, Netflix is able to power a highly available system that rivals the reliability of utilities. The Observability engineering team consists of three sub-groups: Telemetry, Monitoring, Explore & Troubleshooting. You will need to partner with engineering teams across Netflix to build tools and infrastructure that enable fellow engineers to gather timely and actionable insights to help the Netflix service operate reliably. In this role, you will Team Leadership: Hold a high bar in hiring and retention. Inspire the team toward timely execution and delivery. Ensure high and consistent velocity of output even in the face of ambiguity. Technical Vision: Smartly invest in the telemetry data architecture to meet the fast-changing needs of our business. Product Vision: Invests in understanding how Netflix engineering will evolve in the future and develop an iterative roadmap with product leaders to meet those needs. Domain Expertise: Show thought leadership and consistent curiosity in observability engineering. Develop a productivity engineering culture that cares deeply about making fellow engineers more effective. Customer Partnerships: Collaborating with customers and partners, keeping our customers up to date, driving alignment What sets you apart Strong understanding of distributed systems and architecture Deep empathy and connection for other engineering teams and their business goals Track record of building and leading exceptional software engineering teams Proven experience coaching and developing technical leaders and people managers Tenacity and the ability to balance competing priorities across multiple cross-functional partners and programs Exceptional written and verbal communication skills Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000- $1,200,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Want to know more about our team? You can learn about us: - Productivity Engineering Podcast - Edgar: Solving Mysteries Faster with Observability | by Netflix Technology Blog - Lumen: Custom, Self-Service Dashboarding For Netflix | by Netflix Technology Blog - Netflix FlameScope

description: Netflix is seeking an Executive Assistant to provide support for VP, Head of Corporate Legal, in Los Angeles. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is able to exercise good judgment and significant initiative and is looking for a new challenge. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Maintaining calendar for the VP and building relationships and working hand-in-hand with other EAs for our stakeholders across the business Scheduling meetings & calls, internally & externally Helping to plan agendas and programs for the whole team (~140 people) Taking notes in meetings and circulating information to the team Coordinate travel arrangements (domestic and international) and other administrative duties (i.e. processing travel and expense reports, digital filing, etc.) Creating presentations and documents using Google Suite Maintaining a log used to track projects and their status The ability to assist with team projects and events as needed including an annual Offsite/Onsite and a variety of monthly team VCs across multiple time zones Coordinating offsite events & activities Location scouting, talking with vendors, working on all logistics Executing logistics for projects and events that impact the entire org Qualifications: Experience in an EA support role Advanced proficiency with Google Suite including Gmail, Google Calendar, Google Slides, Google Sheets and Slack in a business environment (not just personal use) Resourceful and understands how to navigate stakeholder management Excellent organizational, communication, and customer service skills Quick learner Self Starter Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to see the big picture Ability to work comfortably with people at all levels of the organization Loads of common sense, flexibility, and maturity – must be discreet and able to maintain confidential information Positive attitude and team player, especially when faced with changing responsibilities Belief that no contribution to the team is too big or too small Understanding how to prioritize and respond accordingly We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Come play a pivotal role in Netflix's quest to transform the way a studio empowers and accelerates production workflows. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone that is passionate about production and post workflows and ready to take the filmmaking process to the next level. Netflix’s System Workflow and Technology team is looking for an execution-oriented, highly effective workflow engineer with extensive knowledge in live-action production workflows, tools, and platforms, including a proven history of providing white glove support to post-production. This unique and exciting opportunity will have a direct impact on the future of production supporting bleeding-edge technology, such as next-generation workflows to our post facilities and content creators around the world. The Content Hub Media Production Suite Support Specialist will essentially be an air traffic controller for post production automated tools we offer at Netflix. The Content Hub Media Production suite is Netflix post and production in the cloud system. It enables 21st-century media workflow for media sharing. This role will be responsible for monitoring all pipelines, flagging and resolving issues, and ensuring communication internally and externally is managed for any issues that arise. Your role will include collaborating with the studio, product, engineering, Netflix personnel, and crew directly working on productions. Therefore you will need the ability to manage expectations, multi-task, and make judgment calls on when to elevate which issues to which team. How do you know if this role is right for you? You have managed data and or workflows for a post-production facility You have managed workstations, hardware, and overall support at a post-production facility You have a background in software/hardware development & you have worked on set, or in post-production, OR You have managed an automated transcoding service in a past job offered to post-production Your primary job functions are: Monitor all Content Hub Media Production Suite automated file transfer and transcoding activity Ensure the Netflix Content Hub Media Production Suite tools receive timely support when issues arise, managing communication with that end user throughout the issue lifecycle, as well as escalate/triage when necessary Partner closely with the Senior Manager, Production Media Systems to stay current on product developments. This includes tracking key milestones and timelines to ensure awareness of product version management. Monitor and analyze our tool utilization to proactively identify potential issues, and inform forecasting and future resource management. Partner with the Senior Manager, Production Media Systems on advancing and evolving Media Production suite operational strategy. Own the feedback loop for the Content Hub Media Production Suite from their region to Studio and Product. Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in post-production, with roles in facility, as well as process management, at a post-production vendor, studio, or network. Deep knowledge and experience with content creation processes, on-set production, and post-production services. Proficiency in speaking and writing in English is a must, but the ability to also communicate in Spanish is a valuable asset to this role Understanding of JSON, XML, CSV, and other commonly used data formats Familiarity working across Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems Previous experience working with media asset management and workflow automation systems Understanding of different types of storage infrastructure leveraged throughout production and post, including local drives, facility storage array networks, and cloud storage Understand the practical application of and have experience in dailies processing, editorial, VFX pulls, and conform/online to final delivery. Familiarity with production and post-production software (e.g. Avid Media Composer, Adobe Premiere, Colorfront OSD & Transkoder, and Aspera). A clear understanding of how software from on set through production and post are used and the differentiators between them. Knowledge of industry standards and the bodies that ratify them. Knowledge of and relationships with technology solutions, equipment, and service vendors across production and post-production. Previous background in software development, workflow scripting, or system administration is not required, but a strong plus We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Team Ads Marketing function leads the development of our core Netflix Ads positioning, and the GTM plans to bring this positioning to life through differentiated messaging and narratives in the market.  The team activates this messaging through Sales Materials(presentations, narratives, talking points) and broader B2B channels to garner broad awareness and excitement amongst our key advertising partners. The Opportunity As the Manager, of Ads B2B Marketing, Germany will be a key part of the Ads Marketing team’s success by crafting and activating the Netflix advertising story and value proposition to advertisers across the German market. You’ll work with multidisciplinary teams to develop strategic approaches to fueling business growth on the platform, unlocking the creative potential of Netflix's Advertising offering. Additionally, you will contribute to broader business tactics beyond your role and pursue learning and development opportunities to consistently grow and evolve as a Netflix marketer. Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Design and craft go-to-market strategies and narratives in an exciting way for the Sales team and their advertising clients in Germany in collaboration with the European Ads Marketing team. Lead the strategy and approach for how Netflix Ads show up at local industry events and bespoke client engagements in Germany. Understand our advertisers, assess the right data, seek insights and inform local marketing strategy and stories. Partner regularly with international teams for launches and ongoing growth ( Ad Sales Marketing, Sales, Ad Product, Events, Comms/PR, and others). Help inform the development of new Ads products based on advertiser feedback and market insights. Deliver regular updates to leadership complete with wins, challenges, and asks. Qualifications: At least 7 years of experience in B2B marketing, product marketing, digital advertising and marketing communications. Fluency in English and German An understanding of the CTV/OTT/Streaming landscape is preferred. Previous experience in product positioning, narrative, and sales collateral development. Extensive experience working closely with product and Ad sales teams to develop strategy and messaging. Ability to develop and implement creative ideas, partner with agencies, and manage competing projects with tight deadlines. Experience with developing content including blog posts, case studies, presentations, creative assets, and thought leadership that support our marketing objectives. Ability to work in a highly cross-functional environment to drive stakeholder alignment and scaled communications. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are ). We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Role Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The Content Risk Management Team supports our Content Organisation functions globally. This East Asia-based role will be a joint lead for the Production Safety discipline across APAC (ex-India) and reports to the Regional Lead, Content Risk Management APAC. The role will be responsible for the development, implementation and management of safety programs necessary to ensure a healthy, safe and environmentally sound work place, as well as assisting productions in compliance with all applicable governmental health & safety and environmental regulations. Responsibilities Provides health & safety guidance to Netflix’s APAC ex-India productions Review and advise on production health and safety plans and guidelines to production partners. Upon request, evaluates production/post concepts, scripts, production facilities and workflows for safety and environmental concerns and risks Mitigates safety concerns by working directly with Production Executives, Producers, Unit Production Managers, Supervisors and other production staff as required Advises Production as required in the planning, budgeting and execution phase of filming services: assessing safety needs, securing appropriate vendors, and travelling to remote locations and/or facilities as required Reviews partner Risk Assessments and recommend corrective actions and assist productions in implementation Responds to, and investigates production safety emergencies, incidents and accidents Coordinates production employee health & safety training Develops and maintains effective working relationships with industry safety organisations, representatives, consultants and governmental regulatory agencies as appropriate Determines the applicable regulations in locations where a particular production may be shooting Works collaboratively with Production Security functions in minimising operational risk Qualifications A minimum 5 years of occupational health & safety related experience. Bachelor's degree in H&S, ES, PS is a plus Strong experience in regional market health & safety programs with willingness to learn regulatory framework across APAC region Understanding of motion picture and television production process including organisational structure, terminology, equipment, construction methods, stunt and special effects techniques, etc. preferred Certified Safety Professional (CSP) or Chartered Member to the Institute of Occupational Safety & Health (CMIOSH) certification or regional equivalent a plus Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills in English and a regional language Understanding of security planning and processes a plus Ability to Communicate relevant analysis and forecasting to key stakeholders Interact with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders Ability to respond to production needs/emergencies at all hours of the day Ability to work independently without immediate management supervision Travel regionally (approximately 25%-50%) and internationally as required We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Established in September 2022, Moonloot Games is a Netflix game studio located in Helsinki, Finland. We thrive to become a world-class games studio bringing a variety of delightful and deeply engaging original games to hundreds of millions of Netflix members around the world. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. We are looking for an experienced full-time VFX Artist and Animator with a strong sensibility for art and the technical ability to create visual effects and 3D animations. This position will work with the Art Director, Designers, and Engineering Team to bring innovative visuals to life in the Unity Engine and Blender. As a VFX Artist and Animator at Moonloot you will... Design dynamic VFX systems that add atmosphere and depth to environments and gameplay Create animations for the environment and characters that bring the game to life Maintain a given style across a variety of assets, and expand that style to fit the requirements of new assets Recognizing what VFX and animations are needed, and supporting art vendors and engineers with VFX visualization Designing, creating, and integrating VFX and animations from start to finish Rendering loopable animations You will work closely with the artists, designers, and engineers on the team, to develop, implement, set dress environments and cinematics with VFX and animations You will be the link between the artistic and technical teams and therefore it is vital that you are able to develop the needed systems and applications Ideally, you are... We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with 260+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. We are pursuing consumer products because we believe it will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content and in effect, drive long term value. We want merchandise, interactive games, and experiences to help promote our titles and build them into title brands, or franchises, so they become part of the zeitgeist for longer periods of time. That’s where you come in, we’re seeking a Retail Specialist to support our consumer products growth ambitions in DACH. In this role, you lead the launch of innovative products and immersive retail activations, featuring Netflix titles such as Stranger Things, Squid Game, and Bridgerton. Reporting directly to the country lead, your focus is on developing and implementing best practices to position Netflix as a preeminent player in the region's retail landscape. This role requires someone to take on the responsibility of creating and executing the Netflix consumer retail strategy for DACH based on the Netflix originals content slate. Mission As the Retail Specialist DACH at Netflix, you have a broad and deep knowledge of the diverse DACH retail sector and navigate strategic partnerships with retailers such as Edeka, Schwarz Gruppe, dm-drogerie Markt, Amazon etc. Job Description (Objectives) Foundation & Strategy: Laying out the strategy through DTR and/or retail development and continue building retailers relationship Management & prioritization: Inform retailers about Netflix upcoming content, products and provide necessary tools for them to increase sales performance of Netflix products Revenue maximization: Analyze and scale business opportunities through category analysis, as well as identifying key revenue drivers throughout the year Planning & Trade Marketing: Plan the launch-to-market programs as well as potential cross-category retail activations with key stakeholders both retailers and licensees Cross-functional support: create and leverage best-retail practices from other countries/regions - UCAN, LATAM, APAC and EMEA into local market and vice-versa What we are looking for Demonstrated, 8+ years of experience in the retail industry with F&B brands and/or content IPs, with proven results Ownership of relationship with retailers across buying, marketing and category management, solid retail network Knowledge on operational marketing / omnichannel approach Agile, goal-oriented, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge Data performance analysis Cross-functional teamwork knowledge, how to navigate and connect the dots Retail business knowledge across different tiers from Mass-market, speciality to online Trade marketing and retail activations experience Passion for innovation Proactive and creativity at its core Entrepreneurial and fast-growing competency Adaptable to multiple changes and speed A natural and deep affection for film, television and or brands Deep engagement competency and ability to work with multiple, disparate stakeholders to achieve the best outcome for Netflix. You can read more about our company culture here German/ English (mandatory) Bachelor’s or advanced degree (preferred) We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change plans at any time. The Product FS&A team is tasked with partnering with Product leaders and ensuring great discovery and engagement experiences for our members. To guide the business effectively, this role requires evaluating Netflix’s product experience across markets and platforms, tracking market dynamics and competitor trends, and understanding consumer behavior changes to various in-product experiences. We collaborate closely with several teams including Data Science and Engineering, Consumer Insights, Corporate Finance, and Member Product. This role will be based in the Netflix Headquarters in Los Gatos, California and report to the Senior Director of Product FS&A. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Evaluating how changes to the member/user experience drive user behaviors including engagement and churn. Understanding market, platform, and consumer characteristic differences and the impact each has on key membership metrics. Determining areas for product improvement based on external benchmarks, competitive research, and internal performance metrics. Evaluating opportunities to improve member lifetime value by increasing engagement. Developing models to understand the mechanics and business impacts of different initiatives. Helping build a product and business roadmap by prioritizing projects and product features based on their contribution to business objectives. Translating our initiatives into presentations and memos for cross-functional partners and senior management to facilitate decision-making and disseminate information. Helping track industry developments and relevant benchmarks to understand impacts and implications to our business. What we are looking for: 5+ years of experience in highly analytical roles tied to consumer product strategy. Strong modeling skills and comfort managing large sets of data. Strong proficiency with Excel / Google Sheets and SQL. Team player with strong interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently; must thrive in a fast-paced, always-changing environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Skilled in preparing and delivering effective presentations to executive audiences. Highly intellectually curious, has the courage to challenge the status quo, and exhibits the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Senior Content Designer, Ads Consumer LA, LG or remote Netflix is seeking an experienced content designer to work on Ads. The Role At Netflix, we aspire to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created, and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 220 million paid members. We recently launched a new ad-supported tier to offer our members more choice in how they consume their content. Our new tier allows us to attract new members at a lower price point, while also creating a compelling path for advertisers to reach audiences that are deeply immersed. To help us deliver this compelling experience, we’re looking for a highly ambitious, visionary, and experienced Senior Content Designer who will help shape Netflix’s ads consumer experiences for our users. This includes crafting innovative ad formats tailored to our wide variety of content and experiences, innovating within our existing ad canvases, and creating the future of advertising on Netflix. You will also partner closely with other product designers working across our various member experience teams to deliver a delightful, engaging, and highly relevant Ads experience for our Netflix members. This will be a remote-friendly role, with the freedom to set a flexible work-from-home schedule. This role would be best for candidates located in California or in the Pacific time zone, as monthly in-person travel will be required to collaborate with stakeholders and partners in Los Angeles, CA and Los Gatos, CA.  That said, we can always make exceptions in location for the right candidate. About Our Team Our team designs the ads consumer experiences for Netflix. These experiences span our entire product and empower our advertisers and sponsors to reach our members while maintaining the highest bar for the overall experience.  We also design the foundational features that make the Ads plan different from our other plans, helping our users maintain control and transparency of their advertising experience. Our team’s primary superpower is the ability to design creatively and collaboratively in highly complex environments balancing the needs of our members and our advertisers through rigorous testing, empathy, and expertise. You’ll be one of the lead designers who crafts these experiences and shapes the future of advertising across our product.  More specifically, you’ll be a critical part of one of the most talented and trailblazing advertising design teams in the world. About You As an ads content designer, you’ll help set and elevate the Content Design vision and strategy, codify terminology, define copy style and patterns, and craft UI copy for a global audience. In addition: You have demonstrated experience in content design/content strategy, UX writing, with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. You’re a storyteller at heart who can craft and orchestrate cohesive narratives across touchpoints, both in the product and in training and business settings. You’re a systems thinker who’s familiar with the development of information architecture, design systems and language frameworks that scale. You’re self-motivated, proactive, highly organized, and have a steadfast attention to detail. You’re a product thinker who’s comfortable with innovating and finding creative solutions. You work collaboratively to drive alignment and prioritization, while partnering with cross-functional peers across design, engineering and product, to define a strong UX. You possess a keen sense of empathy for advertisers and consumers and a deep desire to mine opportunities in the space. You communicate productively with visual thinkers and are comfortable presenting and advocating for your point of view in a candid, feedback-driven culture. Qualifications 6+ years of relevant experience: UX writing, content design/content strategy, technical writing, taxonomy, and IA. In addition, past experience at an ad agency or digital agency would be highly valuable for this role. Demonstrated experience synthesizing business requirements and user needs into UI content for consumer audiences. Mastery of AP style and the confidence to know when to break the rules. Ability to think critically about user journeys and content flows, and to connect the dots between them. Ability to navigate ambiguity and traverse altitudes from strategic visioning to tactical execution. Highly collaborative, organized and self-directed, able to effectively prioritize and respond accordingly to the shifting needs of the team. This full-time, salaried position reports to the partnership enablement Content Design Manager. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000-$515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

These experiences span our entire product and empower our advertisers and sponsors to reach our members while maintaining the highest bar for the overall experience.  We also design the foundational features that make the Ads plan different from our other plans, helping our users maintain control and transparency of their advertising experience. Our team’s primary superpower is the ability to design creatively and collaboratively in highly complex environments balancing the needs of our members and our advertisers through rigorous testing, empathy, and expertise. You’ll be one of the lead designers who crafts these experiences and shapes the future of advertising across our product.  More specifically, you’ll be a critical part of one of the most talented and trailblazing advertising design teams in the world. About You As an ads content designer, you’ll help set and elevate the Content Design vision and strategy, codify terminology, define copy style and patterns, and craft UI copy for a global audience. In addition:
  • You have demonstrated experience in content design/content strategy, UX writing, with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.
  • You’re a storyteller at heart who can craft and orchestrate cohesive narratives across touchpoints, both in the product and in training and business settings.
  • You’re a systems thinker who’s familiar with the development of information architecture, design systems and language frameworks that scale.
  • You’re self-motivated, proactive, highly organized, and have a steadfast attention to detail.
  • You’re a product thinker who’s comfortable with innovating and finding creative solutions. 
  • You work collaboratively to drive alignment and prioritization, while partnering with cross-functional peers across design, engineering and product, to define a strong UX. 
  • You possess a keen sense of empathy for advertisers and consumers and a deep desire to mine opportunities in the space.
  • You communicate productively with visual thinkers and are comfortable presenting and advocating for your point of view in a candid, feedback-driven culture.
    • Qualifications
  • 6+ years of relevant experience: UX writing, content design/content strategy, technical writing, taxonomy, and IA. In addition, past experience at an ad agency or digital agency would be highly valuable for this role.
  • Demonstrated experience synthesizing business requirements and user needs into UI content for consumer audiences. 
  • Mastery of AP style and the confidence to know when to break the rules.
  • Ability to think critically about user journeys and content flows, and to connect the dots between them.
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity and traverse altitudes from strategic visioning to tactical execution.
  • Highly collaborative, organized and self-directed, able to effectively prioritize and respond accordingly to the shifting needs of the team.
    • This full-time, salaried position reports to the partnership enablement Content Design Manager. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000-$515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: We are looking for a dynamic candidate with music production or in-house studio experience to act as a  Music Production Coordinator for our live-action and anime productions in Japan. This role will be reporting to the Manager, Music Production - Japan and will partner with them to provide support on the implementation of cross-functional music production solutions that will support our productions and overall slate growth across Netflix-branded Japanese live-action and anime titles. If you are someone with a passion for both the creative development and execution of music for content and who thrives in a collaborative, entrepreneurial, and innovative environment, this role may be for you. Key Responsibilities Read and break down incoming scripts for music needs, flagging upcoming visual vocals/on cameras, and potential licensing issues (challenging song approvals, grand rights, etc.) Liaise with Composer agents//music producers during the personnel hiring process, ensuring key dates, project information, and watermarked materials are distributed. Help field project inquiries as needed Distribute onboarding materials to partners, music supervisors and composers Make appropriate introductions between production and music crew, also ensuring that the music team receives scripts and cuts from production Attend regular check-ins with music supervisors/composers, taking relevant notes and connecting with the Music manager on action items Review cuts, flagging unaddressed music needs/clearance issues as they arise in conjunction with the music supervisor, composer, production, post, etc. Maintain consistent communication between Music Legal Team/Music Licensing partners regarding relevant Music Production updates/action items Attend show-specific/check-ins and provide music updates to the internal title management team Experience & Skills Experience: 5 years either as a music director, producer, or supervisor at a studio. Has in-territory experience in music production ideally for live-action features, series and anime. This role will have deep creative relationships with labels, publishers, managers, agents, composers, music supervisors, etc. as well as an internal content team and have a vast understanding of music supervision or worked in-house at a studio as a music producer. This role will be a liasion between internal cross-functional teams and external partners, and be responsible for ensuring the internal cross-functional teams understand the music production workflow. Collaborate with the external music director, producer, or supervisor to oversee and manage the music production objectives/workflow for the project. Advise/support on-camera performances in collaboration with Music team - including clearance, pre-records, on-set production and post production requirements Work with music editor and post supervisor during temp dub to make sure music is ready for preview/test screening. Support post supervisor, music editor and composer to develop a music post schedule that coincides with  post timeline and adhere to said schedule and music milestones Coordinate music notes and approval process between the studio, composer, director and producers by organizing score review sessions after locked picture Frequently check in with the composer, music director, producer, or supervisor on scheduling, booking and supervising scoring sessions and live recordings to ensure they are running on time and on budget Align with the music team as they are in the process of existing song selection as it relates to studio approvals and budget. Thrive in a fast-paced environment, are very curious and have an entrepreneurial mindset. Native Level Fluency in Japanese is required. Business-level English is a plus. The Netflix culture attracts individuals who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion and curiosity. Our culture is a critical foundation of how we work. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: Company & Role Overview: At Netflix, we are reinventing the way people are entertained by both enabling and innovating how visual storytelling is produced, discovered and enjoyed. Netflix provides a platform for stories from different places and different perspectives to reach, connect, and inspire millions of people all over the world. In this role, you sit at the intersection of content, marketing and product, powering one of the most transformational shifts in the industry. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 230 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. As the Product Discovery & Promotion (PDP) Leader for Korea, you will grow, develop and lead a team that is ultimately responsible for contextualising what is special about Korean stories on our service - for the world.  Your team strives to authentically represent the multiple narratives that exist in every story so that our members can discover the stories that they will love.  You and your team define and drive the creative and operational strategy for how we represent and launch titles across these regions and partner with internal and external partners to ensure a seamless experience for our members in these countries and beyond. Key Characteristics Sought: You value, understand, and can deliver great experiences for our members Approach problems with both a local and regional lens Build strong partnerships locally, regionally, and globally to advocate for the needs, nuances, and complexity of Korea, while seeking a broader understanding and best practices Have first-hand experience working with product/brand/content in Korea Understands that local titles have the power to inspire global phenomena Have a strong track record of building and cultivating great locally-oriented teams You are equally adept at defining and driving both Creative and Operational Excellence Understands the challenges and importance of driving high-quality creative work at scale Ensures regional and global business context is considered alongside local ambitions to find the sweet spot for this team Inspires a multi-disciplinary team toward  shared goals, objectives, and opportunities Complexity and volatility do not faze you - you are able to stretch to drive/ set strategy AND drive implementation/ execution You are a strong strategic partner to cross-functional leaders Great bridge - both to cross-functional teams; as well as to broader PDP (regionally + globally): equally adept at articulating your own vision while also collaborating to drive market success. Adept at speaking to Product considerations (member-first approach, hypotheses forming and experimentation) as well as Marketing/Content concerns (audiences, how to integrate brand into day-to-day work, storytelling) Influence and synthesize functional context and strategy for your teams in a way that best suits the needs of the markets. You are a builder and developer of strong multidisciplinary teams Bring nuanced and deep local business experience which allows you to provide input on local creative and operational strategy from a market perspective while influencing regional and global teams. Be an excellent leader who sees the big picture. You know how to inspire your own team through the challenges of a rapidly evolving, complex business. Be an invaluable colleague to your cross-functional stakeholders and partners by working with them closely to recognize opportunities and synthesize strategy across other countries, regions, and functions. Be equally comfortable in “left brain” or “right brain” problem solving, but be most excited when both are deployed at the same time and understand how to leverage data and insights to push the boundaries of creative excellence. Have an eye for compelling creativity, inspire and set a high bar for quality, and advocate effectively on behalf of what’s best for the member experience. Adept at identifying, innovating, and developing opportunities for efficiency and increased impact on the team. Have experience working within a matrix organisation structure - and be adept at effectively influencing and advocating for both local and global/ functional business goals, serving as a bridge between both. Be an earnest and inclusive leader who will be a great steward of the Netflix culture while also helping it to shape and evolve over time. Qualifications: Leadership experience in a fast-paced growth environment, adept at scaling within a rapidly expanding company and market. 10+ years of experience in building and growing diverse teams through hiring, developing, and managing a sizable team of high-performers. Experience working in Korea, with a nuanced understanding of navigating the local challenges and opportunities while synthesizing regional and global contexts. Experience in managing teams and influencing outcomes in a matrix environment. Comfort working at a company, and in a team, where data and insights are heavily leveraged in decision-making.  First-hand experience with A/B testing is a plus. Business fluency in Korean and English. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. It's an exciting time for Netflix with continued rapid expansion into original programming around the world; it's a great time to join our team in EMEA. As Netflix expands, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our growth opportunities. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more. Netflix seeks a Counsel, Employment Legal - EMEA to join our growing team in EMEA.  We are looking for someone who has great passion for the Netflix brand and our content, and who wants to be a part of our global team of employment lawyers who use their legal knowledge and experience in the most practical and risk tolerant way possible to support our ever-growing business. This position is based in our EMEA head office in Amsterdam (or could be based in Berlin). With our rapid expansion across EMEA, this person would primarily support our offices in Germany, Poland and the Nordics. The role reports to the Director, Employment Legal - EMEA,  based in Amsterdam. Next to him, you’d be working closely with our other Employment legal counsels based in EMEA  as well as with the global employment legal team. Still, the aim is to have this largely be an independent role and to have you run with it! We have multiple corporate offices and a large slate of local language original series and films being produced all across the region in Europe, the Middle East and Africa. This means that we have a wide array of different roles and employees based across our EMEA offices. From Marketing to Business Development and from Tax to Studio and Production roles. All these teams are supported by an amazing HR/Talent team and employment legal. While part of this job may be to handle issues on productions, the main focus, especially over time, will be to provide support to our corporate offices. This means that you could be joining a call on how to set up a new entity in Hungary in the morning, negotiate a termination in Sweden after lunch and have a discussion about benefits in Germany in the afternoon. Believe me, there is still time to watch your favorite shows. Some other examples of what you’d be doing: Main focus: Advise on all corporate employment matters in close collaboration with members of HR (Talent), HRBP’s, Talent Operations,, Employment Tax, Mobility & Immigration. Subsidiary focus: Support EMEA content productions with employment-related matters in EMEA; Provide subject matter expertise and, when appropriate, train on a broad range of employment issues, including recruiting, contingent workers, employment practices, anti-harassment and termination practices and approaches, as well as supporting our other employment legal team members in EMEA on these issues as needed for other EMEA countries; Proactively identify, assess, and balance employment law risk, and be able to offer practical, business-oriented and creative solutions in partnership with the business teams; Stay current with, and advise Netflix on, meaningful employment-related legal developments; When necessary, help investigate incidents and/or complaints and manage employment-related litigation in EMEA; Actively collaborate with the global Employment Legal team on projects and issues; Select, manage and use outside counsel effectively; and Support Netflix’s commitment to maintaining a diverse and inclusive harassment-free workplace. Requirements The successful candidate will have at least 7+ years of deep experience with German employment law in an employment department of a respected firm and/or in-house in a multinational company. Experience with Polish and/or Swedish employment law would be desirable. Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross-functionally, think practically and be solution-oriented This role is for someone who thrives in an environment where freedom and responsibility are core values, and passion, innovation, courage and curiosity are at the heart of everything we do. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

  • Main focus: Advise on all corporate employment matters in close collaboration with members of HR (Talent), HRBP’s, Talent Operations,, Employment Tax, Mobility & Immigration.
  • Subsidiary focus: Support EMEA content productions with employment-related matters in EMEA;
  • Provide subject matter expertise and, when appropriate, train on a broad range of employment issues, including recruiting, contingent workers, employment practices, anti-harassment and termination practices and approaches, as well as supporting our other employment legal team members in EMEA on these issues as needed for other EMEA countries;
  • Proactively identify, assess, and balance employment law risk, and be able to offer practical, business-oriented and creative solutions in partnership with the business teams;
  • Stay current with, and advise Netflix on, meaningful employment-related legal developments;
  • When necessary, help investigate incidents and/or complaints and manage employment-related litigation in EMEA;
  • Actively collaborate with the global Employment Legal team on projects and issues;
  • Select, manage and use outside counsel effectively; and
  • Support Netflix’s commitment to maintaining a diverse and inclusive harassment-free workplace.
    • Requirements
  • The successful candidate will have at least 7+ years of deep experience with German employment law in an employment department of a respected firm and/or in-house in a multinational company.
  • Experience with Polish and/or Swedish employment law would be desirable.
  • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross-functionally, think practically and be solution-oriented
  • This role is for someone who thrives in an environment where freedom and responsibility are core values, and passion, innovation, courage and curiosity are at the heart of everything we do.
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with over 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans any time. The Team You’ll be Joining: Photo & AV Studio The Photo & AV Studio team has the enviable position of straddling two worlds in the entertainment industry: Photo & AV asset creation and global communication strategy. We specialise in capturing and creating photo & video assets that shape, enhance and support our publicity campaigns for our Netflix Original content including series, films, and documentaries. Simply put, we produce the content that compels people to watch our shows through earned media! The Role What photos will ensure a magazine spread? What video will get audiences and publishers excited about a new show? How do we make a talking head interview visually pop? How can we be smart and tell different stories across different countries through visual assets? These are just some of the opportunities you’ll be delivering in this role. We are looking for a seasoned Photo & AV Studio Manager, a strategic individual to support PR campaigns, driven by A/V materials, for Netflix titles - photography, videos, the next big thing. Our content stands out and makes an impact on the industry and consumers alike, compelling them to watch Netflix content. The role requires a high level of creativity, an inquisitive, innovative and self motivated personality, and a succinct communicator with a strong project management background. Being a team player with a positive attitude and willingness to be flexible and get the job done is essential, as is the ability to strategically plan and execute multiple projects simultaneously.  You’ll be working with TV/film productions, talent, filmmakers, publicity and events as part of the Netflix PR team in the DACH region. Building relationships as well as working autonomously in a fast paced environment will be key to success. We don’t focus on job titles at Netflix but hire outstanding high performers who act responsibly on the resources and freedom they are given to do their work. The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their colleagues to do the same. Read our culture memo to learn more! The role is based in Berlin and is reporting to the Photo & AV Studio Lead DACH. Responsibilities of the role include: Develop and execute strategy for the DACH region, per project/title, to capture, produce and utilise creative material to enhance and support the publicity campaign throughout its lifecycle. Lead on a slate of projects that include several original series, films, documentaries and docu-series. Drive communication with your regional campaign publicist counterpart, marketing/social teams, showrunners/filmmakers and talent reps. Hire and oversee unit photographers and video crews, including script and schedule review and communication with production. Produce strong creative materials that shape and enhance the overall publicity campaign. Oversee photography/video needs for premieres, events and photo shoots. Skills and Requirements: 8+ years of experience working across visual asset creation, collaborating closely with publicity, publishing or communications within the DACH region. Understand the photography/video industry with a strong knowledge in digital file specs & size formats. Ideally solid background in the entertainment, music, TV and/or lifestyle industry. Fluency in German and English. Strong eye for producing visual assets. Understand and interest in copyright laws, usage licenses and embargoes. Experience handling high volumes of complex projects and tasks for multiple people and departments simultaneously and managing competing priorities. Possess solid organizational, effective time management and excellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate effectively with internal and external teams. Must be able to work independently, make sound decisions, think strategically, and maintain accuracy and attention to detail. Someone committed to creating more inclusive spaces in advertising, passionate about fostering diversity within their primary network of partners, agencies, production companies etc. Experience working in a global team is preferred, but not essential. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Discovery & Viewing Experiences team builds novel product features on Netflix’s industry-leading Android, iOS, and TV apps to help members discover and connect with stories they’ll love. We’re looking for an Android engineer to join the team and help us entertain the world. You will partner with cross-functional teams like consumer insights, product management, experience design, and more to shape and ship user experiences that will delight millions of customers worldwide. We are part of a global, diverse organization that includes people of all genders, sexual orientations, upbringings, nationalities, ages, and socioeconomic & educational backgrounds. We encourage anyone passionate about building compelling mobile experiences that touch audiences worldwide to apply. The Job Partner with product, design, and engineering teams to scope and build delightful and accessible user experiences Learn and iterate on product features as we validate our judgment by A/B testing product variants with real customers Leverage technologies like DI/Dagger/Hilt, Jetpack Compose, MvRx, GraphQL, etc., to build product features Shape product and design requirements weighing the tradeoffs between moving fast and building for the long-term Develop code with quality in mind and write automated tests with JVM Unit/Espresso What Sets You Apart You take great satisfaction in building user experiences that please our members and move our business forward You’re effective at developing strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication, curiosity, and selflessness You enjoy a creative and collaborative problem-solving approach enabling our design and product partners to realize their vision You take an active role in shaping the features you build, informed by your knowledge and expertise You’ve developed strong coding skills, especially with Java and Kotlin, and can navigate different languages and technology stacks (eg. GraphQL, etc) You care deeply about the quality & performance of the product You value the opinions of others when fleshing out solutions to fill out your blind spots You have read about Netflix’s culture and think you would thrive here Learn about Android Product Engineering Feature launches like My Netflix and Thumb Ratings in the Player Read our take on Rx onError Guidelines See some of our work highlighted at a Netflix Women In Tech Event Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $700,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
