description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages.  Netflix members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they are able to download and play games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced games. About the Job ​​The Director of Game Licensing will report to, and work closely with, the Senior Director of Portfolio Strategy and Content Acquisition to devise and implement the game licensing strategy and execution plan across Netflix's External Games business that will touch licensed, Netflix-owned, and co-published games, high impact marketing activations and Netflix IP integrations with top tier third party game companies. This individual will also oversee the operations and production of a variety of licensed game projects partnering with our Marketing, Production, Comms and Content teams.  Together you will build a successful catalogue of outbound licensed content, entertaining our members across the globe. As a business development leader, you will be responsible for guiding game licensing programming strategies, exploring, managing and maximizing the commercialization of intellectual properties through collaborative partnerships with external partners, defining the right rules of engagement, collaborating with Netflix’s senior leadership on the Company's growth strategy across all of its Gaming businesses, and helping scale the value proposition of Netflix gaming via the right set of partners. You will work closely with game production, live-ops, transmedia, marketing, content, product, comms, strategy and analytics, legal, among others, to deliver results. Responsibilities Build and direct the execution, tone, and vision for the External Games team’s licensing programs. Develop category and distribution strategies that maximize our title and portfolio output, achieving a balance between driving consumer demand (a proxy for fan joy) and delivering meaningful impact. Own the overall production strategy for all External Games team’s game licensing projects, including pipelines and processes, to ensure Producers have everything they need to serve players, developers, and internal partners. Manage a team of Producers, supporting them in their role as our external developer’s and internal partner’s primary point of contact. Mentor and lead Producers, creating growth and opportunities for their success, while maintaining a balanced production capacity. Act as a senior thought leader and develop high-impact, high-priority game marketing activations outside of Netflix that help drive conversation around our biggest IP Franchises. Constantly analyze the rapidly evolving video game landscape, finding new opportunities for licensing deals and partnership opportunities that will support the growth of Netflix properties. Evaluate, negotiate, and close key game licensing deals across Netflix IP that will help grow the footprint of Netflix Gaming with creators and developers of all sizes. Demonstrate fluency in the most complex legal and business issues in contracts and develop creative win-win solutions with our partners. Quickly develop expertise in each of the relevant licensed categories and act as the resource for these categories. This includes developing a thorough understanding of the product line, the market, competitors, and all capabilities of the licensee. Collaborate with our Transmedia team to help expand Netflix’s ever-growing IP catalogue in the digital gaming space via key strategic partnerships with top global gaming companies. Be agile and execute across a quickly evolving range of products. Collaborate with a broad range of internal constituents to help define go-to-market strategies and drive sign-off from internal leadership. Qualifications 10+ years of licensing experience in the games industry across all major categories. 5+ years experience in game production with experience shipping multiple games (social, F2P, mobile, web, console, handheld). Proven track record with scaling businesses, including established and nascent brands. Strong experience sourcing in a gaming environment with a demonstrated track record of helping drive a broad range of PC, console and mobile-focused game partnership deals. High-level expertise in negotiation and deal construction including the legal aspects of negotiations. Strong program/project management skills with successful delivery of quality, drive planning, schedules, estimates, budgeting, resource plans and status reports. Thorough understanding of the product development process. Experience learning quickly about new technologies and distilling information into actionable insights for internal stakeholders. Experience successfully navigating a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $220,000 - $900,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad-supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers. The core Advertising team is charged with building a new, best-in-class Ads organization to establish Netflix as the premiere platform for advertiser partners and to drive advertising revenue. As part of the Business Operations & Strategy team, Netflix is seeking a Sales Enablement Partner to support the EMEA and APAC regions. This role will create a remarkable and equitable learning experience for our sales teams in EMEA and APAC to help empower their growth and achieve results. As a strategic partner to many cross-functional teams around the company, you will act as the voice and representative of the regions as your end customer. The ideal candidate should be self-driven, adept at project and stakeholder management, and able to work in an ambiguous environment with minimal guidance. The role will report directly to the Director, Ads Sales Enablement and Training. Responsibilities: Partner with regional Business Operations teams to ensure enablement programs are integrated into the regional go-to-market approach Partner with the regional Sales Leadership team to plan, coordinate, and execute high-quality learning programs that are aligned with regional sales priorities Facilitate enablement workshops and sessions and translate relevant content for regional use (EMEA/APAC) Develop communication plans that reinforce the regional relevance of global initiatives Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create a world-class learning experience for regional sellers (EMEA/APAC) Report on success metrics and draw insights from the data Experience: 7 - 10 years of experience in ad sales and/or working as a Global Sales and Operation Lead, Curriculum Designer, or similar roles leading strategy for a global sales team. Excellent project and stakeholder management, presence, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. Proven experience facilitating training or other related activity Experience working with LMS like Intellum, Articulate, or similar We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: We are seeking an experienced Administrative Assistant to join our growing team. This position will be responsible for providing support to the Directors of Employee Transportation & Aviation, Director of CREWS UCAN and Director of Workplace Programs UCAN. This role will be based in Los Angeles on a hybrid schedule (Three days in office per week). The Opportunity: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. The Role: A successful candidate will be passionate, self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. Organize, attend, and participate in larger team meetings and offsite - support with driving the agenda. Coordinate vendor meetings Create a positive atmosphere of professionalism and support Support team leaders & coordinators with ad hoc projects Effectively prioritize and manage workload to support the dynamic needs of leaders, balancing immediate tasks with long-term impactful projects. Proactively communicate with leaders and team members, offering and soliciting feedback to ensure alignment and accountability. Qualifications: 4+ years experience as an Administrative or Executive Assistant, providing support to multiple executives at a fast-paced company (experience in an entertainment/tech setting a plus) Team player who operates in a team-oriented setting Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Proficiency in Google Suites (Gmail, Drive, Calendar, Docs, Sheets, Slides) Self-starter with the ability to multi-task, prioritize and respond accordingly in a fast-paced environment Great communicator who can build strong working relationships with vendors, and internal and external partners Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current production process and needs Strong written and verbal communication skills Willingness to take educated risks and think out of the box Demonstrates adaptability and flexibility, with a keen ability to adjust priorities based on leaders’ needs and organizational goals. Open to both giving and receiving feedback constructively, with a focus on continuous personal and professional development. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with more than 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. The Partner Experiences team builds tools that help people around the world integrate their technology with the Netflix platform quickly, with the highest levels of quality.  Some of the integrations we support are Netflix Streaming, Payment, Content Discovery, and Games experiences.  The results of our work can be seen around the world by hundreds of millions of Netflix members. We would like to find a senior engineer who will join the Partner Experiences  Solutions group as part of our newly formed COPA team (Components for Partners) in  Sao Paulo working in a hybrid model. What are Components for Partners? As we have deployed more and more “partner facing” products (like the Netflix application on Smart TVs, payment, voice, and search integrations, and our mobile game SDK), we’ve noticed that there are many similarities in the tools we’ve built to support them. We are looking to hire a senior full-stack engineer to build these common core components that multiple Netflix teams will use to deliver their applications worldwide.  These components will leverage the Netflix cloud-based tech stack using Java, Node, React, SQL, and NoSQL databases. In this role, you will lead cross-functional initiatives and have the opportunity to drive a project from requirements through first deployment ensuring the satisfaction of our users. You will also play a key role in the development of the overall architecture that spans our portfolio of 60+ applications and services. The best candidate will be truly excited by the prospect of designing and building the common components that will allow us to continue the rapid growth of our portfolio; which underpins integration, certification, and monitoring the experience for Netflix integrations across 500+ partners and over 1800 different device types (most likely including the TV sitting in your living room right now!). You will succeed in the role because: You have a passion for solving business needs by building platforms using a combination of innovative spirit and pragmatism complemented by technical acumen. You evangelize new ideas and exemplify technical leadership with a bias for action. You possess strong skills in system design and architecture with a keen eye for the progressive evolution of software solutions. You possess strong software skills in Javascript (React/Node) with expertise in industry-standard frameworks and are familiar with Java. You have experience building platforms that scale. You ideally will have a B.S. Computer Science or equivalent. 4+ years of relevant industry experience. You will love this job because: You drive software solutions across teams, in a multi-disciplinary manner. You appreciate the complexity of engaging with a global challenge. You will be surrounded by world-class engineers sharing passion and energy. You enjoy seeing the end-to-end impact of your work.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity Netflix is seeking a Manager, Awards - Animation to support PR and Strategy for our animation titles. This role is based in Los Angeles, CA and will report to the Senior Manager, Talent Relations & Awards - Animation. The Role As the Manager, you are an integral part of the team who will strategize and implement awards campaign components for select animated feature and series titles and pitch and secure press opportunities. You will be responsible for managing and maintaining relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including filmmakers, showrunners, talent, and Netflix cross-functional teams and partners for support of those titles. You have strong media and press relationships and will develop and pitch stories that bolster awards campaigns. You will oversee campaigns across awards bodies, including the Academy Awards, Golden Globes, Annies, Visual Effects Society, Producers Guild, all below the line guilds which vote in animation, Critics’ Choice Awards, and regional critics groups. You will be able to identify ways to heighten contenders' profiles, strategize around needle-moving campaign opportunities, and execute niche market tactics. Your ability to manage multiple campaigns simultaneously, stay updated with trade and industry news, and your passion for animated features and series, all contribute to your strengths. Responsibilities Create and implement awards strategy for animated features and series Filmmaker and showrunner responsibilities include day-to-day communications, organize schedules, appearances, travel, and accompany on awards tour and at local campaign events Pitch awards press for feature and series animation awards campaigns Coverage of awards screenings, Q&As, events, and panels Pursue trade reviews for select animated features and track regional critics' group awards, update awards press status reports and circulate awards breaks to filmmakers and write awards talking points, AMPAS, and guild synopses Collaborate with cross-functional partners on marketing, social, creative, events/programming, and PR to implement the most effective campaigns Required 8+ years of experience in awards campaign strategy for animated features and series Exceptional talent and partner relations and the ability to effectively communicate strategy and ideas to filmmakers and talent reps Proven track record of press strategy, including but not limited to developing excellent press relationships and pitching and placing high-impact stories Experience in building effective campaign schedules, organizing press days, and participating in industry festivals and conferences (Annecy, Spark, SIGGRAPH, View Conference, Lightbox, Ottawa, Savannah, TIFF) Ability to work nights, and weekends and to travel extensively if needed Excellent verbal and written communication skills Outstanding attention to detail and time management skills with the  ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment Exhibit sound judgment and adept critical thinking skills in various situations, enabling effective problem-solving and decision-making Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $320,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here . We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Public Policy team at Netflix engages with policymakers, regulators, and government bodies in order to advocate for Netflix’s interests in the policymaking process, and acts as a strategic partner to internal business groups as they navigate the policy world. The UCAN Policy team works with federal and local governments, as well as industry stakeholders, to: 1. Shape policy, including on matters of privacy, consumer protection, online safety, competition, tax, copyright and cultural regulations; 2. Promote a production ecosystem that aligns with our growth and values - including diversity and inclusion, accessibility and sustainability. The role is dedicated to Canada within the UCAN Policy team and reports to the Director, Public Policy, Canada. The role is based in Toronto, Canada but entails travel to Netflix offices in Washington D.C., Los Angeles and New York, and other locations as needed. As part of this team, the Coordinator will be immersed in the unique content for which Netflix is known and support advocacy on all matters related to content creation, production, and delivery. The Coordinator will implement and strategize ways to boost the overall effectiveness and efficiency of the team, be responsible for magnifying communications internally, help execute ongoing projects, and act as a point of contact for other internal teams and external stakeholders about the status of projects, progress updates, and team priorities and needs. We are looking for someone who is focused on developing solutions, able to juggle a high volume of requests and can communicate effectively across audiences, thinks creatively, is highly organized, and is eager to learn. Responsibilities Assist in legislative analysis and policy research on a wide range of issues Support the creation of internal communications on key policy developments Maintenance of databases and trackers on priority issues and goals Collaborate with a range of internal cross-functional teams as well as external stakeholder engagement with consultants, trade associations, and industry peers Assist in collateral, asset and campaign development Collaborate with other internal teams on screenings and events Attend company events, trade association meetings and industry receptions Respond to government requests for information Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Public Policy, Law, Economics or Business A minimum of 2 years of relevant professional experience in public policy or government affairs Exceptional written and verbal communication and research skills Excellent interpersonal skills with experience developing and fostering effective relationships across diverse teams Outstanding attention to detail and time management skills with the  ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously Preferred Postgraduate degree in Public Policy, Law, Economics or Business Written and oral fluency in English and French Knowledge of the media & entertainment sector Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $350,000. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here . description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. In this new role, under the Process Excellence track (within the Finance Program Management Office -PMO), you will play a critical role in optimizing our organization's operational efficiency and effectiveness by leveraging automation solutions such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Machine Learning (ML), Intelligent Document Automation, and Process Mining. You will be responsible for analyzing existing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing solutions to enhance productivity, streamline workflows, and drive sustainable growth. You will work with Finance business function owners across various domains and geographies to understand current workflows, identify pain points and implement policy, process, data and automation recommendations. This role sits within Finance and will require close collaboration with Finance stakeholders and product/engineering teams. This is a hybrid position that can be based in either Los Angeles or Los Gatos and offers the flexibility to work remotely part of the time. Occasionally travel may be required to other office locations, including internationally. Responsibilities Facilitate workshops with stakeholders to understand processes pain points and recommend the best combination of process reengineering and automation to deliver the most value. Perform root cause analysis to identify solutions that address the true source of issues. Conduct comprehensive analysis of current business processes, including gathering and documenting requirements, workflows, and data flows using standard business process modeling (BPM) techniques and/or Process mining tools Work with business owners/SMEs to understand automation opportunities and analyze them to  identify process changes that need to happen Understand and document automation requirements Partner with engineering teams and participate in design sessions. Los Gatos, California Corporate Functions Finance Business Process Analyst, Finance Automation Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. In this new role, under the Process Excellence track (within the Finance Program Management Office -PMO), you will play a critical role in optimizing our organization's operational efficiency and effectiveness by leveraging automation solutions such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Machine Learning (ML), Intelligent Document Automation, and Process Mining. You will be responsible for analyzing existing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing solutions to enhance productivity, streamline workflows, and drive sustainable growth. You will work with Finance business function owners across various domains and geographies to understand current workflows, identify pain points and implement policy, process, data and automation recommendations.  This role sits within Finance and will require close collaboration with Finance stakeholders and product/engineering teams. This is a hybrid position that can be based in either Los Angeles or Los Gatos and offers the flexibility to work remotely part of the time. Occasionally travel may be required to other office locations, including internationally. Responsibilities
  • Facilitate workshops with stakeholders to understand processes pain points and recommend the best combination of process reengineering and automation to deliver the most value.
  • Perform root cause analysis to identify solutions that address the true source of issues.
  • Conduct comprehensive analysis of current business processes, including gathering and documenting requirements, workflows, and data flows using standard business process modeling (BPM) techniques and/or Process mining tools
  • Work with business owners/SMEs to understand automation opportunities and analyze them to  identify process changes that need to happen 
  • Understand and document automation requirements
  • Partner with engineering teams and participate in design sessions. Identify use cases to validate/test the automation functionality
  • Facilitate user acceptance testing, document the test results and help procure business approvals 
  • Own the change management & communication when going live with the new process and/or automation 
    • Qualifications
  • 5  years of overall experience with 2-3 years related to finance functions 
  • Demonstrated expertise in performing process analysis 
  • Experience with Order to Cash, Procure to Pay and Record to Report processes
  • Exposure to robotic process automation, machine learning, process mining and intelligent document automation
  • Proficiency using Visio, Signavio or other BPM tools 
  • Familiarity with tools such as UIPath, Automation Anywhere, Celonis
  • Business Process Management certification a plus
  • Lean Six Sigma knowledge is an advantage

description: At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 260 million paid subscribers and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming. Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners to create, launch, and promote our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content creation, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. We are looking for talented distributed systems engineers like you to help build the technologies that allow us to scale our efforts across the globe, and do so effectively and efficiently! You’ll have a direct impact on how the Netflix studio creates and promotes shows such as “Squid Game”, “Stranger Things” and “The Queen’s Gambit” on a global scale. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team to bring new perspectives as we solve the next set of challenges. In addition, we are open to remote candidates - we value what you can do, from anywhere in the U.S. You will be successful in this role if you enjoy: Being self-motivated, working independently, and partnering with a diverse group of engineers, product managers and TPMs across different functional areas and organizations. Empowering other engineers by building and operating robust, scalable, and highly available infrastructures, with a focus on developer experience, observability and operational excellence. Thriving in ambiguity, diving deep to understand problems and customer pain points, and solving them using appropriate technologies. Being an evangelist for high quality code and engineering best practices. Assisting in the career development of others, actively mentoring individuals, and helping build technical communities across the organization. Living the Netflix’s culture and thinking you would thrive here. Qualifications: Have 5+ years of experience in crafting complex distributed systems. Have recent proficient experience with Java, C# or other OO programming languages with a solid understanding of OO design principles, concurrency, multi-threading, performance tuning and observability. Have a proven track record in architecting, building, and operating distributed systems with high availability, fault tolerance, and performance. Have solid experience in setting technical directions for engineering projects, making architectural decisions, and influencing partner and cross-functional teams. Have the ability to proactively describe complex technical concepts to a variety of stakeholders, driving conversations and decisions through written and/or verbal communication. Nice to have: Have a product mindset toward infrastructure and platforms. Experience in developing long-term technical strategies aligning with business goals via appropriate technology investments. Proficient with gRPC and/or GraphQL API design and implementation. Working experience with Kafka, Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Memcached, and/or AWS. Familiarity with library development and DI frameworks (preferably Spring Boot). Have application security domain experience - awareness of AuthN and AuthZ constructs. Spotlight on Content Engineering Teams: Studio Production Engineering (SPE) The Studio Production Engineering team builds products to enable Netflix Studio to optimize and innovate how Netflix plans productions, produces great content, and manages the production of content globally and at scale to achieve operational efficiency, scale economies, and better decision-making through shared, accurate, and transparent data. A few more things about us: As a team, we come from many different countries and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science. Our team includes product managers, program managers, designers, full-stack developers, distributed systems engineers, and data scientists. Folks have the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment and look forward to adding your perspective to the mix! Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Content Data Science and Engineering (DSE) team is passionate about storytelling and bringing our members joy. Our mission to entertain the world is anchored in our content, and data is a crucial component in shaping our comprehensive content strategy. Using rich multi-modal data (text, video, audio, and streaming data), we leverage a variety of state-of-the-art ML tools to unlock unique insights that have high cross-company visibility and impact. Our team creates ML-based products focused on understanding and systematizing diverse member experiences and perspectives, that support our content partners in their complex and nuanced decision-making processes. We are a highly collaborative team that partners across Netflix to drive impact. We are seeking a Machine Learning Scientist to join the team. Your focus will be on developing foundational tools to support member analytics and understanding, including building models, exploring and charting their analytic implications, and developing and supporting high-impact ETLs and downstream tooling. This role features ample opportunity for project ownership and will support impactful decision-making. In success, you will collaborate on existing priorities but also will propose and execute on new opportunities. In this role, you will: Design and implement state-of-the-art machine learning models for visual, audio, and textual data to enhance content understanding and improve content planning, content production, and promotion processes. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, data scientists, consumer researchers, and content teams, to define problem statements, define roadmaps, and execute on priorities. Communicate complex concepts and the results of analyses with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to influence strategic decisions. Engage with the ML community, internal and external, to learn, to teach, to contribute to building a great Netflix brand in ML. Stay abreast of the latest developments in the field by attending conferences, reading research papers, and implementing promising novel ideas that can impact content workflows. About you You have a strong foundation in machine learning and deep learning, including embedding methods, supervised and unsupervised learning, and deep learning architectures. Advanced degree (MS or Ph.D.) in Computer Science, Cognitive Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field with a focus on machine learning, artificial intelligence, or computer vision. Strong programming skills in R/Python and experience with appropriate ML, AI, Mathematical Psychology, or Deep Learning modeling frameworks. Experience with SQL, or with building end-to-end data pipelines. You have a strong track record of solving complex problems with innovative solutions. You are able to both develop novel algorithms and adapt existing methods from the literature to new challenges. You are an excellent communicator, capable of explaining complex technical details to both technical and non-technical audiences. You are a self-starter who thrives under a high level of autonomy in a fast-paced environment and is enthusiastic about Netflix’s unique culture. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Creative Compute and Storage team designs, develops, and delivers technology infrastructure globally for the evolving needs of our creatives. As we expand our content creation globally, we seek the best and brightest engineering talent to be part of our growth. Our team is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to be part of the development and build-out of our purposefully developed infrastructure platforms. You will work with internal engineering teams, technical creatives, production teams, and external vendors worldwide to deliver amazing technology experiences for our creative users. We are looking for an experienced engineer who brings a broad set of technical skills and achievements, a development and automation-focused mindset to solving problems, and unique career and life experiences to join our teams as we continue to evolve entertainment worldwide. Be sure to review our culture page and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The Role: As a Software Engineer focused on Infrastructure for Creative Compute & Storage, you'll be instrumental in solving large-scale creative workflow challenges. Your responsibilities will encompass the strategic design, management, and enhancement of our control plane, which globally orchestrates infrastructure resource placement. In this position, you will have the opportunity to work in a wide variety of areas, such as: Designing orchestration to manage a large number of globally distributed systems. Constructing structured datasets and APIs to assist in managing and maintaining our fleet. Design, build and integrate with core VM, container, network and storage technologies. You will be successful in this role if you enjoy: Being self-motivated, working independently, and partnering with a diverse group of engineers and product managers across different functional areas and organizations. Empowering other engineers by building and operating robust, scalable, and highly available infrastructures, with a focus on developer experience, observability, and operational excellence. Thriving in ambiguity, diving deep to understand problems and customer pain points, and solving them using appropriate technologies. Being an evangelist for high quality code and engineering best practices. Assisting in the career development of others, actively mentoring individuals, and helping build technical communities across the organization. Living the Netflix’s culture and thinking you would thrive here. Required Skills Have 5+ years of expertise in Go, Java, or similar object-oriented languages, with confidence and experience in debugging and problem-solving skills. Have the ability to build and support highly scalable, robust, and fault-tolerant services. Have a demonstrated history in designing, constructing, and managing large systems with high availability, fault tolerance, and performance that are spread across multiple machines or networks. Have solid experience in setting technical directions for engineering projects, making architectural decisions, and influencing partner and cross-functional teams. Familiarity with Linux and Linux systems programming. Experience with IaaS providers such as AWS, GCP, VMware, etc Bonus Skills Proficient with gRPC and/or GraphQL API design and implementation. Working experience with Kubernetes and PaaS offerings such as Heroku, CloudFoundry, etc. Working experience with KVM, QEMU, libvirt, OpenFlow, Open vSwitch. Experience with fault-tolerant, asynchronous workflows Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000- $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

We are looking for an experienced engineer who brings a broad set of technical skills and achievements, a development and automation-focused mindset to solving problems, and unique career and life experiences to join our teams as we continue to evolve entertainment around the world. Be sure to review our culture page and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. As a member of the team, you will... Work with a broad group of engineering teams, internal and external partners, and creative teams to design, develop, implement, and support a broad collection of technology solutions for content creation at Netflix. Design and build services to improve experiences and productivity for a broad range of content creative populations (e.g. post-production, animation, visual effects, etc.).Work in a uniquely challenging global infrastructure space with challenges far larger than almost any other studio in the world. Be empowered to build and develop new solutions to long-standing entertainment industry challenges. Entrusted for developing, scripting, and automating solutions to improve the efficiency and functionality of our production systems. This includes deploying these solutions and ensuring their successful integration within the existing system architecture. Participate in system upgrades and migrations, as well as troubleshooting tasks to maintain optimal system performance. The candidate should be able to identify potential issues, develop effective solutions, and implement them to ensure system reliability and stability. About you. You have a minimum of 5 years of experience in building and developing compute, storage, and connectivity tooling to deliver product experiences for end-users. You are able to dissect large complex systems into sub-components, understanding each component’s additive value to the overall solution and able to optimize them both individually and collectively. You have a passion for automation, efficiency and scale; consistently driving operational excellence. You have a deep technical understanding of large-scale computing infrastructure; operating systems; high-performance storage file, block, and object storage technologies; scaled networking challenges; or any of the above. You enjoy and can effectively work collaboratively with business and product teams to develop product plans and roadmaps and then are able to own parts of the hands-on implementation of those plans. You thrive in identifying high-leverage, high-value work and direct your attention to those opportunities without explicit direction You aim to always be learning new things, working in new spaces, and share this passion with those around you You use data-driven strategies, applying thorough analytics and real-time insights for strategic and operational decisions. You strongly uphold observability principles, promoting transparent, measurable outcomes to improve performance and accountability in all projects. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000- $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: We’re looking for a Production Director to drive the product development of a brand-new AAA multiplatform game, in partnership with the core leadership team.  As Production Director, you will be among the leaders of one of Netflix’s first generation of internally developed original games.  You will develop and execute the production plan - how we structure, build, launch and run the game and its operations, blending our creative aspirations with our desire to innovate in how games are built.  The right candidate will bring industry-leading expertise in managing and launching high-quality, deeply engaging games, along with attention to detail, structured thinking and flexibility.  Proven experience communicating and influencing across all development disciplines and support departments is integral to success in this role.  You will build a team of production experts, all in service of our primary goal of creating an amazing game. We're building the foundation for a small, but ambitious team of creators.  We’re looking for leaders who are aligned with our core values, and care deeply about the experiences they create as well as the people they make them with.  If you are someone with a bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace, we’d love to hear from you!  As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 260 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. Responsibilities Include Task Management in partnership with department leads - prioritization, scheduling, communication and day-to-day management Resource Management - estimation, load balancing, planning / road-mapping Process development and iteration on production pathways Day to day tasking/scheduling requiring hands-on expertise with Jira and Confluence.  Knowledge of plug-ins and best practices to enable smooth workflow for distributed teams. Coordination with partner teams within Netflix on shared development priorities Management of internal and external releases, coordinating across multiple stakeholders Hiring, mentorship, and management of a small team of production experts Adapting our production process to support all phases of development from initial prototyping and concepting through release and sustained operation at scale Actively contributing to the studio culture, modeling behavior, monitoring team health and evolving culture in a way that’s aligned with our core values as we grow Collaborate with the rest of the leadership team to create our development strategy, build a plan, execute on key initiatives, measure our progress and iterate throughout the project. The Ideal Candidate At least 10 years of production experience, including 5+ years of experience managing direct reports in a senior leadership role, with multiple shipped high-quality, large-scale multi-platform games Experience supporting a live service game from development planning to delivery of content and features post-launch Excellent communication skills grounded in authenticity, intention and curiosity Experience with all phases of game development from concept through release and post-launch Well-developed skills and judgment for assessing and balancing competing factors like quality, scope, cost, risk and time Passion for creating structure and organization out of chaos; A desire to build systems to support creativity and innovation Demonstrable track record for providing and accepting feedback; Established strong partnerships with creative and technical leadership, with the ability to influence decision-making through discussion and engagement, rather than authority Gets excited by learning new skills, dashing to pitch in, even if this means flexing beyond this role’s core responsibilities if it can help us win Passion for playing, incubating, building, and shipping video games Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $220,000 - $900,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Netflix launched in Europe in 2012 and opened its Amsterdam office in 2013. As one of our first international markets and offices, the region and the team continue to play a vital role in our ongoing international expansion. As Netflix continues to grow globally, we are looking for the best and brightest to drive analytics that underpin our entertainment strategy and key business decisions. Netflix’s Content Finance Strategy & Analysis team is looking for an Associate to join its team in its EMEA headquarters in Amsterdam. The Content Finance Strategy & Analysis team develops strategic insights to further the company's global entertainment efforts and is primarily responsible for deal valuation, programming and growth strategies, performance/audience insight, and competitive analysis. Executives and senior management depend heavily on the Content Finance Strategy & Analysis team to accurately forecast the business and lead the strategic analysis that is used to inform important business decisions. A sample of work could include: Innovating and developing content performance metrics, frameworks and insights Analyzing content investment and performance to develop short- and long-term recommendations Informing content and audience prioritization based on internal data and market analysis Guiding Netflix’s content launch strategy and deepening understanding of title audiences Conducting market research and competitive trends analysis Streamlining and managing key analytical operations and reporting Working cross-functionally with other Finance & Strategy teams globally as well as Product, Marketing, Data Science and Consumer Insights teams QUALIFICATIONS: 1.5 - 3yrs years of experience in a top management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity, hedge fund, and/or media/entertainment/tech company in a strategy/business development/analytical role. We are looking for candidates that have worked in a highly-demanding environment in which complex modeling and analysis is performed Passion for entertainment and avid watcher of content Strong communication/presentation skills with track record of presenting complex analyses to executives/senior management clearly and concisely Extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis Strong initiative and ability to work independently; thrives in a fast-paced, always changing environment Highly intellectually curious and has the courage to challenge the status quo and exhibits the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Excellent proficiency with MS Excel / PowerPoint Fluency in English required; Fluency in one or more additional EMEA languages (Arabic or European language) is a plus We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: With more than 260 million paid subscribers around the world and growing, Netflix is dedicated to bringing the world’s content to our members everywhere. We’re just getting started, and it’s an exciting time to work at Netflix and change the future of entertainment. THE OPPORTUNITY This is an opportunity to be part of a global entertainment company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of television. The legal team at Netflix is focused on collaborating with its business partners to help foster innovation. We are looking for a talented legal professional to join our Product & Corporate Legal team in Tokyo, Japan as a Legal Associate/Manager.  You will be instrumental in helping our team deliver fast and practical solutions for a wide range of legal issues.  The primary focus will be on supporting the Product & Corporate Legal, Marketing Legal and Consumer Products Legal teams. As a member of the Product & Corporate Legal, Marketing Legal and Consumer Products Legal teams, you will: Collaborate with stunning colleagues across business development, product, marketing, consumer products and other stakeholders to help Netflix achieve its key business objectives. Become the go-to point-of-contact for processing consumer claims and inquiries by local law enforcement to ensure timely and effective resolution. Build knowledge and expertise on Netflix’s products and services to help the business navigate and assess legal risks arising from new and existing user experiences. Draft, review, and negotiate procurement agreements to support Netflix’s business operations. Create and maintain informational resources for the marketing teams and support the marketing team’s contract needs, including reviewing agreements and coordinating with the content licensing team. Act as the legal liaison and partnering with the customer service teams to investigate, draft and respond to consumer claims and other legally sensitive consumer complaints. Work with internal stakeholders to prepare and submit regulatory filings. Required Qualifications: One to three years of legal experience as either a practicing attorney or a member of the legal team in a multinational company Fluency in Japanese and English A strong business-first mindset Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Be comfortable evaluating risk with imperfect information and willingness to ask questions, especially those that may be awkward and/or uncomfortable High intellectual curiosity and strong willingness to tackle new subject matters outside one’s comfort zone and take on special projects as the need arises, even outside the original role Preferred Qualifications: E-commerce and/or IT-industry experience Bar qualification in one or more jurisdictions We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: Los Angeles, California We are seeking a Coordinator of Production to help manage both internal and third party productions, inclusive of a wide range of LIVE programming such as large tent pole variety events, award shows, comedy formats, sports, unscripted, and more.   The core focus of this role is to support the Directors of LIVE in Production & Post Production. Responsibilities include scheduling, creating agendas, tracking notes in meetings, managing multiple schedules, maintaining internal and external communications to set high-priority meetings, data entry,  booking travel for execs, managing expenses, coordinating offsites and specialty events for production, and more.  Together, this team is responsible for supervising all aspects of production in our global LIVE  programming. The Role The ideal candidate will be deeply enthusiastic and inquisitive about LIVE production planning and logistics.They should possess a proactive, adaptable approach, adept at managing multiple tasks with precision and attention to detail in a fast-paced environment.  This is a demanding position requiring someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, able to exercise good judgment and initiative while working with a high-volume production slate in a growing team environment. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Manage complex calendars for multiple executives including scheduling and confirming meetings both internally and externally Facilitate clear communication among relevant stakeholders both internally and externally. Collaborate closely with Coordinators within our broader UCAN team. Prepare comprehensive agendas and meticulously note meeting details for high-level discussions Complete Administrative duties around processing travel (domestically and internationally) and submit expense reports for executives Coordinate department activities (offsites, team building activities, etc) as well as social events for both internal & external groups when requested Maintain logs to track projects and their status Keep Netflix tools updated with the latest show information and optimize database management. Be the team “master of tools” for both internal and external systems, working on improvements and new efficiency opportunities to benefit the team’s productivity Gathering, tracking and entering various production-related data among multiple platforms Support key team dynamics and processes (key meetings, off-sites, team activities…) Support leaders with ad hoc projects such as organizing and supporting events, and preparing presentations using Google Slides, team documents (i.e.: Onboarding), databases, etc. Assist with the identification and curation of experienced, high-quality production staff and crew Research and outreach to potential filming locations and studios in the US and abroad Qualifications: 3+ years experience working in production management, in the field, at a network, or production company. Candidates will likely be at the ProductionCoordinator level equivalent outside of Netflix Previous experience in LIVE production, ideally at the assistant through Coordinator level Ability to comprehend and articulate in writing complex technical details discussed in meetings Ability to handle a fast-paced environment, simultaneously supporting several projects in various phases of production (from evaluation to production through delivery) and courage to take educated risks while thinking outside the box while always responding in a timely manner Team-player who operates in a fast-paced team-oriented setting Strong prioritization skills with a keen eye for detail Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly Genuine passion for all facets of production Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to multitask effectively Proficiency in Google Applications (including Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, Mail and Drive) This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Los Angeles, California Content Product Management Coordinator, Live Production Los Angeles, California We are seeking a Coordinator of Production to help manage both internal and third party productions, inclusive of a wide range of LIVE programming such as large tent pole variety events, award shows, comedy formats, sports, unscripted, and more.   The core focus of this role is to support the Directors of LIVE in Production & Post Production. Responsibilities include scheduling, creating agendas, tracking notes in meetings, managing multiple schedules, maintaining internal and external communications to set high-priority meetings, data entry,  booking travel for execs, managing expenses, coordinating offsites and specialty events for production, and more.  Together, this team is responsible for supervising all aspects of production in our global LIVE  programming. The Role The ideal candidate will be deeply enthusiastic and inquisitive about LIVE production planning and logistics.They should possess a proactive, adaptable approach, adept at managing multiple tasks with precision and attention to detail in a fast-paced environment.  This is a demanding position requiring someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, able to exercise good judgment and initiative while working with a high-volume production slate in a growing team environment. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Manage complex calendars for multiple executives including scheduling and confirming meetings both internally and externally
  • Facilitate clear communication among relevant stakeholders both internally and externally.
  • Collaborate closely with Coordinators within our broader UCAN team.
  • Prepare comprehensive agendas and meticulously note meeting details for high-level discussions
  • Complete Administrative duties around processing travel (domestically and internationally) and submit expense reports for executives
  • Coordinate department activities (offsites, team building activities, etc) as well as social events for both internal & external groups when requested
  • Maintain logs to track projects and their status
  • Keep Netflix tools updated with the latest show information and optimize database management.
  • Be the team “master of tools” for both internal and external systems, working on improvements and new efficiency opportunities to benefit the team’s productivity
  • Gathering, tracking and entering various production-related data among multiple platforms
  • Support key team dynamics and processes (key meetings, off-sites, team activities…) 
  • Support leaders with ad hoc projects such as organizing and supporting events, and preparing presentations using Google Slides, team documents (i.e.: Onboarding), databases, etc.
  • Assist with the identification and curation of experienced, high-quality production staff and crew
  • Research and outreach to potential filming locations and studios in the US and abroad

description: Netflix is the world’s leading Internet television network with over 260+ million paid members enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As a global household brand, we strive to bring joy to users by connecting them with stories and artists through a delightful and high-quality experience. The Team The Netflix Messaging Engineering team is at the forefront of curating and delivering sophisticated multi-channel messaging experiences for our members and partners within our expansive ecosystem. This team manages and operates the platforms, applications, and channels that facilitate seamless communication between Netflix and its customers and partners at scale. As the voice of Netflix to the customer, we deliver over 3.5 billion messages a week. The Role We are looking for a seasoned Engineering Manager to lead the Growth Messaging product engineering team. This role will support key product areas such as Monetization, Ads, and Commerce Platform. The successful candidate will be at the epicenter of all  Monetization and Commerce communication at Netflix, managing multiple high-priority, highly visible, and impactful projects while overseeing a team of nine engineers. This role will be based in Los Gatos, CA. Responsibilities: Lead a team of nine engineers through highly complex and highly impactful projects. Manage multiple work streams and high-priority projects, collaborating with various cross-functional teams to identify project requirements and establish timelines. Drive the technical vision and strategy, with a strong emphasis on overseeing its successful execution. Cultivate strong partnerships with your interdependent engineering teams Prioritize growing your engineers as leaders and technical experts Support and foster operational excellence within the team. About you: You love getting into the details but are equally comfortable giving your capable engineers opportunities to drive and thrive. You are an inclusive leader who makes room for all communication styles. You are comfortable leading in ambiguity and driving toward clarity. You don't shy away from providing constructive AND positive feedback to your team and your peers. You say the hard thing when it needs to be said. Your teams are motivated and inspired by your leadership. Must haves: 5+ years of experience managing consumer-facing product teams. Deep knowledge of how to build systems in a distributed environment. Ability to identify code-smell or poor architecture design.  We have fantastic engineers but everyone can use input and/coaching. Nice To Have Skills: Experience working on Messaging. Experience working with ML Researchers, Algorithm Engineers or Data Scientists. Knowledge and experience working with machine learning systems. Netflix has a unique culture that values employee freedom and responsibility. We seek to grow inclusive and diverse teams that will enhance our perspectives, skill sets, and behaviors.  We highly encourage you to apply if your background will complement us, even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description.  Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $190,000 - $920,000. This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here .
