description: At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 230 million paid subscribers. We recently launched a new ad-supported tier to offer our members with more choice in how they consume their content. Our new tier allows us to attract new members at a lower price point, while also creating a compelling path for advertisers to reach audiences that are deeply immersed. Our Team The core Advertising team is charged with building a new, best-in-class ads organization to  establish Netflix as the premiere platform for advertiser partners and to drive advertising revenue. The ad measurement team is tasked with building best in class insights and measurement solutions for our advertising partners in support of our broader advertising sales efforts. Summary Netflix’s Ad Measurement team is seeking a Manager of Measurement Partnerships to support our expanding portfolio of measurement partners. The successful candidate will work cross-functionally with sales, product and ads legal and policy departments to design, negotiate and manage successful partnerships that delight our advertisers and demonstrate the effectiveness and value of Netflix as an advertising platform.  If you are someone who is a self-starter, obsesses over details and thrives in a collaborative environment, Netflix may be the place for you. For an insider's look at Netflix’s culture, make sure to read Seeking Excellence , our company credo. Key Responsibilities Working with the Sr. Manager and other key stakeholders to develop a modern and robust ads measurement partnership strategy Build and foster relationships with third-party measurement providers and other strategic advertising technology and research partners Partner with the legal team to negotiate and execute measurement partnership agreements Collaborate with the Netflix Ad Product team to help define and scope measurement integrations Work with Sales and Marketing teams to facilitate successful go-to-market (GTM) rollout of measurement partnerships Leverage data from internal and external sources to evaluate and forecast the success of new partnerships and the health of existing ones Act as a facilitator for the wider Measurement team, ensuring partnerships deliver on our key objectives and provide value for money Serve as a subject matter expert on the state of the media measurement landscape, providing valuable advice and insights to key stakeholders across the business Manage finance processes, including managing a budget Experience & Skills 7-10 years experience in Streaming, TV or digital media industry with a comprehensive understanding of the advertising research landscape Experience managing complex vendor relationships through the full partnership cycle - from Master Service Agreement (MSA) negotiation, to successful GTM rollout and subsequent relationship management You are an expert in media data infrastructure. You know the different workflows and identifiers used in measurement integrations, and can clearly explain the tradeoffs between approaches. You supplement your expertise with data to make evidence-based recommendations Deep knowledge of measurement methodologies  (e.g. attribution/ROI/experiments) and a solid understanding of emerging approaches and technologies Appreciation of the critical role played by identity in media measurement, and a solid grasp of the various companies and methodologies prevalent in the space Experience building financial forecasts and models in Excel for deal evaluation Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail, with the confidence to take ownership of projects from start to finish Experience working cross functionally in a fast-paced environment, with the ability to build a good rapport with both internal and external clients Able to collaborate effectively while embracing differing perspectives and experiences to make better decisions A global outlook; ability to work with teams around the globe with an appreciation of the nuances of local market conditions Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must; Netflix is a memo-driven culture and you will be expected to write clearly and effectively Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $210,000 - $475,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Media Systems Engineering team is focused on the design, build, implementation, maintenance, and refresh of the image and sound technology systems present in all Netflix creative environments. This includes but is not limited to, editorial stations, audio mix facilities, technical review environments, screening rooms (large), screening lounges (small), and public-facing exhibition environments such as the Egyptian Theatre in Hollywood, and The Paris Theatre in Manhattan. Additionally, we collaborate with various internal cross-functional partners to develop & deploy innovative workflows for which the creative teams engage with. This can mean on-prem, collocated, or cloud infrastructure-based workflows. We take pride in working to deliver both creatively and technically optimized spaces that empower our end users to actualize their ideas as efficiently as possible. As a Media Systems Engineer (L4) you will bring a broad set of technical skills and experience in image and sound technology integration and post-production workflows. You bring a development and automation-focused mindset to solving problems, and an impressive history of unique career and life experiences to add a diverse viewpoint to our team as we expand our creative infrastructure around the world. Be sure to review our culture page and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. acts as an informed captain and make data-backed decisions on behalf of Netflix Comfortable both giving and receiving feedback, you are curious and not afraid to ask questions and challenge the way things are done today; description: This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. Netflix is looking for an experienced Program Manager to join the Netflix Game Studio in delivering the next generation of video games to a worldwide audience. This role is part of the Game Operations team focused on driving the development of new games on Netflix and supporting the production team in delivering a world-class platform. The Program Manager will ensure that our large portfolio of licensed, and internally developed games, are delivered to the service on time and on budget. The role will drive operational efficiency for the games in development and live on the market, engaging with a broad array of Netflix cross-functional organizations. This role will partner, and collaborate, with Developers, External Production, Platform & Product, Engineering, and Creative Production teams; and includes management of the entire lifecycle of the product portfolio through supporting development up to game release and the ongoing creation of engaging post-release content. Responsibilities: Tracking and reviewing development progress across multiple games that will be in various stages of development Building productive and open relationships with internal and external Development Teams, supporting functions (Platform & Mobile Product and Engineering, Creative Production, Localization, and QA) and Licensing leadership Leading the Launch Readiness effort for the game's commercial release, and content/features thereafter to ensure engagement and partnership across the organization for game launch and live game management Developing dashboards and processes to enable information flow across the organization on development status, key dates, and requests for support Supporting the maintenance and evolution of our Game Development Framework (GDF) to ensure on-track development, identifying possible issues with the product/content development, whether that be resource challenges, time constraints, technical hurdles, or quality Consistently engage with leadership to identify potential issues in the development cycle, narrow down on solutions in partnership with the development teams and support resolution Partner with Publishing, Business Development, and Central Tech to ensure game launches are executed cleanly and in line with the GDF Evaluation and management of third-party services for Development or other ancillary support for the Studios Requirements: Significant experience in Project/Program Management for software development Experience with games across various genres from casual to core Experience managing projects through the development lifecycle from business case/pre-production to launch/post-launch management, has worked on content development/release and live operations through the game lifecycle Project management on AAA games on any major platform preferred (consoles, PC, mobile) Experience working on multiple projects simultaneously, preferably a mix of R&D and live Experience in partner management, internally or externally, working with licensors a plus Nice to have: History of collaboration with release management, production or live operations of games Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $600,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. The Open Connect Capacity Planning team is at the center of all efforts to ensure that there’s always enough capacity so that our members always have a great entertainment experience. We provide long range planning by developing proactive strategies that are future compatible, and nimble enough to change course quickly. Working with the engineering and finance teams, Capacity Planning main tasks include: 1) translating demand forecasts into concise, actionable capacity plans, 2) managing utilization by providing reports and dashboards out to key stakeholders, and 3) provide data-driven analyses to continually optimize spend and ensure the platform is scalable far into the future. The Open Connect Capacity Planning Group is hiring a Capacity Planner to focus on demand and capacity planning Key tasks include: Translating forecasted demand from finance into actionable capacity plans Analyzing and modeling data to enhance operational efficiency as products, hardware architecture initiatives evolve Creating and managing yearly capacity plans for network hardware and IP backbone infrastructure Providing oversight and prioritization to ensure capacity arrives in a timely fashion Managing reporting and dashboards for overall network utilization, and identifying data needs required to improve reporting Continually working to refine workflows that enable the business to achieve alignment and efficiency Who you are: A passion for answering questions with data driven solutions. The willingness to experiment with different approaches to new and existing problem sets Expertise with data modeling and visualization software and experience developing reports and dashboards Expertise in Excel, SQL, Tableau (or other Business intelligence software) Strong background using financial analysis for multi variable decision making Background in statistical analysis, specifically building and refining demand forecasts. Able to independently identify issues, analyze potential solutions, and drive resolutions Strong communication skills, both verbal and in writing and experience collaborating across the entire organization including engineering, finance, and product management The perspective that delivering results quickly, with iteration, is better than waiting for 100% perfection Expertise (or strong curiosity) in the internet ecosystem Prefer MBA or MS Statistics Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000 - $515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We bring entertainment to over 260 million subscribers in over 190 countries. This requires great content, a frictionless choosing experience and engaging conversation. As we continue to grow, we’re increasingly focusing on Commerce as well. We have ambitious plans, an enormous growth opportunity and the passion to be the best in customer experience - which now includes a new ad-supported plan at a more affordable price point for customers. Within the broader Finance, Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) organization, we’re building out a new team, Ads Revenue & Yield Analytics, who will help steward and support our Ads go-to-market strategy.  In this management role, with specialization across Ad Sales pricing, inventory management & revenue analytics, you will support the commercial business in the EMEA region, inclusive of Sales & Account Management. In tandem, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow quickly in this space, working closely with a global, cross-functional team across FS&A, Partnerships, Consumer, Marketing & Content to help build a cohesive understanding and unified approach to advertising at Netflix. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. Your responsibilities will include: Pricing & Yield: Inform Go-to-market pricing & packaging requirements for new ad products, targeting capabilities and/or sponsorships that helps us achieve company goals and drive business growth Partner with Ads Sales to create, manage and implement negotiated ratecards for preferred partnerships Support MSFT/Sales/Account Management on deal approvals & business exceptions to ensure pricing & deal terms adhere to corporate policy and minimize future billing discrepancies Steward internal & marketplace feedback to develop Sales incentive programs and/or resolve pricing/packaging roadblocks Inventory Management: Manage inventory avails across the Ad Sales product suite, with a deep understanding of our inventory composition, pricing strategies and serving logic / delivery efficiency Develop inventory guidelines for Sales & Advertising partners to best maximize campaign delivery & KPI performance Optimize our targeting go-to-market strategies based on data-driven insights of our targeted inventory pools alongside advertiser buying behavior Revenue Analytics: Partner with Ads FP&A and Ads Sales Operations to inform annual Ads revenue targets/forecasts, combining macro-level supply metrics alongside transactional buying trends Work cross-functionally to generate supply & demand reporting, evaluate trends and support optimization to facilitate growth of the business Partner with Ads FS&A & Ads Sales Ops leaders across regions to customize market-level strategy and consolidate/validate reporting outcomes into a cohesive macro view of the Ads business What We’re Looking For: 5+ years of experience in Revenue Management, Pricing & Planning, and/or Advertising Strategy Embodies Netflix’s cultural values and is excited to work in a high-performance culture Knowledge of the streaming advertising and ad tech ecosystem is highly preferred Strong modeling skills and comfort with manipulating large datasets in Google Sheets, Excel, Tableau, and other data visualization tools A strong attention to detail and eye towards using the 80/20 rule to address problems Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, able to work autonomously, and perform tasks with a wide range of difficulties Very strong project management, planning and organizational skills, including the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and to deliver under tight timelines Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build successful relationships and partners at all levels The ability to communicate financial calculations with varying degrees of detail depending on the forum.  You know your audience and what they’re looking for. Champion of diverse and inclusive cultures and working with global teams We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

  • Inform Go-to-market pricing & packaging requirements for new ad products, targeting capabilities and/or sponsorships that helps us achieve company goals and drive business growth

  • A strong attention to detail and eye towards using the 80/20 rule to address problems
  • Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, able to work autonomously, and perform tasks with a wide range of difficulties

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build successful relationships and partners at all levels
  • The ability to communicate financial calculations with varying degrees of detail depending on the forum.  You know your audience and what they’re looking for.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any moment. Netflix launched in Europe in 2012 and opened its EMEA headquarters in Amsterdam  in 2013. As one of our first international markets and offices, the region and the team continue to play a vital role in our ongoing international expansion. As Netflix continues to grow across the Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) footprint, the Content Finance Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) team is looking for a Manager who will focus on the German speaking markets DACH (D - Germany, A - Austria, CH - Switzerland). The role will be based out of our Berlin office. The Content FS&A team develops strategic insights to further the company's global content efforts and is primarily responsible for deal valuation, programming strategy and analytics, competitive analysis and user behavioral analysis. We partner closely with the senior leadership of Netflix who depend heavily on the strategic insights we provide to inform critical business decisions across the company. RESPONSIBILITIES: A sample of work could include: Preparing deal and valuation analyses (model building, scenario testing etc.) in partnership with the Creative and Business Affairs teams Conducting market research, tracking and compiling industry trends in the region Conducting analysis of key business drivers, trends and performance indicators Regularly present analyses and reports on relevant operating and financial metrics in an easy-to-understand format to senior business leaders Compiling thoughtful post-mortem analyses to determine areas for optimization and improvement Working cross-functionally with other FS&A teams globally as well as Product, Marketing, Consumer Insights teams QUALIFICATIONS: 6+ years of experience in a top management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity, hedge fund, and/or media/entertainment/tech company in a strategy/business development/analytical role. We are looking for candidates that have worked in a highly-demanding environment in which complex modeling and analysis is performed Passion for entertainment and avid watcher of content Strong communication/presentation skills with track record of presenting complex analyses to executives/senior management clearly and concisely Superb financial modeling skills and extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis The successful candidate must display, through attitude and accomplishments, strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers. He or she must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics The successful candidate must be motivated, disciplined, and be able to work effectively autonomously Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative orientation. Fluency in German and English required We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 260 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. Games are our next big frontier and an incredible opportunity for us to deliver new experiences to delight and entertain our quickly growing membership. You will be jumping in at the very beginning of this adventure and be in a position to help us redefine what a Netflix subscription means for our members around the world. Data Science and Engineering (‘DSE’) at Netflix is aimed at using data, analytics, and sciences to improve various aspects of our business. We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Games DSE team, leading experimentation and advanced data science needs. This role will be partnering closely with our Game studio stakeholders to drive data informed decisions by building predictive models, conducting statistical analysis and deriving business insights. As a member of this team, you will also play a critical role in presenting insights that shape our decision making and ensure decisions are sound from a statistical perspective. What You Will Do: Partner with our Game stakeholders (e.g., Netflix Games Development team, Game Developers, Game Strategy, Planning & Analysis team) on advanced analytic initiatives (e.g., prediction modeling, causal inference, experimentation etc) Lead the design, analysis, and interpretation of experiments that shape decision-making around Games at Netflix Proactively perform data exploration to discover innovation and testing opportunities Drive and implement high impact projects end to end Present your research and insights to key stakeholders Work with business stakeholders to connect analysis to key decisions that affect the business to influence and drive impact to the business Balance handling ad hoc requests while also driving larger projects forward Who You Are: You have at least 2 years of experience working in the Games industry as a Data Scientist. At least 5 years of experience with a PhD degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Engineering or a relevant quantitative field or 8+ years of experience with a Master degree in those fields. You have statistical skills utilized in A/B testing, analyzing observational data, and statistical modeling You are comfortable working with large data sets and analyzing complex data with SQL and other tools such as Python or R You have good business acumen on product innovations and excellent problem solving skills to translate business requirements to data science problems. You have a strong bias to action, delivering results quickly with iteration instead of waiting for perfection You are a fast learner and are comfortable with ambiguous requests. You have exceptional communication skills and can manage stakeholder priorities directly Willing to mentor junior data scientists on the team to accelerate team growth. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. search_text:
Remote, United States Data Science and Engineering Senior Data Scientist (L5), Games Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 260 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. Games are our next big frontier and an incredible opportunity for us to deliver new experiences to delight and entertain our quickly growing membership. You will be jumping in at the very beginning of this adventure and be in a position to help us redefine what a Netflix subscription means for our members around the world. Data Science and Engineering (‘DSE’) at Netflix is aimed at using data, analytics, and sciences to improve various aspects of our business. We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Games DSE team, leading experimentation and advanced data science needs. This role will be partnering closely with our Game studio stakeholders to drive data informed decisions by building predictive models, conducting statistical analysis and deriving business insights. As a member of this team, you will also play a critical role in presenting insights that shape our decision making and ensure decisions are sound from a statistical perspective.  What You Will Do:
  • Partner with our Game stakeholders (e.g., Netflix Games Development team, Game Developers, Game Strategy, Planning & Analysis team) on advanced analytic initiatives (e.g., prediction modeling, causal inference, experimentation etc)
  • Lead the design, analysis, and interpretation of experiments that shape decision-making around Games at Netflix
  • Proactively perform data exploration to discover innovation and testing opportunities
  • Drive and implement high impact projects end to end
  • Present your research and insights to key stakeholders
  • Work with business stakeholders to connect analysis to key decisions that affect the business to influence and drive impact to the business
  • Balance handling ad hoc requests while also driving larger projects forward
    • Who You Are:
  • You have at least 2 years of experience working in the Games industry as a Data Scientist. 
  • At least 5 years of experience with a PhD degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Engineering or a relevant quantitative field or 8+ years of experience with a Master degree in those fields. 
  • You have statistical skills utilized in A/B testing, analyzing observational data, and statistical modeling
  • You are comfortable working with large data sets and analyzing complex data with SQL and other tools such as Python or R
  • You have good business acumen on product innovations and excellent problem solving skills to translate business requirements to data science problems. 
  • You have a strong bias to action, delivering results quickly with iteration instead of waiting for perfection
  • You are a fast learner and are comfortable with ambiguous requests. 
  • You have exceptional communication skills and can manage stakeholder priorities directly 
  • Willing to mentor junior data scientists on the team to accelerate team growth. 
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000.  Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. description: As a global company, Netflix’s customers come from diverse backgrounds. And each of these backgrounds allow them to experience joy from Netflix in their own unique way. Ultimately, this joy is rooted in our customers’ ability to trust Netflix. At Netflix, we earn this trust through our actions every day. And we work hard to continue to build this trust with our customers throughout the world. With the growth of Netflix consumer products to include new verticals such as Games, Live and Ads, we are evolving our solutions to support the unique needs of additional consumer facing solutions, reflecting unique requirements for transported data and integrations. The Client Security Integrations team provides the security strategy and client engineering solutions to protect content, application integrity, and subscriber data. We're looking for our next stunning colleague to join us to expand our capabilities in Netflix Games security by identifying and preventing vulnerabilities in our games software. Primary responsibilities include reverse engineering, exploitation and automation, as well as collaborating with development teams to drive remediation of findings. What You Will Work On: Build solutions to provide security controls in product feature development in a cloud environment. Work with external vendors and drive requirements on behalf of Netflix. Consider security vs usability trade offs across a complex, cross functional environment with multiple touch points and stakeholders Automate reverse engineering of binaries to detect threats and identify risk. Operationalize vulnerability management. Provide actionable guidance to stakeholders to reduce security risk and protect Netflix’s business model. Desired Skills and Background: Strong software development experience. Binary reverse engineering skill set and understanding of software vulnerability exploits. Energized by a diverse and constantly evolving environment to deliver innovative solutions to security challenges. Ability to perform static and dynamic analysis. Take ownership of deliverables from end to end, including requirements, design, implementation, test, and deployment. Nice to have: Experience working with game development and engines such as Unity and Unreal. Flexible language skills including Java, Python. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. description: At Netflix, our mission is to entertain the world through stories that are shared at the right place and at the right time. The Ad Operations team is core to ensuring efficient, secure & sustainable distribution of consumer advertising; in this role, you will design, optimize, and support best-in-class operational solutions that are both locally relevant and globally impactful. We’re looking for a stunning, savvy Ad Operations Specialist to develop and scale campaign execution and also partner closely with the Account Management, Sales, and Engineering teams to facilitate product rollout, campaign optimization, and policy enforcement. Curiosity combined with ad tech knowledge and a meticulous approach are the keys to success. Our ideal candidate is an expert in the Ads ecosystem with a passion for innovative creative formats, delivery best practices, quality assurance, stakeholder insights, and continuous optimization. In this role, you will Assist the team with Quality and Efficiency Measurement Solutions: compile monthly quality & efficiency metrics (e.g., how is our BPO time best being spent) and provide areas for improvement - partner with Ad Operations Managers on build/analysis of quality dashboard. Maintain current training documentation updated throughout the lifecycle of the material Manage day-to-day campaign issues or questions with outsourced vendors and be the first tier of escalation to troubleshoot Own initial escalations from cross-functional partners (i.e., questionable Ad Policy violation running on the platform, test seat campaigns making noise for Eng/DSE, validate creative length experience in X country, etc.) Collaborate with Ad Operations Managers to document trafficking/setup, updates and workflow optimizations. Work with Product and Engineering teams to execute testing for product offering enhancements. Serve as internal Ad Operations point of contact to investigate campaign setup related to Ads Policy, Campaign Delivery Troubleshooting, Engineering alerts/validation, etc. The ideal candidate has: 4+ years of Ad Tech and/or Ad Operations experience supporting Account Management, Sales, Ads Policy/Quality, or Product/Engineering Teams. Well-versed in Campaign Trafficking and Execution, including Order and Creative trafficking, Quality Control, Campaign monitoring, pacing, troubleshooting, billing, and reconciliation. Knowledge and experience working on advertising campaigns with a strong foundation in executing workflows that support quality and efficiency. A background in Advertising Systems and Tools (CRM, OMS, Ad Servers, Task Management, Reporting, etc.) Comfortable working with cross-functional teams, including Ads Policy, Product, and Engineering. Experience interacting with BPO vendors and managing the vendor's tasks of campaign setup and management, including but not limited to trafficking, QC, and reporting. Demonstrated ability to operate effectively in ambiguity and willingness to pivot as needed Excellent verbal and written communication skills and exceptional attention to detail Fluent in English, additional languages are a plus Experience supporting multiple regions and timezones At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $85,000-450,000 This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 250 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. Production Finance Engineering is responsible for building tools and technologies that enables Netflix to plan and spend our members' money effectively across hundreds of titles that are produced and launched every year. It all starts with creating a budget on how we want to spend the money on a title. From that point onwards, we track every dollar spent on the title by ingesting huge volumes of production accounting data and helping keep the production cost on track. The need to improve production economics is at the core of making Netflix a differentiator amongst its competitors and the work we do as part of this team is critical in making that happen. We're looking for an Engineering Manager who can create a strong vision and viable roadmap as well as build and lead a team of world class software engineers. In this role you will optimize workflows across various aspects of Production Finance. You will help the team overcome technical challenges that come with the ever increasing volume and complexity of our productions -- all while maintaining the accuracy and timeliness of our financial data. As an Engineering Manager you will: Lead a full stack team of UI, backend and full stack engineers with varying levels of industry experience. Drive success with minimal process and a heavy emphasis on individual responsibility. Support your team by helping them understand priorities and enabling them to ignore distractions and non-productive influences. Work closely with various cross functional partners like product, design, data science and stakeholders in being a sounding board. Be an exemplar of the Netflix culture About You: Domain Experience. You have built financial applications and understand the building blocks and foundations required to build a complex financial solution. Engineering excellence. You have experience leading in a variety of contexts, during which you’ve built scalable, robust, and fault-tolerant systems. You have a solid knowledge of the whole web stack: front-end, back-end, databases, cloud applications, integrations. Mentorship / Guidance: You have a proven track record of leading a large team of software engineers with varying levels of experience from interns and new college grads to seasoned engineers. You know that the most important part of your job is setting the team up for success. Through mentoring, teaching, and reviewing, you help other engineers make sound architectural decisions, improve their code quality, and get out of their comfort zone. Execution: You care tremendously about execution and feature velocity. You hold yourself personally accountable, jumping in and taking ownership of problems that might not even be in your team's scope. Hiring know-how. You're a thoughtful interviewer who constantly raises the bar for excellence. You believe that what seems amazing one day becomes the norm the next day, and that each new hire should significantly improve the team. Are Detail Oriented. You value data accuracy and also understand the nuances of the projects in flight. Project Management. You have led large cross functional initiatives by leveraging project management tools like Jira, Trello, etc. and can bring that experience to the team. Hybrid Team Management. You have experience managing a hybrid team of in-person and remote engineers. Remote inclusivity is at the heart of communication and collaboration that you continue to practice and instill on the team. Bonus Experience: Experience working in any studios Built studio productions facing tools Experience with AWS Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: From Stranger Things to Bridgerton, from Red Notice to Don’t Look Up: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. The Role Do you live and breathe entertainment? Are you a born Communicator? Are you eager? Is there truly no task too big or too small? We may have just the opportunity for the right person to join our French PR team based in Paris.It’s the chance to work with a team transforming television through quality series, films, shows, and documentaries that launch worldwide and an innovative platform that enables viewers to watch any time, on any device. The Coordinator will play a key role in supporting the French PR team and work across Brand/corporate communication and Publicity (title promotion). This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker who can exercise good judgment and initiative. Responsibilities: Tasks are varied, extensive and timely. They will include but are not limited to: Working with coordinators across the PR department to put in place a set of best practices that enable us to move quicker, bigger and better; Identifying and seizing PR opportunities across brand/corporate communications and title promotion to bring to life our key narratives (set visits, interviews, talents engagement, influencers activation, events). Assisting with meeting schedules and facilitation, including help putting together presentations and coordinating audiovisual needs; Coordinating with outside agencies and vendors to track contracts and ensure timely payment; Tracking press coverage; Updating & maintaining various lists, documents, and charts on the department’s Google Drive; Liaising with teams that translate press releases for worldwide use and local agencies for distribution; Support and shadowing in large PR campaigns; Coordinating and drafting internal newsletters. Qualifications: At least 3 years of PR experience focusing on brand/corporate PR in a studio, agency setting or lifestyle brand. Confident and able to express ideas and opinions thoughtfully. Poised and mature, not scared to speak up or challenge. Passionate about entertainment. A rabid fan of television, film, and pop culture. Scrappy is resourceful and relentless in finding a solution before escalating issues. Able to anticipate potential problems and knows when to ask for help. Aware that the world of PR is not a 9-5 job. Organized, organized, organized -- i.e., there’s a label on your label maker. Meticulous about the details, every single one of them. Thoroughly completes tasks and follows up. Able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under deadlines and pressure. Able to pivot and adapt to shifting priorities without missing a beat. A proactive and positive contributor to the team. Able to function effectively as a part of a loosely coupled but highly-aligned team. Effective in dealing with global PR agencies, media, and internal executives. A great communicator - via email, phone, and in-person simultaneously, both in French and English.

  • A great communicator - via email, phone, and in-person simultaneously, both in French and English.

description: Location : California Remote/Hybrid. *Flexibility to work from home with in office visits required monthly in Los Angeles or Los Gatos. Strong Recommendation : Please submit a portfolio with password in your application The Role At Netflix, we aspire to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created, and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 220 million paid members. We recently launched a new ad-supported tier to offer our members more choice in how they consume their content. Our new tier allows us to attract new members at a lower price point, while also creating a compelling path for advertisers to reach audiences that are deeply immersed. To help us deliver this compelling experience, we’re looking for a highly ambitious, visionary, and experienced Senior Product Designer who will help shape Netflix’s ads consumer experiences for our users. This includes crafting innovative ad formats tailored to our wide variety of content and experiences, innovating within our existing ad canvases, and creating the future of advertising on Netflix. This will be a remote-friendly role, with the freedom to set a flexible work-from-home schedule.  This role would be best for candidates located in California or in the Pacific time zone, as monthly in-person travel will be required to collaborate with stakeholders and partners in Los Angeles, CA and Los Gatos, CA. About Our Team Our team designs the ads for consumer experiences for Netflix. These experiences span our entire product and empower our advertisers and sponsors to reach our members while maintaining the highest bar for the overall experience.  We also design the foundational features that make the Ads plan different from our other plans, helping our users maintain control and transparency of their advertising experience. You’ll be one of the lead designers who craft these experiences and shape the future of advertising across our product.  More specifically, you’ll be a critical part of one of the most talented and trailblazing advertising design teams in the world. What You Will Do Lead the design and execution of Netflix's ads consumer experiences across a variety of surfaces. Identify, research, and drive the future of our ads canvases for our members. Establish principles to ensure a best-in-class advertising experience for our members across multiple content types. Craft design briefs that provide business, design, and engineering clarity for critical initiatives. Collaborate with engineers, product managers, content designers, data scientists, and business teams to develop and iterate upon new concepts and facilitate product execution What We’re Looking For 8+ years as a Product Designer (or equivalent experience) in the consumer product space, leading high-impact initiatives from concept to execution. Rich portfolio that showcases proven experience at the intersection of advertising, TV, and/or streaming, specifically case studies that demonstrate expertise and leadership at this intersection. A passionate energy for great design and amplifying our team culture . Demonstrated expertise with consumer product experiences that incorporate advertising. Strong understanding of advertising best practices and industry trends for ads on TV and web. Work that highlights the balance between empathy for users and understanding advertiser needs Understands the nuances of advertising across all media types, and a knowledge of advertising best practices on digital products. Experience constructing end-product quality prototypes of consumer experiences that leverage video and motion. Excellent communication skills that excite stakeholders and articulate a vision. Highly organized with meticulous attention to detail (e.g writing documentation to support your design decisions). Experience in video production and editing tools. Experience in web advertising and/or marketing design. Experience in live TV broadcasting and/or TV advertising. Experience working directly with advertisers to deliver their vision. Even Better Mastery of Adobe Creative Suite & video editing tools Experience designing and delivering digital ad formats Experience in the creation and fulfillment of digital and/or video advertising campaigns Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We bring new stories to over 230 million people in over 190 countries worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. This requires amazing content to spark member joy, but also strategic partnerships and payments initiatives that make it easy to sign up and pay for Netflix. We have ambitious plans, tons of opportunity, and the passion to be the best in payments - that’s where you come in. About This Role We’re seeking a payments leader to set the vision for growth through payment innovation and strategic payment partnerships in North LATAM (e.g. Mexico, Colombia, and Peru). In this role, you’ll be building on top of one of the biggest subscription services in the world — helping us achieve an even higher level of business performance, and evolve to a broader set of payment capabilities. The role requires engaging internally with a broad cross-functional team including business development, product, legal, analysts and data scientists to name a few and requires deep collaboration with global and regional business leaders across various domains. Moreover, this role requires managing and contracting external relationships with key partners from financial institutions, card schemes, and fintechs in order to drive best-in-class payment performance and  innovation, all while keeping customer experience a priority. This role reports to the Director of Payments, Americas. Like all great companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. A successful candidate in this role will have three key skills: - You’re an expert on payments infrastructure, processing, and technology for the Mexico, Colombia, and Peru markets. You have an intellectual, problem-solver and strategic mind with the ability to synthesize data, insights, and feedback from multiple sources. You are comfortable in translating abstract ideas and information into concrete short-term and long-term bets that support Netflix’s growth. - You have a visionary perspective of the payments landscape and demonstrate a strategic vision and judgment in payments. You present broad experience influencing external stakeholders whether it be negotiating a commercial contract or shaping new products. - You are known by internal and external stakeholders as collaborative and inspirational. You foster strong relationships and alignment across different stakeholders within and outside the organization with a proven track record building a network in the industry. In order to be successful at Netflix, you must be able to anticipate and meet ever increasing business demands while demonstrating strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.  You must thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and focus on generating results all while exhibiting the highest level of personal and professional integrity. You are someone who is comfortable and confident interacting with all levels of an organization and with the ability to operate independently and someone who  welcomes failure as a learning opportunity. You will be asked to frequently represent the Payments team across the company and debate controversial topics with our executives. You will be a high-impact individual contributor whose responsibilities will include, but not be limited to: Make use of our payments infrastructure to improve the performance of existing payment methods, while evaluating any new payment methods that prove to have incremental value Seek out innovation in the payments domain by considering consumer’s needs, relevant regulatory and technological trends that could influence Netflix’s approach to payments in the short-term vs. the long-term Work alongside the Partnerships team on managing relationships with financial institutions, card schemes, and fintechs in order to drive best-in-class payment performance and innovation Own key payment metrics for your markets and derive actionable insights into improving the experience for our customers, improving performance, and ensuring efficient cost structures Partner cross-functionally throughout the organization (Product, Engineering, Customer Support, Legal, Marketing, Finance, etc.) to get things done - whether that be optimization or market expansion and launching features and products that will drive growth in our business Qualifications 6+ years experience managing very large CNP/recurring payments, either from a merchant, issuer or acquirer perspective Deep knowledge of payments technologies relevant to Mexico, Colombia and Peru Highly analytical with the ability to use data to make decisions Deep experience partnering and negotiating with payment partners Strong verbal and written communication skills Impeccable judgment and integrity; ability to make key decisions quickly and autonomously Existing network of relationships across the LATAM payments ecosystem Ability to juggle multiple critical tasks simultaneously Bachelor's degree, MBA a plus Additional languages a plus Willingness to travel as needed across LATAM and the U.S. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $XXX - $XXX. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here .

description: Our Team The Ads Platform team at Netflix is responsible for the development and integration of cutting-edge advertising systems. We are committed to delivering ads that not only drive significant outcomes for advertisers but also enhance our member's viewing experience. As we continue to grow in the Connected TV advertising space, we are seeking a Senior Product Manager to join our team, focusing on Advertising Creative Workflow and Infrastructure. Role Overview We are looking for a seasoned Product Manager who will be responsible for building an extensible infrastructure that enables other teams to develop new ad formats. This role will also involve defining a configurable workflow for moderating and labeling creatives, transcoding, and publishing to content distribution networks. Key Responsibilities Define and execute a product strategy for the Advertising Creative Workflow and Infrastructure, translating the strategy into a detailed product roadmap. Manage products from concept to launch, delivering features iteratively to address business challenges. Develop strong partnerships with internal teams, establishing continuous feedback loops to better understand their needs. Define success metrics for our products and drive the execution and continuous evaluation of these metrics. Communicate your vision and strategy broadly throughout the organization, engaging in healthy debates of ideas. Qualifications 7+ years of Product Management experience with a proven record of successfully launching and scaling platforms. Proven experience in managing Ad Tech products throughout the product development lifecycle. Deep understanding of the ads ecosystems, including experience with creative workflows, ad formats, and content distribution networks. Exceptional ability to prioritize and articulate your product roadmap across business functions and geographies. Comfortable working with ambiguity and able to adapt to the evolving needs of the business. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to engage in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with executives. Proven ability to inspire, motivate, and lead teams of designers, engineers, and business partners. Experience applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with 260+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. We are pursuing consumer products because we believe it will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content and in effect, drive long term value. We want merchandise, interactive games, and experiences to help promote our titles and build them into title brands, or franchises, so they become part of the zeitgeist for longer periods of time. That’s where you come in. We’re seeking someone to work with the Global Product Development and Creative team here in EMEA to set creative direction and drive innovation through the lens of food and beverage to create excellent product merchandise that supports storytelling as it relates to Netflix titles and content. You will work closely with licensees to drive that creativity from concept to production, including product approvals at all stages of execution. This person understands how to build compelling product ranges by translating core brand attributes and into compelling and conversation driving ranges utilizing style guide creative assets to achieve outstanding assortments. Working Job Description Be an integral part of the EMEA PDC team covering all product development aspects of the CP business across all local markets. Lead the development and execution of Netflix properties in how they turn up across all food and beverage categories. Manage freelancers and outside agencies in the development of creative tools, such as mood boards, product mock ups and other needs to assist in driving the creative direction of products from Infant to Adult. Partner with licensees to drive innovation and supply feedback from concept to final product approval ensuring  brand vision, design quality and product integrity. Manage and maintain product approvals in a timely manner through the internal product approval system. Build and maintain close relationships with cross functional teams such as Licensing, MSD and Retail Marketing to support overall brand vision. Align with key stakeholders across content makers, brand partnerships, BLA, creative marketing and regional marketing teams where applicable to maximize the impact of our strategies. What We Need From You 10+ years of experience in directing creative vision for food and beverage product development categories, with either vertical or entertainment/licensed brands or retail. Strong desire to think outside the box and innovate - exercising storytelling and joy through creative execution and product development. Ongoing observation and knowledge of f&b trends and npd, and the ability to apply that knowledge to direct brand vision and create compelling products. Understanding of the competitive brand and European retail landscape. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with contractors and agencies in soliciting creative projects and deliverables. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and digital. Essential project and time management skills. Italian speaking, however multilingual is advantageous. EMEA regional experience. Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop skills are a must.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 220M+ paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. The Opportunity We are looking for a passionate and talented machine learning engineer to join our applied ML research team on estimating long-term member satisfaction. As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing into exciting new frontiers of personalization to help our members find the content they’ll most enjoy. To do this, we have to understand which titles, and what experiences in the product, produce the most joy for each member. In this role, you will contribute to building, implementing, and scaling the next generation of personalization algorithms using techniques such as causal inference, machine learning, reinforcement learning, and econometrics. You will work with a team of experts in these techniques to understand how members experience titles, and how that changes their long-term assessment of their satisfaction with the Netflix service. You will be responsible for operating, as well as innovating, these algorithms in production. You will conduct applied research by conceptualizing, designing, implementing, and validating potential algorithmic improvements. This includes researching and applying cutting-edge machine learning algorithms, running offline experiments, and building online A/B tests to run in production systems. Los Gatos, California Products & Technology Core Engineering Machine Learning Engineer L4, Algorithms Engineering Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 220M+ paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages.  The Opportunity We are looking for a passionate and talented machine learning engineer to join our applied ML research team on estimating long-term member satisfaction. As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing into exciting new frontiers of personalization to help our members find the content they’ll most enjoy. To do this, we have to understand which titles, and what experiences in the product, produce the most joy for each member.  In this role, you will contribute to building, implementing, and scaling the next generation of personalization algorithms using techniques such as causal inference, machine learning, reinforcement learning, and econometrics. You will work with a team of experts in these techniques to understand how members experience titles, and how that changes their long-term assessment of their satisfaction with the Netflix service. You will be responsible for operating, as well as innovating, these algorithms in production. You will conduct applied research by conceptualizing, designing, implementing, and validating potential algorithmic improvements. This includes researching and applying cutting-edge machine learning algorithms, running offline experiments, and building online A/B tests to run in production systems. description: With 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service and is powered by a work culture that’s focused on excellence and continuous improvement. This is a great opportunity to shape the future of how we enable the best execution of marketing campaigns, in both quality and scale, as we continue to grow our slate of local and global content. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. The Marketing Production Manager role is a strategic thought partner and a key project manager, providing creative production solutions and operational excellence in campaign production. As we are aiming for Creative Excellence & Innovation, the Marketing Production function is critical in achieving Production Excellence for our campaigns in the CEE region. The Role We are looking for a Marketing Producer to lead creative innovation, production and execution of best-in-class entertainment campaigns for CEE markets. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the end-to-end production process of our market-specific campaign initiatives across paid, earned and owned channels. This means that you thrive in an environment that requires you to bridge creative and technical needs, that understand media formats and present exceptional project manager skills. We are looking for someone with hands-on knowledge & extensive experience from Polish market. The role is based in Warsaw. Responsibilities include: Driving and executing marketing project management skills in layered and complex agency environments. Effectively managing multiple title launches across Poland to ensure timely and accurate development, production and delivery of creative assets and consumer experiences in the region. End-to-end production management for key marketing shoots (esp. AV), chosen activations and marketing asset creation for bespoke title campaigns. Driving local implementation of global creative materials to deploy marketing experiences and extensions when high regional relevance is key. Managing agency and vendor relationships in the region by leading day-to-day communications, defining and tracking scope of work, managing creative & production budgets and timelines. Define, negotiate, communicate, implement and monitor technical quality standards and creative integrity on all project deliverables according to Netflix creative guidelines. Driving and enabling innovation and creative excellence across channels like Social, Digital, OOH and Experiential. Execute proper branding in all creative assets produced for marketing campaigns. Personality Attributes & Requirements: Strong familiarity with polish market,  media, production agencies, creative agencies and preferably entertainment landscape. Fluency in English and Polish  is required. Familiarity with any other CEE country (Poland, Romania, Czech, Hungary, Ukraine) is a plus. Passion for storytelling, and exceptional project management skills. 7+ years crafting world class creative direction and execution. Profound knowledge and experience with on set creative production, organizing events, brand activations, OOH, TV production, social media  (360 degree campaigns). Solid experience in working with creative agencies and production houses, and the ability to provide concise, clear, and actionable creative feedback/ direction. Proactive, fast, and flexible problem-solver with superb time, resource, and stakeholder management. Ability to manage a high volume of creatives and campaign types in parallel, with diverse geographically dispersed teams to lead the exchange of information and asset delivery effectively. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong and effective judgment in the face of ambiguity. Comfortably keeping up to date with the zeitgeist in entertainment, culture, tech and business innovations around the world. Good communicator with strong skills to voice point of view. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. The Client and Partner Technologies team is charted with enabling brilliant Netflix experiences on partner devices and building foundational client systems and tools.  As a Product Manager for TV Platform and Device Partner Technologies, you work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to support our technical strategies to support both internal Netflix initiatives and the foundational needs of the Netflix TV app platform. Using both qualitative insights and quantitative metrics to guide decisions and measure success, you will be responsible for driving, developing and executing software product roadmaps. This is a dynamic role interfacing with device partners, partner engineering teams and hundreds of internal engineers to drive efficiency and quality, ensuring members around the world have the best Netflix experience. Areas of responsibility include: Supporting initiatives to enhance the member experience such as Improving application startup time and Mobile Companion connectivity to support and augment TV “10-foot” UI experiences Drive technologies that are integral to the Netflix-supported device platforms such as OS Platform support strategy, accessibility features, and subscriber privacy Supporting  our internal security teams (device, OS platform, application and content) to improve the robustness of our platforms and integrations What Sets You Apart? Track record of technical product transformation, finding new opportunities and building them to scale Comfortable working with ambiguity. This role is fast-paced, fluid, and will frequently evolve based on partner, strategy, and product priorities You welcome candid feedback and can constructively give it as well Self-starter who enjoys quickly bringing organization and direction Experience with risk analysis and modeling Media streaming technology background in areas like Audio, Video or Graphics Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values Required Skills: 10-15 years product management experience working on smart TV’s and streaming devices. 10-15 years product management experience with creation of product strategy, product evolution and product lifecycle Experience improving media-rendering performance on devices Ability to think strategically and lean on data to inform decision-making Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience Can balance consumer, partner, and business interests while considering technical integration tradeoffs Proven experience creating partnerships with cross-functional teams and organizations, driving large-scale technical execution plans with measurable milestones, debating technical approaches, and building long-term scalable solutions Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
