description: The Opportunity We are looking to fill an integral Senior Manager role on the UCAN Slate Marketing team . In this role, you will lead the day-to-day management and execution of slate marketing campaigns for titles spanning Netflix Films, Series, and Nonfiction programming as well as some licensed titles. You will be responsible for developing the creative strategy that inspires cross-functional teams, drives big thinking and creates cohesion across every touchpoint of a campaign. More about the Slate Team Our goal in Slate marketing is to drive discovery and strengthen the Netflix brand by connecting and celebrating our titles in innovative ways. Because we leverage the power of our best titles, Slate marketing is an important opportunity to define how we are seen by audiences around the world. Though multi-title spots have existed for decades, we’re not interested in the cookie-cutter, straightforward approach. We’re looking to push creative boundaries and invent new ways of communicating with audiences. Therefore, success in this role will require a high degree of comfort operating in the gray, and the best candidates are the ones who are passionate about solving business opportunities creatively, and who can thrive without a clearly defined roadmap to follow. How do I know if I’m a fit for the role? You have a proven track record of leading impactful, world-class creative campaigns that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist. You can build a campaign strategy from the ground up. You’re passionate about Creative (trailers, creative content, art, disruptive stunts) and have experience developing strategic insights to inform 360 marketing campaigns. You geek out over advertising and can cite your favorite commercials off the top of your head. You are constantly consuming competitive marketing - not just in single-title entertainment, but also in broader advertising and brand marketing. You’re a fan of entertainment at large, and have a deep knowledge of Netflix’s most culturally relevant titles form the past and present. You can own a room when the time asks for it, and you know when to elevate those around you. You are able to engage, listen and collaborate with different teams to align on campaign goals. You are comfortable operating in the gray, without being given a list of next steps. You keep an eye on Social trends and platform evolution to form an understanding of how to apply social and media analytics to fast-moving campaigns. You are an effective manager in a fast paced, multifaceted environment who can coordinate multiple campaign launches happening at once. You are more interested in a team win than an individual win. Your priority is setting others up for success. If your team members look good, you look good. You understand that learning and improving from experience can be just as valuable as winning. You believe inclusion and diversity are cornerstones of successful marketing teams and successful marketing. You inspire and are inspired. You are a collaborator. You don’t mind asking for help or owning a mistake. You appreciate technology and can collaborate with our world class product team to integrate our multi-title campaigns within the member product experience. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are ). Core Responsibilities Lead multiple slate campaigns simultaneously with a range in scope and scale. Understand the fundamental difference between anticipation, curation and celebration and how to apply those areas strategically when thinking about new slate moments. Create and maintain the strategic platform for slate marketing campaigns, inclusive of positioning, thematic pillars, audience targets, and conversation goals. Oversee the execution of campaign materials (trailers, key art, social, stunts) and media activations, acting as the main point of contact with agencies and external partners. Communicate campaign strategy with key stakeholders and inspire cross-functional alignment to ensure campaign cohesion and consistency. Be on the front lines of every campaign with publicity, social, and content partners. When applicable, serve as a primary contact for filmmakers/showrunners and talent to communicate slate campaign approach, goals and tactics while delivering a best in class experience to the artists. Manage overall campaign scope, budget and timing, and resources from inception to finishing. Partner with the marketing ops team to ensure campaigns are delivered on time, at scale and on budget. Maintain a healthy curiosity for areas outside of core responsibilities and participate in the development and execution of broader business initiatives that impact the audience perception of our slate. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $250,000 - $515,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Product & Technology contracts management team at Netflix provides transactional deal support to Netflix’s corporate, studio and streaming product organizations globally. As part of this team, the successful candidate will serve as a central source of truth for all data and information related to the Product & Technology contract management team. They will oversee and manage contract administration and workflows, including collaborating with contract managers on legal summaries, reporting, and collecting signatures. They will liaise with cross functional partners to answer logistical questions related to agreements and reporting. We are seeking a self-motivated, quick-thinking, proactive, flexible coordinator who is able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is able to exercise good judgment, respond quickly to changes, and show significant initiative. In this role, you will: Coordinate with the contract management team members to ensure we effectively support business needs, including leveraging contract databases, systems, and tools; Conduct multifaceted research to support contract creation and negotiation; Facilitate the completion and execution of contracts such as NDAs, MSAs and SOWs; Optimize and manage contract templates, repositories, and workflow systems; Create and maintain information resources for team members and business partners; Work cross-functionally with internal teams and business partners in a collaborative manner; and Maintain flexibility and openness to take on additional projects as necessary to support business priorities. Who we are looking for: 4+ years of relevant experience as a coordinator, contract manager, or paralegal in entertainment focused law firms or legal departments, ideally including familiarity with technology transactions. Exceptional written and verbal communication and research skills. Excellent interpersonal skills with experience developing and fostering effective relationships across diverse teams. Outstanding attention to detail and time management skills with the  ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously. Willingness to tackle new subjects and take on special projects as the need arises. Whether an introvert, extrovert or somewhere in between, you thrive in a fast-paced environment, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $350,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad-supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers. As the Agency Sales Partner in Japan, you will be responsible for helping lead the development and execution of the agency sales strategy in Japan. Working closely with senior-level account directors, account planning stakeholders, trading leadership, and investment directors within our agency partners, you will build strong relationships with advertisers, promoting the use of the Netflix advertising platform to C-level executives including: CMO, CDO, Media Directors etc. Your role involves the dual tasks of cultivating business with senior stakeholders at major agency groups and establishing key client relationships with C-level, VP, and Director contacts within those portfolios. You will drive Netflix Advertising opportunities with agency partners, client leaders, and internal teams. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the advertising ecosystem in an established network of relationships, and a track record of delivering revenue growth. Key responsibilities: Develop and execute agency-focused sales for Japan to deliver revenue targets and exceed client expectations. Build and maintain strong relationships with a major Agency Holding group and related Agencies to secure ad partnerships and drive revenue growth. Develop long-term relationships with key senior Clients within those portfolios. Partner with Microsoft Partner teams to respond to briefs and grow the business together Develop sales strategies and sales plans for the assigned Account portfolio Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful delivery of advertising campaigns. Leverage Netflix's unique audience insights and premium content offerings to drive revenue growth. Monitor market trends, and competitor activity and identify opportunities for innovation. https://jobs.netflix.com/culture We're looking for: 8+ years of advertising sales experience Fluency in Japanese and English is required for this role Proven strategic thinker with the ability to analyze data and translate it into specific and measurable tactics, actions, and outcomes Highly skilled in negotiating and selling the intrinsic value of a premium offering to customers Problem solver with the ability to collaborate and work across functions Prospecting and cold calling skills necessary Understanding of how our clients set priorities and performance goals, and how we can align our product portfolio to best fulfill those needs Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills Ability to multitask, make decisions and manage at entrepreneurial speed Strong, confident presentation skills Interest in our corporate culture (read our memo here ) If you have a passion for entertainment and a desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment, we would love to hear from you. Come join us and help us entertain the world! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment provider with over 260 million paid subscribers in over 190 countries around the world. This success has depended on an industry-leading engineering organization building cloud-native services with exceptional resilience. Cloud Infrastructure Engineering delivers the platform underneath these services by following three tenets: simple, scalable, speed. We build simple, elegant solutions that are easy to adopt, highly available and efficient at internet scale, and support rapid development and exploration for engineers across the company. Netflix has built a reputation as a world leader in Performance Engineering and the Netflix Performance Tech blog is one of the de-facto resources in the Industry. The Netflix performance engineering team is a small, very senior, and highly impactful team who have massive impact across Netflix engineering by being a trusted expert to countless teams getting involved in the hardest problems and most critical projects to ensure Netflix is always delivering the very best performance to its customers. We are looking for an engineering leader passionate about performance optimization to lead this space at Netflix. You will own a long tenured and deeply experienced team of performance engineers. You have a background in the domain with strong technical expertise enabling you to grow and guide members of the team as well as choose the right problems for Netflix to invest in.  You have a track record of growing very senior engineers to be industry leaders. You will influence some of our key bets enabling great engineering at every level of the stack to result in experiences that delight our customers at massive scale. The team connects the dots across products and features to allow us to ship end-to-end experiences, not org charts.  You will enable the team to continue to develop industry-leading tooling and analytics in partnership with other industry leaders allowing us to stay at the very forefront of our domain. What You Will Do Own vision, strategy, and the end-to-end performance optimization of Netflix on the Cloud. Effectively collaborate across several partner teams, focus on the user, prioritize ruthlessly, and get things done. Support a team of world-class colleagues, keeping them challenged and growing professionally. Make data-driven decisions, make bets, learn from failures, be in situations without obvious right answers, and create an environment where rapid iteration is the top goal. Develop groundbreaking tooling and analytics, cooperating with other industry leaders to continue to push what best-in-class performance optimization is. Own Netflix’s relationship with key Vendor partners and push the boundaries of performance on multiple architectures. Who We Are Looking For A leader who has a strong and deep background in the performance domain with experience of internet scale platforms and their associated complexity. Demonstrated experience growing and developing world-class engineers. Someone who believes deeply in engineering excellence and deriving the very best out of our systems and people. A proven track record of navigating an ambiguous space, solving hard problems with tricky technical or organizational constraints, and identifying the right ones to address. An organized, informed, effective communicator and influencer using context, not control; outcome-focused and able to think from the first principles. Experience building and leading software engineering teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity, ensuring that we can attract and retain the best talent from anywhere and that all voices are heard to inform our direction. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix aspires to provide great entertainment for people everywhere from the world's best creators across movies, TV series, documentaries, comedy and more. Our members have control over what they watch, when and where. It's an amazing time to join the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment. If you are a talented public relations executive with a passion for content and entertainment, keep reading! About the Role We are seeking an Events Specialist who will play a key role in supporting the team of seasoned professionals developing and executing strategic events from in-person to virtual and everything in between in Japan for external and internal audiences. Tasks are varied, extensive and timely. They will include but are not limited to: Lead meeting planning and preparation, work with other department to put in place a set of best practices that enable us to move quicker, bigger and better; coordinating with outside agencies and vendors and internal teams; assisting with meeting schedules and facilitation, including help putting together documentations and coordinating audiovisual needs; updating various lists, documents; helping to coordinate the invite process; trafficking creative and screening asset requests. Support in the planning, managing and execution of press junkets, title premieres, fan engagements and other internal employee-facing events and other duties as assigned. A go-getter, you should not be afraid to push the envelope and bring new ideas to the table, as well as experiment with the latest tools and technologies to elevate our events into unique-to-Netflix  experiences. From external-facing events to internal employee-facing events; you will display curiosity about building holistic event experiences with new and innovative event ideas. Reporting to the Director of Events for APAC, this is a hands-on role and one that requires end to end project management of some events, whilst working as a support on other events. You will have amazing attention to detail, the ability to see the big picture as well as have the ability to partner seamlessly in Japan. The work: Produce creative and well-executed events that are unique to Netflix Creative conceptualization, crafting of creative proposals and quotations with external agencies Ability to pivot quickly and maintain a positive attitude Proactively manage feedback and perspectives from cross-functional partners and APAC team to deliver impactful event campaigns Able to anticipate potential problems, willingness to be flexible and get the job done Adaptable to hybrid or virtual events, with knowledge of what it takes online and off, including the latest tools, platforms and technologies to bring our vision to life External vendor and agency management and supervision Produce creative and well-executed experiences that are consumer and press centric and unique to Netflix Curious and can contribute effectively outside of their speciality The candidate must: 8+ yrs of events/experiential marketing preferably from the entertainment industry that includes managing, executing, planning events at an agency, studio, network or with a brand Be proactive about their tasks and responsibilities, while exercising sound judgment even when faced with ambiguity Be able to pivot quickly and maintain a positive attitude and sense of humor Have budget and time management skills; within tight deadlines Be agile with meticulous attention to details Be confident and able to express ideas and point of view thoughtfully and with passion Be transparent and unafraid to challenge, ask questions or call out obstacles Have excellent organizational skills and ability to roll up your sleeves to get things done Have excellent communication in Japanese and English The Netflix culture attracts talents who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read our culture memo . If it resonates with you, maybe you’re the right person to join our team. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. description: Netflix’s Music Creative & Production (MCP) team provides premiere music support to our productions and cross-functional partners by leveraging relationships and guiding the music creative, scoring, and budgeting process from development to launch. Our goal is to empower Netflix to thrill the world by deepening fan engagement and to amplify storytelling through music. This role will oversee the music process for titles across each Animated Series vertical, including Preschool, Kids & Family, and Adult Animation Action, and Adult Animation Comedy. The successful candidate will excel at identifying and implementing cross-functional creative music solutions that will support our animation productions and overall slate. Responsibilities Collaborate with showrunners, producers, and studio executives (Content, Prod mgmt, Post, Legal, Finance) to oversee and execute music objectives for Netflix Series Animation Act as Music Informed Captain on titles for the multiple Netflix Music cross-functional teams: Soundtrack, Music Marketing, Music BALA, Music Services, etc. Read development scripts, ideate with Content on musical identity of series, and recommend appropriate music schedule & budget in internal review In alignment with Content, recommend key music hires: Songwriter and/or Composer, Music Supervisor, Executive Music Producer. Collect and curate reels to present to internal and external partners and help schedule composer, showrunner meetings. Collaborate closely with Music Business & Legal Affairs (BALA) to define parameters of deals for creative music hires. Work with Production Management, Composer, and Post to develop a music post schedule that coincides with series Post timeline. On high impact titles, steer crucial creative music direction on score/songs with the Composer/Songwriter and help manage the score/song note process between the producer(s), creative executive(s) and composer. Liaise with the music supervisor in the process of song selection as it relates to creative studio approvals and budget. Strategize and collaborate with Netflix Soundtrack and Music Marketing teams on music release strategy for titles including potential label partnerships, marketing activations, etc. Skills & Qualifications: Possessing a keen musical ear and background to assess creative excellence on scores and original songs and provide specific feedback where appropriate Deep knowledge in the music talent space - songwriters, producers, composers, artists, music supervisors, managers, agents Knowledge of and passion for animated content and music in general, including Preschool and Kids & Family content Deep knowledge of the music industry, digital streaming platforms, music publishing, music licensing, record labels, PROs Familiarity with current musical landscape/music tastemaker Comfortability being project and talent facing Highly organizational and comfortable creating and maintaining systems Team player with the ability to prioritize, respond, pivot quickly, think practically, positively, and be solution-oriented Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Ability to work proactively, independently, and reliably on multiple projects under tight time frames in a fast-paced production environment Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to multitask Open to suggestions and feedback Exercises good judgment and initiative when making decisions Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
search_text:
Los Angeles, California Content Production Management Manager, Music Creative Production - Animation Series Netflix’s Music Creative & Production (MCP) team provides premiere music support to our productions and cross-functional partners by leveraging relationships and guiding the music creative, scoring, and budgeting process from development to launch. Our goal is to empower Netflix to thrill the world by deepening fan engagement and to amplify storytelling through music. This role will oversee the music process for titles across each Animated Series vertical, including Preschool, Kids & Family, and Adult Animation Action, and Adult Animation Comedy. The successful candidate will excel at identifying and implementing cross-functional creative music solutions that will support our animation productions and overall slate.  Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with showrunners, producers, and studio executives (Content, Prod mgmt, Post, Legal, Finance) to oversee and execute music objectives for Netflix Series Animation 
  • Act as Music Informed Captain on titles for the multiple Netflix Music cross-functional teams: Soundtrack, Music Marketing, Music BALA, Music Services, etc.
  • Read development scripts, ideate with Content on musical identity of series, and recommend appropriate music schedule & budget in internal review
  • In alignment with Content, recommend key music hires: Songwriter and/or Composer, Music Supervisor, Executive Music Producer. Collect and curate reels to present to internal and external partners and help schedule composer, showrunner meetings. Collaborate closely with Music Business & Legal Affairs (BALA) to define parameters of deals for creative music hires.  
  • Work with Production Management, Composer, and Post to develop a music post schedule that coincides with series Post timeline. 
  • On high impact titles, steer crucial creative music direction on score/songs with the Composer/Songwriter and help manage the score/song note process between the producer(s), creative executive(s) and composer. 
  • Liaise with the music supervisor in the process of song selection as it relates to creative studio approvals and budget.
  • Strategize and collaborate with Netflix Soundtrack and Music Marketing teams on music release strategy for titles including potential label partnerships, marketing activations, etc. 
    • Skills & Qualifications:
  • Possessing a keen musical ear and background to assess creative excellence on scores and original songs and provide specific feedback where appropriate
  • Deep knowledge in the music talent space - songwriters, producers, composers, artists, music supervisors, managers, agents
  • Knowledge of and passion for animated content and music in general, including Preschool and Kids & Family content
  • Deep knowledge of the music industry, digital streaming platforms, music publishing, music licensing, record labels, PROs
  • Familiarity with current musical landscape/music tastemaker
  • Comfortability being project and talent facing
  • Highly organizational and comfortable creating and maintaining systems
  • Team player with the ability to prioritize, respond, pivot quickly, think practically, positively, and be solution-oriented
  • Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information
  • Ability to work proactively, independently, and reliably on multiple projects under tight time frames in a fast-paced production environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to multitask
  • Open to suggestions and feedback
  • Exercises good judgment and initiative when making decisions
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment.  We connect people globally with movies and shows by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation through the world's leading streaming entertainment app, with more than 240 million memberships in over 190 countries. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can enjoy an expanding collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. About the Job: The External Games Creative Design Team is looking for a Creative Producer to manage a range of creative-led projects, including externally developed experimental prototypes. Responsibilities: Work with the Director of Creative, cross-functional partners, and external developers to ensure all projects are delivered on time, within budget, and aligned with creative goals. Track Creative Design assignments and ensure sufficient coverage is provided, resolving dependencies and facilitating information flow. Inspire and empower development teams by guiding them through continuous improvement, and sharing learnings with the External Games Organisation. Develop and maintain relationships with external partners, suppliers, and other game development professionals. Build and maintain ongoing production schedules and scheduling, monitor project progress with necessary adjustments, and facilitate team meetings to reach effective decisions ensuring project completion. Utilize project management tools and techniques to manage projects and communicate with stakeholders. Understand the larger vision for a system, feature, or content and work with Creative Design team leadership to deliver those goals. Partner with the Creative Design team to help update and maintain a shared library of assets and process documentation Qualifications: 5+ years experience in game development Production or Development Management (social, F2P, mobile, web, console, handheld). Able to create, implement, and own effective workflows for creative teams. Experience participating in game development cycles including leading development of game features and/or services. Proven ability to collaborate with internal, distributed, and external teams (development, outsourcing, etc.). Experience and proven ability to work on complex cross-functional projects in a quickly evolving environment; delivering tasks on schedule, budget, scope, capacity, risks, and quality. Knowledge of production and game design difficulties generally encountered by teams and an understanding of how to tailor solutions to their unique requirements. Positive influence and ability to receive and provide objective and constructive feedback. Ability to influence direction, without relying on positional authority. Experience creating reports and presentations with project updates to stakeholders. Licensed IP game experience is a plus. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000-270,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity The Casting Business Affairs Team at Netflix is seeking an experienced professional for an associate role to support the US/Canada/UK Scripted Series group. Members of this team  are the subject matter experts on engaging non-Series Regular performers (including guest performers, stunt performers, singers and dancers) to work on Netflix's award winning scripted series. The Role As the Casting Business Affairs Associate, you will play a primary role in structuring, negotiating, and drafting performer agreements, collaborating with internal and external partners to oversee the entire process necessary for guest performers on a production. This includes coordinating with casting, business and legal affairs, production, accounting, post-production, credits, residuals, and other internal and external teams throughout all stages of series from pre-production to production and post-production. Your capacity to work proactively and independently under tight timeframes will be crucial as you navigate this dynamic environment. Success in this role requires adaptability and the drive to excel in a fast-paced setting, all while maintaining unwavering professionalism and integrity. You embrace and advocate for cultural diversity while upholding the highest standards of professionalism and integrity. If you're prepared to contribute to our success and evolve with our team, we encourage you to apply. Responsibilities Work closely with external casting to advise on deal structure and strategy for guest performers. Serve as the primary point of contact between Netflix and talent agents and attorneys regarding guest performer agreements. Review and approve project-specific guest performer deals, ensuring accuracy, signatures, and payment details. Advise and educate producers, casting, production, finance, post-production, and business affairs teams (in-house and external partners) on the requirements under SAG-AFTRA (and/or other performer union) contracts. Work closely with in-house Creative Casting to provide optimal support to external partners. Provide guidance to post-production regarding cast contract requirements when modifying scenes, including moving, splitting, and deleting scenes, as well as ADR/Loop Group payments. Coordinate with Screen Credits, Residuals, and Legal Delivery teams to maintain an efficient workflow. Willingness to work on new subjects outside area of expertise, take on special projects, and support all areas of the Casting Business Affairs Team as the need arises Requirements Experience with SAG-AFTRA, ACTRA, or Equity Collective Bargaining Agreements High proficiency in contract review, structuring, and drafting, as well as negotiating complex talent/performer agreements. Exhibit sound judgment and adept critical thinking skills in various situations, enabling effective problem-solving and decision-making. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills Preferred JD and/or BA/BS degree Experience with Google Suite, i.e., Google Sheets Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is  $70,000 - $350,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix has been changing how people watch shows and movies, enabling on-demand access to thousands of movies and TV shows. Recently, Netflix has expanded its entertainment offering to include Live content, like Chris Rock Comedy Special, the SAG Awards ceremony or The Netflix Slam tennis match. Bringing stories in real-time to 260+ million viewers around the world is a hard challenge, demanding exceptional levels of stability and reliability from dozens of services and systems between camera and device screens. About the role We are looking for an experienced engineer to drive the evolution of testing tools and practices and help Netflix scale its Live streaming offering. Investments in automation, load, and failure testing practices would enable a flawless Live user experience for Live events with minimal impact on the pace of innovation. Responsibilities: This role combines cross-functional coordination, thought leadership, hands-on development, and data reporting. We are looking for a candidate with Live streaming experience, a proven track record of test infrastructure development and experience of partnership with a diverse set of engineering stakeholders to deliver new complex products. As part this role you will: Transform business requirements from product and details of service architecture into requirements for testing platforms, test suites, and practices. Own Live testing strategy across critical components of Live systems: Transmission, Encoding, Content Delivery, Device Players, Playback Systems, Discovery Systems, Messaging and Title Management. Own or influence the development of test tooling like failure injection, load generation, and stress testing. Develop ways to track test stability and coverage for Live functionality. Support Live SRE team by enabling visibility into areas of risk through tools and reports on testing coverage and stability. Influence test automation and stress testing practices. Identify improvements in Live systems to ensure testability and resiliency. Skills required to be successful in this job: Understanding the basics of Live Streaming infrastructure and product experience. Experience developing testing tools and validation suites for complex systems. Operational or development experience in Live Streaming. Hands-on experience with canary, failure injection and load testing for large-scale systems. Proficiency in at least one programming language (Go, Python, Java, JavaScript). Experience driving testing and validation efforts through business-critical launches across multiple product and engineering teams. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience in leading projects with 10+ engineering and product stakeholders. Working knowledge of continuous integration and continuous deployment systems. Passion for enabling the development of robust and stable systems. Nice-to-have Full-stack software development skills. Data analytics and visualization experience (SQL, Hive/Spark, Tableau). Log analytics and processing. History of collaboration with Product Management. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $230,000- $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading internet entertainment service with 260+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are pursuing consumer products and associated promotion because we believe it will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content and in effect, drive long-term value. We want merchandise, interactive games, and experiences to help promote our titles and build them into title brands, or franchises, so they become part of the zeitgeist for longer periods of time. This manager of Softlines Product Development will be responsible for driving the USA and Canada product design and development for fashion and accessories product categories for all age demos, from concept through to production across multiple Netflix IP. What you will do: Lead product trends, product strategies and product design & development for all mass and specialty softlinescategories, including but not exclusively - mens, womens, juniors, kids and infants - building partnerships with licensees, brands, and retailers, as well as internal CP teams and partners across the organization. Manage product development from creative vision and kickoff with partners, through to retail launch, ensuring the assortments are well designed and merchandised and that there is proper differentiation across retail, globally. Align closely with the product development and creative teams as well as cross-functional partners on all deliverables for product development and packaging. Take a leadership position in driving/influencing the creative translation/extension of our titles into softlines consumer products, with an eye on innovative, market relevant development while ensuring alignment back to the property. Lead and guide licensees, retailers and brands on how to translate our titles into successful products for all Netflix properties for which merchandise will be developed. Develop creative product development tools and guidelines that help to inspire and drive new and elevated ways of developing products and bringing products into the market. Lead in driving efficiencies in how we partner with retailers, licensees and brands, with a focus on speed to market. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix expands globally, we look for the best and brightest talent to scale with and contribute to our growth. We are looking for a Technology Auditor to perform SOX compliance, operational audits, and integrated audits for Netflix. This is a hybrid position based in Los Gatos, California. Responsibilities: Assist in all phases (planning, fieldwork, and reporting) of the IT SOX Program which includes but is not limited to performing walkthroughs, testing (ITGCs, Application controls, IPE testing, SOC review, etc), and communicating results to stakeholders. Partnering with Engineering stakeholders to evaluate system implementation for continued SOX compliance by performing SOX readiness procedures. Audit technology process around home-grown systems and 3rd party systems. In most cases, execute procedures that provide control assurance through code review. Communicate effectively and efficiently with stakeholders to build trust and credibility. Identify improvements and automation opportunities to increase efficiency and impact of audit procedures. Collaborate with external auditors on an ongoing basis to ensure continued alignment and timely completion of agreed-upon milestones. Document accurate and detailed work papers clearly describing the audit procedures, the result of work performed, and conclusions reached. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Accounting, Business or related fields 3+ years experience under your belt, preferably with a minimum of 2 years of public accounting or internal audit experience Strong grasp of basic technology concepts (infrastructure, applications, etc) Knowledge of IT auditing processes/procedures Proficient in using computer software (e.g., SQL, EXCEL, Microstrategy, Tableau) and cloud ERP systems (e.g. Workday) Working knowledge of cloud-based systems and compliance in cloud environment Demonstrate excellent communication skills (written and verbal), sound judgment in analyzing problems, with proficiency in assessing risk and evaluating technology and internal controls Highly detail-oriented along with the ability to deliver high quality work products Strong prioritization and multitasking skills Able to work closely with people at all levels of the organization and facilitate discussions with management regarding audit findings and implementation of corrective actions Understanding of commonly used internal control frameworks including COBIT, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, etc Self-starter that enjoys working in a fast-paced environment CISA, CIA, and Big 4 consulting experience is a plus Embrace and advocate the Netflix culture Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with over 230 million paid members in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, feature films, and games across numerous genres and languages. Members can watch or play as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence powers all of our consumer experience, including content discovery and personalization, identifying and attracting new members to our product, optimizing our payment processing, and much more. The Opportunity The Consumer ML Serving team provides the computational platform on which nearly all our consumer-facing ML/AI applications are built. If you’ve seen it, we probably served it! We provide all the building blocks to serve ML at scale, including a real-time serving platform, an event-driven model and feature compute framework, a distributed cluster orchestration engine, and more. We are looking for a strong technical lead to own and develop our long-term vision. Our systems power some of the most business-critical models at Netflix, and we need you to take our ML/AI initiatives to the next level. You will play a highly cross-functional role, partnering with other engineers, product managers, machine learning engineers, and data/research scientists. If you have a passion for building scalable, robust systems, are interested in pushing the envelope in applied ML algorithms, and enjoy seeing a direct line between your work and what our customers see on their screens, then we want to talk to you. You may enjoy working with us if you are: Able to solve ambiguous problems and deliver top-tier solutions. Eager to learn about new domains and ship high-quality, well-tested code. Able to produce generic and optimal solutions while balancing near-term needs. Excited to work in a multidisciplinary environment (engineering, algorithms, data engineering/science, product experimentation). Comfortable working in a majority-remote team with partners distributed across (US) geographies & time zones. Willing to take broad ownership of team responsibilities (building roadmaps, scoping, task breakdowns, etc.) We would especially love to work with you if have experience with: Building high-traffic, real-time distributed systems and ML infrastructure. Supporting large-scale ML models with a direct impact on what customers see. Translating the requirements of research scientists into generic platform offerings. Delivering systems requiring high availability, throughput, and performance. Navigating highly ambiguous environments. Taking on and executing zero-to-one projects. Leading projects with 3-4 other engineers. Building applications in an object-oriented programming language. (We work primarily with Java, and while prior Java experience is not required to interview, you will be expected to become proficient on the job.) DevOps for large applications, including performance tuning, optimization, deployment management, and capacity planning. Public cloud like AWS, Azure, or GCP. …and if: You are a proactive, effective communicator and have a strong bias towards action. You have a BS/MS in Computer Science, Applied Math, Engineering, or a related field. What do we offer? Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix aspires to provide great entertainment for people everywhere from the world's best creators across movies, TV series, documentaries, comedy and more. Our members have control over what they watch, when and where. It's an amazing time to join the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment. If you are a talented public relations executive with a passion for content and entertainment, keep reading! About the Role We are looking to hire a Senior Manager for Events in Japan who will spearhead a team that is responsible for the development and delivery of world-class innovative events from in-person to virtual and everything in between. From external-facing events to internal employee-facing events; you should be able to blend strategic thinking with execution at scale. You should not be afraid to push the envelope and bring new ideas to the table, as well as experiment with the latest tools and technologies to elevate our events into unique-to-Netflix  experiences. You will have amazing attention to detail, the ability to see the big picture and clearly articulate your vision to internal and external stakeholders, as well as the ability to partner seamlessly, and execute flawlessly across APAC for local and global titles. Reporting to the Director of Events for APAC, the role combines project management with strategic thinking, execution and the smart use of resources for maximum impact. You will need to have strong cross-functional relationships to create, shape, execute and manage events for Netflix content. The successful candidate will be curious about campaign promotional efforts - paying attention to creativity, concept, quality, and time constraints - and will seek to add value and improve campaigns with new and innovative event ideas. You will be able to fulfill the roles and responsibilities of a senior leader, including helping your team navigate ambiguity by providing high-level context while enabling team members to make sound judgment calls. You will look to provide impact through scale but also be able to provide support on event executions. You will seek to up-level the team and are unafraid to take smart risks. You are self-reflective and sunshine what you could have done better, sharing your learnings to up-level the whole team. The successful candidate will be an experienced people manager, looking to grow and develop talent. You will be an inclusive leader and cultural ambassador, embodying and promoting our company values every day, and actively helping others do the same. The work: Oversee the Japan event strategy for the short and long term, in line with business needs Function as a strategic thought partner within Events & Screenings to Publicity, Photo & AV Studio, Awards, Comms, Marketing and Content Lead cross-functional as well as cross-regional debate and collaboration Foster cross-functional partnerships and take strategic approaches to achieve high impact events and campaign goals Lead ongoing roles & responsibilities discussions, grow, nurture and develop the group and manage expectations setting and discussions for their team Provide mentorship to less tenured team members across the Events & Screenings team to support their work and ideation Forecast budgets based on title prioritization and oversee team budget Oversee title staffing and day to day team management Creative conceptualization, crafting of creative proposals and quotations Resourceful strategic thinker and creative problem solver Ability to pivot quickly and maintain a positive attitude and sense of humor Produce creative and well-executed experiences that are consumer-centric and unique to Netflix Adaptable to hybrid or virtual events, with knowledge of what it takes online and off, including the latest tools, platforms and technologies to bring our vision to life External vendor and agency management and supervision Provide team with strategic direction on sourcing of venues, vendors, entertainment and event related requirements Superior project, budget and time management skills, within tight deadlines The candidate must: 12+ yrs of events experience preferably from the entertainment industry that includes managing, executing, planning and staffing events at an agency, studio, network or with a brand (experience in film or television awards campaigns is a bonus) Experience as a people manager A self starter who is able to work independently, and under pressure, while consistently exercising sound judgment even when faced with ambiguity Resourceful strategic thinker and creative problem solver Ability to pivot quickly and maintain a positive attitude and sense of humor Articulate what is and is not required to deliver a successful campaign Be transparent and unafraid to challenge, ask questions or call out obstacles Agile with meticulous attention to details Excellent organizational skills and ability to roll up your sleeves to get things done Excellent communication in Japanese and English fluency is a plus The Netflix culture attracts talents who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read our culture memo . If it resonates with you, maybe you’re the right person to join our team. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. You should not be afraid to push the envelope and bring new ideas to the table, as well as experiment with the latest tools and technologies to elevate our events into unique-to-Netflix  experiences. You will have amazing attention to detail, the ability to see the big picture and clearly articulate your vision to internal and external stakeholders, as well as the ability to partner seamlessly, and execute flawlessly across APAC for local and global titles.  Reporting to the Director of Events for APAC, the role combines project management with strategic thinking, execution and the smart use of resources for maximum impact. You will need to have strong cross-functional relationships to create, shape, execute and manage events for Netflix content. The successful candidate will be curious about campaign promotional efforts - paying attention to creativity, concept, quality, and time constraints - and will seek to add value and improve campaigns with new and innovative event ideas.  You will be able to fulfill the roles and responsibilities of a senior leader, including helping your team navigate ambiguity by providing high-level context while enabling team members to make sound judgment calls. You will look to provide impact through scale but also be able to provide support on event executions.  You will seek to up-level the team and are unafraid to take smart risks. You are self-reflective and sunshine what you could have done better, sharing your learnings to up-level the whole team. The successful candidate will be an experienced people manager, looking to grow and develop talent. You will be an inclusive leader and cultural ambassador, embodying and promoting our company values every day, and actively helping others do the same.  The work:
  • Oversee the Japan event strategy for the short and long term, in line with business needs
  • Function as a strategic thought partner within Events & Screenings to Publicity, Photo & AV Studio, Awards, Comms, Marketing and Content
  • Lead cross-functional as well as cross-regional debate and collaboration
  • Foster cross-functional partnerships and take strategic approaches to achieve high impact events and campaign goals
  • Lead ongoing roles & responsibilities discussions, grow, nurture and develop the group and manage expectations setting and discussions for their team
  • Provide mentorship to less tenured team members across the Events & Screenings team to support their work and ideation
  • Forecast budgets based on title prioritization and oversee team budget
  • Oversee title staffing and day to day team management
  • Creative conceptualization, crafting of creative proposals and quotations
  • Resourceful strategic thinker and creative problem solver
  • Ability to pivot quickly and maintain a positive attitude and sense of humor
  • Produce creative and well-executed experiences that are consumer-centric and unique to Netflix
  • Adaptable to hybrid or virtual events, with knowledge of what it takes online and off, including the latest tools, platforms and technologies to bring our vision to life
  • External vendor and agency management and supervision
  • Provide team with strategic direction on sourcing of venues, vendors, entertainment and event related requirements
  • Superior project, budget and time management skills, within tight deadlines

    • The candidate must:
  • 12+ yrs of events experience preferably from the entertainment industry that includes managing, executing, planning and staffing events at an agency, studio, network or with a brand (experience in film or television awards campaigns is a bonus) 
  • Experience as a people manager
  • A self starter who is able to work independently, and under pressure, while consistently exercising sound judgment even when faced with ambiguity 
  • Resourceful strategic thinker and creative problem solver
  • Ability to pivot quickly and maintain a positive attitude and sense of humor
  • Articulate what is and is not required to deliver a successful campaign
  • Be transparent and unafraid to challenge, ask questions or call out obstacles
  • Agile with meticulous attention to details
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to roll up your sleeves to get things done
  • Excellent communication in Japanese and English fluency is a plus 


    • The Netflix culture attracts talents who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read our culture memo . If it resonates with you, maybe you’re the right person to join our team. 
    We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. description: The Opportunity With 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service and is powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement. This is a great opportunity to shape the future of how we enable the best execution of marketing campaigns, on both quality and scale, as we continue to grow our slate of local and global original, exclusive content. The Role We are looking for a Campaign Operations Manager to join our Marketing Production team. Marketing Production is the center of excellence for creative operations, cross-functional project management, and marketing asset production. Campaign Operations Manager serves as the logistical and operational expert within the team, primarily partnering with AV/Print Producers and Marketing teams along with wider cross-functional teams such as Publicity to ensure efficient execution of creative production and adaptation, localization, asset management and delivery for Japan marketing campaigns. This position requires a nimble, solutions-oriented, project management expert, who thrives in a fast-paced environment that requires abilities to bridge competing priorities amongst multiple complex projects. Qualifications: Over 7 years of experience managing creative production and/or campaign while overseeing complex timelines, budgets and scope, preferably at an agency, entertainment studio or network.  This is not an entry-level role. Possess deep knowledge and experience working on marketing campaigns, with an emphasis on video, print/OOH and digital/social asset materials. Well-versed in Video or Print materials and formats while understanding the fundamentals of asset ingestion and management, servicing and trafficking. A strong background working with internal and third-party tools, designed for asset management and project collaboration. Fluent in the language of marketing and creative production. Language proficiency - Fluent Japanese, Business Level English A deep understanding of business and cultural sensitivities. International work experience is preferred. Personality Attributes: Read about our culture . You are passionate and curious about all aspects of entertainment marketing and project management. You are an enthusiastic self-starter who can proactively determine next steps without being told. You are a natural born communicator, connecting the dots when others cannot and simplifying complex issues and questions. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. You’re comfortable living in the gray and can navigate comfortably in ambiguity. You have experience with cross-functional work and familiarity across the many aspects of campaign development. You exercise sound judgment and flexibility, prioritizing people and solutions over process when necessary. You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: It’s an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. With 260 million paid members in over 190 countries, our approach to Marketing is to defy convention, disrupt industry norms and break new ground through innovative, culturally relevant, breakthrough content and campaigns that pierce the zeitgeist and drive the conversation. The Netflix Social Marketing team brings the joy of watching Netflix into the social feed, entertaining fans anywhere they spend their time outside of the service, so they discover new titles to watch and talk about the Netflix brand, titles and talents. Day to day, that means we set the strategy and work with other teams to curate and create content for Netflix-branded social channels, and develop new audiences across Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, podcasts and more. We are looking for a Manager, Social Marketing to fill an integral role in our Social Marketing Team. In this role, you will be a key contributor in planning, managing and executing the social marketing strategy focused on our Netflix-branded Japanese content for various audiences across key social media platforms. To be successful, you’ll need to be a storyteller at heart and have excellent judgment to balance audience interests with the needs of our business. You’ll have a deep passion, appreciation, and understanding of TV, Film and entertainment broadly, with a depth and breadth of knowledge about the Japanese entertainment landscape and consumers as well as global trends. Social Marketing Team Mission: Our Social Marketing team strives to advocate Netflix Japan as one of the leaders of Japan-centric entertainment culture. The team maximizes social presence effectively through triple media utilization and facilitating deep conversations by creating emotionally resonating content that connects our audience and Netflix titles. Seek new approaches: Explore new ideas and methods that break from the norm and emphasize the brand's personality. Create content that resonates with fans' emotions and encourages involvement with joy and deep engagement. Maximize title excitement: Provide Social strategy and input consumer-centric POV. Maximize social media reach with efficiency by using triple media: Owned, Earned, Paid. Foster brand love and trust: Build awareness of Netflix’s diversified, rich and high-quality content/catalog. Implementation of a cross-media campaign and its outlet for pre-membership retention. Build on our leadership in the social: Continuing the platform growth/expansion roadmap and making a step forward for a mid-long term goal. Gain trust as the number 1 source of information for Netflix content. Key Responsibilities: Contribute to the overall Netflix Social Marketing strategy as a key member of the Team Create social assets optimized to preferences unique to each social platform audience for maximized engagement. Create innovative and engaging Social Marketing campaign strategies for priority title campaigns and multi-title slate and brand campaigns. Identify and engage influencers and creators to create impact outside of owned social channels. Identifying unique opportunities to elevate community conversation and the scale and influence of Netflix's Social channels overall Manage and monitor what’s happening across all Netflix Social channels, including sentiment, trends, and metrics, and ensure content posted to our editorial channels fits into the overall Netflix Social Marketing and Brand strategy Accurately and efficiently lead the planning and execution of the social posting calendar across platforms, including posting of Netflix assets onto our channels using internally developed tools and resources Manage assignment scheduling, prioritization, budgeting and deliveries of external writers/producers and vendor agencies, balancing the need to be nimble and reactive with strong long-term planning Oversee cross-functional localization workflows for editorial content across channels Maintain operational excellence across existing workflows, helping to make them even better when you can and working to develop new ones as needed. Maintain, nurture, and grow a network of freelancers, vendors, and production companies to work with for constant creative excellence and innovation Serve as a thought leader within the team and creative partner on other assets to ensure a healthy overall Netflix Social Marketing editorial ecosystem The Ideal Candidate has: 7+ years of experience as a Social Media Manager, Editor, or Content Marketing at a digital media company or for a consumer brand. Knowledge of the entertainment industry is a plus. A sophisticated understanding of online social platforms and the communities on each of them. Strong grasp of language, especially in Japanese, and is able to write and create effective, engaging content that connects with audiences on social media. The ability to switch between day-to-day tactical matters and high-level strategy as needed. Experience smoothly communicating workflows and tooling. Deep understanding of how cultural trends form, and the ability to anticipate and act on it. Proven track record of maintaining schedules, budgets, and quality for writers’ rooms and/or vendor agencies. Solid understanding of marketing and social media analytics; you are able to apply a data-centric approach to make content that grabs the attention of the audience and to test and optimize the content. Excellent interpersonal skills and experience working directly with talent and talent representation in meetings and on shoots/sets. Excellent skills in pitching/ presenting with the ability to read the room. Ability to clearly and concisely communicate in Japanese. Fluency in English is a plus. Understanding and will align with our unique culture . High tolerance for change, and the capacity to accomplish enormous amounts in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.
