description: About Netflix With over 250 million streaming members in 190 countries, Netflix has been on the leading edge of a deep transformation in the entertainment business. As Netflix expands, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our growth opportunities. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. About the role Do you have great attention to detail, solid writing skills, and want to work on interesting legal issues in a fast-paced, collaborative, innovative environment? Netflix is seeking a motivated, highly organized, detail-oriented candidate with strong judgment and stellar communication skills to join our Law Enforcement Response Team. The Law Enforcement Response Team sits within the Corporate Legal organization and is responsible for the law enforcement response program. As a legal operations coordinator, you will review legal inquiries, investigate and align with different teams to locate information, draft responses, and ensure we comply with relevant laws worldwide. The position is based in Los Gatos, reporting to the Legal Operations Manager, Law Enforcement Response. The team works in collaboration with the Privacy and Security counsels, the CS Investigations & Response Team, and many other cross-functional teams in carrying out their responsibilities. Responsibilities Triage, index, analyze, and accurately respond to a variety of legally and time-sensitive requests from law enforcement authorities; Review data/productions in response to valid legal requests; Organize, log, and maintain accurate internal documentation and metrics to support our law enforcement response program; Provide high-quality support both verbally and in writing to law enforcement authorities. Desired Skills & Experience Experience responding to privacy, data disclosure, and other legally sensitive inquiries is not required but is strongly preferred Experience with operational workflow systems, project management, and familiarity with database queries is highly desirable Ability to comfortably handle (interpret and understand court orders, subpoenas, and police requests from all jurisdictions in languages other than English - the ability to navigate ambiguity - law, regulations, language nuances Superior organizational skills, extraordinary attention to detail, and a mindset that processes can constantly be improved; Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate and represent Netflix with law enforcement authorities; Strong analytical and technical skills, with the ability to review data and identify trends; Ability to maintain a positive, constructive attitude in ambiguous situations and to manage complexity and high pressure in a productive manner; Self-starter and fast learner who can work independently while using impeccable judgment Possess situational awareness to identify and escalate matters that require urgent attention Proficiency in Excel and the Google suite of applications in a business environment (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Slides, Drive, etc.) Experience with operations (ticketing systems, macros, reports, volume) Ability to work in an open, feedback-driven culture Foreign language fluency is helpful but not required - extra points if you are fluent in Japanese, German, or Italian Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $350,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status.

description: Netflix is looking for an experienced game developer to join the Internal Games team. This role reports to the Director of Internal Development and partners with internal games leadership, first-party game studios, as well as cross-functional development partners to ensure the successful launch and operation of world-class, multi-platform live service games. Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. What You’ll Do The Sr. Manager, Platform Relations on the Internal Games team will be responsible for building strong relationships with our Platform partners in service of creating the optimal environment for our development teams to do the best work of their lives. This role will require deep knowledge of game software as a service, high levels of developer and gamer empathy - from feature and technical perspectives.  The successful candidate should have experience navigating complex organization and development problems, especially relationships between dev team and software development organizations.  Our Sr. Manager - Platform Relations will need to be able to understand game requirements from our game teams (filling in gaps) and form great relationships with our partner organizations to help anticipate problems before they happen. Our new Sr. Manager - Platform Relations should be able to clearly communicate what’s necessary for a successful game launch based on experience, yet not be prescriptive about how things need to get done. They should be able to influence other senior directors with different priorities to advocate for features and support needed by our game teams. Responsibilities Accountable for building strong relationships with partner organizations to help ensure success of our internally developed games Partner with program management team to clarify and prioritize feature requirements from our development teams during production and live operations Establish processes to help surface and communicate prioritized feature requests from our dev teams and reflect back updated roadmaps and updated changelists Provide guidance for dev teams on what pitfalls they should look out for when considering platform and live ops features.  Participate in phase reviews for the internal games slate to help ensure that game teams are considering appropriate risks and mitigations.  Become a well-versed, up-to-date resource for dev teams  Cloud, Netflix controller, SDK, Social and Discovery teams. Work with Netflix games platform and product teams to advocate for the features and technology needed for internal game teams to realize their vision for the player. Partner with internal studios leadership to shape the go-forward strategy for internal game development at Netflix. Required Qualifications 8+ years of experience in the gaming industry, working in a technical program management role - especially as relating to central game technology teams and having shipped multiple cycles of games. (e.g., Battle.net , riot.net , or Xbox Live) Able to speak on, and bring an informed perspective to platform technology discussions and how it might impact game development Experienced as a player of live service games with a strong understanding of what matters for players (and developers). Experience managing cross-functional groups and game teams through influence. Continuously looking for ways to improve and iterate on existing frameworks, or building anew for best results. Passion for video games, innovations in software, and how they enrich the player experience. Ultimately accountable for harmonizing the development team’s requirements with the platform team’s roadmap and negotiating compromises, and escalating when all else fails. Location Los Angeles, CA / Remote Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $610,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity At Netflix, we launch a high volume of titles regularly to meet the entertainment needs of our growing member base. The scale and quality at which we launch titles is paramount to our success in bringing these stories to the right audience at the right time. The Operations Hub in India is a part of the wider Operations team within the Product Discovery & Promotion organization at Netflix. This Operations Hub houses several work streams and helps deliver quality operational work for Netflix at scale. The Role The Operations Coordinator role is critical to support the Scaled Launch Operations team to successfully launch titles and protect the member experiences via effective milestone tracking, implementing risk mitigation strategies and effective communication with cross functional stakeholders. Responsibilities Perform audits and checks to ensure that our titles are ready for launch (including all pre-launch promotions) Constant communication with relevant stakeholders about the risks involved in meeting our launch requirements and reporting progress in resolving the risks Protecting the member experience by making adjustments to internal tools to accommodate changes in the launch strategy or shifting timelines Agile risk management when exceptions arise, troubleshooting issues in partnership with other teams and working with our internal support and engineering teams to mitigate risks Qualifications At least 5 years of project management or operations experience, preferably in media/tech Exemplary organizational skills with an ability to prioritize high volume of work effectively Attention to detail while executing on work across several tools and systems Proactive, fast, and flexible problem-solver with superb time, resource and stakeholder management Professional proficiency in English Knowledge of Korean language and entertainment landscape will be a bonus Proficiency in project management tools such as Airtable will be a bonus We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment by producing, distributing, and streaming content at a massive scale. Over 260 million members around the world are currently enjoying more than two billion hours per month of original series, documentaries and feature films. Visit our Long-Term View to learn more. The Team The Privacy Engineering organization is dedicated to ensuring safe & efficient data use across Netflix, and the Privacy Infrastructure Engineering team plays a key role in this mission. We work closely with our stunning colleagues in privacy engineering designing and building privacy and data protection solutions for the entire company. We promote privacy-enhancing designs, set engineering standards and build systems to ensure Netflix is managing data correctly. We are a small and agile team with tremendous visibility and impact, and with Netflix’s culture of “Freedom and Responsibility” you’ll decide how to best use your talents and time. The Role We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Software Engineer to build privacy engineering solutions across the entire Netflix infrastructure. In this role, you will partner closely with other engineers, data scientists, TPMs and core legal to conceptualize, prototype, develop, optimize and deliver high performing and scalable privacy solutions for all Netflix customers. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and impact the business in a meaningful way. Desired Background: You are passionate about privacy and data protection! You are a highly skilled full stack engineer with strong experience in Java, GraphQL, Spring,  React, Javascript, CSS and HTML. You have strong knowledge of building restful APIs, gRPC for internal or external products. You are passionate about building quality products and want to own product development end-to-end leading with the right design and development principles. You have a bias towards action and are comfortable navigating through ambiguous environments. You’re able to communicate complex technical topics to diverse audiences with varying technical and subject matter backgrounds. Stunning colleagues come from different education levels and backgrounds. The Netflix culture determines who we hire, how we work together and how we make decisions. You will be surrounded by great colleagues and empowered to produce your best work. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Opportunity With over 267 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, and is powered by a work culture that focuses on high performance and continuous improvement. This is a great opportunity to shape the future of how we enable the best operational strategy and execution of marketing campaigns, and foster quality and scale, as we continue to grow our slate of global content. The Role We are seeking a seasoned media leader with expertise in advertising, social media, vendor management, and talent development. The successful candidate will bring strong leadership and communication skills, deep understanding of the evolving global media industry, and a track record of leading high-performance teams. This role oversees a team that innovates workflows, maintains quality standards, and builds valuable relationships to drive creative delivery initiatives in digital media. Key partnerships include vendors, Marketing Production teams, Social Marketing, Marketing Technology, Information Security, Engineering, and Operations. Responsibilities: Lead a high-performing global team focused on distribution, paid media launch, and security. Develop talent, foster collaboration and ensure effective communication across regions. Deliver value by defining clear strategies, roles, responsibilities, while being accountable for results. Strategize and implement roadmaps aligned with broader business objectives and manage risk in operations. Foster strong relationships with cross functional teams and leadership, aligning on operational targets, budgets, and roadmaps. Own global team budget and reporting. Oversee vendor partnerships, billing models, and KPIs, guiding resource allocation at a global level. Collaborate with Engineering to define problems and potential solutions. Adopt a solution-first approach, guide the team and partners towards value-driven outcomes. Model and ensure effective program management by defining goals, communicating milestones, identifying roadblocks, and optimizing processes. Develop scalable measurement methodologies and operational frameworks. Use data and user insights to make decisions for new and existing work streams. Qualifications: 15+ years of experience in Marketing & Social Media, Ad Operations, Entertainment, Ad Tech, and/or Media Operations across multiple countries with 5+ years of people leadership experience and  a proven ability to lead successful global teams. Strengths building and motivating diverse teams, defining and implementing strategy, and leading long-term initiatives. Deep understanding of the global media landscape, platforms, trends, distribution platforms, DAMs, and security protocols. Proven ability to deliver effective media management solutions incorporating tooling, User Experience Testing (UAT), and vendor partnerships. Strategic, analytical thinking with a solution-focused mindset. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to define success using both qualitative and quantitative methods. Constant curiosity to learn new domains, evolve with industry innovations, and improve outcomes. Data-driven approach to problem-solving and analysis. Advocate, understand and model the company values Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $ 250K - $515K. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . description: Netflix is seeking an experienced content designer to work on enterprise tools. About our Enterprise Teams Enterprise teams design the B2B tools that our business needs to thrive and enable the member experience. Our teams work with internal stakeholders, external developers and partners integrating with Netflix platforms, and content creators helping to produce the next big hit. As a content designer in the enterprise space, you’ll join a team of stunning designers dedicated to supporting our diverse user base. These teams are at the heart of Netflix’s journey to develop the world’s most modern, creative and innovative streaming experience. About the Role This role will focus on our partnership enablement tools, helping partners integrate with Netflix. This is a unique role at the intersection of storytelling, technology, and business. As an enterprise content designer, you’ll help set and elevate the Content Design vision and strategy, codify terminology, define copy style and patterns, and craft UI copy for a diverse audience. You’ll also create best practices and guidelines that scale. The ideal candidate will have experience in content design/content strategy, UX writing, and technical writing, with the ability to multitask while working in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. They’ll be self-motivated, proactive, highly organized, and have a steadfast attention to detail. They’ll work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ingest and synthesize complex technical information. They’ll also be able to prioritize their work, communicate effectively, and represent their work to key stakeholders. About You You’re a storyteller at heart who can craft and orchestrate cohesive narratives across touchpoints, both in the product and in training and business settings. You’re a systems thinker who’s familiar with the development of information architecture, language frameworks, and design systems. You’re comfortable working with technical partners to ingest and synthesize highly complex information, turning technical jargon into user-friendly content that is consistent and legible for the various B2B audiences (e.g. producers, legal, game developers, sales executives, etc.) You’re a product thinker who’s comfortable with innovating and finding creative solutions. You’re able to drive alignment and prioritization, while partnering with cross-functional peers across design, engineering and product, to define a strong UX for a specific audience. You possess a keen sense of empathy for B2B audiences and a deep desire to mine opportunities in the space. You communicate productively with visual thinkers and are comfortable advocating for your point of view in a candid, feedback-driven culture. Qualifications 6+ years of relevant writing experience: UX writing, content design, technical writing, taxonomy, and information architecture. Demonstrated experience synthesizing business requirements and technical logic into UI content for enterprise tooling and applications. Mastery of AP style and the confidence to know when to break the rules. Ability to think critically about user journeys and content flows, and to connect the dots between them. Ability to navigate ambiguity and traverse altitudes from strategic visioning to tactical execution. Highly collaborative, organized and self-directed, able to effectively prioritize and respond accordingly to the shifting needs of the team. This full-time, salaried position reports to the partnership enablement Content Design Manager. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000-515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

As a content designer in the enterprise space, you’ll join a team of stunning designers dedicated to supporting our diverse user base. These teams are at the heart of Netflix’s journey to develop the world’s most modern, creative and innovative streaming experience. About the Role This role will focus on our partnership enablement tools, helping partners integrate with Netflix. This is a unique role at the intersection of storytelling, technology, and business. As an enterprise content designer, you’ll help set and elevate the Content Design vision and strategy, codify terminology, define copy style and patterns, and craft UI copy for a diverse audience. You’ll also create best practices and guidelines that scale.   The ideal candidate will have experience in content design/content strategy, UX writing, and technical writing, with the ability to multitask while working in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. They’ll be self-motivated, proactive, highly organized, and have a steadfast attention to detail. They’ll work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ingest and synthesize complex technical information. They’ll also be able to prioritize their work, communicate effectively, and represent their work to key stakeholders.  About You
  • You’re a storyteller at heart who can craft and orchestrate cohesive narratives across touchpoints, both in the product and in training and business settings.
  • You’re a systems thinker who’s familiar with the development of information architecture, language frameworks, and design systems.
  • You’re comfortable working with technical partners to ingest and synthesize highly complex information, turning technical jargon into user-friendly content that is consistent and legible for the various B2B audiences (e.g. producers, legal, game developers, sales executives, etc.)
  • You’re a product thinker who’s comfortable with innovating and finding creative solutions. 
  • You’re able to drive alignment and prioritization, while partnering with cross-functional peers across design, engineering and product, to define a strong UX for a specific audience. 
  • You possess a keen sense of empathy for B2B audiences and a deep desire to mine opportunities in the space.
  • You communicate productively with visual thinkers and are comfortable advocating for your point of view in a candid, feedback-driven culture.
    • Qualifications
  • 6+ years of relevant writing experience: UX writing, content design, technical writing, taxonomy, and information architecture.
  • Demonstrated experience synthesizing business requirements and technical logic into UI content for enterprise tooling and applications. 
  • Mastery of AP style and the confidence to know when to break the rules.
  • Ability to think critically about user journeys and content flows, and to connect the dots between them.
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity and traverse altitudes from strategic visioning to tactical execution.
  • Highly collaborative, organized and self-directed, able to effectively prioritize and respond accordingly to the shifting needs of the team.
    • This full-time, salaried position reports to the partnership enablement Content Design Manager. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000-515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is enjoyed by more than 230 million members globally, entertaining new audiences every day.  We are in the midst of major transformative developments for the Netflix product with the launch of an Advertising-supported plan, Games, and Live content. These new products, alongside our streaming service, have resulted in significant increases in the complexity and breadth of our internal data ecosystem. We manage one of the largest paid subscription businesses and are committed to handling our members’ data with a high degree of care towards appropriate use as well as compliance with local privacy laws and regulations in the 190+ countries where we operate. The Privacy and Legal Data Engineering pod builds scalable data management and extraction frameworks which are at the core of our ability to hold ourselves to the highest data privacy and hygiene standards in the industry. We are looking for a Data Engineer to help augment our ability to build these robust, scalable privacy-centric data frameworks. As part of this team, you will work on diverse data technologies such as Spark, Presto, Flink, Kafka, and others to build insightful, scalable and robust data pipelines; write ETL jobs to collect and aggregate data; and build high-quality data frameworks that enable appropriate handling of customer personal data. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in distributed data processing, have great data intuition, and share our passion for continuously improving the ways we handle data to make Netflix's data privacy posture better. Who you are: Passionate about consumer-centric data privacy and risk mitigation for the business Highly proficient in at least one of Java, Python, or Scala with at least 2 years of software/data engineering experience Comfortable with advanced SQL Experienced in engineering data pipelines using big data technologies (Hive, Presto, Spark, Flink) on medium to large scale data sets Excel at taking requirements and implementing scalable data models and pipelines Excited about demonstrating excellence, learning new technologies, and growing your career What you will do: Engineer efficient, adaptable, and scalable data pipelines to process structured and unstructured data Develop a good understanding of the data ecosystem at Netflix from a privacy lens Partner with the privacy engineering teams to understand product goals and provide data that enables us to respond to customer and regulatory data requests Maintain and rethink existing datasets and pipelines Join a stunning team of data engineers who enhance our data privacy posture and mitigate legal and regulatory risk A few more things to know: Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about Netflix at jobs.netflix.com/culture . We regularly share examples of our work on our tech blog. You will need to be comfortable working in the most agile of environments. Requirements will be vague. Iterations will be rapid. You will need to be nimble and take smart risks. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Opportunity Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are seeking a Senior Internal Auditor to join our growing team in support of Netflix’s studio and corporate operations based in Los Gatos. Reporting to the Manager of Internal Audit, the ideal candidate will have hands-on experience identifying and assessing operational, compliance, and financial risks across a variety of business functions, evaluating the design of processes and controls, including leading and executing challenging projects. In addition, the candidate will need to exhibit strong technical and communication skills necessary to navigate a complex environment and cultivate strong partnerships with key stakeholders. Responsibilities: Assist in planning and conducting the company’s SOX program including risk assessment procedures, leading and executing walkthroughs, and effectiveness testing. Execute operational and advisory engagements including understanding business processes and underlying systems, conducting interviews and process walkthroughs, and performing audit procedures to assess operational efficiency and effectiveness, including preparing audit reports and communication of findings to stakeholders. Perform production audits for Netflix productions worldwide in the following areas: policy & procedure compliance, cost reporting, FCPA compliance, local regulatory and legal compliance, and fraud detection. Work collaboratively across the business to drive value through participation in special projects and ad hoc requests. Work closely with cross-functional partners and leadership to develop proactive solutions, communicate potential impacts, and ensure business objectives are met. Interpret the significance of audit insights, make practical recommendations, and collaborate with stakeholders on remediation action plans. Build effective working relationships and trust with business partners across the organization. Effectively manage relationships with the Internal Audit co-sourcing partners (as applicable) and external auditors to ensure cohesive and collaborative execution. Qualifications: 6+ years of operational and/or advisory internal audit experience preferably with a minimum of 2 years of public accounting experience. Relevant academic degree with at least one relevant professional qualification (in accounting, audit, business, or technology). Certified Public Accountant or Certified Internal Auditor preferred. Strong technical skills and working knowledge of GAAP, SOX compliance, COSO, ITGC, and internal auditing standards. Prior experience with cloud-based systems, data analytics audit tools, and/or third-party vendor solutions. Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as presentation skills. Proven prioritization and multitasking skills. Ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously within deadlines. Experience in the Technology and/or Media industry. Knowledge of studio/production accounting and related financial functions is a plus. Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders. Must be able to work independently in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. You embrace and advocate the Netflix culture and our long-term view. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

  • Perform production audits for Netflix productions worldwide in the following areas: policy & procedure compliance, cost reporting, FCPA compliance, local regulatory and legal compliance, and fraud detection.
  • Work collaboratively across the business to drive value through participation in special projects and ad hoc requests.
  • Work closely with cross-functional partners and leadership to develop proactive solutions, communicate potential impacts, and ensure business objectives are met.
  • Interpret the significance of audit insights, make practical recommendations, and collaborate with stakeholders on remediation action plans.
  • Build effective working relationships and trust with business partners across the organization.
  • Effectively manage relationships with the Internal Audit co-sourcing partners (as applicable) and external auditors to ensure cohesive and collaborative execution.
    • Qualifications:
  • 6+ years of operational and/or advisory internal audit experience preferably with a minimum of 2 years of public accounting experience.
  • Relevant academic degree with at least one relevant professional qualification (in accounting, audit, business, or technology). Certified Public Accountant or Certified Internal Auditor preferred.
  • Strong technical skills and working knowledge of GAAP, SOX compliance, COSO, ITGC, and internal auditing standards.
  • Prior experience with cloud-based systems, data analytics audit tools, and/or third-party vendor solutions.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as presentation skills.
  • Proven prioritization and multitasking skills. Ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously within deadlines.
  • Experience in the Technology and/or Media industry. Knowledge of studio/production accounting and related financial functions is a plus.
  • Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders.
  • Must be able to work independently in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
  • You embrace and advocate the Netflix culture and our long-term view.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. Netflix is looking for an experienced Operations Manager to join the Netflix Game Studio in delivering the next generation of video games for a worldwide audience. This role is part of the External Games team focused on driving the development of new games on Netflix and supporting the production team in delivering a world-class platform. The Operations Manager will ensure that our large portfolio of licensed and developed games, are delivered to the service on time and on budget and without unwanted surprises. The role will drive and improve upon operational efficiency for the games in development and live on the market, engaging with a broad array of Netflix cross-functional organizations. This role will partner, and collaborate, with External Production, Platform & Product, Engineering and Creative Production teams; and includes management and refinement of the entire lifecycle of the product portfolio through supporting development up to game release and the ongoing creation of engaging post-release content. Responsibilities Tracking and reviewing development progress across a portfolio of games that will be in various stages of development Building productive and open relationships with internal and external Development Teams, supporting functions (Platform & Mobile Product and Engineering, Creative Production, Localization and QA) and Licensing leadership Supporting the maintenance and evolution of our Production Games Framework (PGF) to ensure on-track development, identifying possible issues with the product/content development, whether that be resource challenges, time constraints, technical hurdles, or quality Consistently engage with leadership to identify potential issues in the development cycle, narrow down on solutions in partnership with the development teams and support resolution Find opportunities to introduce and optimize operational and production workflows. Partner with cross-functional teams to ensure game launches are executed upon cleanly and in-line with the PGF. Requirements A passion to serve the needs of production and cross-functional teams  within the Netflix organization. Must be comfortable working with ambiguity and able to drive projects to completion with transparency and clarity. Significant experience in Project/Program Management for software development Experience with games across various genres from casual to core Experience managing projects through the development lifecycle from business case/pre-production to launch/post launch management, has worked on content development/release and live operations through the game lifecycle Experience working on multiple projects simultaneously Experience in partner management, internally or externally, working with licensors a plus A history of collaboration with release management, production and live operations of games Strong relationship-building skills Proactive risk management Adept at collaboratively moving from uncertainty to clarity Excellent, precise, and proactive communicator Technical Project Management / Program Management / Production experience nice to have Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $600,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Team Ads Marketing function leads the development of our core ads positioning, and the GTM plan to bring this positioning to life through differentiated messaging and narratives in the market.  The team activates this messaging through Sales Enablement (presentations, materials, talking points) and non-sales channels to garner broad awareness and excitement amongst our key advertising partners. The Opportunity The Manager, Ads B2B Marketing will be a key architect in the Ads Marketing team’s success by crafting and activating the Netflix advertising story and value proposition to advertisers in Japan/Korea. You’ll work with multidisciplinary teams to develop strategic approaches to fueling brand and business growth on platform, unlocking the creative potential of ads offering. Additionally, you will contribute to broader business tactics beyond and pursue learning and development opportunities to consistently grow and evolve as a Netflix marketer and executive. Core Responsibilities: Design and craft go-to-market strategies and narratives in an exciting way for the Sales team and their advertising clients in collaboration with Global Ads Marketing team Collaborate cross-functionally (Comms, Ad Product Marketing, Research & Marketing) to ensure a consistent ads narrative. Partner regularly with international teams for launches and ongoing growth ( like Sales, Ad Product, Comms, Partner Marketing, Events, PR, and others). Lead the strategy and approach for how Netflix Ads shows up at local industry events and bespoke client engagements Pull together business goals, to align on audiences to target, channels to employ, messaging to activate, etc. Work with product and comms partners to clearly define marketing needs and coordinate various parts of the Ad Sales organization to execute against those needs (e.g. brand design, organic social, paid social, partner marketing, etc). Assess the right data and insights and upcoming ad solutions to identify key B2B stories that will resonate with the region and local markets Understand our partners (advertisers), and seek actionable insights to inform product and marketing strategy, and represent partners to cross-functional teams. Deliver regular updates to leadership complete with wins, challenges, and asks. Qualifications: 7- 10 years of experience in B2B marketing, product marketing, digital advertising or marketing communications. An understanding of the CTV/OTT/Streaming landscape is preferred. Experience in product positioning, narrative, and collateral development. Work closely with product and sales teams to develop product strategy, positioning, and messaging. Ability to develop and implement creative ideas, partner with agencies, and carefully manage competing projects with tight deadlines. Develop content including blog posts, case studies, presentations, creative assets, and thought leadership that support our marketing objectives. Help inform the development of new measurement products based on advertiser feedback and market insights. Ability to work in a highly cross-functional environment to drive stakeholder alignment and scaled communications. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are ). We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

Tokyo, Japan Advertising Ads Marketing Manager - Japan Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.  The Team Ads Marketing function leads the development of our core ads positioning, and the GTM plan to bring this positioning to life through differentiated messaging and narratives in the market.  The team activates this messaging through Sales Enablement (presentations, materials, talking points) and non-sales channels to garner broad awareness and excitement amongst our key advertising partners.   The Opportunity  The Manager, Ads B2B Marketing will be a key architect in the Ads Marketing team’s success by crafting and activating the Netflix advertising story and value proposition to advertisers in Japan/Korea. You’ll work with multidisciplinary teams to develop strategic approaches to fueling brand and business growth on platform, unlocking the creative potential of ads offering. Additionally, you will contribute to broader business tactics beyond and pursue learning and development opportunities to consistently grow and evolve as a Netflix marketer and executive. Core Responsibilities:
  • Design and craft go-to-market strategies and narratives in an exciting way for the Sales team and their advertising clients in collaboration with Global Ads Marketing team 
  • Collaborate cross-functionally (Comms, Ad Product Marketing, Research & Marketing) to ensure a consistent ads narrative.
  • Partner regularly with international teams for launches and ongoing growth ( like Sales, Ad Product, Comms, Partner Marketing, Events, PR, and others).
  • Lead the strategy and approach for how Netflix Ads shows up at local industry events and bespoke client engagements
  • Pull together business goals, to align on audiences to target, channels to employ, messaging to activate, etc.
  • Work with product and comms partners to clearly define marketing needs and coordinate various parts of the Ad Sales organization to execute against those needs (e.g. brand design, organic social, paid social, partner marketing, etc).
  • Assess the right data and insights and upcoming ad solutions to identify key B2B stories that will resonate with the region and local markets
  • Understand our partners (advertisers), and seek actionable insights to inform product and marketing strategy, and represent partners to cross-functional teams.
  • Deliver regular updates to leadership complete with wins, challenges, and asks.
    • Qualifications:
  • 7- 10 years of experience in B2B marketing, product marketing, digital advertising or marketing communications.
  • An understanding of the CTV/OTT/Streaming landscape is preferred.
  • Experience in product positioning, narrative, and collateral development.
  • Work closely with product and sales teams to develop product strategy, positioning, and messaging.
  • Ability to develop and implement creative ideas, partner with agencies, and carefully manage competing projects with tight deadlines.
  • Develop content including blog posts, case studies, presentations, creative assets, and thought leadership that support our marketing objectives.
  • Help inform the development of new measurement products based on advertiser feedback and market insights.
  • Ability to work in a highly cross-functional environment to drive stakeholder alignment and scaled communications.
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are).
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Tax Operations team is looking for a Tax Analyst to join the team supporting all areas of income tax with an emphasis on the US income tax provision and compliance. A successful candidate will be able to manage complex workflows that involve multiple stakeholders and build strong relationships within Tax and across the Finance organization. The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical and organizational skills, the ability to meet deadlines and prioritize tasks, and a passion for data automation and simplification. The role will be based in Los Gatos (not flexible to other locations). The expectation is to be in the office 2 days a week. Responsibilities Income Tax Compliance – Preparation of the annual income tax return supporting workpapers and tax calculations for federal and state jurisdiction filings. Organization and tracking of all tax calendar items and coordination with co-sourcing partners or compliance due dates. Preparation of timely responses for all federal and state income tax notices. Estimated Tax Payments – Support in the preparation of quarterly estimated tax payments for federal and state purposes. Tax Accounting – Prepare month end reports summarizing tax payments and accruals to verify the data ties to the general ledger. Tax Accounting – Prepare critical month-end tax accounting close tasks, journal entries, reconciliations, and fluctuation analyses. Tax Accounting –  Prepare quarterly and annual global tax provisions and relevant tax disclosures for the company’s quarterly and annual financial statements. Federal, State, and Local Income Tax Audits – Assist with information requests in preparation for tax audits. Support the evolution of the tax reporting function, tax technology tools, and technological enhancements. SOX compliance through documentation and timely performance of controls. Prepare and review tax-related memos. Work closely and proactively with different functional teams. Qualifications 4+ years of tax compliance and accounting experience in C corporations with at least 3+ years of public accounting experience in ASC 740 or equivalent in-house experience. description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service, with over 250 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. As part of the Content Engineering team, Metadata Distribution provides the infrastructure to safely and quickly verify, compute, package, and distribute the extensive catalog library, structure, and liveness that drives what you see and play when you use the Netflix product. This information plays a crucial role in shaping the user experience on Netflix, influencing everything from the recommendations you receive, to the way you experience content and even how the content is played back. As an Engineering Manager, you will: Coach a team of highly driven back-end focused senior engineers, providing them with robust career development opportunities. Establish strong partnerships with upstream teams to better model new entities in the ecosystem and any new metadata needs. Establish partnerships with downstream Engineering to understand controls and distribution needs in service of supporting new consumer product behaviors. Ability to drive architectures and decisions for technology innovation. This team is responsible for launching tiles on the Netflix product and the engineering manager acts as the product manager for some services. Ability to anticipate how new company initiatives will affect the movement of Title data and determine the most effective ways to evolve existing systems. Understanding the pros and cons of various options across different technology layers of the flow is essential. Represent the Content Engineering team in cross-functional forums. Ability to challenge designs and propose solutions for highly scalable distributed systems while minimizing technology costs and troubleshooting. About you: Prior expertise in all aspects of the data lifecycle such as modeling, movement, and distribution in highly scalable and low latency environments for core company data. Experience as an Engineering Manager is required. Experience leading teams working on highly scalable mission-critical distributed systems. Systems thinker with a strong desire to understand the entire end-to-end architecture and data flow. Strong influencing skills across partners and non-direct reports. Able to work with a wide breadth of stakeholders/partners ranging from operations, creative teams, engineering, legal, security, etc. Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, allowing you to do your best work and grow. To learn more about Content Engineering, feel free to listen to this video . Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Want to know more about our team? You can learn about us: - The Netflix culture - Re-Architecting the Video Gatekeeper - Netflix catalog categorization

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Finance Strategy & Analysis team for Content is seeking an experienced individual contributor to join our team. We have an opening for a Manager in our Korea team, based out of Seoul. Finance Strategy & Analysis is the team in charge of the analytical efforts and strategic thinking behind our content buying and original content decisions The team works cross-functionally to translate the incredible amount of data at Netflix into financial and strategic decisions regarding the production and acquisition of series and films. Finance Strategy & Analysis also evaluates the general programming and content strategy, in addition to leading competitive analysis. This person will have a high degree of visibility with senior leadership of Netflix management who depend heavily on the strategic insights we provide to inform critical business decisions on the Korea content and business strategy. Responsibilities: Develop a local content strategy to improve our value proposition to our members and members to be in partnership with the Content team. Identify key drivers in enabling the strategy and drive initiatives in partnership with the Content leadership. Lead the analysis and valuation of new projects (both titles and deals) in partnership with the Content Creative and Acquisition teams. Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers, trends, and performance indicators for optimization and improvement. Develop a deep understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities to better inform our future strategic choices. Work cross-functionally with other FS&A teams as well as Marketing, PR, Consumer Insights, and Data Science teams. Qualifications 5-7 years of experience in a top management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity, hedge fund, and/or media/entertainment/tech company in a strategy/business development/analytical role: We are looking for candidates who have worked in a highly demanding environment in which complex modeling and analysis are performed. Candidates are required to be highly analytical and a strong, effective communicator with experience presenting complex analyses to teams and stakeholders. Candidates must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, and flexible. Superb financial modeling skills and extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis. Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages. A distinct advantage for this position would be a strong passion for, and familiarity with, Korean content. Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics, or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative orientation. MBA is a plus but not required. English and Korean language fluency is mandatory. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The core Advertising team is charged with building a new, best-in-class ads organization to establish Netflix as the premiere platform for advertiser partners and to drive advertising revenue. In this role, you will: Lead the implementation and execution of key sales functions, including territory/role/channel design, sales process management, data hygiene, and sales tool development. Define, build & maintain the sales inputs, forecasting, and pipeline management of a global advertising business. Conduct pipeline and business reviews on a regular basis. Lead the design and implementation of consistent ways to manage the sales process. Collaborate with the sales team and cross-functional teams to understand their strategy and help develop plans for execution. Work closely with sales and other cross-functional teams to provide quantitative and qualitative analysis of program performance, ensuring program and business impact. Support the exploration of new strategic opportunities to inform the business roadmap. Build detailed dashboards and monthly, quarterly review decks for senior (VP+ level) consumption to run the business. Lead discussions on business performance & state of business with expertise and full ownership. Coordinate with global counterparts in (UCAN, EMEA, LATAM, APAC) to assimilate business insights and package for regular check-ins. Bring thought leadership to continuously evolve KPIs & metrics to inform on the state of the business. About you: 5-7 years of experience in advertising/ advertising-related fields; and/or experience working in Sales Operations. Familiarity with agency and client-direct sales models. Self-starter with the ability to manage and lead large-scale, complex projects. Strong collaborator who embraces differing perspectives and experiences to make better decisions. Knowledge of the advertising landscape, including media channels and methods of buying. Ability to understand both detailed aspects and the bigger picture of Sales Operations. Demonstrated track record of creativity, innovation, and implementing better approaches. Proven ability to prioritize and lead multiple projects efficiently. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: INC Studio is a full-service creative studio within Netflix that produces stories about the business, brand, content, and culture of Netflix while integrating resources across makers to empower storytelling. The Finance & Operations Coordinator supports and executes the financial workflow process across our team. They are highly proficient in Excel, Google Suite, Charting, and reporting applications like Tableau, Airtable, Monday.com & CODA with a passion for creating formulas to improve reporting functions. They are well-versed in payroll standards the entertainment industry and the financial and operational needs of physical production and on-site labor teams (ie: post-production). This person should be able to connect the dots between multiple payment streams to create unified and consolidated reporting. Responsibilities Aligns and executes financial tracking and project reconciliation best practices with guidance from Finance, SP&A, and MS&O partners. Reconciles all deposit accounts with FPO on a monthly basis. Oversees & maintains all payroll processing, payment tracking, and reporting within INC Studio. Coordinates with retained payroll partner(s) making sure systems are working properly and flagging roadblocks to the Manager of Operations as they arise. Helps to support the Operations team to accurately input project finance, budgeting, cost tracking, and billing procedures within INC Studio. Meticulously tracks spending in real-time, or as data becomes available, across INC Studio to provide detailed reports while being proactive to point out discrepancies and alert manager and/or project leads Supports managers with distilling project metrics and financial data into accessible modes of information delivery. Graphs, charts, summarized data, upcoming projections, trends, etc Supports data pulls for QBRs, Annual audits, and annual budgeting and headcount planning Supports Producers and Post Supervisor across financial needs for projects. Supports Producers in new SOW and MSA contract creation and/or reviews before signature; logs and records for INC team records. Onboarding support and training for contingent talent, FTEs, and Suppliers as it relates to POs, invoice processing, Vendor Onboarding, Wrapbook timesheets, etc PO and non-PO invoice processing and coding for accurate financial reporting and timely processing of invoices Distributes P-Cards/PEX cards, and ensures proper reconciliation at project wrap. Supports final project wrap review for financial and data integrity. Reviews total estimate and budget against project data in Workday (pulled by FPO partner in lieu of a P&L review). Supports producers in making necessary adjustments or troubleshooting discrepancies. Provides additional administrative support to the Operations team as needed. Helping to ensure documentation is up to date Supporting onboarding contingent talent into systems and workflows. System maintenance and auditing. Updating all trackers and dashboards with notes, documents, etc Qualifications 5+ years of experience within the accounting finance space with a specialization in production finance, payroll & analytics. Deep understanding of the production & post-production process and how that relates to spend, cash flow tracking, and wrap. Strong corporate acumen, with demonstrable experience in understanding relationships between key financial and non-financial business drivers. Excellent competency with Excel, Google Suite, Charting, and reporting applications like Tableau, Airtable, Monday.com & CODA. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and superior interpersonal skills including courtesy, professionalism, and a cooperative attitude.
