Los Angeles, California Product Discovery and Promotion Coordinator, Finance & Operations (INC) INC Studio is a full-service creative studio within Netflix that produces stories about the business, brand, content, and culture of Netflix while integrating resources across makers to empower storytelling. The Finance & Operations Coordinator supports and executes the financial workflow process across our team. They are highly proficient in Excel, Google Suite, Charting, and reporting applications like Tableau, Airtable, Monday.com & CODA with a passion for creating formulas to improve reporting functions. They are well-versed in payroll standards the entertainment industry and the financial and operational needs of physical production and on-site labor teams (ie: post-production). This person should be able to connect the dots between multiple payment streams to create unified and consolidated reporting.  Responsibilities
  • Aligns and executes financial tracking and project reconciliation best practices with guidance from Finance, SP&A, and MS&O partners. 
  • Reconciles all deposit accounts with FPO on a monthly basis.
  • Oversees & maintains all payroll processing, payment tracking, and reporting within INC Studio.
  • Coordinates with retained payroll partner(s) making sure systems are working properly and flagging roadblocks to the Manager of Operations as they arise.
  • Helps to support the Operations team to accurately input project finance, budgeting, cost tracking, and billing procedures within INC Studio.
  • Meticulously tracks spending in real-time, or as data becomes available, across INC Studio to provide detailed reports while being proactive to point out discrepancies and alert manager and/or project leads
  • Supports managers with distilling project metrics and financial data into accessible modes of information delivery.
  • Graphs, charts, summarized data, upcoming projections, trends, etc
  • Supports data pulls for QBRs, Annual audits, and annual budgeting and headcount planning
  • Supports Producers and Post Supervisor across financial needs for projects.
  • Supports Producers in new SOW and MSA contract creation and/or reviews before signature; logs and records for INC team records. 
  • Onboarding support and training for contingent talent, FTEs, and Suppliers as it relates to POs, invoice processing, Vendor Onboarding, Wrapbook timesheets, etc
  • PO and non-PO invoice processing and coding for accurate financial reporting and timely processing of invoices
  • Distributes P-Cards/PEX cards, and ensures proper reconciliation at project wrap.
  • Supports final project wrap review for financial and data integrity. 
  • Reviews total estimate and budget against project data in Workday (pulled by FPO partner in lieu of a P&L review). 
  • Supports producers in making necessary adjustments or troubleshooting discrepancies.
  • Provides additional administrative support to the Operations team as needed.
  • Helping to ensure documentation is up to date
  • Supporting onboarding contingent talent into systems and workflows.
  • System maintenance and auditing. 
  • Updating all trackers and dashboards with notes, documents, etc

    • Qualifications
  • 5+ years of experience within the accounting finance space with a specialization in production finance, payroll & analytics. 
  • Deep understanding of the production & post-production process and how that relates to spend, cash flow tracking, and wrap.  
  • Strong corporate acumen, with demonstrable experience in understanding relationships between key financial and non-financial business drivers.
  • Excellent competency with Excel, Google Suite, Charting, and reporting applications like Tableau, Airtable, Monday.com & CODA.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and superior interpersonal skills including courtesy, professionalism, and a cooperative attitude.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, highest standards of accuracy, and precision.
  • Very organized, with a high attention to detail
  • Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to identify existing or potential problems and recommend solutions.
  • Ability to take direction & execute established workflows with pristine accuracy & conscious collaboration.
  • Ability to distill complex data sets into digestible information.

To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $150,000 - $250,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. description: Location: Remote Friendly About the team Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Developer Enablement team sits at the intersection of Engineering and Learning & Development, and ensures that the technical learning strategy is well integrated with the overall employee learning journey at Netflix. Our mission is to help all Netflix engineers, scientists, and solution developers be as informed and productive as possible by ensuring they have access to curated knowledge, education, and support resources, when and where they need them. Team initiatives include new hire engineering onboarding, continuing education, JIT/on-demand training, overall knowledge strategy for technical training execution, and delivery of Engineering wide programs to build community and drive a culture of learning. About the role General Program Manager 5 with breadth and depth of experience in Developer Enablement We are looking for an innovative, proactive General Program Manager who is passionate about technical training, content creation, discovering and applying data insights, and has a strong opinion on documentation strategies. The Developer Education (DevEd) team’s mission is to transform the engineering landscape of onboarding and continuing education programs into a more interactive, impactful, and engaging experience. Your team is responsible for all engineering onboarding and continuing education training, planning, delivery, and development, including communication campaigns, metric tracking and reporting, defining and aligning training personas, and cross-team partnership training implementation. We’re looking for a self-starter who is excited to give and receive feedback, can ruthlessly prioritize, and is passionate about technology, learning, and can think outside of the box to help us scale. You should be someone who loves discovering new data and metrics, is quick to soak in information and make a smart decision based on data, and brings focused energy to the team and engineering community. Will require travel to the Netflix offices for onboarding and quarterly on-sites. What you will do... Manage and prioritize requests for new and updated technical training and documentation. Guide content creation alongside stakeholders, continually scanning for necessary updates, learning gaps, or outdated material. Manage Paved Road, Manuals, and other documentation platforms, partnering with GTM to create documentation for new tooling. Responsible for data reporting, signaling, and trending, using data from ESO, Manuals, and Search, to make informed decisions about content creation and documentation. Partner with internal and external program managers, instructional designers, technical writers, and facilitators for developer education program execution. Foster a culture of learning that promotes inclusion and diversity in our teams, interactions, and learning models. Your experience must include or demonstrate… Discovering and applying data insights, including experience measuring leading and lagging learning metrics and using those insights to guide strategy and operations. Creating and editing engaging documentation, with a strong opinion on documentation strategy including sustainability, maintenance, and archiving. Managing and prioritizing a large number and variety of requests for new and updated technical training, including guiding content creation alongside stakeholders. Designing and implementing diverse learning formats using blended instructional methods. Navigating diverse stakeholder groups, forming and sustaining successful partnerships by influencing up, down, and across. Creating and maintaining a learning culture that amplifies the organization’s potential. Other attributes that will excite us… A sense of humility, adaptability to change, and a bias towards action. Strong technical understanding and skill set with an ability to communicate with engineers and create and understand technically complex training. Good understanding of the education space for engineers and data scientists, including learning styles and approaches. A track record of consistently and successfully delivering technical education and community-building training and events. Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, allowing you to do your best work and grow. To learn more about Productivity Engineering, feel free to listen to this podcast. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $210,000-$315,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Opportunity: With more than 260 million paid subscribers enjoying great content in over 190 countries, it's an exciting time to work at Netflix. As the company continues to rapidly expand across the globe, we are searching for a Trade Compliance professional to join our Global Ethics & Compliance team as a Analyst, Trade Compliance - Americas (based in Los Angeles ). In this role, you will have responsibility for helping to support the business by ensuring Netflix is able to quickly get an incredible breadth of technologies and goods where they need to be in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and regulations. Whether it’s for a hit Netflix show, movie, global marketing campaign , office location, or next big idea , you will work closely with logistics teams and other stakeholders to navigate the complexities of international trade to make sure everything gets where it needs to be, when it needs to be there. A successful candidate will be passionate, self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. This role is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who has a can-do attitude and is a positive thinker able to exercise sound judgment and communication. Responsibilities Support the day-to-day import & export activities of Netflix across the Americas, engaging with internal logistics and compliance teams, customs brokers, Carnet authorities, and 4PL vendors. Manage HTS and ECCN classification reviews and determinations Support the trade compliance team in determining the import/export requirements, regional POA management, and other critical import trade compliance functions Ensure compliance with Carnets and temporary import regimes around the world Oversee the maintenance of regional import/export documentation (commercial invoices, entry paperwork, licenses, permits, and tariff rulings, etc.) Manage ad-hoc compliance reviews, internal self-assessments, vendor QBRs, and Customs broker vetting Monitoring of regional Customs and trade compliance regulatory change Requirements A minimum of 5 years of relevant working experience as an importer, exporter, Customs broker, or in a similar industry position dealing with trade compliance and Customs matters Extensive (practical) experience with US Customs regulations Experience with Brazilian and/or Mexican Customs regulations is a plus Good understanding of US-EAR regulations Experience using Global Trade Management (GTM) systems as part of the classification, licensing, export/import management, and denied party screening Entertainment supply chain experience is a plus Fluent or business proficiency in English required Proficiency in Spanish and/or Brazilian Portuguese is a plus Data-driven mindset and ability to analyze and utilize data Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $350,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 240 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is also one of the largest studios in the world and empowers storytellers from all over the globe to tell the stories you fall in love with. Producing content globally, at this scale is a unique challenge; this is where our organization comes in. Studio Production Engineering plays a pivotal role in Netflix's content creation and delivery journey. The seamless magic of your favorite show starting with a click is the result of thousands of intricate processes behind the scenes. Our tools are the unsung heroes, enabling many of these workflows. We empower Netflix studios to bring creative excellence to life, build tools to bring operational excellence and accomplish economies of scale. Our solutions aim to elevate the ROI of the $15 billion dollars spent on content creation through cost/time efficiency, data driven decision making. We also provide technology to manage end-user access and build tools that help with resourcing workflows resulting in the production and delivery of the highest-quality content. We are looking for a Technical Program Manager with platform/infrastructure domain experience to drive high-impact cross-functional next-generation production solutions that scale for the growing business needs. This role requires strong collaboration with product managers, data science engineering, business stakeholders, peer technical program managers, and senior leadership to execute, track, and deliver high-impact strategic programs in the Studio space. What's Different About Us? Huge Impact - you will directly impact the workflows that help plan, produce and manage  billions of dollars worth of content spend Speed - we move quickly, iterate rapidly, and learn constantly Unique Culture - we live by our values Responsibilities Lead multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with product, engineering, design, and data science, that deliver technical solutions. Influence without authority and manage a large scope of initiatives and deliverables. Provide deep domain expertise to form technical strategies with engineering partners. Drive engagement with internal partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with measurable milestones, effectively optimize scope and schedule, manage cross-functional dependencies, and proactively manage risks. Craft clear communication of the big picture, challenges, progress toward goals and report status to stakeholders and leadership. We would love to work with you if: You have 10+ years of technical program management experience driving large scale software projects/programs with engineering and product teams. You have proven experience driving large-scale software projects, managing the definition of technical strategies, and building long-term scalable solutions. You have a deep understanding and point of view on product growth and discovery solutions. You are highly skilled, and experienced, and enjoy orchestrating multiple programs with many moving parts and creating partnerships with cross-functional teams. You are able to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience. You are a self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction. You can exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values. You truly believe that diversity is key to a team’s health and success. Bonus Points if: You have application security domain experience - awareness of AuthN and AuthZ constructs. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $230,000 - $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering both candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California, and Los Angeles, California (with occasional travel to other offices).

Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering both candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California, and Los Angeles, California (with occasional travel to other offices).

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We bring entertainment to over 260 million subscribers in over 190 countries. This requires great content, a frictionless choosing experience and engaging conversation.  As we continue to grow, we’re increasingly focusing on Commerce as well.  We have ambitious plans, an enormous scale of opportunity and the passion to be the best in customer experience - which now includes a new ad-supported plan at a more affordable price point for customers. Within the broader Finance, Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) organization, we’re building out a new team, Ads Revenue & Yield Analytics , who will help steward and support our Ads go-to-market strategy.  In this management role, you will support the commercial business in the UCAN region, inclusive of Sales & Account Management, with specialization in Inventory Management. In tandem, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow quickly in this space, working closely with a global, cross-functional team across FS&A, Data, Science & Engineering, Partnerships, Consumer, Marketing & Content to help build a cohesive understanding and unified approach to advertising at Netflix. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. Responsibilities will include: Develop inventory monetization strategy across Netflix Ads product to drive revenue growth and improve yield. Manage inventory availability across targeted media, sponsorship executions and custom programs. Partner with Pricing and Yield to optimize go-to market initiatives against inventory composition, pricing strategies and ad serving logic. Collaborate with MSFT & Account Management to oversee effective inventory utilization throughout the pitch-to-pay process. Work cross-functionally to define inventory guidelines for campaign executions across transaction models and currencies. Work with Product, Data Science and Engineering to assess delivery scenarios across the Ad Product catalog to increase serving efficiency. What we’re looking for: 5+ years of Inventory Management and/or Advertising Strategy Strong modeling skills and comfort with manipulating large datasets in Excel, Google Sheets, Tableau, and other data visualization tools A strong attention to detail and eye towards using the 80/20 rule to address problems Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, able to work autonomously, and perform tasks with a wide range of difficulties Very strong project management, planning and organizational skills, including the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and to deliver under tight timelines Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build successful relationships and partners at all levels The ability to communicate ad serving logic with varying degrees of detail depending on the forum.  You know your audience and what they’re looking for. Familiarity with programmatic advertising, auction dynamics, ad tech and the streaming ecosystem is a plus (though not required) Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. description: Netflix is looking for an exceptional Player Support Lead for the External Games business to help deliver the next generation of video games for a worldwide audience. The role will lead the player support efforts for the externally developed portfolio of games in partnership with the Netflix player Support team that spans a global support network for Netflix. This role will establish the player support process for the external games portfolio, adapting the issue escalation structure to work with external developers, evaluating ticket volume and type by game and delivery to a balanced SLA. They will work closely with External Production to surface and address game specific issues and trends with an understanding of new feature releases and live operated events to best support the player experience, managing through emergent issues. The Player Support Lead will also work closely with the Product Marketing team who manages active paid media, social and community conversations; coordinating proactive and reactive messaging to holistically manage player communication and experience. The candidate will have a track record of building strong relationships with cross functional partners internally and externally with a passion for supporting players to have the optimal experience with our games. Responsibilities: Lead and manage end to end player support for assigned games published by External Games, collaborating with Marketing, Producers and PMs, QA, and other cross-functional teams in providing the best player experience.  For example:  launching new titles, supporting live services games, prioritizing issues that are impacting the game, etc. Partnering with Product Marketing and External Communications to proactively manage broader issues that may impact the game or Netflix brand. Partner and guide external resources to manage support volume for a wide portfolio of games. Monitor app store reviews for assigned games and reply to app store reviews based on specific issues and feedback from players. Leverage CRM tools, dashboards and regular reporting to surface player health for individual games as a part of a holistic approach for player relationship management . Continuously source relevant game information to be leveraged for Help Center and Knowledge Base content for Player self-help. Drive data analysis for all aspects of the player support service to continuously improve the player experience and support KPI’s. Compile and provide ad-hoc or recurring player support reports to stakeholders that highlights the games top issues/feedback as well as positive feedback and game recommendations. Continuously improve and optimize process and framework to best support players, external game studios, and other stakeholders. Prepare for new game launches and ensure support operations are in place. Proactively work with stakeholders to improve the quality of the game that impacts player engagement. You may need to support players that can span across in-game social features, social media, blogs, Discord channels. Requirements: 5+ years of experience in player support as a lead, supervisor, or manager. Familiarity and understanding of the game development process and variety of game content, preferably including live service games and games on the mobile platform. Experience with a data driven approach to analyze and optimize player support for multiple game genres and platforms. Demonstrated record of critical thinking and creative problem solving to address complex, multi-disciplinary challenges. Deep experience with Product Marketing, PR and Community teams building holistic communication with our players. Proven track record of working with a cross functional team, driving results from influence. Strategically approaches challenges and applies flexibility to solutions. Continuously looking for ways to improve and iterate an existing framework, or building anew for best results. Player first mindset & passion for video games, innovations in software and hardware and how they enrich the player experience. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $500,000 USD. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: As the lines between games, film, tv, and animation continue to blur The Game Studio Transmedia Pipeline R&D team will be the vital team working within the Netflix Game Studio organization across the wider company to ensure we’re paving a way towards a future where creatives and teams can seamlessly collaborate across those mediums in a way only Netflix can and ensure our company wide technology investments that enable productions do so with equivalent eye towards game developer needs. The Lead Engineer will build, lead, and manage this initially small team to help us pave the way towards a future where world class IPs can be easily collaborated on via all mediums.  This will involve a high degree of influence and collaboration outside their immediate team, and great candidates will thrive in bringing disparate stakeholders together and identify opportunities and projects in this still largely ambiguous space.  They will be expected to contribute directly with hands-on work, especially earlier in the life of the team. Responsibilities Cross-Netflix relationship, collaboration, and alignment: Working across Netflix organizations as well as Netflix Game Studio game development teams, to drive creation and adoption of new “transmedia” technical and creative capabilities across all mediums for our top and new IPs by identifying and creating effective ongoing collaboration on investments and projects. Team Leadership: Able to work across disciplines with minimum process to organize work and create predictability in an unpredictable space.  Able to build bridges and collaborate well with several Netflix game platform partner teams and help their team to succeed individually and together with them. People and Project Management: Manage this small, senior, multi-discipline team and ensure team focus and health. Working across disciplines: Building and maintaining a high degree of empathy and effective outcomes for disciplines such as design, art, techart, etc in addition to engineering such that solutions are high impact for all that could benefit with “transmedia pipelines” Pipeline/tool R&D hands on work: Especially early on, this person will lean in to do hands on work in pipeline/asset/tools software development work.  Both to understand more directly what it will take to succeed and contribute to it, and to educate the future composition of the team over the long term.  This will include hands-on coding, scripting, and documentation in collaboration with other software teams at Netflix. Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science 7+ years experience in engineering oriented roles in or adjacent to games, Visual effects (VFX), simulation, or related projects/industries One or more Lead Engineer/Engineering Manager role on a team faced with ambiguous but strategic challenges with some aspect of VFX, games, pipeline, or other projects that have challenging performance and/or artistic requirements Exceptional communication and leadership skills Strong engineering fundamentals, hands on experience with Python, C++, batch processing. Exposure and familiarity with at least one full featured game engine and how assets move through them (Unreal, Unity, internal AAA studio engines, etc.) Bonus Skills Worked on shipping games or other high complexity interactive projects that have complex asset pipelines Familiarity with more than one major game engine and its art pipelines Built or managed tools and/or multi-stage complex art pipelines in VFX/film or games Experience managing workflows across disparate OS’s and tools (Mac, Linux, Windows, source control, DCC applications, etc.) Location Options- Los Gatos, (Bay Area, CA), or Los Angeles, CA Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $500,000 USD. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. Netflix is looking for an experienced Director of Live Service to join the Internal Games team. This role reports directly to the VP of Internal Games and will partner with Internal games leadership, first and second party game studios, as well as cross-functional partners to ensure the successful launch and operation of world-class, multi-platform live service games. What You’ll Do The Director of Live Services on the Internal Games team will be responsible for identifying, establishing, and running all central game product management processes related to launching, operating, and optimizing live service games for our internal game studios. The person in this role will take analysis and insights derived from multiple sources, including our cross-functional strategy, analysis, live services, and data science teams, to drive actionable strategies, strategic execution, plans, and recommendations across the internal studios organization and portfolio (including slate strategy, product strategy, and the approach to live services). You will be expected to form great relationships with our internal game teams, working through influence to ensure that all of our internal studios have top-notch game PM, live operations, and analysis capabilities. You will also be expected to form great relationships with our cross-functional partners who dive deep on analysis and insights and the platform teams who are in charge of developing and optimizing the games platform, discovery surface, recommendation algorithm, etc and advocate for the needs of internal studios when it comes to the tech and tools required to launch and operate great live service games on the Netflix mobile download and TV/Web streaming platforms. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution and fine-tuning of the unique metrics used to evaluate game and portfolio performance in a subscription service. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge and understanding of the competitive market for high-engagement feature design and live service programs, be able to anticipate and identify key emerging trends, and help our studios and our slate planning team be on the cutting edge of live service game development. Responsibilities Establish central processes and identify best practices for successful game product management and live operations of subscription and cloud based games. Partner with our first-party game studios, strategy, and central live services teams to ensure accurate forecasts for game launch KPIs. Participate in phase reviews for the internal games slate to help ensure that game teams are properly resourced and set up for success with respect to all things PM, live ops, and analysis. Provide ongoing support to game studios in their development and operation of live service games. Seek out data from all available sources (game strategy team, game teams, our external development team, customer insights, etc). Synthesize data and insights into recommendations that can inform our live ops best practices and content strategy decisions. Work through influence to inflect our games and slate based on these recommendations. Work with Netflix games platform and product teams to advocate for the tech, tools, and processes required for internal game teams to successfully launch and operate live service games. Partner with internal studios leadership to shape the go-forward strategy for internal game development at Netflix. Required Qualifications 8+ years of experience in the gaming industry, working in analytical roles including strategy & analysis and product management, assessing ongoing performance and optimization for games in multiple categories. Deep understanding of video game metrics with experience reading and interpreting metrics, forming and leveraging hypotheses to influence roadmaps and strategies. Experience running live service games on any platform (PC, console, mobile) with the ideal candidate having deep mobile live service experience. Experience as a heavily engaged player of live service games and a deep understanding of engagement drivers in live service game titles. Expertise in creating and presenting engaging, insightful narratives through data. Experience managing cross-functional groups and game teams through influence. Continuously looking for ways to improve and iterate on existing frameworks, or building anew for best results. Passion for video games, innovations in software, and how they enrich the player experience. Location Los Angeles, CA/Remote Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $220,000 - $900,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

What You’ll Do  The Director of Live Services on the Internal Games team will be responsible for identifying, establishing, and running all central game product management processes related to launching, operating, and optimizing live service games for our internal game studios. The person in this role will take analysis and insights derived from multiple sources, including our cross-functional strategy, analysis, live services, and data science teams, to drive actionable strategies, strategic execution, plans, and recommendations across the internal studios organization and portfolio (including slate strategy, product strategy, and the approach to live services). You will be expected to form great relationships with our internal game teams, working through influence to ensure that all of our internal studios have top-notch game PM, live operations, and analysis capabilities. You will also be expected to form great relationships with our cross-functional partners who dive deep on analysis and insights and the platform teams who are in charge of developing and optimizing the games platform, discovery surface, recommendation algorithm, etc and advocate for the needs of internal studios when it comes to the tech and tools required to launch and operate great live service games on the Netflix mobile download and TV/Web streaming platforms. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution and fine-tuning of the unique metrics used to evaluate game and portfolio performance in a subscription service. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge and understanding of the competitive market for high-engagement feature design and live service programs, be able to anticipate and identify key emerging trends, and help our studios and our slate planning team be on the cutting edge of live service game development. Responsibilities
  • Establish central processes and identify best practices for successful game product management and live operations of subscription and cloud based games.
  • Partner with our first-party game studios, strategy, and central live services teams to ensure accurate forecasts for game launch KPIs.
  • Participate in phase reviews for the internal games slate to help ensure that game teams are properly resourced and set up for success with respect to all things PM, live ops, and analysis. Provide ongoing support to game studios in their development and operation of live service games.
  • Seek out data from all available sources (game strategy team, game teams, our external development team, customer insights, etc). Synthesize data and insights into recommendations that can inform our live ops best practices and content strategy decisions. Work through influence to inflect our games and slate based on these recommendations. 
  • Work with Netflix games platform and product teams to advocate for the tech, tools, and processes required for internal game teams to successfully launch and operate live service games.
  • Partner with internal studios leadership to shape the go-forward strategy for internal game development at Netflix. 
    • Required Qualifications
  • 8+ years of experience in the gaming industry, working in analytical roles including strategy & analysis and product management, assessing ongoing performance and optimization for games in multiple categories.
  • Deep understanding of video game metrics with experience reading and interpreting metrics, forming and leveraging hypotheses to influence roadmaps and strategies. 
  • Experience running live service games on any platform (PC, console, mobile) with the ideal candidate having deep mobile live service experience.
  • Experience as a heavily engaged player of live service games and a deep understanding of engagement drivers in live service game titles.
  • Expertise in creating and presenting engaging, insightful narratives through data.
  • Experience managing cross-functional groups and game teams through influence.
  • Continuously looking for ways to improve and iterate on existing frameworks, or building anew for best results. Passion for video games, innovations in software, and how they enrich the player experience.
    • Location
  • Los Angeles, CA/Remote
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $220,000 - $900,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The advertising team is charged with building a new, best-in-class ads organization to establish Netflix as a must-buy for advertiser partners, and to drive advertising revenue, across 12 global markets:  USA, Canada, UK, France, Italy, Spain, Germany, Japan, Korea, Australia, Mexico and Brazil. The measurement team is responsible for building audience insights and measurement solutions from the ground up, partnering closely with data science, consumer insights, product, and sales to understand core client and consumer needs and develop both foundational and innovative solutions. In this role, you will: Collaborate with the wider ads measurement team, encompassing the LATAM (Brazil and Mexico), UCAN, and globally, as well as product and data engineering. Liaise with cross-functional partners, DSE and Consumer Insights, to identify data and insights to be used to build key narratives concerning the Netflix audience and service. Lead third-party research while managing relationships with vendors and external measurement and research partners. Provide marketplace positioning and storytelling customized for sales (verticals and clients) by triangulating internal and external data and insights. Assist in crafting thought leadership by understanding consumer perception, attitudes, and behaviors related to both content and ads on Netflix and the competitive landscape Manage day-to-day operations of the measurement LATAM team in partnership with counterpart in Brazil. About you: 7+ years in media measurement at a TV, streaming or digital company Dual TV/Video and digital experience is a plus. Strong knowledge of the advertising landscape, across digital, CTV or streaming and/or TV and various methods of buying. Experience working with syndicated measurement tools (ie - Nielsen, Kantar- Ibope, GWI, TGI, etc.) and/or familiarity with 3rd Party vendor solutions (ie - Kantar, Ipsos, panels, etc). Experience running campaign effectiveness studies and analysis, including brand lifts, incrementality (MMMs, MTA), etc. Ability to learn tools and improve processes & workflows. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, comfortable presenting and leading meetings. Self-starter with expertise in managing large-scale, complex projects. Strong strategic thinking, planning, and analytical skills. Knowledge of quantitative and qualitative methodologies as well as marketing science. Understanding of the consumer’s voice and how to turn that into actionable insights. Loves to get into the weeds and can see the big picture. Open to innovating, challenging assumptions, and implementing better approaches. A strong business partner to other cross-functional teams and a leader who can prioritize multiple projects. Collaborates effectively and embraces differing perspectives and experiences to make better decisions. Experienced and at ease with diverse cultures and working in international environments. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching, as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Role: We are seeking an Executive to help manage Netflix’s original content (TV and film). The role, Manager, Production Management, is a permanent position that will report to the Director & Head of Production - Benelux, based out of Amsterdam. This Production team is responsible for supervising all operational aspects of original content produced for Netflix in The Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg and plays a key role in executing Netflix’s original content strategy in the region. Responsibilities include: managing multiple projects in different stages of production, reviewing production plans and budgets, providing early guidance for projects in the development phase, curating and supporting local production relationships, and supporting/suggesting best practices from pre-production through delivery. This is a demanding and fast-moving position and a successful candidate will be proactive, innovative, self-driven, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and attention to detail at all times. We want people from different backgrounds to feel expected, reflected, and respected at Netflix, and therefore we are committed to providing an accessible working environment for everyone. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Work closely with Creative Executives to set up new productions by reviewing and approving Production Partners, key Heads of Departments, schedules, and budgets to flag possible issues and identify solutions. Work with different Netflix departments such as Post Production, VFX, Creative, Finance, Legal, Public Policy & external production teams to establish workflows across multiple projects simultaneously in different production phases and support key stakeholders by providing the context and/or expertise in business-critical decisions. Support the Head of Production and Production Org team to develop, communicate and implement an operational strategy for the local slate of Netflix projects. Regularly align with Netflix colleagues across EMEA and the Globe to share best practices and integrate new learnings from other regions. Review scripts and work with internal teams, Executive Producers, and Line Producers to vet show budgets and schedules, providing feedback on viability and risks. Work closely with the Finance team to track & manage all costs, keeping stakeholders informed and working with external partners to ensure we meet deadlines and stay within budget. Collaborate with internal teams, including Safety, Security, HR and Inclusion, to support Production Partners in providing safe, inclusive production spaces. Identify industry trends and potential opportunities for operational improvement. Support production training initiatives in the region. Challenge existing approaches and suggest new ways to solve issues on various productions. Qualifications: Extensive production management experience as a Line Producer, Production Executive or Head of Production. Experience managing the production of local Dutch and or Belgium TV and/or feature films. Knowledge of the service market for international productions is desirable but not a requirement. Role to be based in Amsterdam (candidate must be open to relocating if not based in the Netherlands). Ability to handle a fast-paced environment, simultaneously supervising multiple projects at various points of production (from development through delivery). Access to a roster of high-quality vendors and talent in the region and strong familiarity across Dutch and Belgium production markets. Flexible attitude to work, able to respond to urgent or important matters in a timely manner. Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information, with a solid understanding of prioritizing and responding accordingly. A desire to continue learning to ensure an understanding of current production processes and a curiosity about how they could be improved. Fluency in English and Dutch is required, and additional languages are a plus. Effective communication skills and the ability to multitask. Proficiency in Movie Magic Budgeting, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides, and Google Mail. Enthusiastic about Netflix culture: our culture is unique, and we live by our values - https://jobs.netflix.com/culture We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Come play a pivotal role in Netflix's quest to transform the way a studio empowers and accelerates production workflows. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone that is passionate about production and post workflows and ready to take the filmmaking process to the next level. Netflix’s System Workflow and Technology team is looking for an execution-oriented, highly effective workflow engineer with extensive knowledge in live-action production workflows, tools and platforms, including a proven history in providing white glove support to post production. This unique and exciting opportunity will have a direct impact on the future of production supporting bleeding edge technology, such as next generation workflows to our post facilities and content creators around the world. The Content Hub Media Production Suite Support Specialist will essentially be an air traffic controller for post production automated tools we offer at Netflix. The Content Hub Media Production suite is Netflix post and production in the cloud system. It enables 21st-century media workflow for media sharing. This role will be responsible for monitoring all pipelines, flagging and resolving issues, and ensuring communication internally and externally is managed for any issues that arise. Your role will include collaborating with studio, product, engineering, Netflix personnel and crew directly working on productions. Therefore you will need the ability to manage expectations, multi-task and make judgment calls on when to elevate which issues to which team. How do you know if this role is right for you? You have managed data and or workflows for a post production facility You have managed workstations, hardware and overall support at a post production facility You have a background in software/hardware development & you have worked on set, or in post production OR You have managed an automated transcoding service in a past job offered to post production Your primary job functions are: Monitor all Content Hub Media Production Suite automated file transfer and transcoding activity Ensure the Netflix Content Hub Media Production Suite tools receive timely support when issues arise, managing communication with that end user throughout the issue lifecycle, as well as escalate/triage when necessary Partner closely with the Senior Manager, Production Media Systems to stay current on product developments. This includes tracking key milestones and timelines to ensure awareness of product version management. Monitor and analyze our tool utilization to proactively identify potential issues, and inform forecasting and future resource management. Partner with the Senior Manager, Production Media Systems on advancing and evolving Media Production suite operational strategy. Own the feedback loop for the Content Hub Media Production Suite from their region to Studio and Product. Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in post production, with roles in facility, as well as process management, at a post production vendor, studio or network. Deep knowledge and experience with content creation processes, on set production and post production services. Proficiency speaking and writing in English is a must, but the ability to also communicate in Spanish is a valuable asset to this role Understanding of JSON, XML, CSV, and other commonly used data formats Familiarity working across Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems Previous experience working with media asset management and workflow automation systems Understanding of different types of storage infrastructure leveraged throughout production and post, including local drives, facility storage array networks, and cloud storage Understand the practical application of and have experience in dailies processing, editorial, VFX pulls, conform/online to final delivery. Familiarity with production and post production software (e.g. Avid Media Composer, Adobe Premiere, Colorfront OSD & Transkoder, and Aspera). A clear understanding for how software from on set through production and post are used and the differentiators between them. Knowledge of industry standards and the bodies that ratify them. Knowledge of and relationships with technology solutions, equipment and service vendors across production and post production. Previous background in software development, workflow scripting, or system administration not required, but strong plus Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $245,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

  • Ensure the Netflix Content Hub Media Production Suite tools receive timely support when issues arise, managing communication with that end user throughout the issue lifecycle, as well as escalate/triage when necessary
  • Partner closely with the Senior Manager, Production Media Systems to stay current on product developments. This includes tracking key milestones and timelines to ensure awareness of product version management.
  • Monitor and analyze our tool utilization to proactively identify potential issues, and inform forecasting and future resource management.
  • Partner with the Senior Manager, Production Media Systems on advancing and evolving Media Production suite operational strategy.
  • Own the feedback loop for the Content Hub Media Production Suite from their region to Studio and Product.

    • Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of experience in post production, with roles in facility, as well as process management, at a post production vendor, studio or network.
  • Deep knowledge and experience with content creation processes, on set production and post production services.
  • Proficiency speaking and writing in English is a must, but the ability to also communicate in Spanish is a valuable asset to this role
  • Understanding of JSON, XML, CSV, and other commonly used data formats
  • Familiarity working across Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems
  • Previous experience working with media asset management and workflow automation systems
  • Understanding of different types of storage infrastructure leveraged throughout production and post, including local drives, facility storage array networks, and cloud storage
  • Understand the practical application of and have experience in dailies processing, editorial, VFX pulls, conform/online to final delivery. 
  • Familiarity with production and post production software (e.g. Avid Media Composer, Adobe Premiere, Colorfront OSD & Transkoder, and Aspera).
  • A clear understanding for how software from on set through production and post are used and the differentiators between them.
  • Knowledge of industry standards and the bodies that ratify them.
  • Knowledge of and relationships with technology solutions, equipment and service vendors across production and post production.
  • Previous background in software development, workflow scripting, or system administration not required, but strong plus

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Netflix derives a significant competitive advantage from the analytical approach it takes to managing all aspects of the business. As we continue to push for growth and retention in the UCAN (US & Canada) region, we are looking for an Associate to join our Partnerships Finance, Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) team. This role will be focused on analyzing partnership opportunities with local operators (e.g. T-Mobile, Verizon, Comcast) in North America and conducting global partnership analyses/projects. This role will report to our Director, Partnerships Finance, Strategy & Analysis, and is based in our Los Gatos offices. Partnerships are a critical driver of growth for Netflix. The most common types of partnerships with local operators are bundles, followed by set-top box integrations. These impact millions of members, and our analyses play a critical role in the assessment and ongoing strategy for those partnerships in the region. During negotiations, we provide guidance to the Business Development team using data and analysis. When partnerships are launched, we monitor their performance and search for best practices and areas of improvement. Finally, we work closely with our Product and Partner Engagement teams to determine which changes in the Netflix experience could improve the partnerships’ impact. RESPONSIBILITIES Evaluating the financial impact of partnership opportunities (primarily bundles) Financial projections and scenario modeling Risk identification and mitigation strategies Advising the Business Development team during the negotiations Analyzing the performance of partnerships to extract actionable insights (e.g. best practices, areas of improvement) Conducting global analyses regarding bundle performance Creating insightful presentations that facilitate decision-making for internal stakeholders and external partners Partnering with the Product team to help identify/prioritize and assess the impact of initiatives (e.g. improving Netflix plan upgrades for bundles) Providing inputs to other teams working on partnerships initiatives (e.g. Data Science & Engineering, Consumer Insights) Developing industry expertise for the US and Canada REQUIREMENTS 4+ years of experience, ideally in management consulting or similar field Extensive experience conducting quantitative analysis that leads to actionable insights Team player with strong interpersonal skills, but also able to work independently Adept at managing multiple projects and stakeholders Skilled in preparing effective presentations with clear narrative Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong Excel skills required Proficiency with Tableau and SQL a strong plus Bachelor’s or master’s degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

The Opportunity We’re looking for an experienced Contracts Manager to join the Netflix legal team based in our Los Gatos office. This role will report to a Director, on the Product & Tech Legal Team, who manages a team of efficient, effective, and risk-calibrated contract and project managers that provide legal support services in the corporate, studio, and product organizations at Netflix. The Role As a Contracts Manager, you will work with diverse legal and cross-functional teams and play a critical role supporting Netflix’s Product & Tech Team in managing vendor deals across the globe. With a curious mindset, you'll continuously seek innovative solutions to enhance our processes and drive efficiency. Your ability to work proactively and independently under tight timeframes will be essential as you manage contracts in a dynamic environment. Success in this role requires adaptability and drive to excel in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining the highest standards of professionalism and integrity. If you're ready to contribute to our success and grow with our team, we encourage you to apply. description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix grows globally, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our growth. This newly created role will be based in our Manila office and will be part of the Talent Experience Operations (TEO) team. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Knowledge Management Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimizing our internal knowledge base, ensuring that HR-related information is effectively organized, updated, and disseminated. This role is crucial for improving customer service, enhancing user experience, and boosting the efficiency of support teams. Key Responsibilities Knowledge Base Management: Create, update, and maintain knowledge base articles to ensure they are accurate, relevant, and up-to-date, including retiring articles as necessary. Content Optimization: Use Search Engine Optimization (SEO) best practices to optimize content and make it easily discoverable. User Experience: Improve the user experience by organizing content by user personas in a logical and intuitive way. Training and Support: Train support teams on how to use the knowledge base effectively. Collaborate with partner teams to identify and fill knowledge gaps in the database. Reporting: Monitor and report on knowledge base usage and effectiveness. Use this data to identify areas for improvement. Knowledge, Experience, And Skills Required At least 2+ years in knowledge management, content management, or a similar role. Proficiency in using knowledge base tools such as Zendesk Guide, Contentful, etc. Ability to create clear, concise, and engaging content. Have a good understanding of SEO best practices to improve content discoverability. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Amenable to working in shifts and on holidays. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. The Client and Partner Technologies team is charted with enabling brilliant Netflix experiences on partner devices and building foundational client systems and tools.  As a Product Manager for Partner Device Tools & Services, you work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to support our technical engagements and roadmaps with partners such as Samsung, MediaTek, Amazon, and regional partners like Comcast and Sky. Using both qualitative insights and quantitative metrics to guide decisions and measure success, you will be responsible for driving, developing and executing different software and hardware product roadmaps. This is a dynamic role interfacing with device partners, partner engineering teams and hundreds of internal engineers to drive efficiency and quality, ensuring members around the world have the best Netflix experience. What Sets You Apart? Track record of technical product transformation, finding new opportunities and building them to scale Comfortable working with ambiguity. This role is fast-paced, fluid, and will frequently evolve based on partner, strategy, and product priorities You welcome candid feedback and can constructively give it as well Self-starter who enjoys quickly bringing organization and direction Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values Required Skills Deep experience with software test tools and shipping high quality products 7+  years of experience in product management, technical program management, software engineering, or leading software development projects Strong depth-of-knowledge of embedded platforms and the consumer electronics market Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience Ability to think strategically and lean on data to inform decision-making Can balance consumer, partner, and business interests while considering technical integration tradeoffs Proven experience creating partnerships with cross-functional teams and organizations, driving large-scale technical execution plans with measurable milestones, debating technical approaches, and building long-term scalable solutions Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000 - $515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
