description: The Opportunity We are seeking an experienced Coordinator, Production Management (series/film) in Korea to help manage our series/film slate of Local Language Originals being produced in Korean from a production perspective. Responsibilities include establishing and curating vendor & staff/crew relations, reviewing budgets and supporting/suggesting best practices from pre production through delivery. The position will work closely with our Creative, Post Production and other internal teams along with our local series producers to ensure the efficient delivery of the series. A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and initiative. S/he will report to the Director of Production Management team in Korea. This role will be the operational core of the creative team; expected to manage both internal and external parties for optimum efficiency and the successful launch of our Netflix Series/Film titles. Duties will include but not limited to: Responsibilities: Manage the workflow of incoming material submissions of pertinent materials in relation to titles and evaluate incoming submissions in proprietary Netflix systems. Act as the liaison with various departments and production partners to coordinate information sharing and address incoming and outgoing requests. Meticulously maintain calendaring of all key dates and deadlines related to titles, including tracking resubmissions and schedules. Cross-check and assist the internal creative-related tasks Evaluate and provide coverage of incoming assigned material. Provide secondary creative thought partnership to the creative executives on projects as needed. Qualifications: High level of organization, detail orientation, and ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines in execution of projects. Proven to be agile to evolving needs and responsibilities of the team Demonstrates curiosity, selflessness, good judgment, and strong creative thinking skills Proven communication skills; must be articulate and professional both in written and verbal form Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally Highly collaborative, resourceful, quick thinking, curious, with great calm and a good sense of humor BA/BS required Studio or media-focused experience required Fluency in English and Korean required We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: We are on the hunt for a dynamic, innovative strategist and creative to spearhead the role of Manager, Social Marketing - Australia + New Zealand . With a global social reach of 877m followers, we fuel daily pop culture and foster passionate entertainment fandom to a scale that matches global celebrities. While today we live and breathe TikTok and Instagram - what’s next? We‘re looking for a social marketer who can answer this question by leaning into risk, experimentation and by making big bets. From global blockbusters like Stranger Things and Bridgerton to local Netflix hits like Heartbreak High and Boy Swallows Universe, this an opportunity to build social communities and editorials formats for one of Australia’s most loved entertainment brands. We highly encourage reading the Who We Are section of the Netflix website and learning about the Netflix Culture to ensure that all candidates feel that Netflix is a good fit. Core Responsibilities: Lead the Netflix social marketing strategy across various platforms, focusing on audience growth, organic social title campaigns, and repeatable editorial formats. Connect narratives across our titles to craft compelling brand stories that demonstrate entertainment expertise, local relevance, and title/brand fandom. Build strong relationships with cross-functional partners across publicity, comms, marketing, integrated planning, and content. Partner with external teams (agency, freelance) to deliver creativity and excellence across our social channels and formats. Maintain and strengthen our brand voice and tone and branding through social content strategy, community management and editorial curation. Utilize social analytics and internal data to inform strategy and identify opportunities. Stay on top of cultural trends to foster relevant brand conversations. Be experimental with content, take risks, be ambitious and original. Build and manage budgets to drive efficiency and scale impact. Skills and Requirements: A social /  editorial / marketing superstar with 10+ years of experience in entertainment media or brand building fueled by social content creation. Passionate about great stories. You can talk on and on about your favourite shows, genres, and creators you admire for your life. Deep knowledge of social platforms and the ability to craft engaging stories. Proven track record of creating content that gets shared and talked about. Strong global IQ and the ability to work with teams from different markets. Solid understanding of marketing and social media analytics. High tolerance for change, and the capacity to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Strong leadership, team management and project management skills. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: We're actively seeking a highly strategic and media marketing planner to take the helm as Manager, Film & Series Marketing (Media Specialist) - ANZ This role is responsible for working with our marketing team and media agency to develop best practices, connect paid social to our overall marketing strategy, explore and leverage key media partners, build learning agendas, and scale campaigns and ideas. You'll also spearhead our most awareness-oriented campaigns while acting as a media strategy thought partner to other Film + Series marketing managers. Our ideal candidate is an analytical thinker, adept at leveraging data and insights to uncover the most impactful and engaging marketing strategies. It is expected that a successful candidate will be developing detailed media plans and guiding our partner on operational specifics related to smooth campaign execution, so knowledge of platform setup is required for the role. We highly encourage reading the Who We Are section of the Netflix website and learning about the Netflix Culture to ensure that all candidates feel that Netflix is a good fit. Core Responsibilities: Act as the primarily liaison for our media agency to improve workflows for audience identification, planning and measure the performance of our campaigns, while identifying new ways of working and long-term opportunities to drive greater impact through our media planning and buying. Serve as a platform expert across established and developing paid social channels with the ability to advise cross functional teams on audience demos, targeting capabilities and creative formats. Act as a resource to the country marketing teams to provide paid social creative best practices and recommendations with a focus on ways to execute breakthrough creative concepts. Develop, lead, and execute highly targeted and awareness-driven campaigns to launch some of our most impactful titles in Australia + New Zealand. Collaborate with local and global creative marketing teams to develop the local strategy and media campaign for a variety of proactive and reactive title campaigns. Work with local creative agencies, alongside our marketing production manager, to develop creative ideas and bespoke local strategies, with creative thought-partnership from our other Film + Series Marketing manager. End to end strategy, planning, and managing activation partners for execution of paid social campaigns across multiple channels, including Meta, YouTube, TikTok and X (formerly Twitter). Work with key stakeholders at digital platforms on ways to best leverage their products and opportunities for scalable digital innovation Skills and Requirements: 10+ years of marketing experience, with expertise in audience targeting, paid social, media planning, and performance KPIs, preferably within the entertainment industry (TV, film, gaming, sport). An unshakeable passion for TV, film and storytelling. Your enthusiasm for your favourite shows, genres, and creators is infectious. Experience with full funnel campaign tactics and success evaluation Proficiency in Meta, Tiktok and YouTube’s ad management platforms Well versed in paid social best practices, including channel specific creative formats and the latest strategies resonating with consumers. Highly detail oriented with an ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast paced, high volume environment Comfortable with risk, always pushing the boundaries of data-informed innovation. Excellent research, presentation, prioritization, and decision-making skills. An entrepreneurial mindset. You are a proactive self-starter who's unafraid to take on multiple roles and dive into the data and jump into social platform business tooling. Deeply passionate and curious about all aspects of the Netflix business. A natural leader, team player, and project manager; you are a collaborative marketing professional who will go above and beyond to deliver exceptional results. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. As we move beyond 260 million members and hundreds of partnerships worldwide, our approach to marketing is to build innovative, culturally relevant, creatively excellent campaigns that pierce the zeitgeist and drive conversation. The Role The Netflix Korea Film & Series  Marketing team is seeking a Marketing Manager to support and/or lead the day-to-day development and execution of 360 marketing campaigns for both Korean and global titles. Core Responsibilities: Build successful 360 marketing campaigns for Netflix’s brand and titles -- from strategy development to tactical execution (including media buy, activation, and creative assets) Lead the creation of marketing assets for titles and brand - development of creative, planning, and execution of shoots (key art, AV, etc) Drive successful marketing campaigns in Korea while creating strategies and assets that can also resonate outside of Korea. Act as a liaison to internal x-functional teams at every step of the campaign, from early strategy through campaign completion. Be the main point of contact with agencies - brief, hire, manage and give feedback to create the best campaigns. Communicate and collaborate with external studios, showrunners, producers, talent and talent representatives where needed. Incorporate branding elements into title campaigns to establish the Netflix brand in consumers' everyday lives. Qualifications: Minimum of 7 years of experience in the entertainment marketing/social department at a network, studio, agency or brand. Proven track record in impactful, world-class creative campaigns across multiple channels (AV/trailers, digital/social, print/out-of-home) that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist. Experience in creating culturally relevant and conversation-driving creative, along with marketing shoot experience. Strong cross-functional collaboration skills, with the ability to engage and collaborate with internal departments. Effective communication with executives, showrunners, producers, talent and talent representatives as needed. Proactive self-starter with resourcefulness and a solution-oriented mindset, able to make sound judgments in ambiguous situations. Thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment. Demonstrates a passion for innovation, embraces new technologies, and challenges marketing conventions. Curiosity and enthusiasm for all aspects of the Netflix business. Fluency in English and Korean is required. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

  • Be the main point of contact with agencies - brief, hire, manage and give feedback to create the best campaigns.
  • Communicate and collaborate with external studios, showrunners, producers, talent and talent representatives where needed.
  • Incorporate branding elements into title campaigns to establish the Netflix brand in consumers' everyday lives.
    • Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in the entertainment marketing/social department at a network, studio, agency or brand.
  • Proven track record in impactful, world-class creative campaigns across multiple channels (AV/trailers, digital/social, print/out-of-home) that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist.
  • Experience in creating culturally relevant and conversation-driving creative, along with marketing shoot experience.
  • Strong cross-functional collaboration skills, with the ability to engage and collaborate with internal departments.
  • Effective communication with executives, showrunners, producers, talent and talent representatives as needed.
  • Proactive self-starter with resourcefulness and a solution-oriented mindset, able to make sound judgments in ambiguous situations.
  • Thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment.
  • Demonstrates a passion for innovation, embraces new technologies, and challenges marketing conventions.
  • Curiosity and enthusiasm for all aspects of the Netflix business.
  • Fluency in English and Korean is required.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: THE OPPORTUNITY It’s an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. With over 260 million streaming members in over 190 countries, our approach to marketing is to build innovative, culturally relevant and creatively excellent campaigns that pierce the zeitgeist and drive conversation. THE ROLE The Netflix Series Marketing team seeks a Creative Marketing Manager to lead and support the day-to-day development and execution of 360 marketing campaigns for some of Netflix’s most exciting drama series. The ideal candidate is highly-collaborative with a strategic mindset, strong creative point-of-view, and deep passion for entertainment, especially drama series and films. We highly encourage reading the Who We Are section of the Netflix website and learning about the Netflix Culture to ensure that all candidates feel that Netflix is a good fit. CORE RESPONSIBILITIES Build global 360 creative marketing campaigns for key drama series — from strategy development to tactical execution of print, trailers, digital/social, and more. Act as a liaison to internal cross-functional teams at every step of the campaign, from early strategy through campaign completion. Communicate and collaborate directly with talent, showrunners, executive producers, talent representatives and external studios. Be the main point of contact with agencies - brief, hire, manage and give feedback to create the best campaigns. Collaborate with our international regions to extend your campaign strategy/creative around the world and maximize its impact. Lead shoot planning and content capture for custom creative assets. Manage creative budgets and negotiate scope agreements with external partners. WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR You have a minimum of 4+ years  of experience in an entertainment marketing department at a network, studio, agency or brand. You have a passion for television and a particular interest in the drama genre. You have built world-class, culturally relevant, conversation-driving creative. You can conceptualize and articulate creative strategy and big ideas that people will rally around. You understand how to tell a strategic, compelling and cohesive story across all platforms. You have worked on 360 campaigns, from strategy development to tactical execution (i.e. AV/trailers, digital, social, print, out-of-home and more). You have experience concepting and creative-directing marketing photo and A/V shoots. You are a cross-functional team player who is able to engage, listen and collaborate with internal departments. You can effectively communicate to senior executives, showrunners, producers, talent and talent representatives as needed. You are a proactive self-starter, who is resourceful and solution-oriented. You demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment. You strive to innovate, try new technologies and disrupt marketing norms in your work. You are curious about all aspects of the Netflix business. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. To support our continued evolution, we are looking for an experienced and passionate Art and Print Production Manager LATAM to join our Marketing Planning, Operations, and Production team. This position will work for the LATAM region and will be based in our Mexico City Office. The Role The Art & Print Production Manager is the in-house leader and expert in all related to static marketing expression. This person will lead, design, and operate the ecosystem that produces marketing key art, out-of-home, and print campaigns for LATAM. Specifically, art development, finishing process, print adaptation, printing, and implementation are the focus of the role. You will serve as the go-to partner and key point-of-contact for all internal stakeholders, facilitating alignment between teams dedicated to strategy, creative, production, and localization. This means that you value the importance of protecting creative excellence while maintaining a logical outlook for project execution. You understand Marketing workflows and excel in managing a large volume of assets in a high-speed, high-performance environment. You are nimble, able to balance competing priorities among global stakeholders, and thrive as a strong individual lead, and a collaborative team member, in a rigorous environment. Key Responsabilities Functional Leadership: Design, implement, lead, and operate a high-performing Art/Print Production ecosystem, dedicated to delivery high-volume, high-quality creative campaigns for multiple marketing verticals/clients. Cross-functional thought leadership with senior leaders in creative, marketing strategy, analytics, and production to drive directional team alignment, innovation, and testing.Responsible for overall team financials, staff planning, and other operational functions. Through collaboration and coordination, manage scope, budget, and overall print production regional resourcesLiaise with internal and external partners to provide functional guidance and industry best-practices on art and print campaign collateral. Art Finishing: Design, implement and manage the ecosystem that delivers the finishing, production, localization, and servicing of design assets (key art, print adaptations, OOH, digital OOH), ensuring brand, layout, and specs for our marketing and communications teamsThrough high-end expertise, ensure the quality of the final art to its best level. Out-Of-Home Adaptations: High-quality and scale Lead, design, implement and operate the ecosystem that brings high-quality scale to the adaptations in LATAM. This includes the management and development of key partnerships, vendors, and suppliers throughout the region. Responsible for the final deliveries in time and manner as well as the quality control of the whole process. Experience & Skills 10+ of Print Production and/or Project Management experience, with an emphasis on marketing deliverables with distribution across LATAM — Full understanding of what is needed to produce and adapt print materials at scale as well as print models, materials, challenges and demands in LATAM 7+ years of team management experience, with direct report Producers and/or Project Managers. Experience in organizational design within these roles is preferred. Experience managing high volume programs in parallel, collaborating with diverse, geographically dispersed teams to deliver marketing materials. Experience developing and rolling out solutions to reduce complexity, level of effort and/or costs for your organization. Experience working with business analysts or analytics teams to measure operational metrics for forward-looking organizational planning. Technical experience that brings an understanding of the art and print process and the tools to make this happen (Adobe Creative Suite - Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign) Art & Design: Previous experience on the finishing process, understanding its key milestones and challenges. Spanish & English fluency are required (Portuguese is a plus). You are passionate and curious about all aspects of the business -  a proactive self-starter, who doesn’t wait to be told what to do and is resourceful in finding solutions. You have great communication skills, you connect the dots when others cannot and simplify complex issues and questions. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge! See Who We Are and what our Culture is like. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Next Games, a Netflix Game Studio, is a Helsinki-based studio dedicated to crafting fans-first interactive experiences that combine the stories from popular movies and shows with engaging game mechanics. Our values, Caring, Courage, and Curiosity, drive our commitment to our players and each other, with a focus on fun gameplay free from the constraints of free-to-play. We celebrate diversity, with dozens of nationalities and a third of our team identifying as women or non-binary. We don't seek culture fit, but rather the unique contributions each individual brings to enrich our culture. If you're passionate about creating innovative mobile games in a diverse, supportive environment, we're eager to hear from you! The Role We are searching for a Senior UX Designer to create high-quality games that are playable, enjoyable, and accessible to a broad audience.  You can work hands-on on a day-to-day basis with Your team and can create and execute a strategic UX vision for the game, showing a deep understanding of the game’s audience and their needs as players. You maintain a consistent relationship with players and provide relevant information to the team to help them maintain a player-centric approach to improving features and iterations of the game. You have fantastic communication skills and are a supportive and strong team player. Responsibilities: Have experience holistically improving the game, and guide the team through all of the steps in the UX process Design usable, enjoyable, and accessible UX experiences for a casual and broad audience. Creates the communication and the structure of the game Maintain a holistic view by ensuring all the features are well connected and make sense from a player perspective, build enjoyable communication with the players, and be able to share the intended feeling. Define the content strategy Work following a Design Thinking process. Be able to create hypotheses, and track to demonstrate that we are fulfilling user needs: ideate onboardings and new ways of developing and implementing features. Help the team to be player-centric Work closely with UX researchers, UI Artists, Designers, Artists, Team Lead, and relevant stakeholders to continue identifying opportunities to improve our ways of working and the quality of our games. Teamwork and iteration are our goals Be the player's advocate. Talk regularly with players and share your knowledge with the team to make informed decisions Create a common framework of Heuristics to evaluate the game according to the same criteria Generate a good atmosphere, and be able to transmit to the other departments the UX strategy of the game and the emotions that we must transmit Leads proactively initiatives for improving the game, creating workshops, and improving communication Share polished documentation Skills and Abilities: Create game architecture,  game flows, and wireframes Create polished documentation regarding UX strategy, users, competitors, guidelines, etc. Be able to create prototypes in Figma Be able to create the testing plan. Ability to use User Research tools like PlaytestCloud, run tests, and share results with the team. Make sure the results are taken into account and acted upon Ability to run Accessibility tests Basic knowledge of Unity Understands visual design principles Experience working in a player-centric environment based on teamwork and iteration Great communication and leadership skills Help create UX maturity in the team We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

The Opportunity We are looking for an experienced AV Producer to join our UCAN Marketing Production AV team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the finishing and localization production processes of our AV Marketing campaigns across our content slate. You should have a deep understanding of AV Post production Finishing and Localization workflows and excel in managing a large volume of assets, across multiple platforms, in a high-speed, high-performance environment. You are a force of calm and good judgment as well as an adaptable person who revels in change. This means that you are nimble, able to balance competing priorities amongst global stakeholders, and thrive as a strong individual lead, and a collaborative team member, in a rigorous environment. The Role Reporting to the Sr. Manager of AV Production, you will join a team of AV Producers that manage the finishing and localization for Netflix’s AV Marketing campaigns. Responsibilities include: Finish, localize, and deliver Marketing AV assets (trailers, promos, featurettes, Behind The Scenes, social content, etc.) for our cross-functional marketing and communications teams. Own day-to-day communication and escalation with creative and operational stakeholders, content post teams, external finishing vendors, creative agencies, localization and distribution partners in order to efficiently manage finishing and localization execution. Plan, schedule and manage internal and external AV production workflows, that time-sensitive bottlenecks are eliminated and advise on delivery & budget risks to enable the creation and production of high quality creative at a high velocity. Shepherd scope, budget and overall AV post production resources Assure internal and external production partners are up to date on brand guidelines and file specs for delivery. Partner with a team of operational producers responsible for managing finishing, localization, and trafficking of promotional materials. These include online and offline AV, key art and out-of-home, digital, and social creative assets. Use data to inform production best practices, eliminating inefficiencies throughout our operational pipelines. Requirements: 5+ of AV Servicing in a post-production house,  entertainment studio, or creative agency Excellent written and verbal communication skills Expert knowledge of Marketing campaign workflows, including understanding the creative and AV Post Production process Fluent in AV file types, social and digital formats while understanding the fundamentals of asset management, QC and trafficking. Familiarity with Localization workflows, including motion graphic packages, subtitling and dubbing Experience managing a high volume of AV campaign types in parallel, in collaboration with geographically dispersed teams. Proven ability to effectively communicate amongst a wide variety of cross functional partners, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and global dissemination of campaign milestones, assets and deliverables. Experience with Film or Theatrical Campaign Marketing. Passion and interest in this space is a must. Familiarity with MPA guidelines is a plus, but not required Experience facilitating finishing approvals with  high profile, above and below-the line talent is a plus, but not required. Personality Attributes: You are passionate and curious about all aspects of entertainment marketing. You are a natural-born communicator, connecting the dots when others cannot, and have an ability to simplify complex issues and questions. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment . You possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. You approach all challenges and obstacles with a solutions-oriented mindset. You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed, and always up for a challenge! See Who We Are and what our Culture is like. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. This means that you are nimble, able to balance competing priorities amongst global stakeholders, and thrive as a strong individual lead, and a collaborative team member, in a rigorous environment.  The Role Reporting to the Sr. Manager of AV Production, you will join a team of AV Producers that manage the finishing and localization for Netflix’s AV Marketing campaigns. Responsibilities include:
  • Finish, localize, and deliver Marketing AV assets (trailers, promos, featurettes, Behind The Scenes, social content, etc.) for our cross-functional marketing and communications teams.
  • Own day-to-day communication and escalation with creative and operational stakeholders, content post teams, external finishing vendors, creative agencies, localization and distribution partners in order to efficiently manage finishing and localization execution.
  • Plan, schedule and manage internal and external AV production workflows, that time-sensitive bottlenecks are eliminated and advise on delivery & budget risks to enable the creation and production of high quality creative at a high velocity. 
  • Shepherd scope, budget and overall AV post production resources
  • Assure internal and external production partners are up to date on brand guidelines and file specs for delivery.
  • Partner with a team of operational producers responsible for managing finishing, localization, and trafficking of promotional materials. These include online and offline AV, key art and out-of-home, digital, and social creative assets.
  • Use data to inform production best practices, eliminating inefficiencies throughout our operational pipelines.
    • Requirements:
  • 5+ of AV Servicing in a post-production house,  entertainment studio, or creative agency
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Expert knowledge of Marketing campaign workflows, including understanding the creative and AV Post Production process
  • Fluent in AV file types, social and digital formats while understanding the fundamentals of asset management, QC and trafficking. 
  • Familiarity with Localization workflows, including motion graphic packages, subtitling and dubbing 
  • Experience managing a high volume of AV campaign types in parallel, in collaboration with geographically dispersed teams.
  • Proven ability to effectively communicate amongst a wide variety of cross functional partners, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and global dissemination of campaign milestones, assets and deliverables.
  • Experience with Film or Theatrical Campaign Marketing. Passion and interest in this space is a must.
  • Familiarity with MPA guidelines is a plus, but not required
  • Experience facilitating finishing approvals with  high profile, above and below-the line talent is a plus, but not required.
    • Personality Attributes:
  • You are passionate and curious about all aspects of entertainment marketing.
  • You are a natural-born communicator, connecting the dots when others cannot, and have an ability to simplify complex issues and questions.
  • You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment .
  • You possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity.
  • You approach all challenges and obstacles with a solutions-oriented mindset.
  • You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed, and always up for a challenge!
  • See Who We Are and what our Culture is like.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000- $245,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. description: The Opportunity Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As part of our commitment to keeping the theatrical moviegoing experience alive, Netflix films and shows are presented in many theaters around the world, including in our owned theaters such as the legendary Paris Theater in Manhattan, the historic Egyptian Theatre in Hollywood, and our in-office theaters and screening rooms around the world. The Post Services team is charged with the strategy, implementation, and operational management of Netflix’s purpose-built facilities and infrastructure, which include a diverse global portfolio of screening and review spaces that cater to a variety of use cases. We offer bleeding-edge technology, workflows, and expert services to our filmmakers and studio. Our commitment is to provide an unmatched screening experience: cultivating a creative and immersive environment, fostering filmmaker joy, and preserving artistic intent throughout the production to exhibition pipeline. In this early stage of our expansion to support external screenings, you’ll have a unique opportunity to pioneer and influence the course of our theatrical field operations. We’re looking for a visionary engineer who will not only extend our high presentation standards to the East Coast operations, but will continuously push the envelope to enhance the enjoyment of filmmakers and audiences alike. In this role, you will Serve as a technical lead and operate high-profile screenings at the Paris Theater, such as premieres, press screenings and awards engagements, Conduct tech checks with partners New York, New York Content Post Production Management Cinema Engineer The Opportunity  Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As part of our commitment to keeping the theatrical moviegoing experience alive, Netflix films and shows are presented in many theaters around the world, including in our owned theaters such as the legendary Paris Theater in Manhattan, the historic Egyptian Theatre in Hollywood, and our in-office theaters and screening rooms around the world.  The Post Services team is charged with the strategy, implementation, and operational management of Netflix’s purpose-built facilities and infrastructure, which include a diverse global portfolio of screening and review spaces that cater to a variety of use cases. We offer bleeding-edge technology, workflows, and expert services to our filmmakers and studio. We’re looking for a visionary engineer who will not only extend our high presentation standards to the East Coast operations, but will continuously push the envelope to enhance the enjoyment of filmmakers and audiences alike. In this role, you will
  • Serve as a technical lead and operate high-profile screenings at the Paris Theater, such as premieres, press screenings and awards engagements,
  • Conduct tech checks with partners and talent, performing picture and sound calibration to achieve satisfaction  
  • Oversee daily exhibition best practices for general venue programming at the Paris Theater, seeking to maintain a high standard of exhibition quality 
  • Oversee and support screenings at 3rd party East Coast venues including festivals, and other high-profile publicity screenings
  • Represent Netflix as its trusted expert at screening events and festivals, ensuring filmmaker satisfaction 
  • Support internal studio screening needs in the Netflix New York corporate office  
  • Consistently monitor quality of venues in New York and stay current on changes and upgrades
  • Liaise with internal engineering teams on major upgrades and troubleshooting
  • Provide excellent service to internal Netflix stakeholders and filmmaking talent 
  • Perform maintenance on cinema projection equipment, sound systems, servers, etc.
  • Establish efficient workflows to ensure a reliable and consistent experience 
  • Partner closely with Events and Regional Publicity, Post Production Management teams, Distribution, Workplace Operations, and Media Systems Engineering to achieve uncompromising experience and drive filmmaker and audience satisfaction
    • The Ideal candidate
  • 10+ years of experience in high-end theatrical exhibition, working in an engineering capacity in a client facing role
  • Demonstrated leadership in running complex screening events, orchestrating a variety of technical functions seamlessly to achieve a successful show
  • Hands-on experience with theatrical exhibition workflows, Digital Cinema specifications, maintenance, and calibration, including digital projection, QSC, Dolby, etc. 
  • Able to consistently deliver spectacular DolbyAtmos sound experience that accurately reproduces artistic intent 
  • Strong understanding of file formats, screening assets, and auxiliary media.
  • Attention to details necessary to deliver pristine audio-visual presentation
  • Ability to detect and diagnose faults with both assets and environments, and proactively flag issues 
  • Knowledge of Post Production imaging and color space, as well as sound workflows such as Nearfield and Theatrical mixes
  • Familiarity with live event technology 
  • Knowledge of film projection is preferred 
  • Certified Barco / Christie projection is a plus
  • QSYS Level 1 Cinema certification is a plus  
  • Dolby training is a plus 
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage a heavy volume of work
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication and proactive, solution driven mentality
  • Troubleshooting skills with a strong emphasis on long term solutions and innovation
  • Resilient approach and proven ability to excel under pressure and thrive in constant change
  • Existing relationships with outside vendors, including rental houses and engineering firms, is a plus 
  • Ability to respond after hours for important, timely, or urgent matters
  • Ability and willingness to travel for work; primarily domestic, East Coast travel
  • Passionate about Netflix culture and values in the workplace

description: We are seeking a Senior Technical Producer to join our production team and play a pivotal role in coordinating the complex technical aspects of our multiplayer game projects. The ideal candidate will have a solid technical background, experience in multiplayer game production, and the ability to manage technical risks effectively. Essential Functions/Responsibilities Lead the coordination of complex technical aspects of software development, ensuring alignment with strategic project goals and timelines. Act as a critical partner with external entities for outsourcing, managing relationships, and ensuring high-quality deliverables. Oversee and guide the technical pipeline, including tool building and feature implementation, focusing on innovation and efficiency. Mentor engineers, assisting them in planning and scheduling their work while proactively identifying and addressing potential risks and solutions. Drive the production of advanced technical features, especially those related to multiplayer gameplay, setting high standards for quality and performance. Collaborate with senior cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of technical components and alignment with overall project vision. Skills and Abilities Expert understanding of connected software development methodologies and best practices. Preferred proven knowledge of software methodologies, best practices, and leading technical teams on large-scale multiplayer games. Exceptional analytical skills and the ability to communicate complex technical features and risks clearly to a variety of stakeholders. Strong leadership and project management skills, with a demonstrated ability to drive technical projects to successful completion. Ability to coordinate and build effective partnerships Clear and proactive communication and coordination Able to manage multiple, competing tasks and be self-directed to meet deadlines in a quickly evolving environment Positive attitude and ability to receive and provide objective and constructive feedback Education and Experience Previous experience shipping 2 or more equivalent quality games Extensive experience as a Technical Producer or similar senior role in the gaming industry, with a proven track record of successful technical project management. Engineering degree or a related field (preferred but not required). In-depth experience with server and client networking, with a strong understanding of the challenges and solutions in multiplayer game environments. Significant experience in guiding key technical elements for multiplayer experiences, with a portfolio of successful projects. Other Duties Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: Our core hours are 10 am to 6:00 pm CST, which means you should be available for meetings etc. during this time. Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000 - $270,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming video service with over 200 million paid memberships in 190+ countries. The Consumer Engineering team builds the industry-leading Netflix iOS, Android, and TV apps. To bring new kinds of engaging and cinematic experiences to life, we partner closely with many cross-functional teams including product management, experience design, and creative production. The Android Client Foundations team is responsible for solving shared opportunities and needs of Android product engineers across Netflix. We build foundational client infrastructure, app architecture, automation, and developer frameworks with insightful release and production tooling in close collaboration with our partners. Our mission is to: - Enable teams to craft & ship rich, elegant, and performant product experiences - Enable rapid execution and product innovation on solid, field-tested, operationalized foundational pieces - Stay highly aligned with Product Engineering teams yet loosely coupled to have a dedicated focus on technical missions to serve our customer teams Our responsibilities include implementing large-scale future-looking foundational architecture and frameworks ranging from core UI frameworks to core infrastructure that enables existing and future innovations for product teams across Netflix. We care deeply about the performance, quality, and accessibility of the Netflix app. We’re passionate about creating elegantly designed, highly performant architectures that empower engineers to build unique UI experiences used by millions of users across the globe. We partner closely with teams across Netflix to help deliver solutions that make UI development efficient and enjoyable. What You’ll be Doing Define the automated testing vision and strategy for Android - for our partner teams. Ensure high-quality delivery for each release. Help modernize and expand test infrastructure for better reliability and performance to support our culture of experimentation. Influence Android app development and architecture for improved testability. Leverage and influence existing tools to increase observability over the quality of our team’s domain. Stay updated with new testing tools and strategies. Create tools and platforms to improve release efficiency. Collaborating with internal teams (developers, PMs) to identify new testing requirements. What We Are Seeking Proven work experience in software development in testing and automation, specifically for Android devices. Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, automation, tools, and processes. In-depth knowledge of Android APIs, modern architectural patterns, and the technical landscape of Android automation. Hands-on experience with automated testing tools with extensive knowledge of Espresso, JUnit, Robolectric, UI Automator, screenshot testing, etc. Exceptional coding skills, especially with Java/Kotlin, and ability to navigate different languages and technologies. Proficiency in building all layers of the test pyramid using standard testing tools and frameworks. Ability to write clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases, as well as manage, track, and close automation tickets. Able to analyze data to gain insights for improving app performance and quality. Capable of understanding and operating within a distributed architecture comprising many systems and services. You will be successful in the role if You deeply care about the quality & performance of the product shipped. You have experience building transparent observability tooling and solutions that enhance developer velocity. You love the idea of your work empowering other engineers and striving to understand their use cases. You enjoy pushing the boundaries of what technology can do and exploring uncharted waters with some supervision. You are curious and ready to learn about various new or unfamiliar technologies, our consumer base, and product vision. Your colleagues appreciate the unique perspectives and balanced views you bring to collaborations. You value the opinions of others when fleshing out solutions to fill out your blind spots. You always seek different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to navigate ambiguity comfortably. You are effective at establishing strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication. You have read about Netflix’s culture and think you would thrive here. Learn about Android Product Engineering Read about how we migrated our Android endpoints out of a monolith into a new microservice ( Rohan and Ed ) See one of our pull requests for Epoxy ( Emmanuel ) Read our take on Rx onError Guidelines ( Ed ) See some of our work highlighted at a Netflix Women In Tech Event Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: Netflix is the world’s leading Internet television network with over 260+ million paid members enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As a global household brand, we strive to bring joy to users by connecting them with stories and artists through a delightful and high-quality experience. As part of the Consumer Identity and Access organization, the Consumer Identity Foundations team builds platforms and services to store, manage and serve context on Netflix accounts, profiles and devices for our streaming and games products at high scale. We are seeking a talented Engineering Manager to lead our dynamic team of local and remote engineers and drive the development and innovation of our highly resilient infrastructure that enables product experiences and privacy initiatives. About You: You are an inclusive leader with a proven track record of building and leading high-performing diverse teams. You have an extensive background and strong technical expertise working in backend infrastructure and platforms, and understand how to build for scale and business impact. You have a proven track record of taking innovative projects from concept to production. You are inherently curious and enjoy leading through challenges with building high scale, low latency applications. You are a proactive, effective communicator with great judgment and a bias towards action. You are a role model for integrity, transparency and courage. You have a high tolerance for ambiguity and fast-changing context. You enjoy enabling your team to work on hard problems with new tech, but what really drives you is creating levers for making a big impact and delighting your stakeholders. Scope of the Role: Provide technical vision and strategy for building platforms to scale to the next set of million members. Build strong and productive relationships across product management, engineering, data science, and security partners. Balance immediate stakeholder needs vs longer-term vision. Lead a dream team of backend engineers to execute on a shared vision between security, engineering, and product partners. Grow and mentor team through a supportive mindset, thoughtful observation, and courageous, honest feedback. Must-Haves: Knowledge of distributed systems architectures and infrastructure. An engineering mindset that stays technically curious and engaged in innovation and encourages learning in the team. Thoughtful leadership with experience in hiring, coaching and retaining strong engineering talent with various needs for personal and professional growth. Strong partner for product management and engineering leaders, equally passionate about working with engineering and non-engineering stakeholders. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: At Netflix, we launch a high volume of titles regularly to meet the entertainment needs of our growing member base. The scale and quality at which we launch titles is paramount to our success in bringing these stories to the right audience at the right time. The Launch Manager ensures that we launch our  portfolio of titles at the highest quality and in the most efficient way possible to maximize member joy. The Launch Manager role is unique as its scope requires a deep understanding of our product behavior and a mindset that is equally precise on local execution as it is on strategic judgment calls. The LM’s role is to optimize the content and product strategy, and we do this via effective management of our highest impact areas, leading cross-functional alignment on a portfolio level, and being part of initiatives on innovating and productizing new product experiences. Thorough knowledge of the local and vertical strategies, business nuances, and technical troubleshooting paired with strong partnership investment with stakeholders will be critical to our success. You will be part of a larger Product Discovery and Promotion  team that will innovate approaches, develop scalable solutions, work with teams to drive promotional impact on the UI and drive excellence in every single one of our launches so that we can work smarter, increase efficiency and more importantly increase joy for our consumers on the Netflix platform. This role is based in Mumbai and focused on supporting the India content slate. In this role, you will: Own a portfolio of titles within the India content slate. While multiple teams  (internal or external) get involved at different times along the launch journey for deliverables, you will be overseeing the quality of the launch. Be an expert of the Netflix product and advise our stakeholders on means to improve how members interact with the title on the Netflix platform. Maintain the quality of the launch and mitigate risk to launch by being proactive, exercising sound judgment, and informing and influencing stakeholders. Partner with internal and external teams and serve as the primary point of contact on strategic operational matters for the title. Constantly evaluate our workflows with the intention of improving our efficiency and effectiveness in launching titles. Troubleshoot urgent issues cross-functionally and jump in operationally as needed, in service of the member experience The ideal candidate: A good balance of left and right brain thinking -  with  the ability to understand the  pulse of our consumers and put oneself in the consumers shoes, an appreciation of content nuances and needs, appreciation and fluency to articulate product principles. Expertise in product management experience in a product-centric environment or entertainment-tech company. Possesses an  analytical mindset and a bias towards solving for impact and scale Strong  stakeholder management skills and a good team player. A passion for operations and a thirst to do more with less, to work smarter not harder. Be well informed  of the Netflix product experience Happy to take accountability and drive initiatives. English fluency - written and spoken, with  additional language capabilities  in other Indian languages  preferred Excellent communication skills - written and verbal The ability to exemplify the Netflix culture and values. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

Thorough knowledge of the local and vertical strategies, business nuances, and technical troubleshooting paired with strong partnership investment with stakeholders will be critical to our success.         You will be part of a larger Product Discovery and Promotion  team that will innovate approaches, develop scalable solutions, work with teams to drive promotional impact on the UI and drive excellence in every single one of our launches so that we can work smarter, increase efficiency and more importantly increase joy for our consumers on the Netflix platform. This role is based in Mumbai and focused on supporting the India content slate.   In this role, you will:
  • Own a portfolio of titles within the India content slate. While multiple teams  (internal or external) get involved at different times along the launch journey for deliverables, you will be overseeing the quality of the launch.
  • Be an expert of the Netflix product and advise our stakeholders on means to improve how members interact with the title on the Netflix platform.

description: The Opportunity Do you live and breathe entertainment and the business of entertainment? Do you stay ahead of the curve and take in the latest films and TV shows across different services? Are you interested in the executives, deals and creatives who make it happen? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment? Are you a creative thinker who loves finding solutions to tricky problems or new angles to pitch stories? If this sounds like you, we are looking for you to join our team! The Role The Specialist, Entertainment Communications is a key contributor on the team responsible for promoting and protecting Netflix’s reputation for series, films, and games.  In addition to helping define the Netflix narrative, this role will work on communications plans, announcements, pitches, executive briefings, and more. This role is based out of the Los Angeles office and reports to the Senior Manager, Entertainment Communications. The ideal candidate will have a finger on the pulse of culture with experience in entertainment or media companies, including working directly with production partners, talent representatives, and press. They will be creative and proactive, and able to make wise decisions and exercise sound judgment even when faced with ambiguity. They will be a collaborative team player, resourceful, optimistic, and solution-oriented. Responsibilities: Tasks are timely and varied. They include but are not limited to - Track, vet, and respond to media requests Draft communications plans, announcements, briefing materials, and messaging documents Assemble and keep press lists up to date; developing and nurturing media contacts Identify impactful story angles, craft pitches, and secure stories centered around Netflix’s entertainment content – primarily focused on series with an opportunity to work on films, games, franchises, and related consumer products as needed. Track, analyze and circulate press coverage reports and competitive research Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in corporate or agency settings with a focus on entertainment Background in journalism also highly relevant Working media relationships at traditional and emerging entertainment, consumer, trade and business outlets. Experience handling high volume of complex projects and tasks for multiple people and teams while simultaneously managing competing priorities Ability to leverage insights, develop and secure stories aligned to company priorities Clear and concise communication style; strong written and verbal skills that can effectively convey complex ideas Meticulous organizational skills, good judgment of brand and comms risks, and effective time management A curious and ambitious self-starter with an interest in what drives cultural conversation and how Netflix can be at the forefront Passionate about the evolving entertainment landscape with a strong working knowledge of social platforms and trends Have a point of view, and be able to offer a unique perspective and voice Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000 - $234,000 . Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 220 million paid subscribers and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming. Bring your passion for games and joy of enabling others as we build our games experience. We are rapidly expanding new gaming offerings, so we are seeking an engineer with a wide breadth of experience who is excited to help us lead the continued building and scaling of our efforts for our international audience. This role involves architecting, authoring, and maintaining highly-complex software stacks for our cloud gaming service. This requires an engineer comfortable working throughout the application pipeline, including hardware accelerated video/audio/data processing, media encoding/decoding, and network transport algorithms. This requires engineers whose expertise covers optimizing both local system performance (writing high-performance, efficient code with a deep understanding of both hardware and software dynamics) and total system performance (including efficient and effective use of Internet connectivity). All engineers must be comfortable with producing high-quality solutions to business problems in the midst of high ambiguity to continue to push the boundary on what they can accomplish. We provide the freedom to execute, learn and pivot, and the responsibility to be self directed, collaborative and insightful. This gives you the freedom to do your best work and contribute directly to the success of the business. You will be successful in this role if you: Are a quick learner and excited about learning new technologies Advocate software craftsmanship and take pride in your work Thrive in an environment with lots of context and minimal guidance Enjoy collaborating with engineers across functional teams and have excellent communication skills Enjoy taking full ownership of projects from conception to production Qualifications: Experience developing and optimizing high performance, real-time applications such as games or simulations Strong low-level coding skills in Golang and/or C++ Experience working in complex codebases Experience developing for a variety of different hardware platforms Comfortable learning and working with a wide variety of technologies Nice to have: Experience developing backend tools Experience with CI/CD and test automation Experience working with container technologies (e.g. Docker) Coding skills in multiple languages (e.g. Python, Rust, TS) Experience with game development Experience developing for game consoles Experience working with embedded systems and/or microcontrollers Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $300,000 - $600,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
