description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Netflix Technology Services team is dedicated to enhancing the productivity of Netflix employees by offering seamless technology experiences. We’re looking for a versatile, adaptable and experienced AV Engineer to join our UCAN team, located in our office in Los Angeles. This role requires a high degree of flexibility and a quick response time to ensure the smooth running of our services. As an AV Engineer, your primary role will be within AV Operations, where you'll be responsible for managing the global conference room AV experience. In AV Operations, we strive to improve user experience in collaboration, communication and productivity by identifying the AV needs of users, proactively testing new technological solutions, and monitoring/interpreting ticket data to find and reduce friction. We then provide tools, guidance and support to ensure the best experience. We value quick adaptation to new technologies and the ability to implement them swiftly and efficiently. You will also work cross-functionally within AV Events, which includes managing the setup, support, and teardown of AV equipment and coordinating with external vendors as necessary. This position requires flexible hours as events may take place after normal business hours or on the weekend. In addition, our AV team aids in the design and construction of meeting spaces throughout our enterprise and studio facilities. We rely on Google Meet with Chromebox for Meetings hardware for the virtual meeting experience, and build solutions to optimize the experience. You’ll be empowered to look for ways to optimize the conference room experience for users and partner teams, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability in meeting diverse needs. Strategic Priorities: Leverage data to identify and eliminate friction or inefficiency in AV Systems. Collaborate closely with the support team to quickly recognize trends, pinpoint root causes, and refine designs to enhance stability. Install and maintain audio visual equipment including display devices, projectors, televisions, camera systems, video teleconferencing systems, microphones and speakers. Consult with stakeholders to troubleshoot issues, and deliver AV requirements. Create, maintain, and effectively communicate documentation and processes to improve user experience and promote self-service. Manage equipment inventory and transportation across our LA campus. Handle vendor management, particularly with AV Integrators and Managed Service Providers, which includes tracking and escalating issues as necessary. Act as the site lead to dispatch MSP technicians and foster relationships with key stakeholders. Cultivate the partnership with Google to resolve Google Meet issues and introduce features that enhance the user experience. Refine existing system designs to help create the optimal video conference experience, considering maintenance, scalability and rapid deployment. Provide technical support to other Engineers across various AV domains (Builds, Events, Studio) when required. Provide live event technical support acting as a member of the AV crew, providing pre-production through post-production and operating production equipment. Help with commissioning and handover of all new conference, specialty, studio, and event spaces in the LA area. Promote cross-functional partnerships with Netflix teams working in-region. Be open to both international and domestic travel. Skills for Success: Experience supporting and managing vendors in corporate and studio AV environments Proficiency with Enterprise VC solutions (preferably Google Meet, but also Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Bluejeans, Cisco Telepresence, etc.)—both hardware and software, and administrative fleet management. Experience with AV integration on the integrator and/or corporate side, with a focus on the physical installation. Experience designing and building meeting spaces from the ground up, including acoustics, lighting, and technology, is a plus. Experience operating and supporting live events (corporate, hospitality, or other major event venues). Capability to configure and troubleshoot audio and video equipment in corporate settings or during live events. Understanding of networking technology, video transmission over networks, and audio/video signal flow. Experience working with Crestron equipment, audio DSP’s, and Dante/AES microphone systems. Demonstrated project management experience with large projects, strong organizational skills, and ability to maintain and create standards. Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision; must be a self-motivated self-starter capable of implementing ideas and owning work. Experience in collaborating with and managing a variety of vendors, suppliers, and integrators. Ability to prioritize tasks and projects, forecast upcoming project and business needs. Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and implement them in a fast-paced environment. Experience building and maintaining cross-functional partnerships with internal and external teams. Strong organizational skills and familiarity with inventory management protocols. Proficiency with Google Suite tools. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . search_text:
Los Angeles, California Netflix Technology Services AV Engineer- Operations L4 Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.   The Netflix Technology Services team is dedicated to enhancing the productivity of Netflix employees by offering seamless technology experiences. We’re looking for a versatile, adaptable and experienced AV Engineer to join our UCAN team, located in our office in Los Angeles. This role requires a high degree of flexibility and a quick response time to ensure the smooth running of our services.   As an AV Engineer, your primary role will be within AV Operations, where you'll be responsible for managing the global conference room AV experience. In AV Operations, we strive to improve user experience in collaboration, communication and productivity by identifying the AV needs of users, proactively testing new technological solutions, and monitoring/interpreting ticket data to find and reduce friction. We then provide tools, guidance and support to ensure the best experience. We value quick adaptation to new technologies and the ability to implement them swiftly and efficiently. You will also work cross-functionally within AV Events, which includes managing the setup, support, and teardown of AV equipment and coordinating with external vendors as necessary. This position requires flexible hours as events may take place after normal business hours or on the weekend.   In addition, our AV team aids in the design and construction of meeting spaces throughout our enterprise and studio facilities. We rely on Google Meet with Chromebox for Meetings hardware for the virtual meeting experience, and build solutions to optimize the experience. You’ll be empowered to look for ways to optimize the conference room experience for users and partner teams, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability in meeting diverse needs. Strategic Priorities:
  • Leverage data to identify and eliminate friction or inefficiency in AV Systems.
  • Collaborate closely with the support team to quickly recognize trends, pinpoint root causes, and refine designs to enhance stability.
  • Install and maintain audio visual equipment including display devices, projectors, televisions, camera systems, video teleconferencing systems, microphones and speakers.
  • Consult with stakeholders to troubleshoot issues, and deliver AV requirements.
  • Create, maintain, and effectively communicate documentation and processes to improve user experience and promote self-service.
  • Manage equipment inventory and transportation across our LA campus.
  • Handle vendor management, particularly with AV Integrators and Managed Service Providers, which includes tracking and escalating issues as necessary.
  • Act as the site lead to dispatch MSP technicians and foster relationships with key stakeholders.
  • Cultivate the partnership with Google to resolve Google Meet issues and introduce features that enhance the user experience.
  • Refine existing system designs to help create the optimal video conference experience, considering maintenance, scalability and rapid deployment.
  • Provide technical support to other Engineers across various AV domains (Builds, Events, Studio) when required.
  • Provide live event technical support acting as a member of the AV crew, providing pre-production through post-production and operating production equipment.
  • Help with commissioning and handover of all new conference, specialty, studio, and event spaces in the LA area.
  • Promote cross-functional partnerships with Netflix teams working in-region.
  • Be open to both international and domestic travel.
    • Skills for Success:
  • Experience supporting and managing vendors in corporate and studio AV environments
  • Proficiency with Enterprise VC solutions (preferably Google Meet, but also Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Bluejeans, Cisco Telepresence, etc.)—both hardware and software, and administrative fleet management.
  • Experience with AV integration on the integrator and/or corporate side, with a focus on the physical installation.
  • Experience designing and building meeting spaces from the ground up, including acoustics, lighting, and technology, is a plus.
  • Experience operating and supporting live events (corporate, hospitality, or other major event venues).
  • Capability to configure and troubleshoot audio and video equipment in corporate settings or during live events.
  • Understanding of networking technology, video transmission over networks, and audio/video signal flow.
  • Experience working with Crestron equipment, audio DSP’s, and Dante/AES microphone systems.
  • Demonstrated project management experience with large projects, strong organizational skills, and ability to maintain and create standards.
  • Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision; must be a self-motivated self-starter capable of implementing ideas and owning work.
  • Experience in collaborating with and managing a variety of vendors, suppliers, and integrators.
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and projects, forecast upcoming project and business needs.
  • Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and implement them in a fast-paced environment.
  • Experience building and maintaining cross-functional partnerships with internal and external teams.
  • Strong organizational skills and familiarity with inventory management protocols.
  • Proficiency with Google Suite tools.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: It's an exciting time at Netflix as we continue to expand our business globally. We are revolutionizing the way people watch their favorite shows and movies, and building our own library of original Netflix content for all to enjoy. Visit our Culture Memo and Long-Term View to learn more about our unique Netflix culture and our bold goals for the future. This position is part of the Talent Experience and Operations (TEO) team based in Amsterdam, which designs and runs the infrastructure and operations to deliver an outstanding employee experience throughout the full lifecycle of Netflix employees in the local market. This hire will be a key player, interacting with employees daily to address their employment questions and needs. The role supports the main functions within the ES Generalist team: onboarding, offboarding, Mobility, leaves of absence & Benefits. This position will be expected to be highly independent and proactive in identifying and implementing positive improvements in the employee experience, aligned with our culture, in the local market and across the region. Responsibilities Provide EMEA-based employees with an incredible employee experience aligned with our Culture Organize and facilitate new hire orientation(s) while partnering closely with our IT and Workplace services Identify and implement improvements across our Talent systems, tools and workflows that result in increased efficiency Provide educational, operational and administrative front-facing support with day-to-day and ad hoc requests and inquiries throughout the employee lifecycle such as onboarding, offboarding, leaves of absence, data management and internal transfers Help employees to fully understand their benefits and liaise with our Benefits team regarding complex and tricky care inquiries Partner with our Benefits team to triage and resolve claims while ensuring accurate data flows are maintained on our benefit records Partner with our Talent and Employment Legal department in reviewing compliance requirements and their implementation Work closely with the Talent team to provide operational support for local development and HR programs Support and provide insights into the broader Talent organization using data and analytics Experience 3-5 years of HR experience in a dynamic fast-moving environment. Proven knowledge of employment and labor laws & compliance for the EMEA countries, in familiarity with any of the following countries, United Kingdom, Netherlands, France, Italy, Spain, Poland and Germany. Ability to work across multiple systems, including Workday and Zendesk, while maintaining confidentiality and discretion. Ability to work independently and collaboratively with the team in a fast-paced environment with varied projects. Creative problem solver and critical thinker who approaches work with a positive can-do attitude and thrives in ambiguity Excellent judgment with a high level of attention to detail and accuracy. Demonstrated ability to drive improvements and continuously simplify workflows. Strong organizational and communication skills. You are comfortable working in a culture that values candor, transparency, and courage. Fluent in English. Ideally also fluent in Dutch, German, Spanish, French, Italian, Polish and/or Turkish. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Partner Engineering team at Netflix delivers and maintains the high-quality Netflix experience on hundreds of millions of televisions and set-top boxes around the world. We are expanding our engineering team in Netflix's Amsterdam office. In this role, you will serve as the technical interface between Netflix and the engineering teams of our MVPD operator partners in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa. You will both represent Netflix engineering to our partners and represent the partner, and their needs and interests, to other teams at Netflix. A significant portion of our subscriber growth comes through our operator partnerships in Europe, meaning your work will contribute concretely to the continued success of Netflix. We want to delight our customers with a service that just works, always. This requires our engineers to have a truly full-stack understanding of the Netflix experience, from playback device architecture to the design and implementation of our B2B payment APIs. You will be successful at this job if you have a strong foundation in software engineering with experience building complete systems, enjoy communicating complex ideas to other people, and have a strong desire to find creative solutions to repetitive tasks, reducing effort for Netflix and our partners. The job expectations are broad: one day you will be diagnosing a playback issue detected on a particular device by reading device logs and comparing it to the source code, on another day you will be triaging a partner's payment glitch by examining the behavior of REST API calls. The job is not coding on a regular basis, like a traditional software engineering role, but we expect our engineers to have a strong foundation in software engineering so they can engage with our internal and external engineering teams and implement technical solutions with our partners as a respected technical peer. Our unique company culture and values are essential to the way the Partner Experience team operates. Learn more about the Netflix culture here . To learn more about our teams, listen to this podcast or check out our tech blog for a case study from the team. What you will be doing: Work with partners to integrate, test, deploy, and improve the Netflix streaming application, content discovery APIs and billing integration APIs over the entire device lifecycle using Netflix tools and data. Manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables over multiple partner engagements. Test partner devices, which includes black-box testing using our in-house testing suite. Collaborate with our data analytics team to discover, triage, and resolve post-launch playback issues and payment services API issues. Represent the needs and feedback of our partners with headquarters product and engineering teams in California. Recognize opportunities for improvement in process or tooling and implement changes to deliver the same or better quality with less effort. Build and maintain our engineering relationships with Netflix partners. Ability and willingness to travel to Netflix’s Los Gatos, CA headquarters, as well as regular regional EMEA partners when required. What we are looking for: BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Electrical, or equivalent practical experience. Experience with streaming devices, embedded devices and other small systems (set-top boxes). Experience with backend API (Rest/GraphQL) and B2B API integration 7+ years of experience in one or more of C/C++, Java, or Go. Experience in SQL, Python, and JavaScript is a plus. Experience with streaming device operating systems (Linux, Android) and middleware. Experience working with external partners or multiple internal stakeholders to implement complex systems. Demonstrated history of delivering on full development lifecycle and multiple successful releases. English proficiency is required. Additional proficiency in French, Arabic and/or Spanish will be highly valued. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is building a new internal game studio to incubate and build a new class of hilarious, social party video games. This Gameplay / Feature Engineer will work with the Lead Engineer and a cross-discipline core team to rapidly prototype and iterate towards a new game vision, building confidence on a great game prototype to eventually bring to full production and available to Netflix members. The role is envisioned as one that will start as a core contributor for a small team to enable rapid prototyping, which is hoped to eventually graduate to a full product team as the game vision matures The ideal candidate should have game prototyping experience, and have product and design sensibilities, while being able to implement in the short term and bring industry-leading technical expertise as the product matures, looking forward to larger engineering, architecture and technology selection. You’ll be joining a small, scrappy team with big ambitions, and an obsession to create memorable game moments that leave players telling their own stories for years to come. We’re looking for new teammates who care deeply about the experiences they create and the people they make them with. Those who bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. Responsibilities Gameplay / Feature Development: Work hands-on with a small core, cross-functional team to prototype multiplayer social game concepts, in a fast-paced, iterative environment that will eventually graduate to a live game. Work closely with lead engineer and designer to implement design ideas into rapid prototype implementation, with a thoughtful mix of tooling and hands-on direct implementation, and eventually come up with production-ready code and systems. Requirements 3+ years experience as a gameplay or feature engineer Expertise with Unity Expertise with C# and .NET Familiarity with multiplayer game development Exceptional communication, cross-discipline collaboration skills Passion for making video games, especially in a rapid, focused, smaller form vs multi-year investments Bonus Skills Experience building games for early or unfinished platforms and services Experience with rapid prototyping, with an emphasis with rapid learning Deep experience in games with design sensibilities Familiarity with backend services utilizing REST APIs Familiarity with NoSql database like DynamoDB Location Los Angeles, CA/remote Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $90,000 - $600,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Join Netflix at this exciting time as we continue to revolutionize entertainment. Each month, we deliver billions of hours of content to over 260 million members in more than 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world, and we achieve this by swiftly building and reliably scaling innovative experiences for our members and creators around the globe. Our Infrastructure organization is vital to this mission, serving as the backbone for Netflix’s growing scale and boosting engineering productivity. We enhance the agility, efficiency, and reliability of our cloud infrastructure across compute, networking, and storage. We minimize time spent on infrastructure management and undifferentiated heavy lifting, streamlining developer workflows and reducing toil. This allows our engineers to concentrate on what truly matters: helping Netflix entertain the world. The Opportunity We are seeking a Principal Product Manager to drive the evolution of our networking platform. Your mission is to ensure a robust, agile platform that is reliable, efficient, secure, and scalable to meet the ever-evolving needs of the business. You will simplify networking for end users and enhance infrastructure agility by driving Network as a Service. Your contributions will significantly shape the future of networking at Netflix. In this pivotal role, you will shape the product vision and strategy across the entire networking stack, forging strong partnerships with your engineering teams and key stakeholders. This role spans L3 to L7 networking, from networking primitives to edge gateways processing millions of requests per second: - Edge Services: Handle access control, DDoS mitigations, origin protections, real-time traffic inspection, dynamic routing, load shedding, and push notifications to millions of client devices. - Service Communication: Ensure a secure, reliable service mesh with intelligent service discovery, traffic management, observability, and enhanced features for load balancing, retry policies, rate limiting, circuit breaking, and more, reducing application complexity and improving performance. - Traffic Management: Dynamically steer, shape, and shift traffic within and across regions and externally to balance latency, availability, and cost. - Network Design & Topology: Design and manage the network, ensuring secure and efficient configuration and placement of elements and low-level primitives such as VPCs, load balancers, DNS, and subnets/IP management, aiming for a seamless user experience. - Network Observability: Provide a comprehensive network observability platform for monitoring, analysis, troubleshooting, and reporting on network topology, health, and performance. What You Will Do Deeply understand customer needs, product analytics, and industry innovation to drive the product vision and strategy for Networking, maximizing business and customer impact Partner closely with senior management and engineering teams to define and align with stakeholders on vision, strategy, and roadmaps Develop product roadmaps in partnership with relevant product and engineering teams that execute on product vision and strategy and inform our engineering teams of what problems need to be solved Foster a metrics-driven environment that encourages quality experimentation and sets high standards for measuring product success Stay informed about industry advancements, influence their direction, and conduct comprehensive buy vs. build analysis to align with state-of-the-art solutions, encouraging ROI-based decisions Foster a collaborative environment with Netflix engineers, creating continuous feedback loops to ensure we're solving the right problems and driving maximum impact for Netflix Exhibit robust problem-solving and decision-making skills, tackling both technical and strategic challenges in innovative ways, and leveraging both data and intuition to make strategic choices in the face of ambiguity and complexity Ensure thoughtful product evolution that addresses product lifecycle and adoption experience Help evolve our customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning/roadmapping practices What We’re Looking For 8+ years of experience as a Technical Product Manager Demonstrated expertise and passion in networking and developer experience Proven track record of managing & evolving a product portfolio and driving product vision & strategy A healthy blend of deep technical knowledge with customer-focused mindset and empathy Strategic thinker that can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about end-to-end experience Ability to manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success Leverages product intuition and judgment to solve problems and make decisions without perfect information Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’ Excellent communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations More About Cloud Infrastructure @ Netflix eBPF Flow Logs at Scale for Network Insight & Enrich VPC flow logs at Hyperscale Titus, Netflix container management platform Evolution of Edge @Netflix Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices Open Sourcing Zuul 2 Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $340,000 - $975,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We enhance the agility, efficiency, and reliability of our cloud infrastructure across compute, networking, and storage. We minimize time spent on infrastructure management and undifferentiated heavy lifting, streamlining developer workflows and reducing toil. This allows our engineers to concentrate on what truly matters: helping Netflix entertain the world. The Opportunity We are seeking a Principal Product Manager to drive the evolution of our networking platform. Your mission is to ensure a robust, agile platform that is reliable, efficient, secure, and scalable to meet the ever-evolving needs of the business. You will simplify networking for end users and enhance infrastructure agility by driving Network as a Service. Your contributions will significantly shape the future of networking at Netflix. In this pivotal role, you will shape the product vision and strategy across the entire networking stack, forging strong partnerships with your engineering teams and key stakeholders. This role spans L3 to L7 networking, from networking primitives to edge gateways processing millions of requests per second: - Edge Services: Handle access control, DDoS mitigations, origin protections, real-time traffic inspection, dynamic routing, load shedding, and push notifications to millions of client devices. - Service Communication: Ensure a secure, reliable service mesh with intelligent service discovery, traffic management, observability, and enhanced features for load balancing, retry policies, rate limiting, circuit breaking, and more, reducing application complexity and improving performance. - Traffic Management: Dynamically steer, shape, and shift traffic within and across regions and externally to balance latency, availability, and cost. - Network Design & Topology: Design and manage the network, ensuring secure and efficient configuration and placement of elements and low-level primitives such as VPCs, load balancers, DNS, and subnets/IP management, aiming for a seamless user experience. - Network Observability: Provide a comprehensive network observability platform for monitoring, analysis, troubleshooting, and reporting on network topology, health, and performance. What You Will Do
  • Deeply understand customer needs, product analytics, and industry innovation to drive the product vision and strategy for Networking, maximizing business and customer impact
  • Partner closely with senior management and engineering teams to define and align with stakeholders on vision, strategy, and roadmaps
  • Develop product roadmaps in partnership with relevant product and engineering teams that execute on product vision and strategy and inform our engineering teams of what problems need to be solved
  • Foster a metrics-driven environment that encourages quality experimentation and sets high standards for measuring product success
  • Stay informed about industry advancements, influence their direction, and conduct comprehensive buy vs. build analysis to align with state-of-the-art solutions, encouraging ROI-based decisions
  • Foster a collaborative environment with Netflix engineers, creating continuous feedback loops to ensure we're solving the right problems and driving maximum impact for Netflix
  • Exhibit robust problem-solving and decision-making skills, tackling both technical and strategic challenges in innovative ways, and leveraging both data and intuition to make strategic choices in the face of ambiguity and complexity
  • Ensure thoughtful product evolution that addresses product lifecycle and adoption experience
  • Help evolve our customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning/roadmapping practices
    • What We’re Looking For
  • 8+ years of experience as a Technical Product Manager
  • Demonstrated expertise and passion in networking and developer experience
  • Proven track record of managing & evolving a product portfolio and driving product vision & strategy
  • A healthy blend of deep technical knowledge with customer-focused mindset and empathy
  • Strategic thinker that can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about end-to-end experience
  • Ability to manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision
  • Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success
  • Leverages product intuition and judgment to solve problems and make decisions without perfect information
  • Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’
  • Excellent communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations
    • More About Cloud Infrastructure @ Netflix eBPF Flow Logs at Scale for Network Insight & Enrich VPC flow logs at Hyperscale Titus, Netflix container management platform Evolution of Edge @Netflix Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices Open Sourcing Zuul 2 Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $340,000 - $975,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment by producing, distributing, and streaming content at a massive scale. Over 260 million members around the world are currently enjoying more than two billion hours per month of original series, documentaries and feature films. Visit our Long-Term View to learn more. The Team The Privacy Engineering Operations team ensures safe & efficient data use across Netflix. We work closely with our stunning colleagues in Legal in providing privacy engineering guidance, support and assurance throughout the company. We are a growing team with tremendous visibility and impact, and with Netflix’s culture of  “Freedom and Responsibility” you’ll decide how to best use your talents and time. The Role We are looking for the next senior Privacy Engineer to join the team! You’ll join an established team of stunning colleagues in executing our privacy programs covering highly important areas such as individual rights and data holds. This is a truly unique role combining technical privacy challenges with cross-functional complexities related to global, large-scale privacy programs. In this role you will have a front row seat to Netflix’s new product features and plans. You will take legal and regulatory expectations and translate them into actionable requirements, designs and roadmaps. You’ll get to work on data at a large scale, using data protection, minimization and de-identification methods to provide the best possible outcomes for Netflix and our customers. You will get to use your technical privacy domain expertise as well as program management practices in influencing both what we do as well as how we do it. This role offers a chance to make a real impact in Entertaining the World . If you're up for the challenge, we'd love to hear from you! Desired Background: You’re passionate about privacy and data protection! You have 5+ years of experience in solving complex privacy problems with technical, business, regulatory or organizational constraints (most likely either as a Privacy Engineer or Technical Program Manager). You have a strong subject matter expertise in supporting products or businesses in privacy topics such as data collection, usage and deletion. You’re familiar with Privacy Enhancing Technologies and know why & when to apply them in practice. You’re comfortable in operating and making decisions in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment. You’re an effective communicator across cross-functional stakeholders. You have experience in working with large scale data assets, including querying and analyzing data. Stunning colleagues come from different education levels and backgrounds. The Netflix culture determines who we hire, how we work together and how we make decisions. You will be surrounded by great colleagues and empowered to produce your best work. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across various genres and languages. Members can watch or play as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. The Search Systems team builds the backend systems that help millions of members globally find and discover content they’ll love via Search, Voice UI, and other interactive experiences in the Netflix product. The Opportunity: We are looking for a strong technical lead for the new Search & Recommendations innovation initiative, which is a strategic bet for our business. You will play a highly cross-functional role, partnering with other engineers, product management, machine learning, and data teams to take Netflix’s ML/AI initiatives in the Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) domain to the next level. If you have a passion for building scalable, robust systems, are interested in pushing the envelope in applying LLMs to advance the state-of-the-art Search & Recommendation experience, and operate in a critical part of the stack that strongly influences what our customers see on their screens, then we want to talk to you. What we are looking for: You have proven expertise in building and operating high-traffic distributed systems for search and/or discovery experiences. You are self-driven and highly motivated to deliver top-tier solutions while navigating highly ambiguous environments and can execute 0-1 projects. You are excited to work in a multidisciplinary environment (engineering, algorithms, data engineering/science, product experimentation) and have experience leading projects with 3-4 other engineers. You are comfortable working in a hybrid team with partners distributed across (US) geographies & time zones. You are willing to take broad ownership of team responsibilities (building roadmaps, scoping, and task breakdown). You are a proactive, effective communicator and have a strong bias towards action. You are experienced working with the public cloud like AWS, Azure, or GCP. At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $100,000 - $720,000. This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our benefits here . Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Location: Los Gatos Strong Recommendation: Please submit your portfolio (w/password) in your application We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our Monetization team at Netflix. The Monetization team is responsible for striking the balance between business goals and consumer needs, with revenue being our ultimate priority. The Monetization XD team is focused on crafting innovative and performant experiences for ads growth, global plans & pricing, and new revenue models. Each product designer on the team has a broad set of skills ranging from product thinking to interaction design, user research, and visual communication. We are masters of our craft but aren’t afraid to wear multiple hats when needed. Our mission is to turn every Netflix non-member and member into an informed, delighted, and satisfied Netflix customer. As a senior-level Product Designer, you will collaborate closely with other seasoned product and content designers, product managers, consumer insight researchers, engineers, and stakeholders to go after one of the most impactful and challenging initiatives at Netflix. You will be a great fit if you have 10+ years of Product Design experience with a preference for taking consumer products from zero to one and scaling products from one to one hundred million. Extensive experience working with web and native mobile products. TV UI experience is a big plus. Experiences working with algo-driving products. Deep understanding of the technicality of algo-powered user experience. Top-notch design craft and ability to rapidly ideate and produce design concepts Top communication skills to clearly articulate and defend your design while making trade-offs with complex product and policy definitions. Ability to wear a Product Manager’s hat by thinking through the lens of business impact. A willingness to fail and learn. Earnest, mature, and ego-free. You welcome candid feedback and can constructively give it as well. Why work at Netflix? If you want to have a large impact at a growing company and work with a high-performance team. Work with talented colleagues on challenging problems that affect 250+ million members across the globe. We value high performance, freedom, and responsibility. We don't focus on rules, processes, or procedures. We are candid and transparent and seek excellence in all that we do. We tackle hard problems that others have yet to be able to solve. We produce great content, build systems at scale, and use data to push the business forward. We connect people with visual storytelling globally. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $200,000-$700,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. Netflix members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they are able to download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced  Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to one of Netflix’s most quickly-growing areas by driving key strategic deals in mobile gaming partnerships.  The ideal candidate will have deep experience with strategic negotiations and analysis, a highly-attuned product sense, as well as a strong background in sourcing, evaluating and executing against high-valued mobile game partnership deals.  As a business development leader, you will be responsible for guiding programming strategies, defining the right rules of engagement, collaborating with Netflix’s senior leadership on the Company's growth strategy across all of its Gaming businesses, and helping scale the value proposition of Netflix gaming via the right set of partners. You will work closely with game production, live-ops, internal development, creative design, product, strategy and analytics, legal, among others, to deliver results. Responsibilities Evaluate, negotiate, and close key licensing deals across casual and mid-core mobile game content that will help grow the footprint of Netflix Gaming with creators and developers of all sizes. Demonstrate fluency in the most complex legal and business issues in contracts and develop creative win-win solutions with our partners. Analyze markets and synthesize recommendations into actionable sourcing plans. Collaborate with our Transmedia team to help expand Netflix’s ever-growing IP catalog in the digital gaming space via key strategic mobile partnerships with top global gaming companies. Be agile and execute across a quickly evolving range of products. Collaborate with a broad range of internal constituents to help define go-to-market strategies and drive sign-off from internal leadership. Qualifications Strong experience sourcing in a gaming environment with a demonstrated track record of helping drive a broad range of mobile-focused game partnership deals. High-level expertise in negotiation and deal construction including the legal aspects of negotiations. Knowledge of current and developing industry trends in the mobile market, awareness of competitors, and new business opportunities. Exceptional analytical abilities with a deep knowledge of live services and F2P gaming business models (experience working at game subscription services preferred). Experience learning quickly about new technologies and distilling information into actionable insights for internal stakeholders. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and an ability to effectively build relationships with internal and external partners. Experience successfully navigating a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $610,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with 260+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. We are pursuing consumer products because we believe it will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content and in effect, drive long-term value. We want merchandise, interactive games, and experiences to help promote our titles and build them into title brands, or franchises, so they become part of the zeitgeist for longer periods of time. That’s where you come in, we’re seeking a Retail Specialist to support our consumer products growth ambitions in France. You will work closely with your manager as well as with the cross-functional teams locally and regionally to deploy a retail strategy and needed tools/resources aiming for successful retail projects. The overall goal is to ensure that Netflix’s consumer products are an extension of title brand campaigns and to deliver on our promise to create fan joy at the right destination. Mission To successfully strategize and permeate Netflix licensing programs across major retailers in France  (i.e. mass-market, specialty and online) and deliver best-in-class retail tentpoles. Job Description (Objectives) Foundation & Strategy: Laying out the strategy through DTR and/or retail development and continue building retailers' relationship Management & prioritisation: Inform retailers about Netflix's upcoming content, products and provide necessary tools for them to be autonomous Revenue maximization: Analyse and scale business opportunities through category analysis, as well as identifying key revenue drivers throughout the year Planning & Trade Marketing: Plan the launch-to-market programs as well as potential cross-category retail activations with key stakeholders both retailers and licensees Cross-functional support: create and leverage best-retail practices from other countries/regions - UCAN, LATAM, APAC and EMEA into local market and vice-versa What we are looking for Demonstrated, 8+ years of experience in retail industry with brands and/or content IPs with proven results Ownership of relationship with retailers across buying, marketing and category management, solid retail network Knowledge on operational marketing / omnichannel approach Agile, goal-oriented, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge Data performance analysis Cross-functional teamwork knowledge, how to navigate and connect the dots Retail business knowledge across different tiers from Mass-market, specialty to online Trade marketing and retail activations experience Economies of scale mindset Passion for innovation Proactive and creativity at its core Entrepreneurial and and fast-growing competency Adaptable to multiple changes and speed A natural and deep affection for film, television and or brands Deep engagement competency and ability to work with multiple, disparate stakeholders to achieve the best outcome for Netflix. You can read more about our company culture here. French/ English (mandatory) We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Team You’ll be Joining: Photo & AV Studio UK The Photo & AV Studio team has the enviable position of straddling two worlds in the entertainment industry: Photo & AV asset creation & global communication strategy. We specialize in capturing and creating photo & video assets that shape, enhance and support our publicity campaigns for our Netflix content including Series, Films, and Non-Fiction (Documentaries & Reality). Simply put, we produce the content that compels people to watch our shows through earned media! We tell the story before the audience can watch the story. The Role The role requires a high level of operation, creativity, strategic thinking, judgment, an inquisitive mind, innovative and self motivated personality, and a succinct communicator with a strong project management background. Being a team player with a positive attitude and willingness to be flexible and get the job done is essential, as is the ability to strategically plan and execute multiple projects simultaneously to support on PR campaigns, driven by A/V materials, for Netflix titles - photography, videos, the next big thing. Our content stands out and makes an impact on the industry and consumers alike, compelling them to watch Netflix content. What photos will ensure a magazine spread? What video will get audiences and publishers excited about a new show? How do we make a talking head interview visually pop? How can we be smart and tell different stories across different countries through visual assets? How do we  engage with our audience in a space in which they consume their content whether it be short form videos on social media platforms such as Tik Tok or Instagram or long form platforms such as YT. You’ll be working with TV/film productions, talent, filmmakers and publicity events as part of the Netflix PR team in the UK. Building relationships as well as working autonomously in a fast paced environment will be key to success. We don’t focus on job titles at Netflix but rather hire outstanding high performers who act responsibly on the resources and freedom they are given to do their work. The ideal candidate will use sound judgment to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their colleagues to do the same. Read our culture memo to learn more. This job is based in London and reports to the Senior Manger, Photo & AV Studio, UK. Responsibilities of the role include: Develop and execute publicity assets campaign strategy, per project/title, to capture, produce and utilise creative material to enhance and support the campaign throughout its lifecycle Lead on Medium & Large priority titles as Global Lead for Photo & AV Oversee a slate of projects that include several original films, series  and documentaries Drive communication with your UK, Regional and Global campaign publicist counterparts, marketing/social teams, showrunners/filmmakers and talent reps Hire and oversee unit photographers and video crews, including script and schedule review and communication with production Produce strong creative materials that shape and enhance the overall publicity campaign Assist with the asset management and servicing of material Oversee photography/video needs for premieres, events and photo shoots Manage budgets Skills and Requirements: 8+ years experience working across visual asset creation, publicity, publishing or communications Strategic thought-partner Strong team player Confident and articulate communicator Detai;-oriented with strong time management skills Strong eye for producing visual assets Ability to handle high volume of complex projects and tasks for multiple people and departments simultaneously and manage competing priorities Must be able to work independently, make sound decisions, think strategically, and maintain accuracy and attention to detail Must possess solid organizational skills, effective time management and excellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate effectively with internal and external teams Understanding and interest in copyright laws, usage licenses and embargoes Understanding of the photography/video industry. Strong knowledge in digital file specs & size formats Experience working in a global team is preferred A commitment to embrace and advocate for inclusion is essential Good to have: A varied network made of different types of creatives: Photographers, Videographers, Editors… Experience with the Adobe Suite, particularly Premiere Pro We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix aspires to provide great entertainment for people everywhere from the world's best creators across movies, TV series, documentaries, comedy and more. Our members have control over what they watch, when and where.  It's an amazing time to join the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment. If you are a talented screenings executive with a passion for content and entertainment, keep reading! About the Role The Screening Specialist is a role within the Screenings team responsible for the creation of the media that plays at premieres, festivals and other external Netflix screenings. They work closely with Post Production, Title Ops, Globalization, Public Relations and Screenings Leads to ensure the highest quality assets are created. In addition to asset creation, they manage technical coordination efforts for screenings and theatrical distribution. In essence, they will be responsible for the creation, coordination and on-site experience for screenings and theatrical distribution of Netflix content. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of digital cinema packages and media creation. They will have expertise in post production, theatrical screenings and distribution/operations with experience working on promotional events where flexibility is crucial for success.  They will be able to communicate technical information to both a technical and non-technical audience. The Work Creation of Screening Assets including but not limited to: DCPs, Media Files (h264 and Apple ProRes), DVDs/BDs, viewing links, and more. Work closely with Screenings and Post teams to anticipate asset needs in advance of incoming screening requests Familiarizing themselves with their assigned titles to anticipate potential issues (aspect ratios, forced narratives) Familiarizing themselves with the associated title campaigns to better anticipate and prioritize timelines, budgets and workload Building and tracking asset delivery timelines to ensure assets are completed in advance of relevant campaign dates and incoming screening requests Communicate effectively with various cross functional teams to ensure proper planning, availability and delivery of material Maintain, curate and expand a global network of digital cinema mastering and distribution facilities; and technical vendors Liaise with filmmakers to complete cuts/edits necessary for the creation of screening assets, as well as coordinate the proper QC of a final asset Conduct qualitative review of the created files to ensure they are correct and meet the creation specifications Manage scheduling, tracking, and verification of international deliveries of screenings, festivals, and theatrical assets to venues. Manage digital cinema audio/visual engineers at premieres and special screenings Troubleshooting file based delivery and creation issues in a quick and constructive manner Availability to troubleshoot issues on nights and weekends as needed The Candidate Proven screenings experience of 5+ years within a studio, network or media services company Strong working knowledge of digital cinema (DCPs, KDMs/DKDMs, theatrical aspect ratios) Knowledge of digital audio and video file formats and creation software (Resolve, FCP, Avid, Adobe) Knowledge of Post Production Imaging (Color Space, DI, P3 vs Rec709) and Sound Workflows (Nearfield and Theatrical mixes) Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both UHD/4K, HDR, 2K, Dolby Atmos, Vision, 7.1 and 5.1 audio formats Ability to handle a heavy volume of work, supervising several projects in tandem Effective in dealing with external vendors, agencies and internal stakeholders Excellent organizational skills, awareness of deadlines and high attention to detail. Meticulous about the details and thorough, completes tasks and follows up Strong communication skills both written and verbal, sensitive to cultural nuances and D&I aspects Creative problem solving abilities A proactive and positive thinker and a constant contributor to the team Ability to work well under pressure while remaining flexible and nimble. Scrappy, resourceful and relentless in trying to find a solution Curious to innovate to make the work better - interest in developing best practice and streamlining administrative processes which can simplify how we work Proficient knowledge of Google Suite and are quick to learn and adapt with new systems Excellent communication in English Experience working in the Asia-Pacific region Experience working with on promotional events; and  theatrical distribution and operations The Netflix culture attracts talents who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read our culture memo . If it resonates with you, maybe you’re the right person to join our team.

  • Ability to handle a heavy volume of work, supervising several projects in tandem
  • Effective in dealing with external vendors, agencies and internal stakeholders 
  • Excellent organizational skills, awareness of deadlines and high attention to detail. Meticulous about the details and thorough, completes tasks and follows up  
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal, sensitive to cultural nuances and D&I aspects
  • Creative problem solving abilities
  • A proactive and positive thinker and a constant contributor to the team
  • Ability to work well under pressure while remaining flexible and nimble. Scrappy, resourceful and relentless in trying to find a solution 
  • Curious to innovate to make the work better - interest in developing best practice and streamlining administrative processes which can simplify how we work
  • Proficient knowledge of Google Suite and are quick to learn and adapt with new systems
  • Excellent communication in English
  • Experience working in the Asia-Pacific region
  • Experience working with on promotional events; and  theatrical distribution and operations

description: Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Team We are searching for experienced administrative assistants to support the leaders within our dynamic Content Operations Organization. This team supports the larger group’s objectives by connecting different parts of the business across the pitch-to-play ecosystem. We do this by identifying synergies across Regions, verticals, and functions when solving shared problems, communicating consistently, measuring progress, and helping to improve workflows and ways of working. The Role We are looking for people who are self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, positive, and able to pivot when necessary. Much like the teams you will support, this is a demanding and fast-moving role that requires someone proactive and solution-oriented with a mind towards helping the success of the team and thinking about the needs of the individuals they support.  We are looking for someone who is excited about the content we make and is excited about playing an important role to support our Content Operations team. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Proactive management of calendars for the leader and their team, including scheduling internal and external meetings Book, manage, and coordinate logistics for team meetings, events, and offsites Assist in booking travel when needed Creating presentations and documents using Google Suite Sitting in on meetings and taking notes Processing extensive expense reports in a timely manner The ability to assist with team projects and events as needed Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in an Administrative Assistant or Executive Assistant capacity Proficiency in Google: Gmail, Google Calendar, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Groups Strong written and verbal communication skills Independent worker with strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and balance multiple projects and switch easily between tasks Displays professionalism in communication with internal and external partners Responsive and able to work flexibly across multiple time zones Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Strong judgment and ability to make decisions quickly Strong attention to detail at all times Team-player who operates in a fast-paced, team-oriented setting Able to stay calm under pressure and work on short deadlines Tech-savvy is a huge plus Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status.
