description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We’re looking for a seasoned Principal Counsel to join the Product & Tech Legal Team as part of the Consumer Product Group. This role reports to the Senior Director, Product & Tech Legal (Consumer) and is based in Los Gatos. To entertain the world is no small task, so we rely on really smart people who know a lot about how technology and data can create great content and high-quality member experiences globally. Our mission as a Consumer Product Legal team is to empower product innovation at Netflix by delivering impactful, effective legal support. We don’t sit in a dark corner of the Upside Down holding a giant ‘no’ stamp; we are an integrated part of product development, partnering with our product managers, stakeholders, designers, engineers and data scientists from ideation to launch. We drive strategic, effective collaboration with cross-functional and regional legal partners and think critically about how we can keep scaling the impact of our team. As Principal Counsel, you are passionate about helping our business partners discern a practical real-world risk from a theoretical one. You have the diplomatic skills to unite people together and guide them through impasses by fostering confidence. You thrive in a loosely-coupled world where thoughtfulness and creativity govern, not rule. Responsibilities Working closely with product, design, and engineering teams to understand and assess risks for new consumer-facing experiences, from ideation to launch Providing risk-calibrated legal guidance to support consumer product innovation, counseling the business on privacy, IP, consumer protection and other issues while coordinating with subject matter experts as needed Coordinating with stakeholder partners (including cross-functional, cross-regional, and specialist teams) to share context on product and legal strategy, ensuring we are supporting stakeholder needs effectively Becoming an expert on our consumer product to help ensure we remain helpful thought partners and advance business objectives Helping to scale our team and legal organization by developing innovative processes to support the above Requirements 7+ years of experience in product legal roles, working directly with product managers, engineers, and designers to provide practical and risk-calibrated legal guidance Deep experience counseling on consumer protection, privacy, IP, marketing and other issues Strong track record demonstrating a collaborative approach, effective communication skills, and excellent legal/business judgment Strategic and creative thinker who thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment characterized by ambiguity Demonstrated curiosity and ability to master new areas of tech and law Preferred Experience with consumer-facing digital products/services, in particular with AI/ML innovation. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $180,000 - $690,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 260 million members in over 190 countries. To entertain the world, we must rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe. Our Developer Platform is central to this approach, providing a comprehensive experience across the entire software lifecycle, from development to delivery to operations to maintenance. More than just a set of tools, the platform is designed to streamline the development process, making it more efficient and less burdensome. By evolving with the needs of our developers and business, the platform maximizes the efficiency and effectiveness of Netflix engineers, increasing their overall impact. The Opportunity We are looking for a Director of Product to drive the evolution of our Developer Platform. Your mission is to offer best-in-class experiences that empower and delight our software engineers, and simplify and accelerate their developer experience. You will lead the overall product vision and strategy for our Developer Platform, managing a team of experienced technical product managers who are responsible for different product domains within the platform. This pivotal role enables Netflix engineers to focus on our core mission: entertaining the world. Your contributions will directly shape the future of development, influencing how we innovate and deliver entertainment to millions worldwide. Our Developer Platform offers a comprehensive suite of tools and services encompassing the entire software development lifecycle. These include: Developer Experience : We provide a unified front door, the Netflix Console, for easy software and infrastructure management. This includes product discovery, learning, provisioning workflows, software catalog, inventory management, change campaigns, and core services like search. Developer Foundations: We optimize the inner development loop to keep developers in the flow, with development environments and tools like IDEs, source code management, repository management, project initialization, and CLIs. Application Development: We optimize application development by providing tools, frameworks, and libraries for specific personas and use cases (e.g., backend, frontend), including code authoring, build, test, and debug workflows, build systems, test frameworks, and more. Continuous Integration & Delivery: We ensure safe delivery of changes from commit to production with robust, seamless integration of changes, delivery workflows and pipelines, global deployment orchestration, safe delivery and rollbacks, and fleetwide change orchestration. Reliability & Resiliency: We ensure operational excellence and highly reliable, resilient, scalable systems with incident management and product readiness tools, testing frameworks, automation, reporting & insights, and product infrastructure experimentation (e.g., canaries, shadow traffic, performance testing, failure injection testing, chaos experiments, etc). Observability: We enable rapid issue detection and remediation with telemetry ingestion, storage, and querying of metrics, events, logs, and traces, monitoring and alerting, remediation, system health exploration and troubleshooting, and profiling and diagnostic tools. Examples of opportunities that you and your PMs might tackle include unifying the developer experience, providing holistic end-to-end workflows, managing more for users through higher levels of abstraction, reducing toil, optimizing cycle times, defining how we measure developer experience and productivity, and ensuring we provide best-in-industry tooling. The scope and impact of these roles is significant. You and your PMs will be responsible for managing a portfolio of products and driving holistic product strategy and prioritization across them. Product Management is a newer team within Platform Engineering, and we're on a mission to elevate product thinking across the organization. This unique opportunity allows you to shape our product management practices and contribute significantly to our evolution. If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of developer experience at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you! What You Will Do Deeply understand customer needs, product analytics, and industry innovation to drive the product vision and strategy for Developer Platform, maximizing business and customer impact Lead, mentor, inspire, and grow a high-performance team of technical product managers, developing strategies, roadmaps, and specifications that prioritize the most impactful opportunities Collaborate with senior management to align vision, strategy, success metrics, and roadmaps Foster a collaborative environment with Netflix engineers, creating continuous feedback loops to ensure we're solving the right problems and driving maximum impact for Netflix Stay informed about industry advancements, influence their direction, and conduct comprehensive buy vs. build analysis to align with state-of-the-art solutions, encouraging ROI-based decisions Foster a metrics-driven environment that encourages quality experimentation and sets high standards for measuring product success Exhibit robust problem-solving and decision-making skills, tackling both technical and strategic challenges in innovative ways, and leveraging both data and intuition to make strategic choices in the face of ambiguity and complexity Ensure thoughtful product evolution that addresses product lifecycle and adoption experience Help evolve Platform Engineering’s customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning practices Collaborate with other product leaders across Platform Engineering and Netflix to evolve our practices and competencies in technical product management What We’re Looking For At least 5 years of experience managing a team of senior and staff technical product managers as a Director of Product, Group Product Manager, or similar role Proven track record of leading and scaling teams, managing and evolving a product portfolio, and driving product vision and strategy Deep technical knowledge paired with a customer-focused mindset and empathy. Experience working on developer platforms with a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and passion for developer experience and productivity Strategic thinker who can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about end-to-end experience Ability to manage a portfolio of projects, balancing short-term goals with long-term vision in a rapidly changing environment Proficiency in using both qualitative and quantitative methods to define success, with a track record of making data-driven decisions Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to leverage product intuition and judgment to make informed decisions in scenarios where perfect information may not be available Insatiable curiosity, with a passion for learning new domains, keeping up with industry innovation, and constantly questioning the status quo Excellent communication skills with a knack for setting clear expectations Experience navigating and leading in a fast-paced, agile environment with rapidly shifting priorities Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $430,000 - $1,500,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix culture. More About Developer Platform @ Netflix Full Cycle Developers at Netflix -- Operate What You Build (techblog) Unifying the Netflix engineering experience with a federated platform console (video) Telltale: Netflix Application Monitoring Simplified (techblog) Machine Learning for a Better Developer Experience (techblog) Managed Delivery: Bringing Infrastructure as Code to Spinnaker (video)

This unique opportunity allows you to shape our product management practices and contribute significantly to our evolution. If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of developer experience at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you! What You Will Do
  • Deeply understand customer needs, product analytics, and industry innovation to drive the product vision and strategy for Developer Platform, maximizing business and customer impact
  • Lead, mentor, inspire, and grow a high-performance team of technical product managers, developing strategies, roadmaps, and specifications that prioritize the most impactful opportunities
  • Collaborate with senior management to align vision, strategy, success metrics, and roadmaps
  • Foster a collaborative environment with Netflix engineers, creating continuous feedback loops to ensure we're solving the right problems and driving maximum impact for Netflix
  • Stay informed about industry advancements, influence their direction, and conduct comprehensive buy vs. build analysis to align with state-of-the-art solutions, encouraging ROI-based decisions
  • Foster a metrics-driven environment that encourages quality experimentation and sets high standards for measuring product success
  • Exhibit robust problem-solving and decision-making skills, tackling both technical and strategic challenges in innovative ways, and leveraging both data and intuition to make strategic choices in the face of ambiguity and complexity
  • Ensure thoughtful product evolution that addresses product lifecycle and adoption experience
  • Help evolve Platform Engineering’s customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning practices
  • Collaborate with other product leaders across Platform Engineering and Netflix to evolve our practices and competencies in technical product management
    • What We’re Looking For
  • At least 5 years of experience managing a team of senior and staff technical product managers as a Director of Product, Group Product Manager, or similar role
  • Proven track record of leading and scaling teams, managing and evolving a product portfolio, and driving product vision and strategy
  • Deep technical knowledge paired with a customer-focused mindset and empathy.
  • Experience working on developer platforms with a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and passion for developer experience and productivity
  • Strategic thinker who can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about end-to-end experience
  • Ability to manage a portfolio of projects, balancing short-term goals with long-term vision in a rapidly changing environment
  • Proficiency in using both qualitative and quantitative methods to define success, with a track record of making data-driven decisions
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to leverage product intuition and judgment to make informed decisions in scenarios where perfect information may not be available
  • Insatiable curiosity, with a passion for learning new domains, keeping up with industry innovation, and constantly questioning the status quo
  • Excellent communication skills with a knack for setting clear expectations
  • Experience navigating and leading in a fast-paced, agile environment with rapidly shifting priorities
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $430,000 - $1,500,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix culture. More About Developer Platform @ Netflix Full Cycle Developers at Netflix -- Operate What You Build (techblog) Unifying the Netflix engineering experience with a federated platform console (video) Telltale: Netflix Application Monitoring Simplified (techblog) Machine Learning for a Better Developer Experience (techblog) Managed Delivery: Bringing Infrastructure as Code to Spinnaker (video)

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content.  As we move beyond 260 million members and hundreds of partnerships worldwide, a key to growth is our ability to work well with strategic partners across verticals. We’ve recently introduced a new ad-supported plan, offering customers a more affordable price point and offering advertisers a new way to reach engaged audiences. As we grow & evolve our partnerships & ads offerings, we are looking for a talented leader who can drive strong creative outcomes across the Marketing Partnerships team. The role: The Marketing Partnerships team seeks to drive meaningful marketing outcomes across our strategic partnerships: i) distribution partners like telco operators, pay TV services & consumer electronics brands, ii) co-promotion campaigns featuring the Netflix brand and / or IP with leading consumer brands & iii) the emerging Ad Sales business. The Marketing Partnerships Creative team supports all of the above by developing a strong partnership creative strategy and creating compelling campaigns, activations & sponsorships. We are seeking a strategic leader for the Marketing Partnerships Creative team (15+ years) who can lead a team of end-to-end creatives to develop, design and creatively execute all our partnership campaigns & Ad sales materials. This individual will be responsible for building our creative capabilities as we grow our team and supporting agencies across the region with a special focus on Korea and Japan. The ideal candidate also comes with a deep understanding of how to creatively support an Ad Sales organization. This individual must demonstrate deep passion and expertise in creative marketing. Any entertainment marketing experience will be a bonus. The ideal candidate will be capable of building a strong creative strategy that can drive specific outcomes - consumer acquisition, buzz / word of mouth around the biggest Netflix titles or exciting advertisers by helping them connect with our IP & brand in impactful ways. The candidate will be well versed in developing a partnership campaign positioning and strategy and ultimately, the crafting and execution of marketing campaigns that inspire people to share and talk about Netflix and our content. This role must be able to closely partner with external agencies/vendors, external partners (advertisers) as well as cross-functional teams across Ad Sales, Ads Marketing, Consumer Insights, Title Marketing, Consumer Products, Partnerships & more. This person should value entrepreneurial work environments and thrive in our ‘freedom and responsibility’ culture. If you are passionate about entertainment with demonstrated experience in crafting and executing impactful creative campaigns/programmes, we’d love to hear from you. Key responsibilities: Support & mentor a team of creative managers to develop high quality partnership and Ads Marketing campaigns. Establish a high quality creative team across the region. Build effective ways of working, budget & resourcing efficiencies and a regular cadence of learnings and best practices. Building a network of creative agencies & freelancers across the key APAC markets. Existing relationships with leading advertising agencies and brands across APAC markets is a bonus. Setting the creative strategy and ensuring business objectives are met over time. On occasion, leading creative workshops, presentations, briefings and owning the feedback loop and output with partners and agencies. Creatively supporting the Ads Business through pitch decks, AVs, events, experiences & more. Closely collaborate with key XF partners including Content, Marketing, Production, Ads Marketing and Consumer Products. Qualifications/Experience: THE BASICS: 15+ years of track record in brand or consumer marketing at advertising agency, or in-house Creative team. Experience in Entertainment or Ads Marketing Creative is a plus. Experience in Korea and/or Japan is a plus. STRATEGIC PLANNING: Connector of dots, able to scan through data, behaviours, comms plans, consumer research to find partner insights and content insights and bridge them in the right sweet spot to create the most fertile territory for great ideas to flourish. CREATIVE THINKER: A media-agnostic thinker who can ideate for any space and impact the right audience. Knows how to get to great work and brings a fresh perspective to the way people connect with culture, content and brands. PROJECT MANAGEMENT: A creative shepherd and problem solver who is able to drive multiple projects from start to finish and turn cool ideas into reality. Knowledge of production with the ability to execute flawlessly. Doesn’t hesitate to get into the details, and does not lose sight of the broader strategic intent. CLEAR & CONCISE COMMUNICATOR: We are looking for a fluent English speaker with excellent communication skills, who is comfortable collaborating with multiple internal cross-functional teams and confident in influencing external senior stakeholders. Knowledge of other Asian languages is a plus. Personality Attributes: Curious and creatively-minded in every way. Entrepreneurial and selfless collaborator who is selfless and goes beyond roles and titles to get great work done. Able to give and receive feedback positively, and see the value of different perspectives. Able to think and act with agility. Capable of being impactful without the support of a large team of direct reports. Demonstrates strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. Flexible and adaptive to evolve the role based on our business needs. A natural and deep affection for movies and television and the role of entertainment in today’s media landscape. A desire to thrive in our unique culture . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time - it’s an exciting time to work at Netflix! As a company, we challenge industry norms by pushing one another to think creatively about complex questions. Our legal team is no exception. We think critically about the range of legal issues our business faces and act in a manner consistent with our freedom and responsibility culture, one marked by a bias toward action, collaborative work, candid discussions, by leaning into smart risks and taking ownership of bold decisions. The Opportunity: We are currently looking for an experienced Coordinator to join our Seoul-based Business Affairs team, to help support our growing content acquisition & production efforts in Korea. The candidate will assist in scaling our Korean content business, working alongside core cross-functional teams. The successful candidate will have some prior contract management experience in a business or legal affairs setting. They will be highly-organized, self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible, technology oriented, and be able to juggle multiple responsibilities on a large portfolio of content deals with an unwavering attention to detail. They will also be excited and inspired by Netflix culture . This is a demanding and fast-paced role that requires curiosity and significant initiative. This position will be based in Seoul, Korea. Responsibilities: Contract administration, including contract execution, filing and database management. Coordinating collection and dissemination of a large volume of production contracts. Creating, updating and maintaining Airtable bases and spreadsheets tracking financials, credits, ongoing obligations, deal terms, etc. Managing, maintaining, and updating local templates and forms as well as various dashboards and document management systems. Conducting legal and territory-specific research, and maintaining a legal knowledge and contract templates database. Working cross-functionally to maintain alignment and facilitate communication between departments, and similarly-situated teams in other regions. Identifying operational and tool-related inefficiencies and collaborating with cross-functional partners for better solutions. Analyzing and interpreting agreements for owned and licensed content and accurately setting up distribution windows and other rights attributes in our rights management system. Maintaining high alignment with cross functional partners to assist with legal aspects of Korean titles and their window set-up for the successful launch of titles on the Netflix Service. Qualifications: At least 5 years of contract management experience, rights management, or paralegal experience at either a global company or law firm; experience in drafting contracts and legal documents is preferred. High level of organization, detail orientation and ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines in a very fast-paced environment. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to effectively coordinate between cross-functional teams. Ability to learn about new tools quickly and identify opportunities for tool improvement. Ability to manage a high volume of information with great accuracy. Ability to think practically and be solution-oriented. Ability to respond positively to change, can pivot quickly and be respectful of new ideas with willingness to tackle matters outside their area of expertise. Curiosity in seeking to understand broader business objectives and priorities, and a deep appreciation of how other teams affect, and are affected by, their work. Ability to embrace and advocate for cultural diversity. Proficiency in Google Suite; knowledge of Airtable or other equivalent information management tools would be plus. BA/BS required. Fluency in Korean and English. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time - it’s an exciting time to work at Netflix! As a company, we challenge industry norms by pushing one another to think creatively about complex questions. Our legal team is no exception. We think critically about the range of legal issues our business faces and act in a manner consistent with our freedom and responsibility culture, one marked by a bias toward action, collaborative work, candid discussions, by leaning into smart risks and taking ownership of bold decisions. THE OPPORTUNITY We are looking for a talented lawyer to join our Product & Corporate Legal team in Seoul, Korea. Asia Pacific (APAC) is one of our fastest growing regions, and in this role for Korea, you will be instrumental in helping our team deliver fast and practical solutions for a wide range of legal issues, including business development and commercial transactions. The role will be primarily focused on commercial transactional work and supporting advisory, regulatory and contentious matters in Korea. The successful candidate should be extremely comfortable counseling business partners and making decisions that have both legal and business impacts. The Legal team at Netflix is focused on collaborating with our business partners to innovate and find effective and efficient solutions. The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious, demonstrate great initiative, an effective cross-cultural communicator, and will welcome the opportunity to be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial organization. We are looking for someone who will also be excited and inspired by the Netflix culture . REQUIREMENTS We’re seeking a qualified lawyer with 5~10 years of relevant experience, preferably in-house or at a leading law firm. While not required, strong experience in the internet, technology or media sectors, familiarity with relevant legal issues and agreements, would be preferred. Prior experience in a few of the following areas: advising and supporting commercial transactions; deal structuring, M&A; contract administration; tech, media and advertising, and regulatory compliance. Proficiency in both English and Korean, including excellent verbal and written communication skills; Strong analytical capabilities and sound judgment; Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills; Ability to understand and work with commercial and legal ambiguity and nuance to find creative and practical solutions; Ability to learn quickly and tackle new subjects outside area of expertise; and Ability to work proactively, independently, collaboratively and reliably under pressure. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We bring entertainment to over 260 million subscribers in over 190 countries. This requires great content, a frictionless choosing experience and engaging conversation. As we continue to grow, we’re increasingly focusing on Commerce as well. We have ambitious plans, an enormous growth opportunity and the passion to be the best in customer experience - which now includes a new ad-supported plan at a more affordable price point for customers. Within the broader Finance, Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) organization, we’re building out a new team, Ads Revenue & Yield Analytics , who will help steward and support our Ads go-to-market strategy.  In this management role, you will support the commercial business in the UCAN region, inclusive of Sales & Account Management, with specialization in Pricing & Yield . In tandem, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow quickly in this space, working closely with a global, cross-functional team across FS&A, Ads Commercialization, Partnerships, Consumer, Marketing & Content to help build a cohesive understanding and unified approach to advertising at Netflix. This role will report to our Senior Manager, FS&A, Ads Revenue & Yield Analytics, and will be based out of our offices in New York. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. Your responsibilities will include: Define scatter, advertiser, and agency rate cards and guidelines across US and Canada advertising Provide ad hoc guidance to sales supporting commercial exceptions and deal reviews Create quantitative models necessary for evaluation and implementation of new pricing strategies Inform go-to-market pricing and packaging requirements for new product launches Aggregate internal & marketplace feedback to develop seasonal promotions and packages Work closely with Sales and Account Management to develop solutions that meet advertiser needs Develop automated solutions using business systems to create operational efficiencies Work with Ad Ops, Analytics and Business Operations teams to identify potential issues affecting ad monetization Collaborate with regional Revenue & Yield Analytics teams to aggregate market-level opportunities and drive global partnership deals What We’re Looking For: 5+ years of experience in finance, pricing strategy, media, technology or advertising roles Understanding of programmatic buying methods and auction-based dynamics Strong modeling skills and comfort with manipulating large datasets in Google Sheets, Excel, Tableau, and other data visualization tools A strong attention to detail and eye towards using the 80/20 rule to address problems Experience with ad tech and ad serving tools such as Google Ad Manager and Freewheel Experience implementing workflows in CRM and OMS systems to support sales motions Motivated, data-driven, and able to work autonomously with minimal supervision Strong project management, planning and organizational skills, including the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and to deliver under tight timelines Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build successful relationships and partners at all levels Basic knowledge of SQL is preferred Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $470,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

We bring entertainment to over 260 million subscribers in over 190 countries. This requires great content, a frictionless choosing experience and engaging conversation. As we continue to grow, we’re increasingly focusing on Commerce as well. We have ambitious plans, an enormous growth opportunity and the passion to be the best in customer experience - which now includes a new ad-supported plan at a more affordable price point for customers.  Within the broader Finance, Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) organization, we’re building out a new team, Ads Revenue & Yield Analytics, who will help steward and support our Ads go-to-market strategy.  In this management role, you will support the commercial business in the UCAN region, inclusive of Sales & Account Management, with specialization in Pricing & Yield. In tandem, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow quickly in this space, working closely with a global, cross-functional team across FS&A, Ads Commercialization, Partnerships, Consumer, Marketing & Content to help build a cohesive understanding and unified approach to advertising at Netflix. This role will report to our Senior Manager, FS&A, Ads Revenue & Yield Analytics, and will be based out of our offices in New York.  Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team.  Your responsibilities will include:
  • Define scatter, advertiser, and agency rate cards and guidelines across US and Canada advertising
  • Provide ad hoc guidance to sales supporting commercial exceptions and deal reviews 
  • Create quantitative models necessary for evaluation and implementation of new pricing strategies 
  • Inform go-to-market pricing and packaging requirements for new product launches
  • Aggregate internal & marketplace feedback to develop seasonal promotions and packages 
  • Work closely with Sales and Account Management to develop solutions that meet advertiser needs
  • Develop automated solutions using business systems to create operational efficiencies
  • Work with Ad Ops, Analytics and Business Operations teams to identify potential issues affecting ad monetization
  • Collaborate with regional Revenue & Yield Analytics teams to aggregate market-level opportunities and drive global partnership deals
    • What We’re Looking For:
  • 5+ years of experience in finance, pricing strategy, media, technology or advertising roles
  • Understanding of programmatic buying methods and auction-based dynamics
  • Strong modeling skills and comfort with manipulating large datasets in Google Sheets, Excel, Tableau, and other data visualization tools
  • A strong attention to detail and eye towards using the 80/20 rule to address problems
  • Experience with ad tech and ad serving tools such as Google Ad Manager and Freewheel
  • Experience implementing workflows in CRM and OMS systems to support sales motions
  • Motivated, data-driven, and able to work autonomously with minimal supervision
  • Strong project management, planning and organizational skills, including the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and to deliver under tight timelines
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build successful relationships and partners at all levels
  • Basic knowledge of SQL is preferred

Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment by producing, distributing, and streaming content at a massive scale. Over 260 million members around the world are currently enjoying more than two billion hours per month of original series, documentaries and feature films. Visit our Long-Term View to learn more. The Team The Privacy Engineering organization is dedicated to ensuring safe & efficient data use across Netflix, and the Privacy Infrastructure Engineering team plays a key role in this mission. We work closely with our stunning colleagues in privacy engineering designing and building privacy and data protection solutions for the entire company. We promote privacy-enhancing designs, set engineering standards and build systems to ensure Netflix is managing data correctly. We are a small and agile team with tremendous visibility and impact, and with Netflix’s culture of “Freedom and Responsibility” you’ll decide how to best use your talents and time. The Role We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to build privacy engineering solutions across the entire Netflix infrastructure. In this role, you will partner closely with other engineers, data scientists and TPMs to conceptualize, prototype, develop, optimize and refine data cataloging, detection and metadata systems at scale. This role provides an unique opportunity to work across diverse environments including distributed systems, data streaming and data warehouse solutions. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and impact the business in a meaningful way. Desired Background: You are passionate about privacy and data protection! You are a highly skilled software engineer with strong experience in system design, building and developing scalable and sustainable solutions. You are proficient in Java, with experience in python and scala is a plus. You excel in using SQL (any variant) with large data sets, and have built data pipelines on technologies such as Spark, Presto, Flink or Kafka. You have a bias towards action and are comfortable navigating through ambiguous environments. You’re able to communicate complex technical topics to diverse audiences with varying technical and subject matter backgrounds. Stunning colleagues come from different education levels and backgrounds. The Netflix culture determines who we hire, how we work together and how we make decisions. You will be surrounded by great colleagues and empowered to produce your best work. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: We’re looking for a veteran and highly-skilled Lead Combatants Designer to help us build a brand-new, AAA, multi-platform game. The Lead Combatants Designer will partner closely with the Design Director to rapidly prototype and execute on an original game vision in a new IP. This person will also help build, hire, and manage a small team of designers. The ideal candidate has a keen analytical mind and can not just arrive at the correct answer, but explain how they got there. They are able to lead with the “why,” and can clearly articulate their ideas verbally, visually, and in writing. They will have a strong technical background and be ready and willing to get their hands in the tools and lead by example. They are able to mentor other designers and elevate their design craft. We're building the foundation of a small but ambitious team of creators. We care deeply about the experiences we create and, more importantly, with whom we're creating them. Here at Netflix, we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 200 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. description: About Netflix: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. About the Team: Platform Engineering aims to enable Netflix to scale effectively and empower our technical talent to focus on building innovative experiences for our members, partners, and creators worldwide. We do this by providing a highly available, reliable, secure, compliant, and performant platform of data, software, and infrastructure solutions that: - meet the needs of our growing business - accelerate the productivity of Netflix engineers, scientists, and data users - maintain cost-efficiency that is at most linear to the growth of our business We are looking for a Technical Program Manager for the Platform Engineering organization focused on large cross-functional programs that impact almost all of engineering at Netflix. This individual will partner closely with product management, engineering managers, directors, and VPs across multiple organizations to execute on programs. Responsibilities Leading multiple cross-functional programs in collaboration with product, engineering, design, and data science. Provide deep domain expertise to formulate technical strategies with engineering partners. Leverage the insights and experience from your work to influence the improvement of underlying technologies, architectures, and operations. Drive engagement with internal partners by working with them to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with measurable milestones. Effectively optimize the scope and schedule of deployments, manage cross-functional dependencies, and proactively manage risks. Craft clear communication of progress toward goals, reporting status to stakeholders and leadership. Requirements 10+ years of experience driving large-scale software projects with engineering and product teams. Deep understanding of infrastructure release management. Direct experience in big data, online data store or data analytics infrastructure is beneficial. Proven experience creating partnerships with cross-functional teams, driving large-scale technical strategies, debating technical approaches, and building long-term scalable solutions. Able to identify gaps in solutions and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience. Self-starter who enjoys quickly bringing organization and direction. Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values. What sets you apart? You can drive from strategy to execution with minimal direction. You are highly skilled and experienced and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies. You have the ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs. You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health. You have a data-driven mindset in your decision-making. You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $230,000 - $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is almost everywhere. Serving more than 200 million customers in over 190 countries on multiple device types such as Smart TVs, set-top boxes, phones, tablets, and computers. Netflix is striving to deliver the vision of #NetflixEverywhere. We want to delight our customers with a service that just works, always. The Lab Operations team helps to support these efforts by maintaining extensive device labs with thousands of production, development, and custom home-grown hardware devices. We also keep the physical and logical infrastructure highly available and healthy so our colleagues can access the devices they need easily and reliably. Your Role and Opportunity As a Hardware Operations Lead, your primary responsibility will be the meticulous management and optimization of our hardware assets. Your role will encompass overseeing logistics for hardware devices that enable automation testing and maintaining professional relationships with our third-party vendors. You will also be entrusted with the task of identifying new opportunities for device management and refinement of the inventory life-cycle, defining criteria on device lifetime storage. All this while continuously striving to enhance our standards in hardware management and ensuring the highest level of customer service. What you will do Hardware Management: Responsible for managing the hardware lifecycles of Netflix devices as well as organization of over 10,000 partner devices throughout various locations. Vendor Management: Establish and maintain relationships with third-party vendors. This includes issuing purchase orders, reviewing vendor invoices, leading partner meetings, and managing manufacturing schedules. Stakeholder Engagement: Regularly meet with stakeholders to explore new business opportunities for device management and storage. Asset Management: Oversee the workflow of hardware check-out and return to stakeholders, ensuring efficiency and accuracy in asset tracking. Logistics Support: Help support shipping and transit disruptions between our partners, carriers, and third-parties. Continuous Improvement: Cultivate a mindset geared towards continual enhancement of stored hardware management. Strive to set higher standards for installations and customer service for our stakeholders. What you need to have 7+ years of proven experience in hardware and asset management. 7+ years of experience with third-party vendor management. 5+ years of project management experience. Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Strong problem-solving abilities and a strategic mindset focused on continuous improvement. Ability to travel to stakeholder sites as needed. Sound knowledge of shipping logistics best practices. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Experience with hand tools like power drills and screwdrivers Preferred Qualifications A problem solving-attitude that can work with minimal guidance and oversight. Highly value your stakeholders and have a customer service mindset. Organizational mindset - maintaining order from chaos in our diverse inventory. Confidence in configuring electronics - Smart TVs, Amazon Fire TVs, Roku devices. Comfortable driving a company van for transporting devices when needed. The ability to lift up to 50 lbs of equipment. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $700,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

The Strategic Knowledge Management (SKM) team, integral to the Legal Operations team, plays a pivotal role in shaping and advancing knowledge and information management initiatives for Netflix’s legal functions. While our primary emphasis is on supporting the legal team, we recognize the importance of fostering effectiveness and impact, through close collaboration with cross-functional partners. As the Manager in this dynamic role, you will work with diverse legal and cross-functional teams, navigating intersections that demand critical thinking, innovation, and sound judgment as you work through a multitude of issues and decisions. You will exercise strong project management skills, proactively and independently driving initiatives while aligning with the overarching team goals and roadmap. Success in this position requires adept collaboration, as building  and managing relationships are integral components of this role. description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 220 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch videos and play games as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Algorithms Engineering is responsible for the applied machine learning algorithms that drive the personalization, recommendations, search, explanations, messages, and many other areas of the experience. We use cutting-edge machine-learning techniques and work at the forefront of applied research. We are looking for a product-minded Technical Program Manager, who also has had experience working with applied research teams. You need to be passionate about applying cutting-edge algorithms to build great customer experiences. You will be part of a cross-functional group of product managers, machine learning researchers, and engineers leading the evolution of Netflix’s core machine learning algorithms. Primary responsibilities: Drive the execution of large consumer-facing initiatives at Netflix. Leverage the insights and experience from this work to influence the improvement of underlying technologies, architectures, and operations. Apply strong technical, organizational, and communication skills to devise sound technical approaches to abstract goals. Identify the systems involved to build new solutions, align roadmaps, and weigh relative priorities. Establish an overall plan for numerous teams to rally around and successfully launch new experiences for Netflix customers. Identifying and mitigating technical risks. You are a strong communicator with exceptional listening skills. You can operate independently, challenge the status quo, and always play for the larger team. What sets you apart? A passion for driving toward clarity and simplicity. Experience making smart architectural investments to meet the demands of a rapidly growing user base across the world. You’ve learned the difference between building flexible systems that adapt to business needs and unnecessarily complex systems that attempt to guess the future. You are a thought partner to your business stakeholders and successfully influence product direction. You seek to understand other parts of the business, their limitations, and where product sensitivities lie. You balance competing concerns and make tough calls on where to cut scope vs. invest more, and how to make resourcing trade-offs across different domains. As comfortable speaking technically as non-technically and able to bridge between the two. 10+ years of experience in product management, technical program management, software engineering, or leading software development projects. Desired Technical Skills: Consumer software, systems design, and architecture experience. Ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and see various perspectives. Able to provide insights into business, product, and technology tradeoffs. Great at adapting solutions to meet short and longer-term needs. Expertise in machine learning and infrastructure. Desired Project Management Skills Can devise and apply various approaches to the execution of complex initiatives. Experience driving applied research programs. Coordination across many independent tracks of work and organizations. Excels at leading large-scale software projects. Risk identification and mitigation. Can balance strategic and tactical efforts to make tough calls and broadly communicate the decision framework. Los Gatos, California Core Engineering Technical Program Manager (L6) - Algorithms Engineering Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 220 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch videos and play games as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen.  Algorithms Engineering is responsible for the applied machine learning algorithms that drive the personalization, recommendations, search, explanations, messages, and many other areas of the experience. We use cutting-edge machine-learning techniques and work at the forefront of applied research.  We are looking for a product-minded Technical Program Manager, who also has had experience working with applied research teams. You need to be passionate about applying cutting-edge algorithms to build great customer experiences. You will be part of a cross-functional group of product managers, machine learning researchers, and engineers leading the evolution of Netflix’s core machine learning algorithms.  Primary responsibilities:
  • Drive the execution of large consumer-facing initiatives at Netflix.
  • Leverage the insights and experience from this work to influence the improvement of underlying technologies, architectures, and operations.
  • Apply strong technical, organizational, and communication skills to devise sound technical approaches to abstract goals.
  • Identify the systems involved to build new solutions, align roadmaps, and weigh relative priorities.
  • Establish an overall plan for numerous teams to rally around and successfully launch new experiences for Netflix customers.
  • Identifying and mitigating technical risks.
  • You are a strong communicator with exceptional listening skills. You can operate independently, challenge the status quo, and always play for the larger team.
    • What sets you apart?
  • A passion for driving toward clarity and simplicity.
  • Experience making smart architectural investments to meet the demands of a rapidly growing user base across the world. You’ve learned the difference between building flexible systems that adapt to business needs and unnecessarily complex systems that attempt to guess the future.
  • You are a thought partner to your business stakeholders and successfully influence product direction.
  • You seek to understand other parts of the business, their limitations, and where product sensitivities lie. 
  • You balance competing concerns and make tough calls on where to cut scope vs. invest more, and how to make resourcing trade-offs across different domains.
  • As comfortable speaking technically as non-technically and able to bridge between the two.
  • 10+ years of experience in product management, technical program management, software engineering, or leading software development projects.

  • Consumer software, systems design, and architecture experience.
  • Ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and see various perspectives.

  • Expertise in machine learning and infrastructure.

  • Experience driving applied research programs.
  • Coordination across many independent tracks of work and organizations.

  • Detail-oriented, can identify what’s missing in planning and execution of software development, testing, and launch.

description: Design Manager, Member Experience Location: Los Gatos, California (San Francisco Bay Area - USA) With over 260 million members in over 190 countries, Netflix is the world's leading entertainment service offering great Series, Movies, and Games that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight members around the world. Netflix is powered by a work culture that focuses on high performance and continuous improvement. About XD Discovery This leadership role is on the Experience Design (XD) Discovery team. The XD Discovery team is responsible for the core member experience worldwide, creating personalized entertainment experiences that focus on connecting people with stories they’ll love. The team designs the end-to-end member experience from the moment someone joins Netflix: onboarding, searching, playing, and managing their Netflix experience. Our team’s focus is to create engaging user experiences to entertain our global members by making it easier to discover and choose content that’s right for them. About You You are a Product Design Manager with exceptional design, communication, and people management skills. As a leader, you will lead and manage teams to ensure our products and features are valuable for our members, easy to use, and of the highest level of craft and execution. You'll be a foundational member of the leadership team, working together with your partners in product, engineering, data science, consumer insights, content design, and other disciplines to define the strategy, operations, and communications that guide the team to build great products addressing real user needs. You measure success in terms of both human and business impact. You foster excellence through collaboration and encourage an inclusive, open environment that makes space for different perspectives and work styles. You inspire creativity and you’re an excellent advocate, evangelist, and listener who seeks and offers candid, constructive feedback. What You'll Do Manage and build a diverse, inclusive team of Product Designers that consistently delivers impactful human-centered experiences that meet user needs and business goals. Coach and mentor team performance, manage resource allocation, and project prioritization, and cultivate a culture of design excellence. Keep your teams inspired and engaged by providing strategic clarity,    direction, and focus while identifying and unblocking barriers to success. Champion the design thinking philosophy across the org and be an advocate for user-centered design and systems thinking to drive innovation at scale. Utilize your full range of people management skills, product strategy, product design, interaction design, and visual design skills. Introduce new user-centered methodologies, frameworks, and thought leadership to help your team facilitate strategic alignment across the organization. Contribute to strategic decisions around the future direction of Netflix's products. Establish a vision for the long term while ensuring near-term product features ladder up to a holistic user experience that delivers on the user needs and business goals. Collaborate closely with your Product, Engineering, Data Science, Consumer Insights, and leadership partners to plan OKRs and execute product roadmaps. Develop and nurture relationships with stakeholders and ensure your team is designing and shipping impactful and cohesive product experiences. Effectively communicate your team's product goals (both within the team and outside the team), and connect related projects across the company. Bring a balanced perspective and thoughtful decision-making to strategic discussions, advocating for both user-centricity and the needs of the business with your teams and your peers. Embody a growth mindset and a deep curiosity for the business, emerging technologies, and human behavior to identify product opportunities. Actively seek and provide constructive feedback and look to improve things for the product, team, and company. Qualifications 8+ years of successfully managing high-performance Product Design teams. Successful track record of leading teams to successful outcomes and shipping impactful consumer products across a variety of platforms at a global scale. Ability to inspire, lead, and engage your design teams, leaning in and giving them critical business context, feedback, and direction. Ability to navigate ambiguity, and drive clarity that brings the user, technology, and business together through rigorous design thinking and human-centered design for evolving problem spaces. Experience working on large-scale, complex projects across multiple teams. Experience leading product direction and strategic thinking by articulating a product vision, and goals, identifying opportunities, and making decisions based on the impact to people and the company. Experience collaborating closely with cross-functional stakeholders, helping drive alignment between design and your cross-functional partners, and building strong relationships across business areas. Exceptional communication skills, in writing and verbally, to represent work to broader product teams and leaders. Experience connecting the dots across the organization with other related initiatives across the company while driving collaboration. Pay Transparency Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $270,000-$700,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our benefits here . Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds more substantial teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We’re looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Consumer Insights Data Management & Analytics (DM&A) team. This team leverages technical expertise in applied data science, engineering, and solutions development to support a high-impact team of 90+ quantitative and qualitative researchers. The Consumer Insights team conducts cutting-edge research designed to help answer Netflix’s most complex business challenges. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in statistics/machine learning, causal inference, and research design to help drive innovations through the effective identification and application of analytics. You will seamlessly bridge attitudinal and behavioral data to deliver comprehensive insights that inform and guide our business strategy. You will collaborate with researchers, data scientists, and engineers to help answer Netflix’s most complex business challenges through the analysis of rigorous consumer research. This is a high-impact role in which you will directly influence strategic decision-making at Netflix. Visit our Research page to learn about what it’s like to work on Analytics at Netflix. In this role, you will: Leverage your expertise in Statistics, Causal Inference, Machine Learning, and research design to analyze quantitative survey data in conjunction with behavioral data to develop comprehensive insights. Partner with Researchers, Engineers, and Data Scientists to develop comprehensive analysis plans and generate high-quality quantitative research across the globe. Consult on research plans e.g. surveys, MaxDiff, Conjoint, A/B tests (tangential space to CI), and analysis plans e.g. experimentation or causal inference modeling, key drivers analysis (usually outsourced to vendors), etc. Develop a strong understanding of various business areas including Content, Brand, Product, Ads, Games and more to connect dots and effectively address primary business questions with attitudinal metric development. Work collaboratively and iteratively throughout the research lifecycle to support survey design, deployment, analysis, and interpretation. Consult with Legal and Privacy Engineering teams to ensure best practices in the collection, storage, retention and use of data collected across consumer surveys, focus groups, and other research methodologies. To be successful in this role, you have: Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field or relevant industry experience. Strong statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in experimentation, market, consumer, or social research settings. Strong partnership skills and ability to plan, execute and independently drive projects forward. Ability to communicate technical and statistical concepts clearly and concisely among audiences at various levels. Expert quantitative analysis, programming, and data manipulation skills using SQL,  R and/or Python, and version control (Github, Stash). Experience building multi-step ETL jobs/data pipelines and working with job scheduling systems is a plus. Experience in building causal inference solutions is a plus. Experience working with 3rd party APIs for data ingestion is a plus. Tags: ResearchSite Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off.
