Los Gatos, California Consumer Insights Data Scientist (L5) - Applied Research, Consumer Insights Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We’re looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Consumer Insights Data Management & Analytics (DM&A) team. This team leverages technical expertise in applied data science, engineering, and solutions development to support a high-impact team of 90+ quantitative and qualitative researchers. The Consumer Insights team conducts cutting-edge research designed to help answer Netflix’s most complex business challenges.  In this role, you will leverage your expertise in statistics/machine learning, causal inference, and research design to help drive innovations through the effective identification and application of analytics. You will seamlessly bridge attitudinal and behavioral data to deliver comprehensive insights that inform and guide our business strategy. You will collaborate with researchers, data scientists, and engineers to help answer Netflix’s most complex business challenges through the analysis of rigorous consumer research. This is a high-impact role in which you will directly influence strategic decision-making at Netflix. Visit our Research page to learn about what it’s like to work on Analytics at Netflix. In this role, you will:
  • Leverage your expertise in Statistics, Causal Inference, Machine Learning, and research design to analyze quantitative survey data in conjunction with behavioral data to develop comprehensive insights.
  • Partner with Researchers, Engineers, and Data Scientists to develop comprehensive analysis plans and generate high-quality quantitative research across the globe.
  • Consult on research plans e.g. surveys, MaxDiff, Conjoint, A/B tests (tangential space to CI), and analysis plans e.g. experimentation or causal inference modeling, key drivers analysis (usually outsourced to vendors), etc.
  • Develop a strong understanding of various business areas including Content, Brand, Product, Ads, Games and more to connect dots and effectively address primary business questions with attitudinal metric development.
  • Work collaboratively and iteratively throughout the research lifecycle to support survey design, deployment, analysis, and interpretation.
  • Consult with Legal and Privacy Engineering teams to ensure best practices in the collection, storage, retention and use of data collected across consumer surveys, focus groups, and other research methodologies.
    • To be successful in this role, you have:
  • Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field or relevant industry experience.
  • Strong statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in experimentation, market, consumer, or social research settings.
  • Strong partnership skills and ability to plan, execute and independently drive projects forward.
  • Ability to communicate technical and statistical concepts clearly and concisely among audiences at various levels.
  • Expert quantitative analysis, programming, and data manipulation skills using SQL,  R and/or Python, and version control (Github, Stash).
  • Experience building multi-step ETL jobs/data pipelines and working with job scheduling systems is a plus.
  • Experience in building causal inference solutions is a plus.
  • Experience working with 3rd party APIs for data ingestion is a plus.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with 240 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The core Advertising team is charged with building a new, best-in-class ads organization to establish Netflix as the premiere platform for advertiser partners, and to drive advertising revenue. in this role, you will: Partner with sales to build a high-performing sales organization that can represent Netflix’s offerings to our advertising customers. Assist in the implementation and execution of key sales functions, including territory/role/channel design, sales process management, data hygiene, and sales tool development. Contribute to defining, building, and maintaining the sales inputs, forecasting, and pipeline management of a global advertising business. Assist in conducting pipeline and business reviews on a regular basis. Contribute to the design and implementation of consistent ways to manage the sales process. Collaborate with the sales team and cross-functional teams to understand their strategy and help develop plans for execution. Work closely with sales and other cross-functional teams to provide quantitative and qualitative analysis of program performance, ensuring program and business impact. Support the exploration of new strategic opportunities to inform the business roadmap. About you: Minimum of  5 years of directly relevant experience in Sales Operations in advertising or related fields/ Fluency in English is required, additional European languages are a plus Familiarity with agency and client-direct sales models Self-starter with the ability to manage and contribute to large-scale, complex projects. Strong collaborator who embraces differing perspectives and experiences to make better decisions. Knowledge of the advertising landscape, including media channels and methods of buying. Ability to understand both detailed aspects and the bigger picture of Sales Operations. Demonstrated track record of creativity, innovation, and implementing better approaches. Proven ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects efficiently. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Finance Strategy & Analysis Team (FS&A) for Content is looking for an Associate to join its APAC team in Tokyo. Finance Strategy & Analysis is the team in charge of the analytical efforts and strategic thinking  behind our content buying and original content decisions. The team works cross-functionally to translate the incredible amount of data at Netflix into financial and strategic decisions regarding the production and acquisition of series and films across Anime and Live Action. FS&A Content also evaluates the general programming and content strategy, in addition to leading competitive analysis. This person will have a high degree of visibility with senior management which uses the team’s analysis and insights to inform important business decisions, such as our content performance analysis and programming strategy. This role will reside in Netflix's Japan office and be involved in projects across Asia. You will report to the Director, Finance Strategy & Analysis for Japan, based in Tokyo. Responsibilities: Lead deal analysis and valuation of new projects (both titles and deals) in partnership with the Content Creative and Acquisition teams. Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers, trends and performance indicators. Develop a deep understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities. Regularly present analyses and reports on relevant operating and financial metrics in an easy-to-understand format to senior business leaders. Compiling thoughtful post-mortem analyses to determine areas for optimization and improvement. Work on region-wide analytical projects with the global Content Analytics team Working cross-functionally with other FS&A teams globally as well as the Product, Marketing, Consumer Insights, and Data Science team. Qualifications 2+ years of experience in a top management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity, hedge fund, and/or media/entertainment/tech company in a strategy/business development/analytical role. We are looking for candidates that have worked in a highly-demanding environment in which complex modeling and analysis is performed. Candidate are required to be highly analytical and be a strong, effective communicator with experience presenting complex analyses to executives/ senior management Candidate must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, and flexible. Superb financial modeling skills and extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis. Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages. Passion and familiarity with Japanese content and entertainment is a strong plus Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative orientation. MBA is a plus, but not required. English and Japanese language fluency are mandatory. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: Design Director, Monetization Location: Los Gatos, California Preferred (San Francisco Bay Area - USA) Team: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages.  As our slate of original productions and licensed content continues to grow and we increase our global reach, we must scale the business and look for value creation across markets and user segments. Within the Monetization team, revenue is our ultimate priority. To be successful, we need to find the right balance between... Business Case : Viability (could this make money), feasibility (does it pass the ethical, and legal bar), capability (can we build it), and cost (how much time and effort to build). To be viable, we need to consider risk and reward for both shorter (1 year) and longer-term (3+ years). Consumer Needs : Value considerations (does it address a real or perceived need), desirability (how important is this need relative to others), and willingness to pay. We are looking for an experienced design leader to manage the teams responsible for further developing and generating new business and revenue models, iterating on our global plans & pricing strategy, and identifying ad growth levers across different flows and content types to help generate revenue and keep Netflix profitable and successful. In this role, you'll be responsible for product innovation on plans and pricing design, and collaborate closely with several cross-functional leaders while managing a talented and diverse remote design team. You’ll help your teams design and build superlative experiences that help Netflix monetize with existing and new business models. These experiences are part of our consumer acquisition and retention flows, so experience with and a deep passion for design excellence and creativity is essential. This role is ideally based in our Los Gatos offices. There is also the option to be based out of LA, or remotely from the West Coast/PST working hours. Expect to travel monthly to meet with your teams, stakeholders, and partners. Key Responsibilities Collaborate closely with your Product, Engineering, Data Science, and Operations leadership partners to plan and execute our product roadmaps. Develop and nurture relationships with our global stakeholders, learn the nuances of their workflows, and ensure your team is designing and shipping impactful and cohesive product experiences that meet our stakeholders’ needs. Balance being a passionate advocate for our users while pushing your teams towards efficient operational excellence. Manage and coach your design team by helping them navigate the complexity and ambiguity of our business areas. Keep your teams inspired and engaged by providing clear direction that looks towards the future while creating actionable steps that are impactful today. Skills, Characteristics & Qualifications 7+ years of experience successfully leading and scaling high-performance design teams, including ICs and people managers. Demonstrated passion for design excellence in the consumer space and a successful track record of shipping impactful products at a global scale. Experience collaborating closely with cross-functional stakeholders, helping drive alignment between design and your cross-functional partners, and building strong relationships across business areas. Comfortable working with ambiguity. Ability to bring rigorous design thinking and operational structure to complex and evolving problem spaces. Exceptional communication skills both written and verbal whether in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with executives. Ability to inspire, lead, and engage your design teams, leaning in and giving them critical business context, feedback, and direction. Bring a balanced perspective and thoughtful decision-making to strategic discussions, advocating for both user-centricity and the needs of the business with your teams and your peers. Bonus Experience working in the entertainment industry and a deep understanding of existing creative production and marketing technology workflows, launching successfully from 0 - 1. Passion for storytelling and filmmaking. Courage when asked to join team karaoke 🎤😜 Pay Transparency Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $290,000 - $1,900,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds more substantial teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: About Netflix Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. About Marketing Partnerships * At Netflix, the Marketing Partnerships team maximizes the impact of our brand engagements, driving business results through creative excellence. * The team consists of (4) business units focused on distinct outcomes: Partner Marketing: grow our subscriber base * Brand Partnerships: promote our titles to membersAds B2B Marketing: drive preference with advertisersIntegrated Marketing: offer custom solutions for advertisers All of these business units and objectives are supported by the Marketing Partnerships Creative team. This creative team collaborates with external brands and agency/production partners as well as internal cross-functional teams to create compelling campaigns, activations, sponsorships, and other innovative solutions. The Marketing Partnerships Creative team consists of (3) disciplines: Brand Strategy, Creative, and Creative Production. This team is tasked with ensuring partnership programs are rooted in a compelling strategy, crafted at the highest quality, and executed flawlessly. Examples of the work created by this group can be found here - https://www.netflixmp.com/ About The Role After launching Netflix with Ads in late 2022, we have continued to innovate our offering to better serve advertisers while continuing to provide a best-in-class experience to ad-tier subscribers. We are building a new Integrated Marketing business unit and expanding our current creative capabilities to support this endeavor. Our goal is to help advertisers connect with our IP, fandoms, and the Netflix brand in innovative and impactful ways. All candidates should demonstrate their deep experience and passion for creative marketing. The truly outstanding candidates will offer a clear and compelling point of view on integrated marketing and how/why Netflix is well-positioned to enhance the entertainment experience for both brands and members alike. This role presents a huge opportunity to be at the forefront of a new Netflix offering, one that continues to prove how Netflix is the most innovative entertainment company in the world and grows an important new revenue stream for the business. This role is ideal for someone with a personal passion for entertainment and a belief that marketing can be a natural extension of the entertainment experience, enhancing members' experiences and providing unique value for brands. Key Responsabilities Be a creative leader for the Marketing creative team in LATAM. Ideate, pitch and execute best-in-class creative campaigns in service of the Netflix advertising tier and our advertising partners Extract insights from partners and internal marketing teams to develop and steer the creative vision from concept through to execution Build foundational concepts that reflect the strategic intersection between the brand and the title Provide guidance and feedback to partner creative agencies and brands Translate our brand/marketing requirements into ideas the partner and ultimately consumer easily understands Introduce new partners and their agencies to the Netflix brand, creative guidelines, and workflowAttend brand/advertiser meetings and manage all creative relationships Collaborate with cross-functional teams including: Integrated Marketing, Sales, Creative Marketing, Social, Content, Events, and Public Relations Requirements 15+ years of desired experience in a creative role (Art Director or Copywriter background) within the entertainment/media, advertising, or related industry. At least 5 years in a creative leader position (Creative Director and above) Passionate and curious about marketing, brands, and entertainment. Have key, demonstrable experience leading innovative creative solutions with notable brands. Strong experience in brand and/or consumer marketing. Partnerships experience a plus. Has a history of managing people and takes pride in helping others and the group succeed. Willing to invest the time and effort and sometimes even sacrifice personal goals for the benefit of the overall project. Confident presentation skills and excellent communication skills. Experience and palpable passion for building great content marketing programs that are unique and scalable. Clear and articulate writer/speaker, in Portuguese, Spanish and English, who is comfortable crafting a narrative and developing points of view, despite some ambiguity or uncertainty. Desired Attributes A natural and deep affection for entertainment and brands. Strategic, forward-thinker, extremely organized, effective communicator, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Capable of working independently as well as part of a broader team. Can organize, clarify and communicate complex ideas quickly, succinctly and accurately. High level of intellectual curiosity with the ability to demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. Agile, goal-oriented, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge. Has a passion for concepting and pitching unique and innovative marketing campaigns. Can flourish in our unique ​​ company culture . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Game Studio Tech Lab team is a small, dynamic team. We build focused, creative games to validate and steer Netflix’s emerging technology investments that will make Netflix an amazing destination for games of all kinds.  These unique projects will be a mix of demonstrating and inspiring what’s possible with these new technologies and services while working directly with partner teams to help ensure an excellent developer experience that enables developers to focus on the fun. The Tech Lab Games Engineer will be a senior engineer on this small, senior-leaning team of multi-talented game engineers, designers, and artists. This role will involve creative game engineering across a variety of technical and creative challenges to make these smaller, experimental games and projects. Responsibilities Games development and prototyping: Making fun, interactive game experiences of a variety of types across a variety of technologies (potentially including different engines), in a fast-paced, iterative environment comfortable with shifting or in-progress technologies and platforms. description: Netflix is seeking an exceptionally strong Executive Assistant with 8+ years experience to provide support to the Head of Internal Audit and her team. Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 223 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. About Internal Audit- The purpose of the team is to help the business assess and manage risk, by providing objective, risk-based and practical insights. The IA team strategically plans projects determined by existing and emerging areas of focus and align our approach with the overall strategic approach of the business. IA works with the Board of Directors, Audit Committee and our external auditors, EY, to provide risk insights and updates on our compliance obligations as a publicly listed company. The Executive Assistant's responsibilities include managing complex calendars, managing travel plans & associated expenses, editing key emails and memos, and coordinating with administrative support across their business organization. A successful candidate is a strong communicator, highly detail-oriented, has great bias for action with the ability to make judgment calls and move quickly. Prior experience as an executive assistant in a fluid, fast-paced environment is a must. This position will be based in Los Gatos, CA in-office on a hybrid schedule. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: Proactively maintaining the calendar for VP Internal Audit and Internal audit directors,  including scheduling, rescheduling and confirming meetings multiple weeks to months in advance Scheduling both internal and external meetings Creating and proactively maintaining meeting agendas Coordinating detailed travel arrangements (domestic and international) Detailed and proactive expense reporting Create draft presentations, documents, meeting notes, or other materials as requested and / or needed. Support other ad hoc operational projects and / or organizational updates, including activities impacting the office location(s) of our teams. The ability to manage and assist with team projects and events (inc facilitation) as needed including maintaining the team’s learning and development program Partner closely with the organization’s HR partners and cross-functional teams to identify issues and solutions affecting the morale and cultural health of the organization Ability to single handedly plan and execute multi-day, multi-person offsites and events (large and small) Maintaining high level of confidentiality and discretion Update and maintain organizational charts on a regular cadence for accuracy, including reconciliation between Whitepages and Workday, as needed, and proactively manage email distribution lists. Draft meeting notes and resulting action items, as requested. Assist with new hire onboarding plans, as requested. Serve as a first point of contact with our Real Estate team in establishing an outline and initial recommendation around the execution of any office moves Qualifications: 8+ years of experience managing multiple executive calendars Proficiency in Google Workspace preferred: Gmail, GCalendar, Google Docs, Google Groups, MS Word/Excel Excellent writing and editing skills High attention to detail Responsive and able to work flexibly across multiple time zones Able to stay calm under pressure and work on short deadlines Strong organization skills, with the ability to prioritize and balance multiple projects, and switch easily between tasks Independent worker, with strong judgment and ability to make decisions quickly Discreet with the ability to maintain confidential information Being tech-savvy is a huge plus Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is  $60,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Financial Planning & Analysis group is looking for an Associate to focus on Financial Planning & Analysis for Japan and Taiwan. This role will be a critical and integrated business partner to the global APAC content acquisition and production team and be responsible for financial planning and analytics for the company’s rapidly expanding programming initiatives. This position will reside within the company’s Tokyo office. Responsibilities Own near-term and long-term P&L and Cash forecasts across a broad range of content categories including Original Local Language TV and Film Productions and Licensing for/from Japan markets Work with senior leadership within the content and production organization to translate strategic initiatives into financial plans Develop KPIs, metrics and dashboards to understand and communicate progress against future plan Provide recommendations on how to adjust future spending to track towards investment goals across content categories and geographies Improve workflows to scale with the growth in original productions Maintain a schedule of estimated future contractual commitments for accurate disclosure in financial statements and proper capital planning Qualifications Candidates are required to be highly analytical and be strong, effective communicators Prior experience in financial planning & analysis is preferred. Prior experience in the entertainment industry is a plus. Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of superior financial and strategic analysis, and delivering actionable recommendations in a clear and concise manner The successful candidate must display initiative in anticipating and exceeding the business demands of senior-level executives and cross-functional stakeholders. Candidate must thrive in a fast-paced environment and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidate must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, and be able to work effectively autonomously Requirements 3+ years of relevant experience. Prior experience in Financial Planning & Analysis is preferred. Prior experience in the Media / Entertainment industry is a plus. Extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative financial analysis. Must have proficiency working with systems and automated reporting tools (i.e., Hyperion, SAP, Workday financials, etc.). Financial systems development experience is a plus. Superior proficiency with Excel; complex financial modeling. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Fluent in Japanese and English. 4-year degree in a relevant field with strong academic performance, MBA preferred. Extensive knowledge of Japan and Anime markets is a plus. description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch videos and play games as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence are central to accelerating Netflix’s business and elevating the experience for members. ML/AI are being used throughout the company, from personalization to business planning to operations optimization. The Machine Learning Platform (MLP) is responsible for enabling new technological development at Netflix and improving researchers’ and engineers’ productivity. MLP covers all phases of machine learning development at Netflix, including data processing, training, evaluation, deployment and operations. We are looking for a product-minded Technical Program Manager who’s passionate about maximizing ML engineer and research productivity. You’ll drive the processes and tracking that help our teams and partners execute efficiently. You’ll be a steward for our internal measurement and goal tracking. And, you’ll coordinate high-profile projects in partnership with Product Managers and Engineering Leaders throughout Netflix. Excellent candidates have deep experience in program, project or product management for developer platforms. They demonstrate initiative, especially in ambiguous areas with unclear ownership. They’ll show uncanny communication skills and a strong ability to bring different teams to consensus. Primary responsibilities: Drive the execution of cross-functional ML Platform initiatives at Netflix across the various stakeholders for MLP, from Consumer Engineering, Algorithms Engineering, Studio and Content engineering and Data Science organizations Establish and follow-through on regular measurement of success metrics like adoption and productivity Define and drive effective execution processes on the ML Platform team Manage and oversee operations including SLA definition & measurement, cost optimization, and data governance Apply strong technical, organizational, and communication skills to devise sound technical approaches to abstract goals. Establish an overall plan for numerous teams to rally around and successfully launch new productivity improvements for Netflix engineers Own regular communication to senior Netflix management as well as broad communication to MLP consumers at Netflix Identify and mitigate risks to execution in large-scale projects Skills and Qualifications: 10+ years of experience in product management, technical program management, software engineering, or leading software development projects. Extensive experience working and innovating on developer platforms, especially those for machine learning Knowledge and experience in defining, measuring, and improving developer productivity Demonstrated initiative in clarifying ambiguous projects and driving them to completion Strong technical background for close collaboration with engineers and ML practitioners both working on and consuming the platform. At minimum, familiarity with Big Data technologies like Spark (and, preferably, with ML technologies like Tensorflow / PyTorch). Candidates should also have strong familiarity with cloud computing environments & tech (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure) Mastery of development process management (e.g. Agile, Scrum) and the related tools (e.g. Jira) Demonstrated leadership experience working effectively with engineers, data scientists, ML practitioners, Product Managers, etc. Excellent written communication skills and ability to present technical content to non-technical audiences. Ability to partner with different functions to ensure that your solutions drive real business impact. description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying series, documentaries, feature films, and live events across a wide variety of genres and languages. The Content Data Science and Engineering (DSE) team is passionate about storytelling and bringing our members joy. Our mission to entertain the world is anchored in our content, and data is a crucial component in shaping our comprehensive content strategy. We focus on creating analytical products that support our content partners in their complex and nuanced decision-making processes. We are a highly collaborative team that partners across Netflix to drive impact. We are seeking a talented Senior Analytics Engineer to lead metric development, analysis insights, and tooling projects with our business stakeholders. This role features ample opportunity for project ownership and will support impactful decision-making. In success, you will collaborate on existing priorities but also will propose and execute on new opportunities. You’ll help set our strategic agenda in the analytics space, ramp up on new tools required to guide projects to completion, track down bugs, and everything in between. In this role, you will: Collaborate closely with data scientists, engineers, finance partners, and our content teams to deliver insights through statistical analyses, modeling and/or dashboards that drive key decisions. Be a strategic thought partner with business stakeholders to define high impact analytical problems and innovative ways to solve them with data. Design, build and automate business metrics into self-serve dashboards to tell a story. Assist and educate on interpretation. Research and develop key metrics and performance indicators. Translate analytical insights into concrete, actionable recommendations to our content teams for decision making. About you: Strong experience in scripting with SQL, extracting large sets of data, and design of ETL flows. Proven track record in transforming large amounts of complex data into insights by leading the end-to-end creation of intuitive data products. Highly effective in engaging with diverse stakeholders and adept at cultivating strong partnerships. Passionate about communicating difficult concepts to non-technical audiences. Self-starter who thrives under a high level of autonomy. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. Enthusiastic about Netflix culture Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. description: At Netflix, we seek to entertain the world. We have more than 250 million members in 190 countries, reflecting that great stories can come from anywhere and be loved everywhere. Our payments teams across the world are a key part of this mission, continuously optimizing the set of payment methods that we offer in each country and investing in innovation to enable a seamless payments experience for our members. Their deep market knowledge and focus on operational excellence makes it easy for customers to access Netflix and enjoy their next story without interruption. And to continue increasing our worldwide reach, our partnerships and business development teams work with a range of partner companies from cable (KDDI), telcom (Jio, Airtel), consumer electronics (Samsung, LG), and app platforms (Google, Apple, etc.). Our partners not just allow consumers to enjoy Netflix on a wide variety of devices, but also reach new audiences via subscription bundles and partner billing. Data is at the heart of our business strategy and innovation at Netflix. In the Payments & Partnerships Data Science & Engineering team, we provide guidance to the business not only through analysis, metrics research, experimentation, causal inference, and modeling, but also through exceptional judgment, partnership, and business acumen. These deeply collaborative efforts unlock millions of dollars of revenue impact each year through new member growth and improved member retention. We are seeking a passionate Senior Data Scientist to help drive innovation and insights across our payments and partnerships initiatives in APAC. You’ll design metrics, generate insights by scoping and executing deep dive analysis (occasionally with local partner analytics teams, Consumer Insights and Finance & Strategy), and assess incrementality of campaigns and initiatives using observational causal inference and quasi-experimentation. This is a high-impact position where your analysis will have direct and high impact on business decisions. In this role, you will: Partner closely with leadership on our partnerships, business development, and payments teams on analytical problems, predictive modeling, and causal inference (including quasi-experiments) that drive key decisions in the region Design and evaluate A/B tests with local external partners to reach and retain new members Craft, prototype, and socialize metrics in collaboration with partner teams to help the business measure initiative performance Build dashboards and visualization that enables stakeholders to self-serve metrics and trends effectively. Actively socialize and educate, aiding on interpretation Develop statistical models explaining user acquisition, retention, and engagement on partner initiatives and devices Translate analytic insights into actionable recommendations for business or product improvement, and communicate these findings clearly to a broad audience Identify and proactively socialize regional insights, including those that may generalize to opportunities in other markets What you’ll bring: Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills to influence stakeholders using clear insights and recommendations Exceptional thought partnership to build credibility and relationships with stakeholders Strong statistical knowledge: understanding of predictive modeling and time series; ability to tease out incrementality vs. correlations using causal inference Strong knowledge of randomized experiments (i.e., A/B testing) and non-randomized designs Strong SQL skills and experience with distributed analytic processing technologies (S3, Presto, Hive & Spark) Strong skills in Python or R Data visualization skills to convey information and results clearly Willingness to learn and rapidly absorb business context in the complex payments & partnerships ecosystem Ability to work independently and drive projects forward MS or PhD degree in Statistics/Biostatistics, Quantitative Social Science, Econometrics or related field What you’ll learn: Innovation and partnership on a global scale, partnering with regional market experts to improve payments & partnerships experiences for members around the world We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are building world-class live experiences such as Squid Game The Trials, Stranger Things: The Experience, and Stranger Things: The Official Store to help promote our most-popular IP and build them into title brands, or franchises, so they drive long-term value and become part of the zeitgeist for longer periods of time. As a Technical Manager, you will lead, consult on and oversee all technical aspects of the location based entertainment projects for the Experiences team, ensure they are executed to the level of technical excellence required by production and be the driver for new and innovative approaches to our experience slate. What you will do: Ensure technical excellence in all aspects of the productions. Standardize best practices in Experience technology pipeline in both design and delivery. Execute all technical aspects of project scope to support creative vision, budget, schedule, & project strategy - including show design & production strategy, systems integration, overall safety, and maintenance. Create strategies for technical solutions for different types of experiences. Research and implement relevant innovative technologies into our experiences. Vet and hire third party technical vendors. Review and comment on technical drawings, designs and SOPs from our vendors to make sure they fit our creative vision, budget, schedule as well as our overall experiences strategy. Optimize and value-engineer through creative problem solving. Oversee timely execution of proof of concept mockups and staging efforts with vendors as needed. Work closely and communicate with Netflix creative, production and operations teams. Communicate with and solicit feedback from internal stakeholders such as CP cross-functional teams. Integrate our overall production and technical strategy into production “ways of working” with all partners. Establish regular meetings with key stakeholders to update on progress and solicit feedback. What we need from you: Demonstrated, 10+ years of technical experience in location based entertainment industry. Strong knowledge and excitement of both permanent and touring experiences around the world. Excellent knowledge of all aspects of technical (lighting, AV, show control, scenic integration, SFPX, rigging, programming, etc.) Well rounded knowledge of current and future technology trends. Excellent knowledge of Autodesk software (CAD, Revit, etc.) Experience in AR, VR, and emerging technologies production and integration. Strong desire to think outside the box and innovate through technical solutions. Strong desire to find innovative and creative technical solutions to different types of experiences. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and digital. Excellent organizing skills using digital tools and google suite. Global experience. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 200 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. We are looking for a regional growth expert to join our Monetization team. The Monetization team is responsible for product innovation on plans and pricing.  We are looking for Regional Growth Managers who can connect nuanced audience insights at a local level to help drive product innovation at a global scale.  You will help a team of global product managers prioritize business initiatives. You should be comfortable at the hub of a fast-paced environment where you interface daily with cross-functional experts. You are able to build alignment but not afraid to push ahead in the face of ambiguity. The Netflix consumer product team is different from most technology companies. Many key product leaders - including this position - work with multiple cross-functional teams but do not have direct reports. Consequently, we’re looking for experienced leaders who are strategic and also like rolling up their sleeves. As part of the broader Monetization Product Team, you will: Lead local audience insights analysis for commerce innovation, scaling the global Product Management team and enabling more proactive vetting of opportunities. Use local knowledge, product expertise, and historical experimentation performance to assess commerce opportunities to improve product-market fit. Evaluate consumer sentiment/impact of new potential monetization opportunities to help define whether or not we move forward. Drive go-to-market planning for new monetization launches, e.g. facilitating discussions between global/local teams and formulating local product changes where appropriate. Collaborate with a team of stunning colleagues across consumer insights, data science, and product marketing to launch outstanding products to our customers. Ensure timely communication between global and local teams, e.g. writing newsletters, elevating local insights/challenges. Represent the Monetization team in country leadership forums, funneling feedback to global team and supporting regional commerce deep dives Author regional strategy memos and communicate / represent the broader Monetization team’s work throughout the organization. Qualifications +10 years of experience in Product Strategy, Strategy Planning & Analysis, in a highly analytical environment. Strategic thinker with a strong customer-focused mindset and empathy Highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive alignment amid ambiguity Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and effectively influence and contribute with concrete recommendations/next steps, across both regional and global teams Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’ Excellent written (memos and presentations) and verbal communication skills; timely communication

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. What We Expect The Senior Product Manager is primarily responsible for our live service games slate; they will analyze and report on game & event performance, from high-level KPIs to deep dives into specific strategies. They will utilize game data, competitive research, and player feedback to formulate new learnings and recommendations for the business. They will also drive strategic initiatives to improve the way that the PM team operates within the broader Netflix ecosystem. Additionally they will work with producers and designers to prioritize content that improves retention and provides members with a great gaming experience. As part of the PM team they will work to ensure the portfolio as a whole is healthy and driving the correct outcome in line with business goals. Responsibilities: Proactively identify improvements and optimizations of our approach to running live games. Set those up as strategic initiatives that you propose, collaborate on and drive all the way to implementation. Use deep knowledge of the mobile market and free to play space to ensure that we are signing best in class games to our service in a most cost effective way. Own Live Service optimization efforts at the title level, for a set of key 5-10 titles. Partner with Live Service Producers and cross-functional game pods to make data driven decisions that optimize each game. Closely collaborate with external studio production & creative partners to ensure external games cater to players’ motivations while maximizing acquisition and engagement drivers, and manage key features that further optimize efforts towards live service best practices. Determine the research strategy to ensure product decisions are data-driven and meet user needs, including the ability to qualitatively and quantitatively teardown games on any platform. Provide excellent information sharing on game and slate performance through regular reporting and deep dive analysis. Required Qualifications: 8+ years of experience in the gaming industry, working in analytical roles including strategy & analysis and product management, assessing ongoing performance and optimization for games in multiple categories Experience managing cross functional groups through influence Experience driving business-wide impact through optimizing PM function workflows and processes Exceptional experience in game design for retention optimization. Deep understanding of economy and monetization design Experience working with live service games on any platform (PC, console, mobile), supporting feature development and live service over several major feature deployments Deep understanding of engagement drivers in live service games Continuously looking for ways to improve and iterate on existing framework, or building anew for best results Passion for video games, innovations in software and how they enrich the player experience Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $600,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are seeking a State Income Tax Manager to join our Tax Operations Team, reporting to the Senior Director of Tax Operations. You will be responsible for all state income tax matters including state and local income tax compliance/provision, state income tax controversy, state legislative tracking/impact analysis, and state income tax research and planning. The ideal candidate will be a strong leader who can collaborate across the business, has a hands-on mentality, and a desire to jump right in and make a difference. We are excited to have you join our culture of high performance built around freedom and responsibility. Responsibilities Oversee preparation and review of US state and local income tax returns, quarterly estimates, and extensions. Assist the tax provision team with state tax calculations impacting the global tax provision. Track and evaluate proposed and enacted state tax legislation to assess the impact to the Company. Partner with the US planning team on state income tax planning; prepare memoranda, written correspondence and other documents as necessary to support conclusions. Oversee and manage state and local income tax audits and tax notices. Identify and oversee process improvement initiatives with respect to state income tax processes. Research complex state income tax issues and prepare technical memoranda. Continue to develop a system/approach to ensure the accuracy and completeness of work papers for all state income tax positions. Train and mentor staff including review and evaluation of their work as well as assistance in staff development. Qualifications You embrace and advocate the Netflix culture and our long-term view . 10-12 years combined public accounting and industry experience, specializing in state income tax (technology or entertainment industry experience is a plus). Experience in identifying, analyzing, and communicating complex state income tax issues. Advanced knowledge of multi-state tax laws. Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with the ability to use these skills to make quality decisions promptly. Strong communication skills (oral and written) and proven ability to develop professional relationships with internal and external parties. Ability to quickly understand and integrate business objectives with tax strategies, and effectively communicate tax requirements to tax and non-tax stakeholders. Ability to work proactively and independently in a fast-paced environment, a self-starter. Growth mindset with the ability to learn, change, and adapt quickly. Experience with OneSource tax compliance software is a plus. CPA and/or Masters in Taxation preferred. The role is ideally based in Los Gatos, CA, but we can be flexible for someone based in Los Angeles, CA. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $220,000 - $385,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here . Due to the nature and scope of this role, we will need to run a background check prior to starting with us.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As we grow our business and teams, we look for people from a wide range of backgrounds to reflect the global nature of our members. It takes diversity of thought, culture, background, and perspective to create a truly global business. While we highly value the importance of diversity in our teams, we also recognize the even greater importance of building an inclusive and equitable environment where all employees feel equally welcomed and their voices valued - without inclusion, diversity cannot thrive. At Netflix, all employees own this mission, not just one person or team. We believe we have to work from the inside out to create the place where top talent from all over the world want to work - that is how great work happens. The Director Inclusion Strategy EMEA will establish themselves as a trusted expert for the region on a range of Inclusion and Diversity (I&D) topics. This includes providing guidance on leading inclusively. In collaboration with the global Inclusion team and the EMEA Talent leadership team, the Director Inclusion Strategy EMEA will evaluate the current status of diversity and inclusion across the EMEA region. This assessment involves reviewing past and ongoing programs, analyzing the representation of underrepresented groups, identifying any prevalent local and regional challenges, opportunities or urgent needs, and crafting a comprehensive strategy to address these effectively. Key Job Responsibilities: While driving scalable I&D practices and solutions across the wider EMEA region, generate  strong local I&D impact through close partnership with HRBP’s and the business. Build robust and sustainable local I&D strategies through leveraging qualitative and quantitative insights as well as lived experiences of our employees and people from underrepresented groups. Coach and advise teams and senior leaders in the region to elevate their diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural aptitude and competence Partner with all functions across Talent (e.g. Talent Acquisition, HRBPs, Talent Management etc) and the business to ensure I&D is embedded into all our programs, tools and processes across the region You create the conditions for a highly successful, inclusive and high performing team by leading, developing and organizing the Inclusion Strategy team reporting into this role Work with HRBPs and other leaders on identifying and actioning on the day-to-day inclusion needs within their teams, which may including one-on-one coaching relationships with leaders Closely partner with the global VP of Inclusion Strategy and other key stakeholders from the global I&D organization to translate global I&D practices into a regional context and ensure regional needs are taken into account. Support and guide ERG development in alignment with global ERG strategies. Engage and network with external groups and/or organizations within EMEA to gain knowledge of trends in the field and build partnerships to leverage I&D work at Netflix and the region as a whole. The ideal candidate: Has Inclusion expertise in an EMEA context Ability to leverage a strong understanding of equity, power, and identities both academically and in one’s reflection of their lived experience Understands how to disrupt existing systems and behaviors within an organization or company and is well versed on change management Can navigate crisis and conflict across all levels of leadership and on behalf of a company Has preferably lived for an extended period of time or is from the EMEA region and will sit in the region (Amsterdam) Has preferably worked in larger multinational organizations and roles that have covered a global span. Drives impact through developing & implementing strategy Ability to anticipate future organizational needs and implications accurately Can surface opportunities and generate ideas at an organization and company level that provides sustainable value Uses quantitative and qualitative data to set vision for a team and connect vision with action Ability to define long term and mid-range goals and understands how to accomplish them Drives Partnership and Collaboration Draws energy and support from a wide variety of distinct stakeholders to get things done, create leverage, and mobilize internal advocates Ability to communicate cross functionally amongst leaders and organizations, and surface opportunities for connecting inclusion efforts Drive accountability and investment at the organizational level Track, record and build on past progress Coaches, Advises, and Influences Can advise and influence senior leaders/executives on diversity, equity & inclusion initiatives, and how to demonstrate inclusive leadership and manage diverse teams Can coach through asking versus answering questions Can identify skills, knowledge, and the attitude gaps that may be holding someone  back from being an inclusive leader Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to turn around time-sensitive, high-visibility comms on sensitive topics related to race, gender, class, sexuality, and ability status Strong Ability to Lead Self and Lead Others Leads by example, demonstrating inclusive leadership skills in action on day-to-day management Can build inclusive teams, and develop talent Fosters opportunities for collaboration within own direct reports and across other pods within the Inclusion Strategy team We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. The Consumer Products team aspires to connect members to our content, and each other, by bringing their favorite stories to real life. Our products and campaigns should entertain, delight and bring joy to our fans all over the world. Due to the expansion of licensees and categories, we are in need of additional support with active and prospective partnerships for current and upcoming titles. We are looking for a Licensing Coordinator who will work across the entire slate of Netflix content to bring our content to life via compelling products. They will support a senior manager and associate across all categories, focusing on opportunities in Korea. The individual would be a taskmaster extraordinaire who will assist in the day to day deliverables, working alongside internal as well as external partners. The successful candidate will be a dynamic professional who has an understanding of the outbound licensing workflow and can roll up their sleeves to knock out tasks in an orderly and swift pace. Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Help drive business by supporting the Licensing team on tasks related to category management, facilitating information between external and internal stakeholders and maintaining communication of product and partner plans. Coordinate with internal teams to gather and distribute brand and marketing updates to share out with licensing partners as well as housekeeping partner marketing approvals working closely with the relevant cross-functional teams. Maintain and update internal systems and docs with category licensing plans and activity. Prepare, distribute and track deal memos and final agreements to ensure deals are processed efficiently through all steps. Partner with creative teams to keep product development on track to attain commercial objectives. Facilitate receipt of forecasts and send royalty payment reminders as needed. Assist in compiling licensing recaps following product launches. What we need from you: Demonstrated 3+ years of experience in the entertainment industry, preferably in outbound IP licensing, or any relevant brand/marketing partnerships. Experience working with reputable entertainment and/or lifestyle brands. Ability to thrive under pressure in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Possess attention to details with superb organizational skills. Multi-tasking extraordinaire with ability to prioritize. Fluent in English and Korean is a must. Excellent communicator both verbally and written. Alignment with our company culture and values. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 240 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. The Client and Partner Technologies (CPT) organization is charted with enabling brilliant Netflix experiences on partner devices and building foundational client systems and tools. Partner Products Lifecycle Apps team within CPT is looking for a senior full stack engineer with frontend-focused expertise to help us revamp our suite of web applications to enable the future of our partner products lifecycle. This team focuses on enabling the SmartTV+ partners devices including TVs, streaming sticks, and other “10 foot” devices with Netflix experiences by providing business to business solutions to scale the integrate, launch, update and retire lifecycle. We are looking for generalizing specialists who have the aptitude and agility to work on a broad spectrum of applications (e.g. device management, configuration and testing) with passion for intuitive user experience. You will excel if you are comfortable with the ambiguity that comes with innovation, can deliver scalable technical solutions, remove technical debts,  think strategically, make decisions for long term effectiveness and are curious. What you will do: Drive new technical solutions across teams, in a multi-disciplinary manner from requirements to applications deployment Actively work with product managers and our design team to scope and shape product decisions. Revamp and update existing web applications with new paved path solution Focus on streamlining user experience with simplicity Enhance and maintain existing applications to meet the needs of our partners and internal stakeholders Operate in a cross-functional dynamic environment where you will collaborate and learn from stunning colleagues with different roles and expertise to achieve common goal to bring #NetflixEverywhere What we are looking for: 7+ years of experience in a software development role Strong full-stack development skills with strength in front-end UI work. Experience with at least several UI frameworks Deep experience with React & GraphQL Strong programming skills in Javascript. Experience with Java & Node.js . Ability to innovate through iteration; using prototypes and experiments to navigate solution ambiguity and passionate about data insight Proven ability to operate and troubleshoot complex systems crafted with microservice architecture Experience maintaining and improving legacy systems. Can evaluate and speak to tradeoffs concerning refactor vs rebuild vs buy. Ability to learn and use in-house software framework/components/service to build solutions effectively Outstanding communicators who are curious, flexible, and selfless Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $230,000 - $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

  • Drive new technical solutions across teams, in a multi-disciplinary manner from requirements to applications deployment 
  • Actively work with product managers and our design team to scope and shape product decisions.
  • Revamp and update existing web applications with new paved path solution 
  • Focus on streamlining user experience with simplicity  
  • Enhance and maintain existing applications to meet the needs of our partners and internal stakeholders 
  • Operate in a cross-functional dynamic environment where you will collaborate and learn from stunning colleagues with different roles and expertise to achieve common goal to bring #NetflixEverywhere
    • What we are looking for:
  • 7+ years of experience in a software development role
  • Strong full-stack development skills with strength in front-end UI work.
  • Experience with at least several UI frameworks
  • Deep experience with React & GraphQL 
  • Strong programming skills in Javascript. Experience with Java & Node.js.  
  • Ability to innovate through iteration; using prototypes and experiments to navigate solution ambiguity and passionate about data insight 
  • Proven ability to operate and troubleshoot complex systems crafted with microservice architecture
  • Experience maintaining and improving legacy systems. Can evaluate and speak to tradeoffs concerning refactor vs rebuild vs buy.
  • Ability to learn and use in-house software framework/components/service to build solutions effectively
  • Outstanding communicators who are curious, flexible, and selfless
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $230,000 - $960,000.  Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Job Opportunity: A key architect in LATAM Ads Marketing team’s success by crafting and activating the Netflix advertising story and value proposition to advertisers across Mexico. This person will act in the intersection of customers, brands and the advertising industry to fuel the Ads Marketing narrative through innovation and creativity. Responsabilities Design and craft go-to-market strategies and narratives in an exciting way to present the Ads brand across the advertising industry in the country. Architect of innovative and creative strategies to fuel Netflix Ads equity in the local market, striving for excellence and bar-raising tactics.
