description: Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Content Promotion & Distribution (CPD) sits at the intersection of the consumer experience and the Netflix Studio. Our team is integral to making the Netflix experience feel personal and relevant by developing innovative approaches to how we catalog, promote, localize, and distribute content. Because our products touch both members and content creators, we seek someone who can fluidly move between both worlds, applying strong product principles and strategic frameworks to the member experience while deeply empathizing with the art and craft required to create great content. The Role We are looking for a Product Manager to advance our portfolio of products that manage all the playable media assets consumed by over 260 million members worldwide. The Content Fulfillment PM is responsible for the systems and services that enable our business users around the world to order, route, prepare, deliver, validate, process, and track over 3M VOD assets annually; the critical content systems needed to ensure the accurate and timely fulfillment and evaluation of each and every playable media asset. You’ll develop innovative solutions to further scale how media assets are delivered, managed, and assembled for playback, including live streaming technology to support a growing programming slate of live events. You’ll optimize our quality control systems and workflows while innovating on how we protect the Netflix experience. You’ll partner closely with product managers across Globalization, Promotional Media, Marketing Technology, and adjacent Studio product areas. This will be a remote-friendly role, with the freedom to set a flexible work-from-home schedule. This role would be best for candidates located in the Pacific time zone, as bi-monthly in-person travel may be necessary to collaborate with stakeholders and partners in Los Angeles, CA, and Los Gatos, CA. That said, we can always make exceptions in location for the right candidate. About Our Team We innovate on a portfolio of products, services, and data models responsible for the setup, preparation, fulfillment, and distribution of titles. Our goal is to make launching titles on Netflix as easy as pressing a button on your remote. We work with diverse and globally distributed groups of business users and vendors. We also build the foundational capabilities and technology for the next generation of Netflix experiences, like games, ads, and live. Our team’s primary superpower is the ability to work creatively and collaboratively in highly technical environments – from core services that power Netflix search and discovery to industry-leading content management platforms. What You Will Do Devise and communicate a vision and strategy for the domain broadly throughout the organization. Own the content fulfillment and QC portfolio of products that manage media assets and orchestrate workflows from creation to playback. Develop and deliver a roadmap that balances the needs of our partner teams and prioritizes what is most impactful for our members and the business. Lead cross-functional teams, including design, engineering, and data science, to discover and execute opportunities through automation, including transforming workflows using ML and AI. Partner with different teams responsible for launching titles and new and emerging experiences, including Product Discovery & Promotions, Encoding Technologies, and Studio teams. Author strategy memos and presentations and represent your team’s work to senior executives. Operate with true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate What We’re Looking For 6+ years of experience as a Product Manager within the media, content, and/or live streaming systems with a proven record of successfully prioritizing, ideating, and launching impactful products and solutions. Ability to inspire, motivate, and lead a cross-functional team - your ability to build strong relationships is critical to success. Exceptional analytical skills and ability to balance short-term goals and long-term vision. Deep experience using data and metrics to influence business decisions, inform priorities, and evaluate impact of initiatives. Demonstrated experience working effectively across different technical teams and with data scientists, machine learning engineers, statisticians, etc. Excellent communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations whether in written documents, small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or to executives. An ideal candidate is a highly motivated, self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive alignment amid ambiguity. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000 - $515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix contributes significantly to internet traffic during peak hours, often representing double-digit percentages. We're actively working with Internet Service Providers to ensure our high-quality content is delivered both efficiently and cost-effectively. Today, we deliver 100% of Netflix content to 190 countries via Open Connect, our purpose-built content delivery network. We also strive to deliver a world class ecosystem to our content creators in every stage of the production process through technology and collaboration enabled by network infrastructure solutions. We need great infrastructure and networking professionals to help us manage the remarkable challenge and opportunity in these environments. Individuals in this role are focused on network strategy, topology planning and acquisition for the portfolio of infrastructure required to support Netflix’s consumer products and internal corporate and creative workflows. They are responsible for ensuring Netflix maintains market-leading commercial structures across Netflix's portfolio of global network connectivity as well as its data center space, power and cross-connects. They work with architecture, engineering, capacity planning, partner engagement, finance, business operations and legal teams on a collaborative basis to ensure the infrastructure meets business requirements. This role actively negotiates with external vendors and sets long term procurement strategies. Additionally this role provides cross functional technical leadership and coordination across disciplines with an emphasis on developing long term infrastructure strategies that are scalable and efficient. This is a heavily external-facing role with day to day infrastructure planning and sourcing and large scale industry engagement and direction setting. At Netflix, this team incorporates multiple functions and job roles (as compared to our FAANG equivalents). This role calls for an effective collaborator with essential skills and a keen interest in professional growth. The day to day functions of this role are: Manage acquisition of infrastructure services Gather context, requirements and identify viable service providers Run and analyze complex RFIs including technical and commercial requirements Contract services including negotiation of service terms and pricing Promote and grow a healthy, global vendor ecosystem Develop and maintain the rolling plan for all infrastructure components including data center colocation and network connectivity globally Create financial models to compare solutions on technical and fiscal merits Consideration to failure domains and fault planning Understand technology trends in our service and the long term impacts on the infrastructure Balance solutions appropriately to the good, fast, cheap (pick 2) ideology Provide context on infrastructure to the organization Share industry and locality specific knowledge Determine key metrics and report them back to the business Develop and maintain visual dashboards on carrying capacity and financial metrics Identify and communicate cost sensitivities in the infrastructure What does this really mean: This individual will manage space, power, cross connects and network connectivity for our global infrastructure portfolio servicing our Open Connect Backbone, our Data Centers, our Studio and Production locations, and our Corporate offices They intake forecasts or requirements from our stakeholders and using their knowledge of the industry, develop options and recommendations They effectively communicate requirements and context to downstream teams and functions They manage and curate relationships with existing and prospective vendors They gather and share industry trends and context with the organization and identify long term infrastructure trends and bets. They provide data back to the organization to help drive holistic decision making Who you are: 5+ years of infrastructure planning experience and a passion for internet and networking innovation Expertise in the internet ecosystem and knowledge of physical colocation and network infrastructure Experience with vendor relationships, negotiating, contracting and performance management Basic understanding of financial analysis for scenario modeling and multi variable decision making Experience collaborating with and articulating recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences Confidence to take ownership of projects and make decisions in a fast-paced environment with minimal documentation and process The perspective that delivering results quickly, with iteration, is better than waiting for 100% perfection Be sure to review our culture page to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $150,000 - $300,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad-supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers. We are now seeking a Sales Partner in Singapore to help shape our sales strategy for Netflix across the markets we cover APAC (Japan, Korea & Australia). As the Sales Partner in Singapore, you will be responsible for helping lead the development and execution of the sales strategy for APAC out of Singapore targeting both regionally hubbed advertisers and their agencies.  You will work closely with the senior-level account director, account planning stakeholders, trading, and investment directors with our Agency partners and build key client relationships with C-level, VP and Director contacts within those portfolios to help shape and execute multinational partnerships that deliver customer solutions to accelerate the overall growth of Netflix Global Business Solutions. You will also need to work closely with cross-functional teams not only in APAC but around the world in order to drive a holistic Netflix strategy for the top brands in the world in this region. You will be accountable for delivering revenue targets by leveraging Netflix's unique audience insights and premium content offerings. You will work closely with our Measurement Leads to develop the best-in-class measurement solutions to meet our Clients’ needs. Cross-functional collaboration with Ad Product, Marketing, Content and Partnership Development teams will be crucial. The ideal candidate is creative, entrepreneurial, deeply passionate about cross-functional account development, proficient in high level strategic thinking and local market enablement. The candidate will have a deep understanding of the advertising ecosystem in an established network of relationships, and a track record of delivering revenue growth. This role requires the ability to work across different time zones and cultures, and bring a philosophy of client-centricity to the role both internally and externally. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute both client direct agency-focused sales for APAC to deliver revenue targets and exceed client expectations. Build and maintain strong relationships with a major Agency Holding group and related Agencies to secure ad partnerships and drive revenue growth. Build on the strengths of the Netflix portfolio of product offerings to shape the vision, global strategy, approach, local coordination, and success metrics for Netflix top global brand customers and develop long-term relationships with key senior Clients within those portfolios. Partner with Microsoft Partner teams to respond to briefs and grow the business together Develop sales strategies and sales plans for the assigned Account portfolio Collaborate with cross-functional teams across Netflix Ad Sales Product, Marketing, and Research to ensure that agency and client’s needs are being met Leverage Netflix's unique audience insights and premium content offerings to drive revenue growth. Monitor market trends, and competitor activity and identify opportunities for innovation. We’re Looking for: At least 10 years of experience in advertising or media (incl. sales) with a proven track record of delivering revenue growth including considerable time managing global accounts for a platform/publisher Deep understanding of the Media Agencies/Holding Companies and an established network of relationships at the senior level within them. Extensive strategy development and consultative skills and proven track record working across multinational organization leadership teams Ability to move easily from strategic thinking to operational tasks Experience in both TV and digital advertising sales will be a plus A degree of people management experience is preferable Strong analytical (strategic and creative) capabilities and judgment. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross‐functionally. Open to the challenge of starting a new business, comfortable with risk, uncertainty and ambiguity. Local language proficiency a beneficial but not a requirement Autonomous A passion for  entertainment and our product will be a + We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

As the Sales Partner in Singapore, you will be responsible for helping lead the development and execution of the sales strategy for APAC out of Singapore targeting both regionally hubbed advertisers and their agencies.  You will work closely with the senior-level account director, account planning stakeholders, trading, and investment directors with our Agency partners and build key client relationships with C-level, VP and Director contacts within those portfolios to help shape and execute multinational partnerships that deliver customer solutions to accelerate the overall growth of Netflix Global Business Solutions. You will also need to work closely with cross-functional teams not only in APAC but around the world in order to drive a holistic Netflix strategy for the top brands in the world in this region. You will be accountable for delivering revenue targets by leveraging Netflix's unique audience insights and premium content offerings. You will work closely with our Measurement Leads to develop the best-in-class measurement solutions to meet our Clients’ needs. Cross-functional collaboration with Ad Product, Marketing, Content and Partnership Development teams will be crucial. The ideal candidate is creative, entrepreneurial, deeply passionate about cross-functional account development, proficient in high level strategic thinking and local market enablement. The candidate will have a deep understanding of the advertising ecosystem in an established network of relationships, and a track record of delivering revenue growth. This role requires the ability to work across different time zones and cultures, and bring a philosophy of client-centricity to the role both internally and externally. Key Responsibilities:
  • Develop and execute both client direct agency-focused sales for APAC to deliver revenue targets and exceed client expectations.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with a major Agency Holding group and related Agencies to secure ad partnerships and drive revenue growth.
  • Build on the strengths of the Netflix portfolio of product offerings to shape the vision, global strategy, approach, local coordination, and success metrics for Netflix top global brand customers and develop long-term relationships with key senior Clients within those portfolios.
  • Partner with Microsoft Partner teams to respond to briefs and grow the business together
  • Develop sales strategies and sales plans for the assigned Account portfolio 
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams across Netflix Ad Sales Product, Marketing, and Research to ensure that agency and client’s needs are being met
  • Leverage Netflix's unique audience insights and premium content offerings to drive revenue growth.
  • Monitor market trends, and competitor activity and identify opportunities for innovation.
    • We’re Looking for:
  • At least 10 years of experience in advertising or media (incl. sales) with a proven track record of delivering revenue growth including considerable time managing global accounts for a platform/publisher
  • Deep understanding of the Media Agencies/Holding Companies and an established network of relationships at the senior level within them.
  • Extensive strategy development and consultative skills and proven track record working across multinational organization leadership teams
  • Ability to move easily from strategic thinking to operational tasks
  • Experience in both TV and digital advertising sales will be a plus
  • A degree of people management experience is preferable
  • Strong analytical (strategic and creative) capabilities and judgment.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross‐functionally.
  • Open to the challenge of starting a new business, comfortable with risk, uncertainty and ambiguity. 
  • Local language proficiency a beneficial but not a requirement
  • Autonomous
  • A passion for  entertainment and our product will be a +

We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. With this international expansion and a move into Thai originals, it's a great time to join Netflix. The Opportunity We are seeking a Post Production Coordinator to support the series/film Originals Post Production team in Indonesia. This position would organize vital post information and workflows with an increasing, growing slate of Original Shows from pre-production through archive & wrap using internal tools, as well as working closely with internal Netflix teams to anticipate challenges, problem solve and communicate expectations and needs. Collaborative working with internal teams is a must to ensure our content is maintained at the highest standards and on schedule. A successful candidate will be passionate, self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a versatile and fast moving position that requires someone who is proactive and able to exercise good judgment and communication. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Support the post managers reviewing schedules, budgets, quotes, and workflows Keep up to date with Netflix tools, specifications, and technologies Track and manage post schedules, keeping stakeholders apprised of status Set up and attend post production calls and meetings as needed Update and manage internal databases and trackers Maintain and curate preferred vendor lists for dailies, sound and finishing Research and maintain preferred freelance post crew Set up and manage dailies and cut viewing access for shows Audit completion/delivery of post production materials during prep, production, archive and wrap Qualification: More than 3 years’ experience as a freelance Post Production Supervisor or Coordinator, Post Producer or VFX Producer within a post facility (Experience in VFX production is a plus) Has experience working with local or regional vendors (editorial, sound, color, VFX) on independent or studio feature films and TV series Possess strong knowledge and operational proficiency of current trends and post-production workflows, tools and finishing formats for both UHD/4K and HDR, such as Adobe Premiere Pro and Davinci Resolve Has strong organizational skills; is efficient and detail-oriented and can supervise several projects at various points of production (from development through delivery) Must be comfortable working in a fast-paced collaborative environment and has the ability to navigate constant changes Possess a high level of curiosity and willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current post process Strong written and verbal communication skills Native Bahasa Indonesia Speaker who is also highly proficient in English We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: Netflix’s mission is to entertain the world by building the world’s leading streaming platform offering TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight over 260 million members of all ages and tastes across 190 countries. Like all companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. What is special about Netflix, among other things, is our Culture . We treat each country we enter differently since it is not just about translation, it is about providing our audience with an experience that feels local, and we do it at scale. Our team is looking for an experienced Regional Language Manager to drive and manage the language strategy for Southeast Asian languages on Netflix Products, Content, and Games, and to work closely with external resources and internal stakeholders and partners at Netflix in order to deliver the best user experience to our members and non-members in the region. This highly motivated individual will be based in our APAC hub in Singapore and will work closely with the rest of the Globalization team in the US, Asia, and Europe. Responsibilities Develop linguistic and cultural standards and guidelines, define quality expectations across the whole localized user experience, including supporting the development of style guides, glossaries, tone and voice of Netflix products (UI, navigation, synopses) and content (subtitle, title name localization, supplementals), games and marketing in the region. Monitor the linguistic quality output of Thai, Indonesian, and Malay languages (subject to adjustment depending on shifts in the relevant business signals) by using our internal MQM-based LQA model and other internal quality metrics and KPIs, and provide feedback and context to the translation teams for each of the languages/markets supported, in order to ensure the best resource fit for the highest quality impact. Communicate proactively with Globalization cross-functional teams to anticipate, identify, and fix linguistic, product, and subtitling issues related to the region. Proactively engage with relevant stakeholders in regional offices (e.g. Marketing, PR, Social) for additional context and insights on high visibility titles and to define and influence the best creative and linguistic approach for top priority content. Facilitate collaboration between internal stakeholders (in the region and in the US) and vendors, making sure the necessary resources have access to the relevant information, and advising on the best course of action regarding localization processes. Collaborate closely with other Globalization Language Managers and internal stakeholders (e.g. Globalization Program Managers, Content Acquisition teams) to collect relevant cultural and linguistic information about Netflix South East Asian International Originals and support the localization effort in bringing this content to a global audience. Partner with our International Dubbing team to influence the language strategy of our local language dubbed assets for Netflix branded and non-branded content in the region. Gain deep production knowledge and awareness of product and content data for the region and define quality expectations through research and A/B testing. Proactively engage with internal and regional stakeholders to drive regional product initiatives and create an optimized and consistent local experience and ecosystem for our regional members and non-members. Role Requirements 10+ years of experience in managing language quality and localization programs at a strategic level - experience in entertainment localization (subtitling, dubbing, gaming) a plus. Strong business acumen and proven stakeholder management skills. Proven experience in translation, localization, and language quality management. Ability to show initiative, work independently, and drive initiatives at a strategic level. Fluency in English and native knowledge of Thai languages. Fluency in any other regional language is a plus. Strong knowledge of the movie/entertainment industry in the region. Experience in creative writing and media/journalism is a plus. Deep understanding of localization specificities and pitfalls. Eagerness to embrace a culture of candid feedback. Excellent presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills. Willingness to travel often in the region (between Singapore, Seoul, Tokyo, and Mumbai) as well as to Europe and the US on a regular basis, as external conditions permit. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

We are now seeking an experienced film and TV lawyer to join our Business & Legal Affairs team, for work in a broad and interesting role. As a successful candidate, you will work alongside creative partners to structure, negotiate, and draft production/licensing/talent agreements and harmonize Netflix objectives within production, business, and legal frameworks in the Nordics. You will also advise on intellectual property and union matters. We seek out colleagues who are extremely comfortable making decisions that have both business and legal impact, and who will become trusted partners for both our internal production teams and external partners. The ideal candidate will have direct experience with deal-making and media production issues in the Nordics, across different genres. Experience in licensing would be appreciated. The role requires a good knowledge and willingness to dive into intricacies in the multi-territory Nordics region - with a curiosity to understand business and policy impact, an ability to think out of the box, and flexibility to quickly pivot within a strategy. Required Qualifications: Law degree 5+ years of entertainment experience with both business and legal aspects of production and licensing Strong business acumen and ability to negotiate business terms, with an adaptable negotiation style Strong analytical (strategic and creative) capabilities and judgment Excellent drafting skills Strong communication skills (candor, honesty) Curiosity and willingness to tackle matters outside their area of expertise Ability to work proactively, independently, and reliably under tight time frames in a fast‐paced environment Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross‐functionally, think pragmatically, and be solution‐oriented Ability to collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds Comfortable traveling internationally Fluency in English is required, fluency in a Nordic language is a big plus. This position will be based in Stockholm, with regular travel, primarily in the Nordics and EMEA. description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Role The program management team is a group of Program and Project managers tasked with driving scale solutions across the Marketing and Comms organizations at Netflix.  Partnering with leads across the globe to define best practices and frameworks, lead operational change management, and to identify and implement cross-functional product solutions. We closely partner with our internal product and engineering teams to develop technology solutions for MarComms. In this role, the program manager will be responsible for definition and implementation of global tools and programs which will support the efficient scaling of MarComms workflows.  As the global program manager, they will help set the vision and direction on MarComms priorities, and drive alignment with our global teams, product managers, and Marketing leadership. Key Responsibilities: Workflow Optimization & Change Management Partner with product teams to Identify addressable opportunities to implement tooling and workflow improvements to streamline and simplify complex workflows, on a global scale Strategize and implement change management plans and coordinate with global teams to ensure the successful rollout of new products or operational processes; this includes partnering with key stakeholders to drive change management with minimal operational friction, crafting communication to key stakeholders, contributing to the creation of guidance and best practices documentation, and directly addressing challenges that may emerge during rollout. Activate and lead change across complex and matrixed organizations. Key Responsibilities: Technology Implementation Coordinate with the MarComms team and cross-functional teams to ensure effective rollouts of new operational capabilities and technology.  Responsible for end to end project management on rollout of features & programs.  This includes creating implementation plans, change management needs across the organization, collaborating with customer success teams on communications / training strategy, Monitoring adoption to identify gaps Surface potential issues and impact on workflows to stakeholders and leadership. Advocate for MarComms needs and ensure adoption of technology and workflows Key Responsibilities: Stakeholder Alignment & Communication Facilitate communications and drive alignment on MarComms technology programs, roadmap, and execute against priorities. Work closely with product and customer success to help develop and implement an overall engagement model for the team, including best practices, workflows and methods for feedback Identify risks and misalignment to projects and reduce  the impact of potential risks by developing a plan to manage, eliminate, or limit setbacks. Qualifications 7+ years of experience in project and/or program management, driving large scale cross functional programs. Knowledge of the product development workflow strongly preferred, project management, user acceptance testing, and workflow documentation development. Strong communication skills with proven ability to socialize, explain and “sell” new and complex strategies, practices, and workflows. Experience with techniques and tools that drive process efficiency and continuous improvement Ability to multitask and handle a heavy volume of work, supervising several projects in various stages. Ability to manage and operate in ambiguous situations and think on your feet to solve challenges and problems Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

In this role, the program manager will be responsible for definition and implementation of global tools and programs which will support the efficient scaling of MarComms workflows.  As the global program manager, they will help set the vision and direction on MarComms priorities, and drive alignment with our global teams, product managers, and Marketing leadership. Key Responsibilities: Workflow Optimization & Change Management
  • Partner with product teams to Identify addressable opportunities to implement tooling and workflow improvements to streamline and simplify complex workflows, on a global scale
  • Strategize and implement change management plans and coordinate with global teams to ensure the successful rollout of new products or operational processes; this includes partnering with key stakeholders to drive change management with minimal operational friction, crafting communication to key stakeholders, contributing to the creation of guidance and best practices documentation, and directly addressing challenges that may emerge during rollout.
  • Activate and lead change across complex and matrixed organizations.
    • Key Responsibilities: Technology Implementation
  • Coordinate with the MarComms team and cross-functional teams to ensure effective rollouts of new operational capabilities and technology.  Responsible for end to end project management on rollout of features & programs.  This includes creating implementation plans, change management needs across the organization, collaborating with customer success teams on communications / training strategy, Monitoring adoption to identify gaps
  • Surface potential issues and impact on workflows to stakeholders and leadership.
  • Advocate for MarComms needs and ensure adoption of technology and workflows
    • Key Responsibilities: Stakeholder Alignment & Communication
  • Facilitate communications and drive alignment on MarComms technology programs, roadmap, and execute against priorities. 
  • Work closely with product and customer success to help develop and implement an overall engagement model for the team, including best practices, workflows and methods for feedback 
  • Identify risks and misalignment to projects and reduce  the impact of potential risks by developing a plan to manage, eliminate, or limit setbacks.
    • Qualifications
  • 7+ years of experience in project and/or program management, driving large scale cross functional programs.  
  • Knowledge of the product development workflow strongly preferred, project management, user acceptance testing, and workflow documentation development.
  • Strong communication skills with proven ability to socialize, explain and “sell” new and complex strategies, practices, and workflows.
  • Experience with techniques and tools that drive process efficiency and continuous improvement
  • Ability to multitask and handle a heavy volume of work, supervising several projects in various stages.
  • Ability to manage and operate in ambiguous situations and think on your feet to solve challenges and problems
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new video game offering. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. We are looking for a talented Marketing Manager to work in our games product marketing group as part of the Netflix Marketing organization. As a member of our team, you'll be integral in our mission to provide vision, and help build Netflix into a top global destination for games. As a marketing associate for external games, you will work cross-functionally with game production, brand, creative, title marketing, social and comms to build and execute marketing campaigns for different titles in our external games portfolio. You are thrilled by the unknown and you’re able to come up with groundbreaking initiatives that will take our relationship with members and partners to the next level. You will be a member of a small and growing team based in LA, reporting to the Director of Marketing, External Games. Responsibilities: Provide marketing and brand-centric thinking - partnering with global creative leads, regional marketing partners, and external creative agencies on game campaigns. Define and execute the overall marketing strategy for external games including positioning, goals, priority, budget, innovations, and connecting with the broader Netflix product marketing and title marketing organizations. Manage roadmaps, deliverables, owners, and workback schedules for each event/game and product marketing campaign. Partner with the Director and Marketing Manager to plan, organize, and execute campaigns for higher-priority marketing campaigns. Support and lead games marketing strategy discussions, including positioning, key messaging, and visual identity in partnership with the brand and creative teams to ensure strategic objectives are met. Manage and maintain departmental documents, trackers, and spreadsheets. Succinctly articulate and write strategies, briefs, memos or any documentation needed to communicate our marketing approach and vision, in partnership with cross-functional teams. Support the comms strategy and help to ensure the goals for marketing and comms are aligned. Represent games across Netflix as an expert in the space with deep knowledge across the portfolio. Outline goals and narrative for each event from a marketing perspective and help to determine the approach for each event in collaboration with Creative Production and Comms. Provide onsite support for events to ensure that the beat is achieving the goals we laid out and developers/producers are supported from a marketing perspective. Collaborate with internal cross-functional teams including but not limited to Creative Production, Brand, Product, Localization, QA, Game Production, Game Design, Title Marketing, Social, Partner Marketing, etc. Manage external partners including but not limited to product developers, creative/social/influencer agencies, and researchers, to make sure company brand values and image are followed Qualifications: 4 years of experience in game publishing/marketing; having launched successful marketing campaigns for games on a variety of platforms and genres with a focus on F2P Live Service mobile. Experience working on marketing campaigns for large entertainment IPs in collaboration with filmmakers, showrunners, studios, and license holders is required. Experience working across multiple game marketing functions including community management, social, player support, and user acquisition. Successfully worked on multiple games simultaneously at different stages of development, understanding how to position and create large-scale reach and satisfaction for those games. Experience partnering with product development teams to make insight-informed decisions that impact members Proven ability to galvanize and influence teams and partners across departments at all levels Experience using multiple agencies and vendors that worked in concert and created a cohesive product marketing campaign. Have a style that promotes respect, credibility, and trust throughout the organization Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $245,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: About Us Netflix is transforming how people enjoy TV shows, movies, live events, and games. While we already serve 260 million members across 190 countries, our major growth phase is still to come. Our team develops the mobile, TV, and web applications members use to discover and enjoy great entertainment. Our purpose is to increase member satisfaction by proving our product ideas through creativity and analytical thinking. Achieving this requires skilled, inquisitive technologists who can envision and implement solutions that scale across various devices and ambitious product features. Job Overview The Netflix app should provide an elevated and delightful experience: quick to open, highly responsive to user input, animate smoothly, have a low error rate and easy recovery when they do happen, visually elevated, and accessible by a broad user base from around the world. We are looking for engineers with experience in creating consumer apps for Android to join us in elevating the quality of our Android experience. What You'll Do Identify opportunities: help shape a strategic body of work related to performance, error reduction, visual polish, and accessibility Increase member satisfaction: improve the Android app to give members a more elevated experience Rigorous innovation: validate ideas by A/B testing variations with real customers Bring creativity: collaborate with other engineering teams to unlock your work Partner: collaborate with product and design to strike healthy tradeoffs Enhance our culture: be a great role model and active agent in improving our unique culture Why work at Netflix Make an Impact: Develop products that deliver top TV shows and movies to over 260 million customers worldwide High Performance: Collaborate with outstanding talent on each project Growth: Enjoy opportunities for personal and professional learning and mentorship Freedom and Responsibility: Proactively improve Netflix, even without explicit permission About You You’ve worked on consumer-facing client applications on Android You demonstrate user experience insights and have a usability and accessibility perspective You know performance optimization techniques for client applications You’re unafraid to take on new challenges and learn quickly to be effective in a new domain You can run with ambiguous requirements, be decisive when appropriate, and take smart risks You’re proactive and results-oriented You communicate and collaborate effectively and can advocate for controversial positions At Netflix, we have found that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams, leading to superior results. Our compensation solely consists of an annual salary without bonuses. You're free to choose your ratio of salary and stock options each year. Your compensation in the market range is based on market indicators, including your specific job family, background, skills, and experience. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides inclusive benefits, including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in 190+ countries. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Our world-leading Product Organization team is responsible for anything a non-member or member touches when they come to the service. This team aims to improve the experiences across the diverse device ecosystem with the goal of delighting our members by offering an amazing, personalized experience that will allow them to discover relevant content. The Marketing & Communications (MarComms) Strategy & Analysis team is looking for a talented Manager to help Netflix grow its publishing platform ( TUDUM.com ) and to inform its broader MarComms decisions. TUDUM.com launched in December 2021 with the goal of being Netflix’s home for fans. Our mission is to bring members joy by deepening their connections to their favorite titles and helping them discover their next obsessions. We have nearly tripled our traffic within the last year. To help us unlock our next phase of growth, we are looking for an analytics and strategy manager who can synthesize insights from our wealth of data to drive editorial and growth team decisions. In this role, we’re looking for a big-picture thinker, self-starter, and analytical thought partner with an eye for detail. You must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and embrace ambiguity and change. Prior experience in an analytics role within other publishing organizations is strongly preferred. The position is based in our Los Angeles office and will report to our Senior Manager, Strategy & Analysis, Marketing & Communications. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Liaise with internal editorial, growth, SEO, and operations stakeholders to understand their objectives, challenges and opportunities for TUDUM Help the team to deeply understand TUDUM’s audience and their behavior on site Analyze data around content and page traffic data to recommend improvements TUDUM’s editorial formats Partner with Data Analytics engineer to design dashboards and reports to keep the TUDUM team updated on content successes Lead long range budget planning and budget management throughout the year with an eye towards in-market impact Analyze content viewing behavior within Netflix at large to inform MarComms campaign strategies Influence internal stakeholders at all levels of the organization to take action on business opportunities based on insights generated. Qualifications 6+ years of experience, with at least 2-3 years of experience within a data analytics role within a publishing organization; background in marketing and social analytics is a bonus, but not required Fluency with industry-standard metrics of success within digital publishing Deep understanding of consumer behaviors and discovery habits with entertainment, understands how those intersect with content catalog and services Highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive alignment amid ambiguity Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and effectively influence and contribute with concrete recommendations/next step Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’ Excellent written (memos and presentations) and verbal communication skills; timely communication Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $470,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: About Us At Netflix, we are passionate about delivering joy to our 260+ million Netflix members around the world, whether they’re traveling to a remote location or at home with family. The TV Release Quality team is dedicated to understanding and ensuring the quality of our flagship TV streaming application, allowing us to deliver a stunning experience to members across the globe. We are looking for an experienced UI Engineer who is passionate about quality to join the TV Release Quality team. The TV Release Quality team is dedicated to testing, measuring, understanding, and communicating the overall quality of our TV streaming application both before and after it is released to production. The team will focus on improving and innovating in the spaces of our test automation framework, metrics, observability, and alerting. This team will also set a strategic vision for test automation and quality in the TV space, collaborating with stakeholders and partners across Netflix. About the role Join a team of senior foundational TV UI engineers who value inclusion, transparency, autonomy, and humility. Identify and build innovative solutions that improve our understanding of the quality of the TV streaming application. Tell the quality story of our product through improved observability, alerting, dashboarding, and tools. Strengthen our test automation foundations and signals. Work in our custom TV platform space, which has unique constraints and capabilities. Collaborate, build alignment, and develop strong relationships with engineers and leaders across multiple teams. What sets you apart You love to empower other engineers and strive to understand their use cases. You are excited about building innovative ways to tell the quality story of our product. You are proficient in TypeScript/Javascript. You’ve worked on consumer-facing client applications; bonus if you’ve worked in the areas of observability, alerting, or developer tooling. You can run with ambiguous requirements and have a strong bias to action. You value the perspectives of others when identifying solutions. You know there is rarely one “right” solution, and you make thoughtful trade-offs. You proactively give and receive feedback, even when it's hard. You lean in to help build an inclusive team culture that enables team members of all backgrounds to succeed and thrive. Why Netflix? Collaborate every day with a team that values selflessness, inclusion, and integrity Make your impact on a product loved by hundreds of millions around the world Remote-friendly with a flexible work environment Strong parental leave policy and family forming benefits Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

  • Join a team of senior foundational TV UI engineers who value inclusion, transparency, autonomy, and humility.
  • Identify and build innovative solutions that improve our understanding of the quality of the TV streaming application.
  • Tell the quality story of our product through improved observability, alerting, dashboarding, and tools.
  • Strengthen our test automation foundations and signals.
  • Work in our custom TV platform space, which has unique constraints and capabilities.
  • Collaborate, build alignment, and develop strong relationships with engineers and leaders across multiple teams.
    • What sets you apart
  • You love to empower other engineers and strive to understand their use cases.
  • You are excited about building innovative ways to tell the quality story of our product.
  • You are proficient in TypeScript/Javascript.
  • You’ve worked on consumer-facing client applications; bonus if you’ve worked in the areas of observability, alerting, or developer tooling.
  • You can run with ambiguous requirements and have a strong bias to action.
  • You value the perspectives of others when identifying solutions.
  • You know there is rarely one “right” solution, and you make thoughtful trade-offs.
  • You proactively give and receive feedback, even when it's hard.
  • You lean in to help build an inclusive team culture that enables team members of all backgrounds to succeed and thrive.
    • Why Netflix?
  • Collaborate every day with a team that values selflessness, inclusion, and integrity
  • Make your impact on a product loved by hundreds of millions around the world
  • Remote-friendly with a flexible work environment
  • Strong parental leave policy and family forming benefits
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. description: We're a group of developers, artists, and storytellers that make games full of wonder, danger, and humor. Everyone at our studio, whether an industry vet or new voice impacts each game through collaborative feedback, mutual respect, and creative empowerment. If you want to make games that leave a meaningful impact on players: we want to hear from you. We're looking for new teammates who deeply care about the work they do, the stories they tell, and the people they create with. As part of the Netflix team, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. PRODUCTION AT NIGHT SCHOOL At Night School, production helps to keep all of the other departments and teams coordinated, collaborating, and on track to build unique and compelling game experiences. Iteration and autonomy is a core production value at Night School. Where there’s a gap in process or way to improve a workflow, the production team is empowered to make positive adjustments to bring about a higher quality to our development frameworks and ultimately our game experiences. We’re always looking for ways to reduce project risk, balance priorities, and improve our teammates' ability to create. ABOUT THE JOB The production team takes the creative goals of the development team and translates them into achievable steps to reach those goals. We anticipate and avoid pitfalls in the path toward our creative vision and technical processes. We build plans and seek alignment on strategy across all disciplines while balancing scope and creative ambition. As a Producer at Night School Studio, you’ll be focused on keeping our catalog titles, such as the OXENFREE games and Afterparty, in top-level condition ensuring they’re up to date, optimized for multiple platforms, and stable, high-quality experiences for our members. Responsibilities Include Maintain a robust post-launch production strategy supporting our legacy titles Build and manage balanced releases that account for product bugs, improvements, and technology updates Translate customer service and other player feedback into a cohesive backlog Provide analysis of product health and status to leadership and the studio Partner with other producers, department leads, and project leads to strategize around priorities, resourcing needs, etc Build strong working relationships within Night School and the greater Netflix Games organization Mentor, motivate, and support your teammates and partners by identifying and helping to remove friction, roadblocks, and project risks Skills & Requirements 4-5 years of game production experience in video game development Strong fluency in game development methodologies, best practices, and production systems Leadership and communication skills with a passion for working with creative teams Proficient with project management suites (Google Suite, Jira, Confluence, ClickUp, etc.) Excellent communication, analysis, and organizational skills Thrives in uncertainty and an enthusiasm for working with new or bleeding-edge tech stacks Experience working as a producer on the publishing side and/or with in-market product updates (i.e., Live Ops, DLC, ongoing maintenance) Experience with game publishing and release management on major platforms such as Mobile, PlayStation, Switch, Steam, Xbox, etc Knowledgeable of the game industry from player and developer perspectives About You Passionate about story-telling, video games, and video game development Strengths include being goal-oriented, conscientious, tenacious, thoughtful, meticulous, and organized Both a great listener and effective communicator Self-starter who works well autonomously and is willing to find solutions, be curious, and ask questions when needed Desires to support and guide a team to achieve their goals from a “bottom-up” rather than “top-down” management approach Filters team creative ideas, ambitions, and goals through the lens of strategy and pragmatism Proficient at interpersonal communication, negotiation, and diplomacy Receptive to and skilled at giving and receiving critiques and feedback Lifelong learner who wants to bring experience and knowledge to the project and team every day Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000 - $270,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is seeking a Coordinator to support the Production Management team in Indonesia. This position would support slates from pre-production through delivery, working closely with Production Management Manager and cross-functional teams within Netflix and external partners. The Role A successful candidate will be passionate, self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible, a creative problem-solver, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities, with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail. The position requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and clear communication. Responsibilities: Work in tandem with Production Management executives to onboard and support original series productions Act as a bridge between productions and internal Netflix teams to ensure both sides receive pertinent information in a timely manner Create, update, track and proactively maintain inward and outward-facing production resources and documents Maintain internal databases for production schedules, crew, and contacts Schedule, coordinate, track and attend initial in-house kick-off and ongoing production meetings for the various productions Serve as the in-house production coordinator for all phases of pre-production through post-production, including start paperwork management, writers’ room and office set up, and additional support Procure and maintain heads of department lists for freelance crew Research and outreach to potential filming locations and studios across the world Champion evolving technologies and determine how to incorporate them into production workflows Perform special project research for production executives as needed Qualifications: 3- 5 years production office or studio experience in films and series production Native Bahasa Indonesia speaker who is also highly proficient in English Strong understanding of traditional production schedules and paperwork Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi­task Team ­player who operates in a fast-paced, team-­orientated setting Ability to be discreet and maintain confidential information Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and the Google Suite apps Familiarity with Movie Magic Budgeting and Scheduling beneficial but not require We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 260+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Machine Learning drives innovation across all product functions and decision-support needs. Building highly scalable and differentiated ML infrastructure is key to accelerating this innovation. The Opportunity We are looking for a driven Software Engineer to join a new team focussed on Foundation Model infra under our Machine Learning Platform (MLP) org. MLP’s charter is to maximize the business impact of all ML at Netflix. We develop innovative ML infrastructure to support key product functions such as personalized recommendations, studio algorithms, virtual productions, growth intelligence, and content demand modeling among others. In this role you will get to: Define the LLM and Foundation Model Application frameworks with agentic approaches for large-scale language applications Design and implement tooling around the productization of generative foundation models such as RAG, version control, and prompt management. Design easy-to-use APIs and interfaces for experienced ML practitioners, as well as non-experts. Minimum Job Qualifications 2-5 years of experience in ML engineering on production systems dealing with training or inference of deep learning models. Experience with LLM Ops tooling, LLM Agent APIs, and LLM orchestration frameworks and libraries like LangChain BS/MS in Computer Science, or a related field Experience with cloud computing providers such as AWS Comfortable with ambiguity, ability to take on and execute 0-1 projects Experience partnering closely with ML researchers Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Preferred Qualifications Experience with training, fine-tuning, or serving large deep learning models, or LLMs, at the scale of millions of users. Experience with popular optimized LLM serving libraries such as DeepSpeed, TensorRT, or vLLM. Experience with large-scale distributed training and different parallelism techniques for scaling up training, such as FSDP and tensor/pipeline parallelism. Experience with cloud computing providers such as AWS Recent Artifacts from the team Invited Paper at RecSys 2023 - InTune: RL based pipeline optimization for Deep RecSys Synergistic Signals: Exploiting Co-Engagement and Semantic Links via Graph Neural Networks Talk on heterogeneous compute environments for ML at Ray Summit 2023 ​​OSS LLM Serving & Benchmarking - Talk at ML Platform Meetup Dec 2023 Opportunities for OSS LLMs in the Enterprise - Panel Discussion at ML Platform Meetup Dec 2023 Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range.
