description: We are seeking an experienced Production Executive to join the Production Management team to manage both internal and third party co-production Netflix Original titles from a physical production perspective. Responsibilities include establishing and curating relations with producers and production companies, reviewing budgets, and supporting/suggesting best production practices. The position will work closely with our Creative, Post Production, and other internal teams along with producers to ensure efficient delivery. The Role The successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, able to exercise good judgment, initiative, and has an in-depth knowledge of Japanese unscripted content and production process. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to the points below: Pre Production/Setup of Show -Work with Finance, Legal, Creative, Post, VFX, Music and external production teams on establishing key production schedules and workflows and maximizing budget to spend as much on screen as possible Budgeting -Work with Showrunners and Producers to prepare and vet show budgets and schedules, providing feedback internally and externally on viability and risks -Review creative/scripts and begin defining the budgets -Collaborate with internal teams and our production partners to lock the budget -Track and manage all costs, keeping stakeholders apprised of the status -Review cost reports and trackers on a bi-weekly basis -Help ensure that productions run smoothly, meet deadlines and stay within budget Scheduling -Create/Help inform and draft production and post schedule -Collaborate with internal teams (including Post, VFX, Music) and external production team to lock schedule -Troubleshoot and communicate all changes to schedule to internal/external teams Staffing/Vendors -Lead or assist with search and hire of key production staff -Determine key vendors to accommodate creative vision and relationships, tax incentives, budget needs, location issues -Help maintain/curate preferred vendor list Content Management -Set up and attend key creative approval sessions -Set up and schedule legal clearance reviews with Legal Department Qualifications 10 Years + experience of Japanese unscripted content production, especially Variety TV Shows Ability to handle a fast-paced environment simultaneously supervising several projects in various points of production (from development through delivery) Familiar with the current trends and workflows for both HDR and 4K productions, within a Japanese unscripted content production environment Access to a long roster of high-quality vendors and talent throughout Japan Ability to respond after-hours for important, timely or urgent matters Team-player who operates in a fast-paced team-oriented setting Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly Willingness to travel, as external conditions permits Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current production process and gear Must be fluent in Japanese. Fluency in English is a plus. Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multitask Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides and Google Mail preferred We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service for over 247 million households in more than 190 countries, connecting people of all ages with stories they love on any of their favorite devices. The EMEA Research team is central in uncovering compelling ways to engage and entertain our members across Europe, Middle East and Africa. This Researcher role supports our country researchers, who support local decision making, and our Product researcher who works with Partnership, Payments and Monetization teams across EMEA This is an opportunity to lead innovative research, analysis and storytelling with a demonstrable impact on the EMEA business. You will be responsible for defining, leading, analyzing, and socializing research studies that generate insights to empower business decisions across the company. You’ll partner with cross-functional teams passionate about delivering the most engaging, innovative, and inclusive content and experiences. In this role, you will: Synthesize data from multiple sources (surveys, qualitative,  behavioral, 3rd party) to craft clear meaning and create bigger insights. Lead both qual and quant ad hoc research projects across multiple countries and areas (Content, Marketing, Product), under the supervision of senior researchers across the EMEA team. Proactively partner with other CI researchers and cross-functional partners, including Content, Marketing, Product, Data Science and Brand, to develop new research initiatives About you: Experience in product research, market research, content research, and/or analytics. Hands-on experience leading end-to-end quantitative research studies is required. Some mixed methods research experience is preferred but not required. A balance of creative and analytical skills with the ability to proactively define research questions, identify appropriate methods, execute studies, and synthesize findings. Able to prioritize their efforts in line with business need, and juggle multiple requests from different colleagues Strong communicator with a bias toward action to proactively collaborate with multiple teams across the company Strong storytelling and data synthesizing skills Can thrive in our unique culture Self-starter and problem solver who loves “getting in the weeds” with quantitative data (including survey data, public “big data” repositories, and internal logged data). Research experience in EMEA (including the Middle East and Africa) is preferred but not required Business English required; a second EMEA language is beneficial We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 245 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and games,  across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing into exciting new frontiers of personalization and discovery to help our members find the content they’ll enjoy the most. Fast-paced innovation in the theory and practice of large language models (LLMs) and other foundation models is greatly helping to advance state-of-the-art in personalization and discovery experiences. However, cost-effective and efficient training and serving of the models at Netflix’s scale is a technical challenge. Hence we are looking for an exceptional applied research engineer to help us develop the technology that would enable efficient training and serving of these models. In this role, you will aid applied research and product development by conceptualizing, designing, and implementing engineering improvements related to large-scale deep neural networks. You would have proven expertise in efficiency optimizations using techniques such as quantization, model pruning, distillation, compute-efficient finetuning, etc. You have to be deeply knowledgeable in ML hardware and software to be successful in this role. Additionally, you need solid software development skills, a love of learning, a passion for solving problems, a bias to action, and effective collaboration with scientists. What we are looking for: 5+ years of software engineering experience with a track record of delivering quality results. Proven expertise in training and serving infrastructure for LLMs and other large foundation models. Strong problem-solving skills with knowledge of statistical methods. Strong software development experience in languages such as Python and Java. Deep understanding of TensorFlow and/or PyTorch. Familiarity with hardware and software accelerators and GPU-based optimizations Great interpersonal skills. Strong communication skills - written and verbal. Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. Preferred, but not required, additional areas of experience: Experience as a technical leader. Experience working with cross-functional teams. Experience in Search, Recommendations, Natural Language Processing, Knowledge Graphs, Conversational Agents, and Personalization. Experience with Spark or other distributed computed platforms. Experience with cloud computing platforms and large web-scale distributed systems. Experience in applied research in industrial settings. Open source contributions. Research publications at peer-reviewed journals and conferences on relevant topics. Links to some of our published work: Synergistic Signals: Exploiting Co-Engagement and Semantic Links via GNN - Under review. Lessons Learnt From Consolidating ML Models in a Large-Scale Recommendation System Search Personalization at Netflix - PaRiS Workshop - WebConf 2023. Augmenting Netflix Search with In-Session Adapted Recommendations - RecSys 2022 Query Facet Mapping and its Applications in Streaming Services - SIGIR 2022 Recommendations and Results Organization in Netflix Search - RecSys 2021 Challenges in Search on Streaming Services: Netflix Case Study - SIGIR 2019 Netflix Research site Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing into exciting new frontiers of personalization and discovery to help our members find the content they’ll enjoy the most.  Fast-paced innovation in the theory and practice of large language models (LLMs) is greatly helping to advance state-of-the-art in Search and Recommendation experiences. description: About Netflix Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. About this Role Netflix is seeking an individual to join its Southeast Asia (SEA) Public Policy team. This person will have responsibility for managing government relations and public policy strategies, programs, and initiatives relevant to the operation and growth of Netflix’s business in SEA - with a focus on Thailand (TH), Indonesia (ID), and the Philippines (PH). This will include engaging and building relationships with government officials, industry partners, and civil society groups. The successful candidate will be charged with supporting the Director of Public Policy for SEA in developing and executing the Company's public policy strategy in SEA and contributing to the overall success of the company. One aspect of the role is being able to advise the company on political matters across the region and manage the relationships with key political figures able to influence the business environment in which the Company operates. This role would be centered around the following key activities: Monitor regulatory and general policy developments in SEA and the other specified markets that may impact the Company’s business. Identify, build relationships, regularly engage and coordinate with key government agencies and working-level officials relevant to the Company Develop and strengthen relationships with industry partners, civil society, and other organizations relevant to the public policy space Assist in interpreting laws and regulations to identify and assess the impact of such instruments on the Company’s operating environment Liaise with industry and/or trade associations, including the Motion Pictures Association (MPAA), Asia Video Industry Association (AVIA), US-ASEAN Business Council, etc. and work with them to advocate the Company’s position on public policy matters Support and work with other internal teams for any other necessary issues. The ideal hire should have: At least 7 - 8 years of experience working in corporate/public affairs/events in Singapore and other SEA countries; An understanding of diplomatic and political dynamics between regional institutions (e.g. ASEAN), national government, civil society groups, and thought leaders across SEA; and Strong relationships with thought leaders and diverse groups and stakeholders in the policy community in SEA. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix grows globally, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our growth. This newly created Payroll Specialist will be based in our Philippines office and interact with the Finance and Payroll Team in APAC The perfect candidate for this position must be organized, detail-oriented, with high accuracy in volume transactional work. They must also have excellent communication skills and the ability to work remotely with other APAC team members outside of the Philippines. The Opportunity: As an APAC Payroll Specialist, you play a vital role in ensuring the efficient and accurate processing of employees net pay assigned to you, with a high degree of responsibility, discretion and confidentiality.  Your responsibilities will encompass payroll processing, compliance with relevant regulations and providing excellent employee support on their queries. Job Scope: Payroll processing of assigned APAC countries using a third-party payroll provider. Weekly expenses are processed in-house through Workday Host-to-Host Payment. Prepare, submit payroll changes, new hires, and leavers for each entity to the payroll vendors timely through Workday HCM Responsible for reporting new hires/leavers' documents to the payroll provider within the timeline, ensuring all new hire paperwork complies. Validation of payroll input against payroll register and coordination with payroll vendors for required adjustments/corrections. Coordinate with payroll vendors on timely payout to employees and statutory payments. Perform tasks associated with monthly, quarterly and year-end payroll reporting and taxation. Point of contact for employees on payroll questions through the Zendesk ticketing system Record, monitor on monthly payroll cost and raise purchase orders Record, monitor on payroll vendors’ agreement renewal date Work with Philippines and Singapore team members and follow global process alignment. Knowledge, Experience and Skills Required Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field. Experience in Payroll and Accounting processing for at least 7 years in a BPO or Shared Services environment. Experience working in APAC payroll, a must in Korea, Australia and India. Excellent knowledge of payroll and related statutory labor laws required for payroll-related calculations. Above-average use of Google Docs, Sheets, Gmail, Microsoft Excel and Word, and Workday. Language Skills - Strong written and verbal communication in English We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad-supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers. The core Advertising team is charged with building a new, best-in-class ads organization to establish Netflix as the premiere platform for advertiser partners and to drive advertising revenue across key markets. The Ideal candidate will provide strategic planning, operations, and thought partnership to the APAC Advertising team. Define, build, and maintain the sales inputs, forecasting, and pipeline management of the global advertising business. Lead pipeline and business reviews on a recurring basis. description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 250 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. This scale and experience requires a large engineering organization that collectively works together to give customers the end product they love to use. Productivity Engineering is the organization tasked with making Netflix engineers more effective by building and supporting the infrastructure to create, build, test, deploy, run and Observe the Netflix stack. As Netflix grows, so does the complexity behind our engineering systems. Our challenge is deceivingly simple: keep the developer experience amazing even as complexity increases. Our work impacts virtually every engineer at Netflix and enables other platform teams to innovate faster. We are looking for a talented engineering leader to join our team. In this role, you will Drive the team’s strategy and vision towards a connected and opinionated Observability Exploration and Troubleshooting experience that leads to better and faster operational insights. Lead, empower, challenge, and coach a team of exceptional engineers to grow their impact as individual technical leaders by providing them with context and continuous feedback Effectively prioritize and manage our engineering roadmaps in alignment with our product roadmap Collaborate closely within the broader Productivity Engineering organization, delivering cohesive solutions Where you’ll focus Delighting Netflix engineers with amazing user experiences and customer service Work to reduce toil through connected experiences that spans metrics, logs, traces, events, heap dumps and other operational datasets Take more opinions on users behalf to help engineers manage complexity in extracting insights Provide polished building blocks that are great out of the box but promote extending when needed What sets you apart Experience building and leading high-performing teams Proactive at giving and receiving feedback with a growth mindset. You initiate the hard conversations. Experience working closely with central development platform and tooling team Experience building self service experiences with strong UI/UX components Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; adept at active listening Thoughtful exercising of strong judgment in ambiguous situations Does this sound interesting but intimidating? Please don’t self-select out; let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you! About Netflix Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, allowing you to do your best work and grow. To learn more about Productivity Engineering, feel free to listen to this podcast . Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Want to know more about our team? You can learn about us: - The Netflix culture - Productivity Engineering Podcast - Edgar: Solving Mysteries Faster with Observability | by Netflix Technology Blog - Lumen: Custom, Self-Service Dashboarding For Netflix | by Netflix Technology Blog - Netflix FlameScope

description: Location : Los Gatos, CA in a hybrid model (preferred) or remote based in the US aligned to Pacific Standard Time hours. Strong Recommendation : Please submit a portfolio in your application (with the password) With over 247 million members in over 190 countries, Netflix is the world's leading entertainment service offering great Series, Movies, and Games that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight members around the world. Netflix is powered by a work culture that focuses on high performance and continuous improvement. About XD Discovery This role is on the Experience Design (XD) Discovery team. The XD Discovery team is responsible for the core member experience worldwide, creating personalized entertainment experiences that focus on connecting people with stories they’ll love. The team designs the end-to-end member experience from the moment someone joins Netflix. Our team’s focus is to create engaging user experiences to entertain our global members by making it easier to discover and choose content that’s right for them. This role supports the Member Experience and Personalization product teams, which strive to make finding the right title on Netflix intuitive and compelling with relevant recommendations tailored to members’ needs. Specifically, this role focuses on emerging and experimental consumer-facing Search and AI experiences powered by machine learning to maximize member satisfaction. About You This role will bring the transformative potential of AI to delight members in our mission to entertain the world. This is an opportunity to lead innovative product design with a demonstrable impact on a global scale. Using your full range of interaction, visual, and product-thinking skills, you’ll lead and own product features. You balance a passion for AI and creating highly functional and emotionally resonant experiences with a strong desire to understand user behavior and business success. You’re comfortable switching between vision-level, defining UX frameworks, and hands-on pixel-level work. You’ll partner with cross-functional teams who are charged with revolutionizing how entertainment is consumed and how storytelling is showcased by delivering engaging, inclusive experiences to members. You’ll thoughtfully question the status quo and look closely at how we can push the user experience further with emerging technologies. You thrive in uncharted territories where design hasn’t historically found itself or where the rules and engagements aren’t already established. How do the user experience, underlying logic, recommendation systems, and tooling all fit together? You’ll define strategies and design solutions that will bring this vision to life, then work with cross-functional partners to execute against it. What You’ll Do • Design and build new AI experiences for Netflix product features. search_text:
Remote, California 
  
 Design 
  
 Staff Product Designer, Member Experience 
 
Location: Los Gatos, CA in a hybrid model (preferred) or remote based in the US aligned to Pacific Standard Time hours. 
Strong Recommendation: Please submit a portfolio in your application (with the password)

With over 247 million members in over 190 countries, Netflix is the world's leading entertainment service offering great Series, Movies, and Games that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight members around the world. Netflix is powered by a work culture that focuses on high performance and continuous improvement. 

About XD Discovery
This role is on the Experience Design (XD) Discovery team. The XD Discovery team is responsible for the core member experience worldwide, creating personalized entertainment experiences that focus on connecting people with stories they’ll love. The team designs the end-to-end member experience from the moment someone joins Netflix. Our team’s focus is to create engaging user experiences to entertain our global members by making it easier to discover and choose content that’s right for them. This role supports the Member Experience and Personalization product teams, which strive to make finding the right title on Netflix intuitive and compelling with relevant recommendations tailored to members’ needs. Specifically, this role focuses on emerging and experimental consumer-facing Search and AI experiences powered by machine learning to maximize member satisfaction. 

About You
This role will bring the transformative potential of AI to delight members in our mission to entertain the world. This is an opportunity to lead innovative product design with a demonstrable impact on a global scale. Using your full range of interaction, visual, and product-thinking skills, you’ll lead and own product features. You balance a passion for AI and creating highly functional and emotionally resonant experiences with a strong desire to understand user behavior and business success. You’re comfortable switching between vision-level, defining UX frameworks, and hands-on pixel-level work. You’ll partner with cross-functional teams who are charged with revolutionizing how entertainment is consumed and how storytelling is showcased by delivering engaging, inclusive experiences to members.

You’ll thoughtfully question the status quo and look closely at how we can push the user experience further with emerging technologies. You thrive in uncharted territories where design hasn’t historically found itself or where the rules and engagements aren’t already established. How do the user experience, underlying logic, recommendation systems, and tooling all fit together? You’ll define strategies and design solutions that will bring this vision to life, then work with cross-functional partners to execute against it.

What You’ll Do
• Design and build new AI experiences for Netflix product features. Identify and define product opportunities and create elegantly simple solutions to complex problems. 
• Drive a human-centered design process for defining and executing features from concept to launch.
• Clearly communicate design rationale and iterations to partners and stakeholders.
• Articulate a vision and contribute to strategic decisions around the future direction of what it means to design AI-powered member experiences. 
• Collaborate with a cross-functional team spanning consumer research, data science, product management, and engineering to test, iterate and launch features that advance our mission to connect members with the best Series, Films and Games. 
• Learn and explore the fast-evolving technical landscape to solve member problems.
• Provide systems thinking for large-scale design systems, both strategically and tactically. 
• Employ storytelling to present a vision to create a shared understanding of the UX strategy with the broader team. 
• Apply big-picture thinking to break down ambiguous opportunities into an actionable roadmap.
• Champion our members and a global-first mindset.
• Give and solicit feedback in order to continually raise the bar for quality and craft.
• Embrace our culture of experimentation and A/B testing.

Qualifications 
• 10+ years of experience designing user experiences for consumer-facing products across mobile, web and/or TV. Discovery or search-related experiences are a plus.
• Experience designing and shipping AI or conversational products.
• An understanding of the intersection of User Experience and AI. 
• Excel in interaction design, visual design, and prototyping skills for defining how an experience should function and look based on understanding people's needs. 
• Experience showcasing an end-to-end design process across multiple projects, that include interaction and visual design artifacts, multiple iterations, and high-fidelity prototypes.
• Ability to think at a high level about product strategy and articulate a vision.
• Track record of designing and shipping products and leading projects to successful outcomes for global users and the business. 
• Ability to navigate ambiguity, and drive clarity that brings the user, technology, and business together.
• Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to articulate the rationale behind your design decisions. 
• Experience presenting work to a broader product team and leaders, clearly and succinctly articulating goals and concepts.
• Experience connecting the dots across the organization with other related initiatives across the company while driving collaboration.
• An insatiable curiosity for user experiences powered by AI, machine learning, algorithms, and recommendation systems.


 
  
 Pay Transparency
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off.

See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Location: Los Gatos or US Remote only. It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 230 million members in over 190 countries. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. To achieve this, we must be able to rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe. The Opportunity Platform Product is a team of exceptional product managers and designers who define, drive, and align product direction for Netflix’s cloud infrastructure, developer, and data platforms. Our primary mission is to provide a platform that enables the business to scale effectively and efficiently, accelerating the productivity of Netflix engineers, data scientists, and machine learning practitioners. We prioritize the most impactful opportunities by deeply understanding and synthesizing business & customer needs, data & insights, and industry trends into long-term product vision & strategy with roadmaps and experience design. To further our mission, we're seeking a Staff Product Designer. We’re looking for a highly ambitious, energetic, and experienced staff-level Product Designer who will enable a best-in-class experience for technical talent at Netflix. You’ll collaborate closely with product designers, product managers, data scientists, and engineers to unpack user needs, inform strategy, and design innovative solutions for unique problems faced by technical talent at Netflix. What You Will Do Leads design for one or more large and complex product domains. Assess complex workflows and create simple, intuitive, and scalable product experiences that improve our ability to support the needs of Netflix's technical talent. Scopes design work and negotiates with product and engineering partners to align around milestones and deliverables that are realistic and feasible. Articulates design vision, approach, and status to cross-functional partners and leads through presenting prototyping and design specs. Builds scalable and foundational practices in the design team. Collaborates successfully with product managers, technical program managers, product designers, and engineering teams. Communicates effectively with senior leadership. What We’re Looking For Passionate about great design and amplifying our team culture. 8+ years as a Product Designer (or equivalent experience) in the B2B space, leading high-impact initiatives from concept to execution. Inspires and aligns the cross-functional team with a design vision, communicating and understanding the sequencing of getting to that ultimate vision. Works autonomously and collaborates well with leads and peers on the design and UX vision, informs roadmap and strategy, and executes implementing designs and systems with cross-functional partners such as engineering, research, and PM. Experience building, contributing to, and consuming component-based design systems. Fluency in core product design and prototyping tools (Figma, Origami, or other) Able to collaborate with engineers through implementation and beyond (not necessary to know code) Excellent communication skills that excite stakeholders and articulate a vision. A willingness to fail and learn. Earnest, mature, and ego-free. You welcome candid feedback and can constructively give it as well. Even Better: Experience working with complex internal tooling targeting technical talent. Experience with products around Developer, Data, and Cloud Infrastructure. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $500,000 - $750,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Consumer Products and Live Experiences Finance Strategy & Analysis (CPX FS&A) team is looking for a talented Associate to drive our global growth efforts in themed consumer-facing experiences (including ticketed, food & beverage, and retail offerings). The Live Experiences team is responsible for a diverse portfolio, including the Stranger Things retail stores, The Queen’s Ball: A Bridgerton Experience, Netflix Bites (restaurant pop-up), Squid Game: The Trials, and the upcoming Netflix House locations, to name a few. We’re looking for an Associate who can help the Live Experiences team innovate at the portfolio level and within individual experience projects. In this role, you will need to be a self-starter, big-picture thinker, and analytical thought partner with an eye for detail. You must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, embrace ambiguity, and manage multiple work streams. You must be a solution-oriented problem solver and be able to communicate complex ideas using both qualitative and quantitative means to a broad spectrum of stakeholders. The position is based in our Los Angeles office and will work closely with the Head of Live Experiences. Responsibilities: Develop strategies to scale the business across UCAN, EMEA, LATAM, and APAC Lead long-range planning with an eye toward execution and in-market impact Develop and manage business models and P&Ls to optimize consumer reach and guest satisfaction in line with financial and operational targets Apply innovation to disrupt the way consumers interact with their favorite film/TV stories, and test new transformational ideas (e.g., channels, technologies) Conduct market research and industry/competitive analyses to inform consumer-centric strategies Inform title and audience prioritization, marketing & operational decisions, and assess past programs via the development of key metrics, strategic frameworks, and analyses Support broader brand and franchise strategy development in partnership with Content and Marketing teams Create memos and presentations to influence a broad range of creative and technical business stakeholders, executive leadership, and external partners Qualifications: 4+ years of experience in a highly demanding and analytical environment, e.g. top management consulting firm or investment bank A background in live experiences, themed entertainment, top tier Intellectual Properties (IP), and/or hospitality is a plus, but not required Superior proficiency in Excel & complex financial modeling Superior communication skills (slides, memos, and synthesizing insights) High aptitude for problem-solving, research, and financial modeling used in support of analyses and prescribed recommendations Experience in developing strategies and executing plans to operate and scale consumer-facing businesses across multiple markets Detail-oriented with a keen eye for process and business improvement opportunities Must be a self-starter and be able to operate with little guidance Experience with Google Suite (Sheets, Slides) is preferred Genuine passion and excitement for Netflix’s unique culture and long-term vision. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000-$190,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Company Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity We are looking for a talented event professional, who will be based in the Mexico office, to join a team that is spearheading promotional campaigns across Latin America. Join us for a chance to strategize, plan and execute events across external-facing corporate initiatives and advertiser events in Mexico as well as oversee guest operations for all consumer and external-facing corporate events. We need an expert who will understand the different cultures and idiosyncrasies of the markets in the Latin American region. The Team The mission of the Events team is to provide a consistent, high quality experience to all audiences in our events across Latin America in order to fuel fandom for our titles and talent. The Role The Mexico Ads Events Manager will play a key role in strategizing, executing and managing events in collaboration with the Ads Marketing team, Mexico Publicity and Marketing teams as well as LatAm Events, working across industry events, series and films. The role will manage a wide range of events such as Industry moments, red carpet premieres, influencer activations as well as experiential marketing campaigns and digital engagement. The ideal candidate has broad event experience business to business and has worked with Advertisers,  worked with events for film, TV or entertainment brands will be a bonus.  They will be able to communicate with industry stakeholders, filmmakers, talent representatives, agencies, executives and production partners on efforts. They can formulate, oversee and manage a budget, and give visibility into their process successfully. Pack your bag because travel is a requirement. The ideal candidate is able to make wise decisions, even when faced with ambiguity and thinks strategically. This person is curious by nature, an “outside-the-box” thinker with a passion for and understanding of experiential events and someone who is not afraid to shake things up. They can articulate what they are - and are not - trying to do. They are a good listener and a real doer, and are able to multitask and work at a clip pace. Most importantly, they can guide a team to do all of the same and work as autonomous adults. They are organized, thorough and not afraid to get their hands dirty - and that will mean jumping in to handle tasks that range from hiring an agency to plan an event, to maintaining and updating guest lists, to booking a venue themselves for an event or to working a check-in table. We are a small team, so the responsibility is wide-ranging. They collaborate well with partners that range from the advertisers to publicists to marketing to social to product and beyond. Strong candidates can handle a vast amount of work and are eager to learn. They are curious and also contribute effectively outside of their speciality. A good fit in the role has a candid and direct communication style, they are willing to admit to mistakes quickly and question values inconsistent with our values. They understand that sometimes the job requires delivering bad news, and they're tactful in handling such issues. Qualifications The successful candidate for Events Manager will have 7+ years of event experience, organizing, planning, executing and staffing events at an agency, studio, network or with a brand. They are familiar with a broad range of event productions from red carpet premieres to industry moments to consumer experiences. Languages: Ability to speak/write in Spanish and English is essential. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

They understand that sometimes the job requires delivering bad news, and they're tactful in handling such issues.

They are familiar with a broad range of event productions from red carpet premieres to industry moments to consumer experiences. 

  • Languages: Ability to speak/write in Spanish and English is essential.

description: Position Overview: Join us as a Marketing Producer in Mexico City! You'll bring to life title marketing campaigns, creating unforgettable public experiences. Your diverse production experience and deep understanding of the Mexican market will be invaluable in our fast-paced, dynamic environment, just like every production environment in a high-performance company. Who you are: A Marketing Production Manager is a  resilient team player who thrives on change, is detail-oriented, and has a global business vision. You're comfortable working with all levels of the organization and understand the value of nurturing relationships with agencies and vendors. You're adaptable and ready to adjust workflows as necessary. You're passionate about executing ideas with a clear north star for success and always pursue operational excellence. Key responsibilities: Excellent Project Management skills Driving top-notch execution as an operational expert, bringing innovative campaign ideas to life. Acting as the guardian of excellence in execution, demonstrating craftsmanship and attention to detail. Ensuring that vendors involved in a project and stakeholders consistently meet their deadlines. Proactively troubleshooting, anticipating, and creatively solving problems in a timely manner during a production setup. Having a holistic point of view when working cross-functionally on each initiative from both creative and production perspectives. Jumping into conversations when needed to clarify project concerns with the team, vendors, or agencies. Sharing toolkits and available material with agencies as required. Collaborating effectively with various teams, ensuring deadlines are consistently met. Local production expertise: Coordinating and overseeing a variety of production types like AV, experiential, digital, and traditional, among others. Developing bespoke production strategies for each campaign and offering tailored production solutions. Evaluating the technical feasibility according to the creative idea and identifying the best vendors for the projects. Selecting vendors, overseeing production paperwork, and managing budgets to ensure successful, feasible campaigns. Making sure that everything is produced in line with the vision and Netflix's creative and operational quality standards. Solution-oriented and curious by nature: Thrive on change and use it to fuel creative solutions, maintaining the capacity to elevate production values and local impact even when facing unexpected challenges. Consistently look for ways to improve how we bring ideas to life, considering new tools, technologies, and trends. Maintain an open mindset, prioritizing ideas and finding ways to make things work, avoiding the mindset of "can't be done". Emphasize simplicity and efficiency in decision-making, always optimizing available resources. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with other marketing producers, support agency onboarding, and advise on best practices. Cultivate strong relationships with top-tier agencies and vendors. Requirements: 7+ years of diverse production experience, particularly in the creative industry (preferred in advertising/events). Proven experience in corporate environments, agencies, and/or brands. Budget management and a knack for bringing ideas to life. Comfortably handle at least two campaigns per month and six different types of campaigns per year. High tolerance for change and resilience in demanding, fast-paced environments. Passion for Entertainment, Design, local and worldwide pop culture, Technology, Arts, and Advertising. Impeccable record of cultivating diverse relationships with vendors, partners, agencies, and production companies. Committed to creating more inclusive and safe workspaces. Fluent in English. Familiar with digital experiences, virtual reality, or the metaverse (preferred not limited). We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Partner Engagement team builds strategic, holistic, and long-term partnerships with mobile, broadband, and TV operators to make it easy to access, enjoy and pay for Netflix. The Partner Engagement Manager will be responsible for leading the integration of Netflix into the operator set-top box and payment systems, creating a compelling bundle of complementary services. The Partner Engagement Manager will understand the needs of our operator partners and build products that will spark joy with current and future Netflix members. Responsibilities include managing the integration of the Netflix application into operator set-top boxes, negotiating Netflix placement within the operator entertainment experience, creating user journeys for operator bundle offers including Netflix, allowing the customer to pay for Netflix on the operator bill, defining joint product roadmaps, contributing to the regional partnership strategy, as well as, testing and learning. Our culture is unique and we live by our values.  It is a key part of our approach to innovation, and so the ability to adapt and embrace Netflix culture will be critical in determining success in this role. Ideal Candidate: 10+ years of experience building strategic relationships at leading operators or global platforms Developed payment, acquisition, mobile, wallet, prepaid, or direct carrier billing products Built entertainment products for mobile, web, and TV Designed and optimized acquisition user journeys through consumer insights and AB testing Lead complex technical projects involving multiple parties Navigated complicated, high stakes negotiations resulting in value creation Collaborated with cross-functional teams including product, engineering, business development, legal, marketing, and finance distributed around the world Strong written and verbal communicator, able to be effective at all levels, internally and externally Data-driven analysis and decision-making, informed by a passion for metrics Willingness to travel for partner and internal team meetings MBA We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: LOCALIZATION PRODUCER, GAMES (LOS GATOS or LOS ANGELES, CA) Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Netflix is a global product and our Globalization team needs to scale to support that. We are currently looking for a Localization Producer to help bring the Netflix gaming experience to international markets. As a Localization Producer, you oversee the development of games into target languages, ensuring the conversion of the titles and all game-related components (metadata, marketing, CS, etc.) into localized versions to meet meaningful translation and international standards. You will use your localization and gaming experience to develop and manage relationships and strategies with game studios and vendors. You will develop and oversee the localization strategy, schedule, budget, and quality targets for your assigned games during the project lifecycle, and proactively identify, prioritize, and mitigate risks and blockers encountered along the way. You will also participate in specific games program initiatives, contributing to building the infrastructure and best practices that enable consistently excellent localization and member experience. A successful candidate is a highly motivated individual who thrives when working autonomously in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment. They passionately collaborate and problem-solve. They have a demonstrated ability to manage priorities and projects and have the right mix of organizational and communication skills. Responsibilities: Manage localization projects and requirements across internal and external studios and vendors Work cross-functionally with Netflix stakeholders to identify critical business blockers and collaborate to solve and optimize these Oversee end-to-end localization workflows using our translation management tools and systems Identify and manage project risk through prioritization, bug management, and any other means necessary Manage independent projects within the program Drive high-quality output from localization vendors Oversee the localization budget for your projects by gathering data on the cost, timeliness and quality of your projects Kick-off project & vertical meetings with cross-functional groups for planning Evangelize Globalization to stakeholders Support innovation initiatives like A/B Tests, localization task forces, including info gathering, deliberation, pivoting, viz for results, analysis & optimization of workflows Qualifications: Bachelor's, or Master’s degree, in Localization, Language Studies, or International Studies or equivalent experience as applicable 5+ years of prior buyer-side localization producer/project management/LQA experience, working on projects that involve language launches, software/games, creative content and/or subtitle localization Working knowledge of industry-standard localization tools Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong analytical problem-solving skills Bias to action, proactive & innovative by nature Strong attention to detail Solid in-depth knowledge of internationalization is a plus Experience working in games and entertainment is a plus Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $370,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: About Netflix Netflix is a global online streaming service that offers movies, TV series and games, to users who pay a monthly subscription, and choose how, when and where to watch. We produce award-winning original content and deliver cutting-edge streaming technology, allowing local stories to travel to users across the world. More than anything else, Netflix’s culture is about getting to work with extraordinarily talented people, in an impactful environment. About this Role The Netflix Legal and Public Policy team is a group of highly talented and experienced individuals who work closely with their business counterparts and governments to advance the strategic goals of the company. The team is perceived within Netflix as solutions-oriented and as a welcome part of Netflix’s business team. The Manager, Public Policy - Japan will be a critical member of the Japanese Legal and Public Policy team and a meaningful fellow to the APAC Public Policy team, charged with further growing the Japanese market, specifically the market is the largest in the APAC region, creating Japanese language originals. The manager will be charged with developing and executing Netflix's public policy campaigning, advocacy and ally-building in Japan. The manager will also be a part of a diverse global public policy team, working across regions, product areas, and functions. You’ll combine creativity and intellectual rigor with the organizational skills to manage various campaigns, projects and initiatives. In this role, the manager will advocate for Netflix to bring external perspectives back into the company to inform our perception and direction. She/ He is passionate about the opportunity to shape the future of how we create content and entertainment for everyone and deliver Japanese contents to global audiences. In this role, she/he will represent Netflix externally at the highest levels with government, regulators and third parties, and also become a member of  our stellar team in the Japanese office. You will be responsible for determining and managing our key policy campaigns in-country and also for coordinating with cross-functional peers locally and with colleagues across Netflix’s global Public Policy organization. You will have strong organizational and planning skills and have a keen focus on getting things done. The successful candidate will be charged with building relationships with government officials, industry partners and civil society groups. This role will involve managing advocacy projects, research and writing of policy briefs, monitoring legislative and rule-making initiatives. An important aspect of the role is being able to advise the company on political matters in Japan, in particular, and build as well as manage the relationships with key political figures able to positively influence the business environment in which Netflix will operate. The prospective manager will manage our Japanese policy advocacy, campaigns and ally-building. The primary area of focus will include but not be limited to: - Represent Netflix at the highest levels of policy-making and Government in Japan. - Advising the company on political matters in the region - Develop and lead public policy advocacy and campaigns across the full range of policy areas that impact Netflix (ex. Audiovisual Media Law, Telecommunications, E-Commerce, Privacy, Data Security, Copyright and other IP issues) - Build a network of trade associations, industry partners, non-profit groups and others to support policies that will help create/maintain Netflix positive environment. - Built Netflix policy campaign strategy and delivers flawlessly to achieve our policy objectives. - Ensure relevant and timely internal communications and information flow locally and vis-a-vis global colleagues. In addition to the functional expertise and ability to lead strategically in Public Policy, she/he will also need to exemplify the qualities that lie at the core of our culture - qualities such as excellence, selflessness, honesty and impact, among others. The successful candidate will have: at least 5 years of government or government relations experience related to Japan and substantial campaign experience, either working with a company, government, trade association or similar employer and have an excellent communication skill experience working with governmental entities and knowledge of Internet and technology issues is preferred, as is a background in telecoms/audiovisual media law or policy. excellent writing and oratorical skills in Japanese and English, and will be highly organized and solutions-oriented. This position is based in Tokyo and will require international travel. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The Security & Intelligence Team supports our content, production and publicity functions globally, including Netflix public-facing events across all verticals. This role will report to the Manager of Talent and Events Security. The role will be instrumental in ensuring a safe experience for talent and executives at our events and experiences, driving a high standard of resilience and support. Responsibilities: Provide risk assessment, plan development, vendor management, and security support for our public-facing marketing and publicity events Engage with relevant stakeholders and maintain the talent and event security vendor portfolio Coordinate with Awards, Publicity, and Marketing teams Coordinate with our Security Operations Center for real-time monitoring of events Provide immediate stabilization and management for talent security incidents Qualifications: 5 years of relevant experience, which can include executive/talent protection, security, intelligence, military; with a focus on protection/security issues Experience working internationally with talent, media/entertainment, or production preferred Must be business fluent in English, additional languages a bonus Ability to: Maintain an awareness of security trends affecting global entertainment sector Communicate relevant security issues impacting talent relations to key stakeholders Build and maintain a network of trusted security/close protection vendors and officers Interact with security stakeholders, from law enforcement and intelligence agencies to embassy staff and talent & event management Travel regionally as required (approximately 50%) We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

  • Provide immediate stabilization and management for talent security incidents
    • Qualifications:
  • 5 years of relevant experience, which can include executive/talent protection, security, intelligence, military; with a focus on protection/security issues 
  • Experience working internationally with talent, media/entertainment, or production preferred
  • Must be business fluent in English, additional languages a bonus
    • Ability to:
  • Maintain an awareness of security trends affecting global entertainment sector
  • Communicate relevant security issues impacting talent relations to key stakeholders
  • Build and maintain a network of trusted security/close protection vendors and officers
  • Interact with security stakeholders, from law enforcement and intelligence agencies to embassy staff and talent & event management
  • Travel regionally as required (approximately 50%)

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are constantly innovating to grow our member base and revenue. Algorithms and machine learning power critical systems that enable this growth: from the messages we send to the back-end of our payments infrastructure. We are looking for a product manager to innovate on the next generation of growth algorithms for Netflix. This includes using our vast amount of data to maximize the chances that we enable consumers to maintain their access to our product by successfully collecting payments for one of the biggest subscription services in the world and using machine learning to find the right titles to show non-members as they look to sign up. You will craft and communicate a strategic roadmap and see to its execution leading cross-functional teams of the industry’s best data scientists, machine learning and software engineers. You will work in close partnership with the commerce product management team, design, consumer insights and other functions to bring your vision. As a high-leverage thought leader, you will have the ability to shape our thinking on how to evolve the commercial aspects of our product and have a massive impact on our ability to accelerate growth. This role is based in our Los Gatos office (preferred) in a hybrid model, but we are open to remote candidates who are on the West Coast. Some travel to Los Gatos will be required. Who will be successful in this role? You combine a deep technical background in (e.g. statistics, econometrics, or machine learning) with a strong product sense and excellent communication skills to define, explain and execute your vision. You naturally gravitate towards experimentation as a way to validate your hypotheses while having a healthy skepticism when interpreting experimental results. To be successful in this position, you need to be able to work with world-class engineers, have the statistical acumen to collaborate with top-notch data scientists, and business sense to drive product goals and strategies. Demonstrated ability to build successful consumer-facing applications and algorithms, experience in Growth and/or Payments, and a strong feel for the entertainment business are big pluses. What We Offer The opportunity to have impact. The products and features you will be working on are central to the product experience of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Responsibility. Netflix offers true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate. Learning. You will be creating customer experiences and business models that have never been done before. You will have the opportunity to work with stunning colleagues who value collaboration and from whom you can learn. A work environment where you can grow your career. Many of our top execs started out as individual contributors. Skills Required: Experience managing consumer products leveraging machine learning (e.g. recommendation systems) with a proven record of prioritizing and successfully launching impactful products or platforms. Demonstrated leadership experience working effectively with data scientists, machine learning engineers, statisticians etc. Proven ability to map algorithmic solutions to product problems with demonstrated impact on business metrics through AB testing. Excellent written communication skills and ability to present technical content to non-technical audiences. Ability to partner with different functions to ensure that your solutions drive real business impact. Strategic thinking and ability to incorporate larger business context into algorithm and product development. Postgraduate education (MS or PhD) in an applied quantitative field is strongly preferred (such as Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations research, Information theory, Control theory, Econometrics etc)  or equivalent experience working in data science or machine learning engineering. Experience working in the Payments ecosystem is a plus. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
