description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are seeking an Administrative Assistant to support two executives within the Marketing and PR organization and their teams in CEE. We are looking for an experienced Assistant to support these directors and teams by handling a heavy volume of organizational work. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, and able to pivot when necessary. This role will juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. This will be a demanding and fast-moving role that requires someone proactive and solution-oriented. We want folks from different backgrounds to feel expected, reflected, and respected at Netflix, and therefore we are committed to providing an accessible working environment for everyone. Scope of role: Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to; Manage complex calendars for multiple executives including scheduling and confirming meetings both internally and externally Coordinate logistics for partner meetings Coordinate travel arrangements, both domestically and internationally Administrative duties around processing travel and expense reports, file management, etc. Communicate to relevant stakeholders internally and externally Work collaboratively with Assistants in our wider EMEA team Be the team “master of tools” for both internal and external systems, working on improvements and new efficiency opportunities to benefit the team’s productivity Support key team dynamics and processes (key meetings, off-sites, team activities, budget support…) Support leaders with ad hoc projects such as organizing and supporting events, preparing presentations using Google Slides, team documents (i.e.: Onboarding), databases… Support respective teams with selected organizational tasks Skills & Experience: 5+ years as an assistant supporting multiple senior-level executives in a corporate environment ideally with a media background Knowledge of the entertainment industry would be a plus Fluency in English and Polish Team player who operates in a fast-paced team-oriented setting Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Experience setting up and supporting events Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly, demonstrating flexibility toward work Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task Proficiency in Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Google Mail We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Job Description We are looking for a Marketing Production Coordinator to lead creative innovation and production of best-in-class entertainment campaigns for Japan. This person will be joining our Marketing Production team, a center-of-excellence for creative operations and production, working closely with Marketing & Communications groups at Netflix to connect our stories with millions of people worldwide. The Opportunity With 240+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries, Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service and is powered by a work culture that’s focused on high performance and continuous improvement. This is a great opportunity to shape the future of how we enable the best execution of marketing campaigns, on both quality and scale, as we continue to grow our slate of local and global original, exclusive content. The Role In this role, you will partner with marketing leads on bringing the creative vision to life by focusing on how these ideas will be produced and implemented. You will create innovative connections between our content and consumers and manage the end-to-end production process of non-traditional marketing tactics. This means that you thrive in an environment that requires you to bridge strategic, creative and technical needs. You are a creative talent with a proven track record of bringing marketing campaigns to life across a variety of media, spaces, and canvases. Responsibilities: Contribute to Japan Creative and Production needs, by driving creative marketing innovation, online and offline. Manage and own local creative and production agency relationships to maintain industry leading executions that help further our brand and connect new fans to Netflix Original and licensed titles. Lead, brief, plan and manage internal and external local integrated & short-form production communications and workflows, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and asset delivery, whilst always managing expectations. Be a regional creative and production expert, driving workflow practices about best-in-market activations, in-market technical capabilities and cultural nuances back with global and international teams. Manage localisation, production process and creative approvals of advertising materials (including clearances, delivery, trafficking, etc.). Define, negotiate, communicate, implement and monitor technical quality standards and creative integrity on all project deliverables according to Netflix creative guidelines. Integrate closely with internal and external trafficking teams to ensure that all tracking is implemented correctly, efficiently, deadlines are met, and executions are flawless. Work closely with the global teams, supporting local implementation and customisation of global campaigns, leveraging global materials to deploy local marketing experiences and creative extensions. Work closely with the other regional teams, supporting local implementation of other regional campaigns, leveraging regional materials to deploy local marketing experiences and creative extensions. Personal Attributes: See Who We Are and What our Culture is like. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and leadership in the face of ambiguity. You are always-solving and forever curious. You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge! Passion for TV and film content with some knowledge of the entertainment landscape and media trends for Japan and globally You are a multi-tasker, with clear time management and prioritization skills. Requirements: At least 7 years of experience, preferably at an entertainment brand, advertising or creative content agency with an emphasis on integrated production including online and offline video, high impact display takeovers, rich media, D/OOH, on-ground event activations, digital marketing and paid social campaigns. Language Proficiency - Japanese: Fluent, English: Business level Expert knowledge of marketing campaign and localisation workflows, including understanding the creative and production process for both Video, Digital and Print materials. Ability to translate creative ideas through to technical and native executions, for various ad serving platforms and proprietary publisher platforms. High competency and proven track record of building high performance digital marketing experiences across display, social, mobile and online video channels. Ability to manage a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel, with diverse geographically dispersed teams, across Japan. Global experience is a bonus. Knowledgeable of and familiar with leading creative and production agencies in Japan. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: We’re looking for a creative and highly-skilled Senior Concept Artist to help us forge the creative vision on a brand-new AAA PC game. This is a unique opportunity to be at the heart of crafting and bringing to life worlds for one of Netflix’s first generation of internally developed original games. As Senior Concept Artist, you will have a meaningful role to play in shaping and directing the world that we are creating. The ideal candidate is a well organized leader with a strong, hands-on background with a devotion for sharing and mentoring. You’ll be responsible for generating a variety of industry leading AAA character and environment concepts, as well as help with game design elements for the project. You’ll work with the development teams to create environments along with unique and compelling characters that exude personality and help push the visual style. We're building the foundation for a small, but ambitious, team of creators who’s primary goal is to create a game experience that our players want to repeatedly come back to; and as our Senior Concept Artist, you will be able to create, ship, and help run a game without any competing design constraints due to monetization Quality is something that we are immensely proud to be aiming for, and we are looking at putting the right team together to help take us forward. We’re looking for that group of leaders who are aligned with our core values, and care deeply about the experiences they create as well as the people they make them with.  Those who bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 200 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there Responsibilities Include Be the artistic leader and take ownership for delivering high quality, distinction, and style for our environments Work closely with the Art Director and Lead Concept Artist to help drive the art style and evolve the vision of the project Collaborate with the art team to implement and maintain the creative vision for the game Develop the world that is worthy of a Netflix film/TV series Design characters, props, production callouts, system interacts, high vision concept art, color scripts, marketing material and other visual guides and tasks as needed to assist the development team Develop and maintain strong creative and collaborative partnerships across subject areas to help further develop the game Proactively contribute to drive the department and studio to the forefront of pioneering Games development The Ideal Candidate Minimum 10+ years of relevant experience with 3+ years of it being in a senior artist role. Experienced in working with external outsource vendors (OS)Has an excellent understanding of art pipelines, dependencies, and overall scope of the project Strong communication skills and understanding of various art disciplines (animation, character, environment, VFX Experience designing detailed, modern and forward looking characters The ability to storyboard and help conceptualize character movement and VFX You can arbitrate sensitively between creative desires and production requirements Excellent foundations skills, including composition, design, and color theory and advanced knowledge of human and animal anatomy. Ability to design for a range of art directions, from photo realistic to stylized. Strong ideation, brainstorming and documentation skills Ability to find creative solutions for technically challenging tasks. Additional and Bonus Skills Good communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills Experience with Zbrush and Maya Experience with Epic's Unreal Engine VFX concept experience Passion for gaming A passion and understanding of world building Strong portfolio that demonstrates a range of 2D and 3D concepts Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $90,000-$600,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

You’ll be responsible for generating a variety of industry leading AAA character and environment concepts, as well as help with game design elements for the project. You’ll work with the development teams to create environments along with unique and compelling characters that exude personality and help push the visual style. We're building the foundation for a small, but ambitious, team of creators who’s primary goal is to create a game experience that our players want to repeatedly come back to; and as our Senior Concept Artist, you will be able to create, ship, and help run a game without any competing design constraints due to monetization Quality is something that we are immensely proud to be aiming for, and we are looking at putting the right team together to help take us forward. We’re looking for that group of leaders who are aligned with our core values, and care deeply about the experiences they create as well as the people they make them with.  Those who bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration.  Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 200 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there Responsibilities Include
  • Be the artistic leader and take ownership for delivering high quality, distinction, and style for our environments
  • Work closely with the Art Director and Lead Concept Artist to help drive the art style and evolve the vision of the project
  • Collaborate with the art team to implement and maintain the creative vision for the game
  • Develop the world that is worthy of a Netflix film/TV series
  • Design characters, props, production callouts, system interacts, high vision concept art, color scripts, marketing material and other visual guides and tasks as needed to assist the development team
  • Develop and maintain strong creative and collaborative partnerships across subject areas to help further develop the game
  • Proactively contribute to drive the department and studio to the forefront of pioneering Games development
    • The Ideal Candidate
  • Minimum 10+ years of relevant experience with 3+ years of it being in a senior artist role. 
  • Experienced in working with external outsource vendors (OS)Has an excellent understanding of art pipelines, dependencies, and overall scope of the project
  • Strong communication skills and understanding of various art disciplines (animation, character, environment, VFX
  • Experience designing detailed, modern and forward looking characters
  • The ability to storyboard and help conceptualize character movement and VFX
  • You can arbitrate sensitively between creative desires and production requirements
  • Excellent foundations skills, including composition, design, and color theory and advanced knowledge of human and animal anatomy. 
  • Ability to design for a range of art directions, from photo realistic to stylized. 
  • Strong ideation, brainstorming and documentation skills
  • Ability to find creative solutions for technically challenging tasks.
    • Additional and Bonus Skills
  • Good communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills
  • Experience with Zbrush and Maya
  • Experience with Epic's Unreal Engine
  • VFX concept experience
  • Passion for gaming
  • A passion and understanding of world building
  • Strong portfolio that demonstrates a range of 2D and 3D concepts
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. The range for this role is $90,000-$600,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. description: We’re looking for a creative, highly-skilled Senior Gameplay Animation Engineer to help us build a brand-new, AAA, multi-platform game. The Senior Gameplay Animation Engineer will partner closely with the design team to rapidly prototype and iterate toward a new game vision. This role will eventually grow into leading a small team of gameplay animation engineers to launch and support the game on the Netflix game service. As our Senior Gameplay Animation Engineer, you will have strong gameplay and design sensibilities along with solid engineering fundamentals. description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service in over 190 countries. Netflix aspires to provide great entertainment for people everywhere from the world's best creators across movies, TV series, documentaries, comedy and more. Our members have control over what they watch, when and where, all with no commercials.  It's an amazing time to join the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment. About the Role: This is a newly created regional Awards role with an emphasis on understanding the entertainment landscape across APAC and how Netflix’s role regionally can not only strengthen our goals within the region but also impact our global awards ambitions alongside our content growth. We are seeking someone who is a creative self-starter with experience & understanding of the APAC entertainment industry. They will work closely with the Director, Awards & Talent Relations to manage and execute our awards and festivals strategy across the Asia Pacific region. This will include supporting not only top regional priority titles but also global awards priority tiles. Ideally they have experience with executing impactful publicity and/or marketing campaigns for film, series or documentaries. They need to be passionate about the entertainment industry and willing to seek out and learn about the best-in-class talent both behind the scenes and in front of the camera. This is an incredibly diverse and dynamic region that we want to stay ahead of. They need to be curious but cool under fire - able to work with internal partners across languages, cultures and countries, and represent the company with members of our creative community internally and externally including executives, filmmakers, talent and talent representatives. This is a great opportunity to join a team of professionals dedicated to supporting an exciting slate of films, series and documentaries that feature some of the brightest filmmakers, creatives and actors in the industry. This is a very hands-on role, one where we want you to throw the playbook out the window and push the team to innovate as we continue to push the boundaries of what we can do. To succeed in this role you will need: An entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to make tough decisions, even when faced with ambiguity, and think strategically. Excellent communication and people management skills to foster strong relationships with people and talent at all levels internally and externally. The ability to be scrappy, resourceful and relentless in trying to find solutions. A direct and candid communication style to articulate clearly what you are - and are not - trying to do. Not be defined by past experiences and able to put a new, creative spin on what a campaign can be. Organized, thorough and not afraid to get your hands dirty. Eager to learn and yet, also be able to contribute effectively outside of your specialty. The Work: Maintain alignment on local and regional awards and festival strategy with publicity, content and marketing teams in the APAC region. Work within the global awards team to implement strategies across APAC film festival programming for Netflix titles. Start to develop an APAC Awards press strategy - identifying primary individuals and outlets that write extensively about awards and can lend legitimacy to our regional efforts. Design on and off-season talent relations engagement strategy to elevate networking efforts across creative, industry and press communities. Effectively determine ways in which we can engage with the members of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences and other guild and industry associations in the region. Execute and manage awards campaigns and explore new tactics of promoting our films, series and documentaries. Maintain and manage a budget, and give clear visibility into the process. Potentially talent handler at events and festivals. Responsible for managing external consultants with the Director, Awards & Talent Relations. Handle submission paperwork for different awards and event logistics including planning and organizing screening events. The successful candidate will likely have: Minimum of 5+ years in entertainment with related experience organizing, planning, executing awards campaigns and submissions, and/or agency, studio or broadcast network; Related experience in film festival activity, industry events with a keen understanding of the global entertainment industry. Knowledge of awards voter membership is a bonus. Familiarity with the media landscape as well as entertainment industries across the APAC region. Fluency in an Asian language is required along with the ability to speak and write in English is important. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers. Netflix is seeking a Manager of Account Management who will be responsible for leading a team of Account Managers who function as a strategic partner to sales leading pre-to-post sale campaign execution. The ideal candidate will be responsible for partnering with their aligned Sales Directors on all pitch-to-pay processes and workflows to maximize revenue and ensuring our clients have exceptional experiences with Netflix.  The Account Management team partners with many cross-functional teams including Sales, Ad Ops, Product, Research, Marketing, etc. on all aspects of the campaign lifecycle. This role will work closely with Sales and Account Management leadership to identify efficient workstreams and establish strong relationships internally and externally with key Advertisers and Agencies. Key Responsibilities: Lead and manage a team of Account Managers responsible for pre-to-post sale campaign execution in partnership with Agency Sales Partners Partner with aligned Sales Director(s) to develop and execute sales strategies and packaging to meet revenue targets and drive business growth Develop, document and rollout new processes and workflows that create efficiencies for day-to-day Account Management responsibilities Partner with cross-functional teams including Ad Ops, Product, Research, Ads Marketing, etc. on key projects & initiatives as we build and scale our Advertising Business Provide regular updates to sales counterparts on client feedback, campaign performance, optimization recommendations, booking trends, etc. Develop training and education strategies for Account Management including onboarding and ongoing learning & development Work closely with FP&A on ensuring accurate revenue forecasting, reporting, upfront tracking, etc. Ability to navigate client and campaign escalations and drive long-term solutions to proactively address future concerns Analyze sales data to measure performance and identify areas for improvement Establish and maintain relationships with key clients and media agencies We’re Looking for: 7+ years of experience in Account Management and Sales Planning functions in the digital media industry, with a focus on video advertising Strong leadership and team management skills with a proven track record of managing direct reports Excellent understanding of Sales Operations and pitch-to-pay systems and workflows Deep knowledge of digital media sales, including Direct IO, Programmatic Advertising and CTV Excellent communication and presentation skills Strong analytical and strategic thinking abilities with the ability to make data digestible for cross-functional stakeholders Familiarity with industry tools and software, including ad servers, DSPs, and CRM systems Deep understanding of Advertising Measurement vendors Written & spoken proficiency in English & Spanish (Italian is a plus) If you have a passion for entertainment and a desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment, we would love to hear from you. Come join us and help us entertain the world! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix aspires to provide great entertainment for people everywhere from the world's best creators across movies, TV series, documentaries, comedy and more. Our members have control over what they watch, when and where. It's an amazing time to join the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment. If you are a talented public relations executive with a passion for content and entertainment, keep reading! About the Role We are looking to hire a go-getter, creative events manager who can lead the development and delivery of world-class events from in-person to virtual and everything in between in Korea for external and internal audiences. From external-facing events to internal employee-facing events; you should be able to blend strategic thinking with execution at scale. You should not be afraid to push the envelope and bring new ideas to the table, as well as experiment with the latest tools and technologies to elevate our events into unique-to-Netflix  experiences. You will have amazing attention to detail, the ability to see the big picture and clearly articulate your vision to internal and external stakeholders, as well as the ability to partner seamlessly, and execute flawlessly in Korea for local and global titles. In bringing Korean titles to life, you will partner seamlessly with a regional team of seasoned event professionals while collaborating with local PR, Content, Marketing teams. The role combines project management with partnerships, strategic thinking, execution and the smart use of resources for maximum impact. You will need to have strong cross-functional relationships to create, shape, execute and manage events for Netflix content. The successful candidate will be curious about promotional efforts - paying attention to creativity, concept, quality, and time constraints - and will seek to add value and improve campaigns with new and innovative event ideas. The work: Creative conceptualization, crafting of creative proposals and quotations Partner with key stakeholders across multiple disciplines to align on the narratives to build through events Resourceful strategic thinker and creative problem solver Ability to pivot quickly and maintain a positive attitude and sense of humor Informed captain on all things events, proactively collating Seoul, South Korea Marketing and Publicity Publicity Events Manager - Korea Netflix aspires to provide great entertainment for people everywhere from the world's best creators across movies, TV series, documentaries, comedy and more. Our members have control over what they watch, when and where. It's an amazing time to join the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment. If you are a talented public relations executive with a passion for content and entertainment, keep reading! About the Role  We are looking to hire a go-getter, creative events manager who can lead the development and delivery of world-class events from in-person to virtual and everything in between in Korea for external and internal audiences. From external-facing events to internal employee-facing events; you should be able to blend strategic thinking with execution at scale. You should not be afraid to push the envelope and bring new ideas to the table, as well as experiment with the latest tools and technologies to elevate our events into unique-to-Netflix  experiences. You will have amazing attention to detail, the ability to see the big picture and clearly articulate your vision to internal and external stakeholders,  as well as the ability to partner seamlessly, and execute flawlessly in Korea for local and global titles. In bringing Korean titles to life, you will partner seamlessly with a regional team of seasoned event professionals while collaborating with local PR, Content, Marketing teams. The role combines project management with partnerships, strategic thinking, execution and the smart use of resources for maximum impact. You will need to have strong cross-functional relationships to create, shape, execute and manage events for Netflix content. The successful candidate will be curious about promotional efforts - paying attention to creativity, concept, quality, and time constraints - and will seek to add value and improve campaigns with new and innovative event ideas.  The work:
  • Creative conceptualization, crafting of creative proposals and quotations
  • Partner with key stakeholders across multiple disciplines to align on the narratives to build through events 
  • Resourceful strategic thinker and creative problem solver
  • Ability to pivot quickly and maintain a positive attitude and sense of humor
  • Informed captain on all things events, proactively collating feedback and perspectives from cross-functional partners, including title and market publicists, Photo & AV Studio, Editorial & Publishing, to deliver impactful event campaign strategies 
  • Produce creative and well-executed experiences that are consumer-centric and unique to Netflix
  • Adaptable to hybrid or virtual events, with knowledge of what it takes online and off, including the latest tools, platforms and technologies to bring our vision to life
  • External vendor and agency management and supervision
  • Provide team with strategic direction on sourcing of venues, vendors, entertainment and event related requirements
  • Superior project, budget and time management skills, within tight deadlines
    • The candidate must:
  • A minimum of 12 yrs of events experience preferably from the entertainment industry that includes managing, executing, planning and staffing events at an agency, studio, network or with a brand (experience in film or television awards campaigns is a bonus) 
  • A self starter who is able to work independently, and under pressure, while consistently exercising sound judgment even when faced with ambiguity 
  • Resourceful strategic thinker and creative problem solver
  • Ability to pivot quickly and maintain a positive attitude and sense of humor
  • Articulate what is and is not required to deliver a successful campaign
  • Be transparent and unafraid to challenge, ask questions or call out obstacles
  • Agile with meticulous attention to details
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to roll up your sleeves to get things done
  • Excellent communication in Korean and English fluency is a plus 
  • Experience working in the Asia-Pacific region is a plus

  • The Netflix culture attracts talents who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read our culture memo. If it resonates with you, maybe you’re the right person to join our team. 
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: The Opportunity From “Small Town Scares” to “Irreverent Comedies,” the system that powers Netflix’s multitudes of personalized row recommendations is the result of years of painstaking content analysis, intricate taxonomical work, data science and pure movie and television geekery. If you are an avid fan and a serious consumer of visual entertainment, the Product Metadata & Ratings team at Netflix is seeking a unique candidate who can capture the essence of movies, series, and specials — and turn that into data and information. This starts with digging deep into every assigned title, researching, tagging, rating, and enhancing other pieces of metadata that will help connect our members to content they’ll love. This role will join a team of classification experts: people who can identify, collect and transform the artistic qualities of movies and series into the data that powers personalization for more than 240 million people around the world. This hire innately understands the facets, tropes and themes that allow audiences around the world to laugh, think, escape, cry and tell their friends, “You have to watch this.” The ideal candidate is passionate about global entertainment and has extensive experience working with content, along with a deep and broad knowledge of visual media. They can succinctly and broadly communicate what’s important about a title, and why. They are comfortable working in a high-volume, high-quality, deadline- and data-driven environment with a focus on tagging and metadata. They are an excellent cross-functional partner who can relay the importance of this work to colleagues beyond their team, as well as collaborate on unique projects that use content insights in new and engaging user experiences on the Netflix service. Responsibilities: Objectively analyze, tag, research and write about movies and series with attention to detail, while also understanding the underlying creative intent Serve as an ambassador for our business-critical titles, digging deep into the content and catalog to support strategic positioning Meet tight, dynamic deadlines in a fast-moving, professional environment and assure the highest quality of output Develop a deep understanding of Netflix’s French content slate and successfully interpret the business strategy for the region Multitask, self-direct and self-manage day-to-day aspects as well as other editorial and innovation projects, including A/B tests that require cross-functional collaboration Keep a finger on the pulse with regard to current affairs and cultural moments, while also being aware of historical, political, social and/or sensitive issues from across the region Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills, especially with core cross-functional partners Represent and advocate for the Product Metadata & Ratings team, while also building successful partnerships in region Master internal tools and systems successfully Qualifications: A minimum of 4 years experience working with content via tagging, metadata application and/or title analysis and insights Passionate about movies and series with a deep knowledge of the entertainment and global streaming industries, along with a finger on the pulse of the French entertainment landscape Knowledge of and passion for pop culture and new media trends, including other entertainment platforms Possess a rigorous and analytical mind, with the ability to distinguish nuances within different movie and TV genres and distil the essence of a film/series, including sharing findings in an objective, concise manner Experience demonstrating excellent cross-functional skills in previous roles, including written and presentation skills Strong leadership, time management and communication skills Strong ability to handle conversations with senior stakeholders whilst maintaining a collaborative approach Experience working with large data catalogues is a plus Fluency in data trackers and data management systems is a plus Full professional fluency in French and English is required We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

This hire innately understands the facets, tropes and themes that allow audiences around the world to laugh, think, escape, cry and tell their friends, “You have to watch this.”  The ideal candidate is passionate about global entertainment and has extensive experience working with content, along with a deep and broad knowledge of visual media. They can succinctly and broadly communicate what’s important about a title, and why. They are comfortable working in a high-volume, high-quality, deadline- and data-driven environment with a focus on tagging and metadata. They are an excellent cross-functional partner who can relay the importance of this work to colleagues beyond their team, as well as collaborate on unique projects that use content insights in new and engaging user experiences on the Netflix service.  Responsibilities:
  • Objectively analyze, tag, research and write about movies and series with attention to detail, while also understanding the underlying creative intent
  • Serve as an ambassador for our business-critical titles, digging deep into the content and catalog to support strategic positioning
  • Meet tight, dynamic deadlines in a fast-moving, professional environment and assure the highest quality of output
  • Develop a deep understanding of Netflix’s French content slate and successfully interpret the business strategy for the region
  • Multitask, self-direct and self-manage day-to-day aspects as well as other editorial and innovation projects, including A/B tests that require cross-functional collaboration
  • Keep a finger on the pulse with regard to current affairs and cultural moments, while also being aware of historical, political, social and/or sensitive issues from across the region 
  • Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills, especially with core cross-functional partners
  • Represent and advocate for the Product Metadata & Ratings team, while also building successful partnerships in region
  • Master internal tools and systems successfully
    • Qualifications:
  • A minimum of 4 years experience working with content via tagging, metadata application and/or title analysis and insights 
  • Passionate about movies and series with a deep knowledge of the entertainment and global streaming industries, along with a finger on the pulse of the French entertainment landscape
  • Knowledge of and passion for pop culture and new media trends, including other entertainment platforms
  • Possess a rigorous and analytical mind, with the ability to distinguish nuances within different movie and TV genres and distil the essence of a film/series, including sharing findings in an objective, concise manner

  • Strong leadership, time management and communication skills
  • Strong ability to handle conversations with senior stakeholders whilst maintaining a collaborative approach
  • Experience working with large data catalogues is a plus

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Role: Based out of our Seoul office and reporting to the Manager of Marketing Production, you will be the go-to partner and key point-of-contact for all aspects of Print Production and Servicing: finishing, proof reviews, localization, and adaptation. You value the importance of protecting creative excellence across artwork, static- / image-based-based assets, while maintaining a logical outlook for project execution. You understand Creative Marketing Production workflows and excel in managing a large volume of assets in a high-speed, high-performance environment. You are a force of calm and good judgment as well as an adaptable person who revels in change. This means that you are nimble, able to balance competing priorities among global stakeholders, and an entrepreneurial production + project management expert who can thrive as a strong individual lead and a collaborative team member in a rigorous environment. Responsibilities include: Manage the finishing, production, localization, and servicing of static artwork assets (key art, key visuals, key poster, adaptations, digital OOH, etc), ensuring branding, layout and specs for local and global marketing teams. Drive and manage all aspects of static- / image-based print-related production work, including retouching, colour management, creating production-ready finished art / mechanicals, proof reviews, localization, resizes and everything in between. Create and modify finished artwork files / mechanicals for a variety of static- / image-based / print-related production needs (static visuals, images, OOH, or custom wraps) for regional marketing campaigns. Plan and manage internal and external print production communication and workflow, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and asset deliverables. Shepherd scope, budget, and overall print production resources. Liaise between internal and external partners to provide functional guidance and industry best-practices on art and print campaign collateral Identify and drive initiatives to streamline the print production process Support the broader Marketing Production team by consulting and giving context through a print-based / image-based creative and production lens. Qualifications: 7+ years Print Production / Digital-Imaging / Finishing - Retouching experience at a creative, production agency or similar environment. Advance fluency in colour theory, management and regional ICC profiling practices. Advance fluency in the Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and Acrobat. Strong working knowledge of RGB to CMYK print process and the transition between digital to print color. Knowledge of advertising and marketing campaign workflows, including translating media plans and delivery standards. Understand the difference between a digital comp file and a high res print finish. Fluency in print formats while understanding the fundamentals of assets management, servicing and trafficking. Fluency in digital formats and best practices, know your PPI from your LPI. Expert knowledge of the trends and limitations of the evolving Asia Pacific print-based marketing ecosystem, including exposure to/experience with publishers and distribution networks. Experience managing a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel, while working with geographically dispersed teams. Experience in retouching, masking, colour correction is preferrable. Strong design, layout and finished artwork skills are advantageous. CMP or similar certification is favourable. English and Korean fluency is required. Please provide an online portfolio where applicable. Key Attributes: See Who We Are and what our Culture is like. You are passionate and curious about all aspects of print marketing production and have an entrepreneurial mindset. You are a proactive self-starter, who does not need to be told what to do and will be resourceful in order to find solutions to any challenge. You are not afraid to get your hands dirty. You are a natural team leader, with the ability to conceptualize and articulate creative production and trafficking workflow that all will rally around. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: The Role Reporting to the Senior Director of Marketing Partnerships APAC, the Marketing Partnership Director for Japan will be responsible for developing and executing marketing campaigns whilst cultivating deep relationships with partners like mobile & broadband operators, consumer electronics and other leading consumer brands. Our partners are an extension of Netflix’s own marketing efforts and therefore a strategic lever of growth for us. It is therefore essential that our partner communication is clear, consistent and engaging. Additionally,  we’re always looking for cutting edge, creative ways to work with partners to make the Netflix service and our titles shine. The successful candidate will be a seasoned professional with 15+ years of demonstrated experience in executing partner marketing initiatives. A passion for technology and entertainment is a must in addition to a keen understanding of how access to entertainment fits into consumer’s lives and how it is likely to evolve over time. Ultimately they must own the full life cycle of partner marketing projects from idea to execution to post-analysis. Essential duties and responsibilities: Lead a small team and together, own the marketing relationship & opportunity with our partners in Japan. Execute partner marketing programs that deliver on our broader business strategy. Provide strategic support to internal product and business development teams to develop and execute Go-to-Market strategies across partner channels for maximizing Netflix exposure on new and existing partnerships. Work closely with the cross functional teams; our business development, marketing, content and PR teams to identify opportunities for partnerships and subsequently, the right partners for executing those opportunities. Develop and launch highly creative & conversation-driving marketing partnership programs that advance exposure for Netflix content or the brand in a way that benefits Netflix and our partners. Collaborate with partner creative, marketing and content teams to elevate the campaign creatives and introduce our content to consumers in unique and unexpected ways. Evaluate performance against marketing goals with partners through established review rhythm and define corrective actions to improve effectiveness and results. Be a hands-on leader who is willing to constantly learn and iterate our campaign initiatives to drive bigger & better impact. The role will be based in our Tokyo office and will require occasional travel. Qualifications: Extensive knowledge and 15+ years of experience in Japan in connected industries like Consumer Tech and Entertainment. Strong experience in consumer marketing with natural partner management and influencing skills. Proven record of strong negotiation skills with an ability to develop rapport and translate established partner relationships to programs that impact the business. Ability to analyze and apply data to business strategy and goals. Experience and passion for building great content partner marketing programs that are unique and scalable. Experience working with Entertainment properties (movies, tv series, video games, music, etc) is a plus. Ability to manage multiple time-sensitive projects simultaneously without the support of a large team, working both independently and in close collaboration with a wide variety of stakeholders, mainly remotely. Strong cross-team collaboration skills and ability to promote innovation through a creative collaboration process that transforms different input into one actionable output. Tokyo, Japan Marketing and Publicity Partner Marketing Director, Marketing Partnerships - Japan The Role Reporting to the Senior Director of Marketing Partnerships APAC, the Marketing Partnership Director for Japan will be responsible for developing and executing marketing campaigns whilst cultivating deep relationships with partners like mobile & broadband operators, consumer electronics and other leading consumer brands. Our partners are an extension of Netflix’s own marketing efforts and therefore a strategic lever of growth for us. It is therefore essential that our partner communication is clear, consistent and engaging. Additionally,  we’re always looking for cutting edge, creative ways to work with partners to make the Netflix service and our titles shine. The successful candidate will be a seasoned professional with 15+ years of demonstrated experience in executing partner marketing initiatives. A passion for technology and entertainment is a must in addition to a keen understanding of how access to entertainment fits into consumer’s lives and how it is likely to evolve over time. Ultimately they must own the full life cycle of partner marketing projects from idea to execution to post-analysis. Essential duties and responsibilities:
  • Lead a small team and together, own the marketing relationship & opportunity with our partners in Japan.
  • Execute partner marketing programs that deliver on our broader business strategy.
  • Provide strategic support to internal product and business development teams to develop and execute Go-to-Market strategies across partner channels for maximizing Netflix exposure on new and existing partnerships.  
  • Work closely with the cross functional teams; our business development, marketing, content and PR teams to identify opportunities for partnerships and subsequently, the right partners for executing those opportunities.
  • Develop and launch highly creative & conversation-driving marketing partnership programs that advance exposure for Netflix content or the brand in a way that benefits Netflix and our partners.
  • Collaborate with partner creative, marketing and content teams to elevate the campaign creatives and introduce our content to consumers in unique and unexpected ways. 
  • Evaluate performance against marketing goals with partners through established review rhythm and define corrective actions to improve effectiveness and results.
  • Be a hands-on leader who is willing to constantly learn and iterate our campaign initiatives to drive bigger & better impact.

    • The role will be based in our Tokyo office and will require occasional travel. 
    Qualifications:
  • Extensive knowledge and 15+ years of experience in Japan in connected industries like Consumer Tech and Entertainment. 
  • Strong experience in consumer marketing with natural partner management and influencing skills.
  • Proven record of strong negotiation skills with an ability to develop rapport and translate established partner relationships to programs that impact the business.
  • Ability to analyze and apply data to business strategy and goals.
  • Experience and passion for building great content partner marketing programs that are unique and scalable.
  • Experience working with Entertainment properties (movies, tv series, video games, music, etc) is a plus.
  • Ability to manage multiple time-sensitive projects simultaneously without the support of a large team, working both independently and in close collaboration with a wide variety of stakeholders, mainly remotely.
  • Strong cross-team collaboration skills and ability to promote innovation through a creative collaboration process that transforms different input into one actionable output. 
  • Willingness to be a hands-on leader with an ability to be deeply involved in the details of the execution. 
  • Knowledge or experience with telco/ISP industries or previous experience working with CE and/or retail partners is a plus.
  • Fluency in Japanese and English is required.
  • A desire to thrive in our unique culture.
    • The Netflix culture attracts talents who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read our culture memo. If it resonates with you, maybe you’re the right person to join our team.  We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. description: With Netflix's Korean content swooning over the world, it is an exciting time to join the team here. We are seeking a Korea-based Administrative Assistant to support our executives in Korea. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with unweaving attention to detail at all times. Our teams at Netflix travel and interact with internal and external teams across several countries and time zones, so a high level of organization is a must. Someone who demonstrates significant initiative and inherently exercises good judgment will be most successful both in the role and at Netflix. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Proactively maintain calendars for multiple executives including scheduling and setting meetings that are internally and externally across different regions and time zones Perform administrative duties such as processing travel (domestic/International), accommodation, visa application, expense reports, etc Assist and coordinate internal meetings and events including meeting preparation, digital document organization, and facilitating communication flow both with internal and external team members Maintain a log to track projects and their status In addition, using creative problem-solving and innate organizational skills the ideal candidate may assume this role by adding value such as consist of chart and Google site creation and maintenance, digital tracking of information, proactive collaboration with internal stakeholders to facilitate information flow, implementing organization for information and documents, driving special projects within the team, and more. Qualifications and Requirements: 5+ years experience as an executive/administrative assistant supporting Director or above Collaborative team player who is able to operate and multitask in a fast-paced team-oriented setting Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Positive attitude and proactive willingness to add value Ability to prioritize, exercise good judgment and respond accordingly Ability to be flexible and adapt to shifting priorities while reaching goals Strong written and verbal communication skills in both Korean and English Proficient in Google Mail & Apps Must be excited to learn about and strive in the Netflix culture We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Over 200 million members worldwide love Netflix. When they sit down to watch or play, we want to ensure that nothing gets between them and their favorite shows, movies, and games. And Netflix Customer Service (CS) is here to assist customers when they are in need of help. The Technical Research team sits within the CS Technology team under the CS organization. The team is responsible for managing technical issues escalated through our customer support channels and works closely with Netflix Engineering teams to address member-impacting technical issues and troubleshooting steps. We’re looking for a talented and experienced manager to oversee the daily operations of the Technical Research function and work closely with the rest of the CS functional teams (e.g., Operations, Workforce Management, CS Technology, Knowledge Management, Investigation & Response, etc.) as well as Netflix Engineering teams to address trending technical issues that are impacting Netflix members and mitigate a potential spike in customer support contact volume. You will be joining us as one of the Technical Research Managers who report to the Director of CS Technology and will be based out of the Mexico City office in hybrid working settings (e.g., working in the office a few days per week). In this role, you must have the passion and ability to become a subject matter expert in your responsible area of technical specialties, which are closely tied to Netflix technology and products. Although you’ll be based in Mexico City, this role is not regional but a global role. You must have a great understanding and adherence in representing a global view of the Technical Research function. You are great at leading and managing a team(s) of Technical Research Specialists with coaching and escalation/incident management frameworks and disciplines and building a good rapport with our primary engineering stakeholders and the rest of the CS functional teams. You will be the key player in streamlining the complex workflows and processes and promoting seamless collaboration among the team. Responsibilities: Become a subject matter expert and lead and coach a team(s) of Technical Research Specialists in more than one area of technical specialties. Oversee and manage the execution of the day-to-day operations with escalation and incident management processes, frameworks, and disciplines together with the rest of the Technical Research Managers. Collaborate with the rest of the CS functional teams to streamline the overall member experience of CS from the end-to-end technical issue management perspective. Build trust and strong relationships with the primary stakeholders of Netflix Engineering teams for our collaboration and partnership. Continuously improve and optimize the escalation and incident management process and framework as well as the partnership and collaboration framework with the internal and external stakeholders. Manage the day-to-day operations and relationship with BPO (Business Process Outsourcer) which supports a part of the Technical Research operation. Foster a collaborative and high-performance culture through continuous feedback, supporting employee growth, coaching, and guidance. Use data-driven insights to enhance team performance. What We’re Looking For: At least 5+ years of experience as a people manager in customer service, technical issues investigation and advocacy, and escalation and incident management capacity. Demonstrated ability to manage and articulate highly complex issues effectively. Prior experience working with the US-headquartered company with global responsibility. Prior experience managing customer-reported technical issues with great time sensitivity. Prior knowledge and experience with internally built tools, mobile devices and TV software and platforms, streaming platforms, payment and billing systems, and/or games. Ability to manage projects as well as oversee projects with delegation. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills: great memos and presentations, building trust, and creating collaborative partnerships cross-functionally are extremely important. Ability to identify problems, develop solutions, and implement them effectively. Ability to understand and use technical language. Must be able to communicate effectively with both highly technical teams and less technical audiences, facilitating shared understanding and collaboration. Excellent leadership, interpersonal, and multitasking skills. Experience working in a fast-paced, global environment that requires flexibility for schedule changes based on business needs. Experience using Atlassian JIRA, Confluence, Kibana, Tableau, Zendesk, or similar products. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 200 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. We are looking for a regional growth expert to join our Monetization team. The Monetization team is responsible for product innovation on plans and pricing.  We are looking for Regional Growth Managers who can connect nuanced audience insights at a local level to help drive product innovation at a global scale.  You will help a team of global product managers prioritize business initiatives. You should be comfortable at the hub of a fast-paced environment where you interface daily with cross-functional experts. You are able to build alignment but not afraid to push ahead in the face of ambiguity. The Netflix consumer product team is different from most technology companies. Many key product leaders - including this position - work with multiple cross-functional teams but do not have direct reports. Consequently, we’re looking for experienced leaders who are strategic and also like rolling up their sleeves. As part of the broader Monetization Product Team, you will: Lead local audience insights analysis for commerce innovation, scaling the global Product Management team and enabling more proactive vetting of opportunities. Use local knowledge, product expertise, and historical experimentation performance to assess commerce opportunities to improve product-market fit. Evaluate consumer sentiment/impact of new potential monetization opportunities to help define whether or not we move forward. Drive go-to-market planning for new monetization launches, e.g. facilitating discussions between global/local teams and formulating local product changes where appropriate. Collaborate with a team of stunning colleagues across consumer insights, data science, and product marketing to launch outstanding products to our customers. Ensure timely communication between global and local teams, e.g. writing newsletters, elevating local insights/challenges. Represent the Monetization team in country leadership forums, funneling feedback to global team and supporting regional commerce deep dives Author regional strategy memos and communicate / represent the broader Monetization team’s work throughout the organization. Qualifications 10 years of experience in Product Strategy, Strategy Planning & Analysis, in an highly analytical environment. Local language skills: Japanese or Korean is a must. description: The Opportunity: From Bridgerton to Lost in Space, Stranger Things to Narcos, Netflix brings the most talked about series content to viewers around the world.  The Original Series team is composed of the most experienced and passionate professionals in the industry, who are dedicated to crafting unique stories that are captivating, imaginative and push the boundaries of what's possible for series content. The Role: We seek a highly experienced Manager, Visual Effects to manage both internal and third-party co-productions across Netflix Original Series. This person should be very well established in the VFX industry and should have solid work experience at vendor and/or production level. Key to the position is the ability to help curate vendor and VFX crew relations, review and help budget scripts, creatively assess and comment on work, all while supporting filmmakers and helping to develop the Netflix VFX pipeline. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. This person should intuitively understand and appreciate right-sizing budgets and customizing approaches to visual effects in alignment with a specific Title from high-end spectacle to story-serving invisible effects. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and initiative. Responsibilities Working with Production teams, Studio Creative Executives, and Finance during development and pre-production.  Analyzing scripts, developing VFX breakdowns & budgets and production/post-production planning.  Providing recommendations and feedback on VFX scope of work and feasibility. Building the visual effects teams. Recruiting Supervisors, Producers, Vendors and negotiating with agents. Overseeing contract negotiations and liaising with Legal to maintain thresholds for expenditures and company policies. Managing VFX delivery progress and cost report tracking.  Working closely with the VFX Producers to anticipate and troubleshoot schedule and budget issues.  Ensure production is running smoothly, meeting deadlines and staying on budget. Helping develop and maintain a weekly reporting system for show VFX Producers to generate a concise weekly snapshot of the budget, schedule and VFX progress.  Working with the VFX Supervisor and VFX Producer to review VFX media as a way of ensuring highest quality work. Researching and networking with new businesses and up-and-comers.  Tracking talent availability. Technical understanding of the visual effects process including 4K pipelines as well as emerging technologies for improving workflows. Understanding of tax incentives and rebates. A love for the creative process! Qualifications Minimum 10-12 years of experience specifically overseeing multiple projects at a time in managerial roles such as VFX Producer, Post Producer, VFX Executive Producer, VFX Supervisor, etc. A passion for visual effects and the technology and artistry that makes it possible Experience collecting and negotiating vendor bids, and budgeting for visual effects Knowledge of current trends for VFX production workflows Team-player who thrives in a fast-paced team-oriented setting Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Desire and self motivated to continuously learn Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task. Track record of fostering, building, and maintaining relationships with filmmakers, VFX supervisors, VFX producers, and key vendors Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $210,000 - $525,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Do you live and breathe entertainment? Do you stay ahead of the curve and latch onto the latest films and TV shows across different services? Do you believe that entertainment can have a social impact, even change the world? If you are a talented communications expert with a passion for content and storytelling, keep reading! The Role We are looking for a talented communications expert with a strong understanding of and relationships with corporate, business, entertainment, and technology media. The Speciaist, Communications - Japan, will be based in Tokyo. As a member of a group of seasoned professionals, you will help to tell the story of Netflix as a brand and the technology that underpins our content. You will also bring to life how Netflix is investing in local content, as well as being a significant exporter of content from Japan, providing creatives with a platform to tell new and different stories with diversity and quality. Additionally, this individual will help build and protect the Netflix reputation and brand throughout the country by working with both traditional media and social/online creators. The Communications function is strategically critical to reinforcing the Netflix brand and its service in a fast-changing, complex, and competitive entertainment landscape. We tell our product, financial, innovation, and culture stories and engage media and industry audiences on a wide range of issues while working closely with other public-facing functions to infuse these stories within their efforts. Reporting to the Communications Senior Manager in Japan, the role requires the ability to build and maintain strong rapport with key press. The role has strong cross-functional interactions with the broader team, with a high level of visibility and impact within the business. This individual will be a key partner to the Content, Marketing, Production, Policy, Legal, and Business Development, and other internal groups around the world. The successful individual will be used to working in a fast-paced environment that requires agility, selflessness and the ability to manage multiple things at once. The Netflix culture attracts talents who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion, and curiosity. Read our culture memo (available in Japanese). The work: Set strategy & execute communications plans that help elevate the Netflix brand by working closely with cross-functional counterparts Create high-impact campaigns, and develop proactive stories centered around films & series titles with an emphasis on trying new and innovative ways to promote our brand Explore and continuously build strong relationships with key media outlets, journalists, and opinion formers Act as the point of contact for business partners and organizations when participating in partner panels, film festivals, and other forums Support relationship building and engagement with local third parties on key issues related to our content, social impact efforts and representation efforts Act as the informed captain to coordinate press conferences, roundtables, and any other interview opportunities driven by Communications Develop useful and impactful press materials in support of the campaign for media use Develop reactive communication plans related to issues and risks with content and legal as partners Formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into the process successfully Manage PR agencies integral to creating impact, and staying efficient Qualifications: Have 7+ years of experience in communications. Fluency in both written and spoken Japanese and English. Be a storyteller. Embrace we’re an entertainment brand who develops and tells compelling stories that promote Netflix as a studio. Have excellent judgment with in-depth knowledge about the related industries and competitive landscape affecting the business, and should be capable of serving as a spokesperson of the company Have a strong network of relationships with journalists and key opinion formers. Have creative and innovative ideas to talk about our brand, product, and related issues by closely partnering with various stakeholders in not just the traditional media landscape but also the social and online Is able to work cross-functionally and build relationships inside and outside the organizations; Passion for external relations across media, social, and content partners. Be a succinct communicator in a 'hands-on' role, detailed and highly organized. Have a bias for action who is known to manage things in a timely manner. A go-getter who actively secures and places great stories about our brand Familiar with, and/or enthusiastically curious about the entertainment sector, technology, innovation and media Prior experience working for global brands is a plus. To succeed at Netflix, the candidate must also possess the following characteristics: Agility and the ability to stay cool under fire Adept in a fast-paced environment, and is strong in detail and highly organized. Selflessness Effective communicator and writer (we love debates and memos) Flourishes in a 'hands-on' role, adding value both upstream and downstream We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.
