description: About the role In this role, you will manage day-to-day global live-streaming operations for Netflix. As a Live Broadcast Operations Manager, you will mainly coordinate and execute live-focused initiatives based on collaboration with the Live Streaming Pipeline Engineering Team, Live On-Site Technical Managers and Production teams, and our Reliability Engineering teams. You will impact multiple areas of the live event lifecycle, from the pitch & planning phase to testing and event launch days. You will lead innovation initiatives that bridge the gap between production, hardware, broadcast engineering, and our software engineering teams. Responsibilities Coordination and partnership across multiple stakeholders and clients for the smooth execution of live-streaming events Collaborate with contractors and in-house engineers for transmission planning. Establish and maintain partnerships with satellite and IP transmission vendors. Establish and maintain partnerships with hardware and broadcast companies such as contribution/distribution encoder vendors, closed-captioning gears, and services. Ability to organize and maintain maps & drawings of venue infrastructures for communication with all entities Acts as a central resource for engineering and production, collaborating with teams to develop and execute technical plans that align with Netflix's creative and technical objectives, often managing concurrent schedules. Responsible for troubleshooting, diagnosing, and reporting audio, video, and infrastructure issues. Monitor and manage cloud-based and hardware-based video infrastructure. Provide analysis and remediation of any issues in the video workflow. Manage, build, and evolve ground ingest capabilities, including signal acquisition, inspection, validation, and standardization. Monitors the industry for emerging technologies, developing trends to keep Netflix live on the cutting edge. Work closely to help enable new feature development by figuring out how the feature affects overall operations and how to make it work at scale. Be present on launch days at Network Operations Center (NOC) or ground ingest facilities as required. Be able to work with flexible hours based on the live events schedule. Must have flexibility to travel for scheduled live events. Qualifications 5+ years of broadcast remote operations experience (preferably network level) in a coordination or supervisory role Strong understanding of digital audio/video fundamentals, compression technologies, distribution formats, and associated technologies such as Multicast and Unicast video distribution, MPEG Video (2,4, & HEVC), MPEG-2 TS, HDR, SCTE-35 & ESNI signaling, closed-captions, satellite video distribution, and ad-splicing. Experience with video transport protocols such as SDI, SMPTE-2110, RTP, RTMP, SRT, Zixi, RIST, HLS, MPEG-DASH Proficient in Video and Audio Compression technology Understanding of nuances of remote production and the on-site technical operation Knowledge of remote production facilities and equipment vendors Deep understanding of MVPD-based linear ecosystem and working knowledge of OTT video distribution, contribution technology, and architecture Ability to assess and troubleshoot video and audio quality Experience with on-premise video acquisition with partners or co-location facilities. Nice to have Experience with cloud-based infrastructure Experience with at least one programming language (Java, Go, Python) Experience in Unix (or unix-based systems), shell scripting, and good SQL knowledge Experience with web technologies and distributed systems with microservices architecture Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. Los Angeles, California Video Encoding and Streaming Operations Manager 5, Live Broadcast Technology About the role In this role, you will manage day-to-day global live-streaming operations for Netflix. As a Live Broadcast Operations Manager, you will mainly coordinate and execute live-focused initiatives based on collaboration with the Live Streaming Pipeline Engineering Team, Live On-Site Technical Managers and Production teams, and our Reliability Engineering teams. You will impact multiple areas of the live event lifecycle, from the pitch & planning phase to testing and event launch days. You will lead innovation initiatives that bridge the gap between production, hardware, broadcast engineering, and our software engineering teams. Responsibilities
  • Coordination and partnership across multiple stakeholders and clients for the smooth execution of live-streaming events
  • Collaborate with contractors and in-house engineers for transmission planning.
  • Establish and maintain partnerships with satellite and IP transmission vendors. 
  • Establish and maintain partnerships with hardware and broadcast companies such as contribution/distribution encoder vendors, closed-captioning gears, and services.
  • Ability to organize and maintain maps & drawings of venue infrastructures for communication with all entities
  • Acts as a central resource for engineering and production, collaborating with teams to develop and execute technical plans that align with Netflix's creative and technical objectives, often managing concurrent schedules.
  • Responsible for troubleshooting, diagnosing, and reporting audio, video, and infrastructure issues.
  • Monitor and manage cloud-based and hardware-based video infrastructure. Provide analysis and remediation of any issues in the video workflow.
  • Manage, build, and evolve ground ingest capabilities, including signal acquisition, inspection, validation, and standardization.
  • Monitors the industry for emerging technologies, developing trends to keep Netflix live on the cutting edge.
  • Work closely to help enable new feature development by figuring out how the feature affects overall operations and how to make it work at scale.
  • Be present on launch days at Network Operations Center (NOC) or ground ingest facilities as required.
  • Be able to work with flexible hours based on the live events schedule.
  • Must have flexibility to travel for scheduled live events.

    • Qualifications
  • 5+ years of broadcast remote operations experience (preferably network level) in a coordination or supervisory role 
  • Strong understanding of digital audio/video fundamentals, compression technologies, distribution formats, and associated technologies such as Multicast and Unicast video distribution, MPEG Video (2,4, & HEVC), MPEG-2 TS, HDR, SCTE-35 & ESNI signaling, closed-captions, satellite video distribution, and ad-splicing.
  • Experience with video transport protocols such as SDI, SMPTE-2110, RTP, RTMP, SRT, Zixi, RIST, HLS, MPEG-DASH
  • Proficient in Video and Audio Compression technology
  • Understanding of nuances of remote production and the on-site technical operation
  • Knowledge of remote production facilities and equipment vendors
  • Deep understanding of MVPD-based linear ecosystem and working knowledge of OTT video distribution, contribution technology, and architecture
  • Ability to assess and troubleshoot video and audio quality
  • Experience with on-premise video acquisition with partners or co-location facilities.

    • Nice to have
  • Experience with cloud-based infrastructure
  • Experience with at least one programming language (Java, Go, Python)
  • Experience in Unix (or unix-based systems), shell scripting, and good SQL knowledge
  • Experience with web technologies and distributed systems with microservices architecture

description: The Role We are looking for a Campaign Operations Coordinator to join our Marketing Production team. Marketing Production is the center of excellence for creative operations, cross-functional project management, and marketing asset production. Campaign Operations ensures all assets are planned, executed, and trafficked on-time and on-budget. We work closely with Creative Marketing, Strategy, Publicity, & Regional teams at Netflix to connect our stories with millions of people worldwide. To support our continued efforts, we are looking for an experienced coordinator to join this department, partnering with a team of project managers in all aspects of production. The ideal candidate for this role is enthusiastic, entrepreneurial, organized, and able to thrive in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. You’re a calm in the storm, and able to prioritize competing objectives across a range of global, regional, and local cross-functional partners. In short, you build bridges and connect dots... The Campaign Operations Coordinator will partner closely with the Campaign Operations Managers, as well as producers in our AV, Print, and Regional production teams, to communicate campaign needs, timelines, and status across our Originals and Branded slate. Responsibilities include: Support in coordinating all production across AV, print, and digital assets, including the input and maintenance of campaign status and data across our tooling set, ensuring internal sources of truth reflect current, accurate, and most up-to-date status for campaigns & assets Manage operation-related cross-functional communications, ensuring effective exchange of campaign milestones, assets and deliverables. End-to-end campaign operational scope including: operational management of creatives, asset planning and production, and campaign fulfillment/delivery, as needed. Work with various in-house creative and operational teams to source assets and initiate internal production work. Liaise with cross-regional producers to ensure all deadlines and deliveries are on track Serve as a go-to point of contact for our tooling and infrastructure teams Collaborate with assigned Campaign Operations Managers to document campaign updates, pivots, and workback schedules, as needed Provide back-up and coverage to assigned Campaign Operations Managers Qualifications: 7+ years of experience supporting creative, project management, and/or creative production teams, preferably at an agency, entertainment studio or network. This is not an entry-level role. Knowledge of and experience working on marketing and publicity campaigns, with a strong foundation in creative and production processes for video, print/OOH and digital materials. A strong background working with internal and third-party tools, preferably tools designed for asset tracking, asset management, and project collaboration. Well-versed in Video and Digital types and formats while understanding the fundamentals of asset management, servicing and trafficking. Fluent in the language of marketing and/or tooling Organized and concise with information and communication Comfortable working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders across a wide variety of titles and content Personality Attributes: See Who We Are and what our Culture is like. You are passionate and curious about all aspects of entertainment marketing. You are an enthusiastic self-starter who can proactively determine next steps without being told. You are a natural born communicator, connecting the dots when others cannot and simplifying complex issues and questions. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. You’re comfortable living in the gray and can navigate comfortably in ambiguity. You have experience with cross-functional work and familiarity across the many aspects of campaign development You have a track record of successful cross-functional work and lead deftly across the many aspects of campaign development. You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Netflix connects people all over the globe with movies, television, and now video games by pairing outstanding content with technological innovation. This is your chance to be at the forefront of our new Gaming offering. Members have always been able to watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can also download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced games. At Netflix, we have a perpetual need to improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it; this role sits at the center of these efforts. The Gaming Finance, Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) team develops strategic insights to advance the company’s gaming initiative and is primarily responsible for programming strategy, performance/audience insights, competitive analyses, and metric development. Executives and senior management depend heavily on our team to accurately assess, contextualize, and forecast the business and lead the strategic analysis that is used to inform critical business decisions. In this role, you will need to be a self-starter, an analytical thought partner with a keen eye for detail, and have proven skills and experiences as a cross-functional partner. You must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and embrace ambiguity. You must be an expert communicator who is able to convey complex ideas using both qualitative and quantitative means to effectively work with a broad spectrum of stakeholders. Responsibilities Preparing valuation analyses (model building, scenario testing) to support deal-making decisions and negotiations. Developing insightful presentations that summarize key data, identify underlying trends, and ultimately result in actionable strategic recommendations. Conducting market research and competitive trends analyses and summarizing them for a senior executive-level audience. Working cross-functionally with our Data Science, Consumer Insights, and other data-driven partner teams to develop new metrics and track them through dashboarding and reporting. Collaborating directly with top leaders in the Gaming organization: expertly delivering on their requests, translating their high-level thoughts into actionable strategies with measurable goals, and assisting in socializing these strategies and coordinating execution across a diverse set of stakeholders. Developing, evangelizing, and implementing strategic frameworks to help our executives and stakeholders make informed decisions and evaluate critical trade-offs for this nascent vertical. Netflix Gaming is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. You must be motivated, disciplined, and able to work effectively autonomously. Qualifications 10+ years of work experience in a highly analytical role, ideally in investment banking, management consulting, or in a strategy & operations-focused role at a top-tier gaming or technology company. Relevant experience in gaming, particularly in mobile, is required Strong passion for Netflix IP and the entertainment industry at large. Experience conducting quantitative analyses (including modeling) and qualitative analyses that can drive insights and results. Excellent communication/presentation skills with a track record of presenting complex analyses to senior management clearly and concisely. Excellent writing skills, and the ability to communicate complex data & analysis concisely. Strong initiative and ability to work independently; must thrive in a fast-paced, always-changing environment. Highly intellectually curious, has the courage to challenge the status quo, and exhibits the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Bachelor's degree with an emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature, preferably Business, Economics, or Statistics MBA is a strong plus Passion for gaming is critical Excellent proficiency with MS Excel / PowerPoint (and ideally their Google Suite counterparts) Nice to have: Experience with Tableau, SQL, Data.ai, Sensor Tower Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $470,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Role Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want anytime, anywhere and can change their plans at any time. Personalization permeates almost every aspect of the Netflix product experience: From adapting the UI’s layout to member tastes, recommending the most delightful content, to showing the most helpful title images and trailers to help members choose better - machine learning is essential to how members enjoy our service. We are looking for a Product manager to both advance our existing personalization capabilities in the member experience and to build new algorithmically powered experiences that will delight our members, with a focus on specific contexts like ranking titles a member has previously interacted with, or recommendations related to a specific context like “More Like This”. Leveraging available data, you will craft and communicate a strategic roadmap and see to its execution leading cross-functional teams of the industry’s best data scientists, machine learning and software engineers. You will work in close partnership with the member experience product management team, design, consumer insights and other functions to bring your vision to life and drive transformational change of the product experience. As a high-leverage thought leader, you will have the ability to shape our thinking on how to evolve our product, and have a massive impact on how members enjoy our service. This role is based in our Los Gatos office (preferred) in a hybrid model, but we are open to remote candidates who are on the West Coast. Some travel to Los Gatos will be required. Who will be successful in this role? You combine a deep technical background in e.g. statistics, econometrics, or machine learning with a strong product sense and excellent communication skills to define, explain and execute your vision. You naturally gravitate towards experimentation as a way to validate your hypotheses while having a healthy skepticism when interpreting experimental results. In order to be successful in this position, you need to be able to work with world-class engineers, have the statistical acumen to collaborate with top-notch data scientists and the business sense to drive product goals and strategies. Demonstrated ability to build successful consumer facing applications and algorithms, and a strong feel for the entertainment business are big pluses. What we offer The opportunity to have impact. The products and features you will be working on are central to the product experience of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Responsibility. Netflix offers true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate. Learning. You will be creating customer experiences and business models that have never been done before. You will have the opportunity to work with stunning colleagues who value collaboration and from whom you can learn. A work environment where you can grow your career. Many of our top execs started out as individual contributors. Skills Experience managing consumer products leveraging machine learning (e.g. recommendation systems) with a proven record of prioritizing and successfully launching impactful products or platforms. Demonstrated leadership experience working effectively with data scientists, machine learning engineers, statisticians etc. Proven ability to map algorithmic solutions to product problems with demonstrated impact on business metrics through AB testing. Excellent written communication skills and ability to present technical content to non-technical audiences. Ability to partner with different functions to ensure that your solutions drive real business impact. Strategic thinking and ability to incorporate larger business context into algorithm and product development. Post graduate education (MS or PhD) in an applied quantitative field is strongly preferred, such as : Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations research, Information theory, Control theory, Econometrics etc. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000 - $515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As our slate of original productions and licensed content increases, we must scale and formalize management of content and operational data to meet the changing needs of the business. Now is an exciting time to join a talented, energetic team that is helping to shape operational data standards and practices from pitch to play. We are looking for a strong manager to lead the Data Management team that is responsible for managing critical data sets and taxonomies for our content technology products.  This role is pivotal in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of core data that supports our content pipeline, such as talent and vendor data, deals and pitches metadata, title/season/episode/production hierarchy, and content lifecycle data.  You will partner closely with product management teams to ensure that the data brings value to their products while also working to improve underlying data quality through better processes, analysis, guidelines and user education. This role can be based in our Los Angeles or Los Gatos offices. There is also the option to be based remotely from the West Coast/PST working hours. Some travel will be required if remote-based. In this job, you will: Manage a team of Data practitioners, ensuring data consistency and quality to meet overall business needs. Provide continuous training, guidance, and feedback to empower the team. Define the long-term vision and strategy for the content data management practice, with a focus on efficiently scaling data quality work and maximizing business impact. Partner with Product Managers to implement tools and processes for managing data quality, metadata governance, and the enforcement of data policies, ensuring seamless integration with product development. Expand team responsibilities to include taxonomy services, including crafting classification systems, taxonomies, and controlled vocabularies to support product scalability and interoperability Define a new data governance framework, encompassing operational policies, procedures, controls, and metrics. Own the strategic rollout of the Content Data Governance program, acting as a liaison between Technology and Business Teams. Collaborate with the Content Data Product Manager to lead the development and management of knowledge graphs and ontologies for referential and domain-specific data to support enhanced product functionality. Define how we will measure the success and effectiveness of our data practice and drive the execution and continuous evaluation of those metrics Qualifications: 7-10 years of experience in a data management, data operations, or data governance role, with 5 years of experience in team management. Experience in leading Data Governance, Data Quality, and Data Management programs in a global, complex organization, including experience with data management platforms or content management systems. Experience working with product development teams to lead data administration and management functions. Comfortable with ambiguity and skilled at managing multiple projects simultaneously. Confident in diving into data, understanding it thoroughly, and its connection to business stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to provide clear, concise explanations of data management concepts, priorities, and initiatives. Proven ability to lead and manage a team with a strong focus on tackling the right problems at the right time. Skills to thrive in a fast-changing work environment where ambiguity is seen as an opportunity. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is  $270,000 - $700,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The Opportunity The APAC Partner Engagement  team builds strategic, holistic, long-term partnerships with consumer electronics manufacturers, mobile, broadband, and TV operators to make it easy for Netflix members to access, enjoy and pay for Netflix across Asia. The Partner Engagement Manager will be responsible for leading the integration of Netflix into our Korean operator partners' consumer devices, set-top boxes and payment systems, creating a compelling bundle of complimentary services. The Partner Engagement Manager must understand the needs of our  partners, Netflix, and the industry to build products that will spark joy with current and future Netflix members. Responsibilities Managing the integration of the Netflix application into consumer electronics devices (e.g. Smart TV) and operator set-top boxes. Negotiating Netflix product experience within the consumer electronics and operator entertainment experience. Enabling operator bundle offers that include the Netflix subscription and facilitate members to pay for Netflix through the operators' bill. Defining joint product roadmaps. Contributing to the regional partnership strategy and testing, learning, and evolving our future product offerings. Qualifications 12+ years of experience building strategic relationships at leading operators or global platforms. Fluent in Korean and English. Strong written and verbal communicator. Led complex technical projects involving multiple parties. Navigated complicated, high-stakes negotiations resulting in value creation. Collaborated with cross-functional teams including product, engineering, business development, legal, marketing, customer service, and finance distributed worldwide. Able to effectively influence at all levels (internally and externally). Designed and optimized acquisition user journeys through consumer insights and AB testing. Developed payment, acquisition, mobile, wallet, or direct carrier billing products. Data-driven analysis and decision-making, informed by a passion for metrics. Willingness to travel for partner and internal team meetings. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

Seoul, South Korea Business Development Partner Engagement Manager - Korea Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The Opportunity The APAC Partner Engagement  team builds strategic, holistic, long-term partnerships with consumer electronics manufacturers, mobile, broadband, and TV operators to make it easy for Netflix members to access, enjoy and pay for Netflix across Asia. The Partner Engagement Manager will be responsible for leading the integration of Netflix into our Korean operator partners' consumer devices, set-top boxes and payment systems, creating a compelling bundle of complimentary services. The Partner Engagement Manager must understand the needs of our  partners, Netflix, and the industry to build products that will spark joy with current and future Netflix members. Responsibilities
  • Managing the integration of the Netflix application into consumer electronics devices (e.g. Smart TV) and operator set-top boxes.
  • Negotiating Netflix product experience within the consumer electronics and operator entertainment experience.
  • Enabling operator bundle offers that include the Netflix subscription and facilitate members to pay for Netflix through the operators' bill.
  • Defining joint product roadmaps.
  • Contributing to the regional partnership strategy and testing, learning, and evolving our future product offerings.
    • Qualifications
  • 12+ years of experience building strategic relationships at leading operators or global platforms.
  • Fluent in Korean and English.
  • Strong written and verbal communicator.
  • Led complex technical projects involving multiple parties.
  • Navigated complicated, high-stakes negotiations resulting in value creation.
  • Collaborated with cross-functional teams including product, engineering, business development, legal, marketing, customer service, and finance distributed worldwide.
  • Able to effectively influence at all levels (internally and externally).
  • Designed and optimized acquisition user journeys through consumer insights and AB testing.
  • Developed payment, acquisition, mobile, wallet, or direct carrier billing products.
  • Data-driven analysis and decision-making, informed by a passion for metrics.
  • Willingness to travel for partner and internal team meetings.
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: We don’t need to tell you that Netflix is everywhere. Chances are you’re watching Netflix right now. What you might not know is just how much goes into building the world’s leading streaming service, with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. It is the intersection of award-winning entertainment and cutting-edge technology, woven together by our Freedom and Responsibility culture and powered by some of the most innovative and collaborative talent in the world. At the center of this is the Netflix Talent team, who are responsible for identifying, attracting and developing Netflix's team of stunning colleagues. Our Talent team supports our employees across the globe in a variety of ways, including supporting the development of our people’s skills and capabilities so they can do the best work of their lives at Netflix. We believe that the responsibility for the growth and development of our employees and leaders is shared between Netflix and all our employees. Our Talent Management team specifically plays a key role in this effort, and we are hiring a talent management professional to support our employees across APAC. As a Manager, Talent Management & Learning you will work in close collaboration and partnership with a variety of internal partners to support and drive the execution of the Global Talent Management strategy and all things learning, growth, and development. This is a full-time, individual contributor position based in Tokyo, Japan, and reports to the Regional Lead, Talent Management. Responsibilities include, but aren’t limited to: Strategic Partner Advise on Talent Management Strategies, with a strong awareness of regional and functional needs and nuances Act as a trusted advisor and thought partner to leadership and our HR Business Partners Implement programs that will address business needs and support Netflix’s unique culture. Support leadership development initiatives which enable managers to cultivate high-performing teams Facilitate learning multiple delivery mediums, including in-person training, virtual training, digital learning, and innovative strategies as well as creating ways to assess impact and success. Possess a strong "stage presence" and solid command of audiences large and small. Comfortable facilitating discussions on ambiguous or challenging topics. Can unify and focus a room to gain buy-in and consensus on highly contentious subjects while keeping participants engaged and supported. Review, evaluate and report on Talent Management and learning program effectiveness; analyze feedback from the business, to ensure alignment of Talent practices with business needs Learning Practitioner Build relationships with key stakeholders, understanding the goals and strategies of the function/region. Collaborate on key capabilities with HRBPs which will fuel the company’s creativity and growth When needed, perform needs assessments and analyses to identify and prioritize opportunities to identify and improve gaps in behavior-based, skill-based, and knowledge-based competencies. Set clear expectations for the development and implementation of learning solutions with stakeholders and partners Where applicable, support and facilitate team and leader effectiveness sessions at senior leadership offsites Project/Program Management Responsible for programmatic planning, operations and communication (e.g. regional programs) Collect and analyze feedback on targeted program components. Identify program efficiency and proactively identify program risks and opportunities Partner on the central Talent Management strategy via agile project management workflows and planning Maintain tracking of projects and key initiatives, working in close partnership with the broader Talent Management and other Talent GBP teams; familiar with Asana project management software Work with Talent Management Coordinators to manage program operations, activities and contracting processes with learning vendors Manage tracking of project budget and all associated spending Where applicable, audit and approve vendor invoices We are looking for someone who: Is passionate about growing our culture, leaders and employees: you are thoughtful about what will provide the biggest impact to our employees and focus on delivering exceptional program experiences Stays organized and has a high level of attention to detail and accuracy: you have strong project and program management skills, you manage your time well - you can balance multiple projects and multiple work streams simultaneously, and effectively prioritize, you can design scalable workflows that are effective and efficient Effectively collaborates: You are a selfless team player, you are open to and respectful of different working styles, you welcome diverse perspectives and are open to feedback, you bring others along with you as you work on projects Thrives in a fast-paced environment and navigates ambiguity well: you self-manage, take initiative, and work independently in an ever-evolving, fast-paced environment, you stay flexible and adapt quickly as situations change Thinks creatively and outside of the box: You are resourceful and can think of creative solutions for problems without easy and straightforward answers Holds a growth mindset: You’re someone who is curious and excited to learn and grow on our team Has strong communication skills in both English and Japanese Preferred Experience You have experience in Training, Human Resources, Leadership Development, Talent Development / Talent Management, Organizational Development or related field You’ve supported scaling local, regional, global initiatives You’ve planned large scale programs or broader Talent efforts, specifically within the culture evolution or Talent Management, Learning & Organizational Development space You’ve led Agile and/or design thinking workflows and operating methods You are adept at use of survey and assessment tools to identify business needs and measure effectiveness of solutions You have exceptional group process and facilitation skills to all audiences, including executive leadership We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: The Netflix Talent Engineering team manages and delivers applications for the constantly evolving needs of our HR organization. As Netflix grows globally, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our growth opportunity. Our team is seeking an outgoing, curious Senior HRIS Business Analyst to work in a rapid development environment with multiple internal customers throughout the business. This position will reside in the company’s Los Gatos office and will report to the Manager, Talent Engineering. To succeed in this role you should have at least 5 years of working experience in implementing and supporting ATS, and HCM/HRIS applications and be passionate about the internal customer's business as well as the field of business analysis and QA. An ability to think critically and outside the box is a must. The opportunity to participate in requirements definition, development, training and implementation offers tremendous job satisfaction for a highly motivated problem solver. Visit our culture deck and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team Responsibilities, but not limited to Work cross-functionally with multiple internal teams including Talent Acquisition, Talent Operations, and Planning. Configure, and maintain business process definitions in Workday. Configure and maintain domain security in Workday. Develop and support integrations (EIB), for inbound and outbound data exchange between Workday and other internal/external systems. Build reports and dashboards using Report Writer, and Discovery boards. Experience & Competencies Required At least 5 years of hands-on Business Analyst experience working with Workday Recruiting. Subject matter expertise on the following Workday modules: Recruiting, Onboarding, and Core HCM. In-depth understanding of HR domain and processes. Project management experience. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to think outside the box. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 235+ million memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages increasing our accessibility to Global markets around the world. Growth Data Science and Engineering is part of our product organization within Data & Insights. We power insights to make all the impactful decisions around what countries we launch and grow our membership in, what plan and pricing strategies we employ in those countries, and how we vary our signup flow to make Netflix more accessible and appealing to more potential members.  We also partner in various countries to bring Netflix to life on various devices and subscriptions. Lastly, we take great care and consideration to ensure our customers globally have their payment of choice so that all of our members have a great experience signing up and renewing Netflix monthly. The Growth Data Engineering team sits at the core of building an analytics and data ecosystem that powers Netflix’s understanding and decision-making about how our product is performing and maximizing global member growth. We provide insights and data that help measure the customer experience from acquisition through to recurring subscriptions.  It is part of a larger vertical organization for Growth, with a strong sense of our Netflix product and a data community that fosters technical, and personal growth. Growth Data Engineering is seeking a senior manager to lead a team of seasoned engineers building analytical data sets that help drive product, research, and data decisions in its Growth & Acquisition strategies  (Monetization, Commerce, and Experimentation) Who are you? You are a natural people leader who also demonstrates humility. You care deeply about growing and coaching your team toward success. You invest in your relationships so that you have an understanding of the whole person and their perspective. You have experience in measuring and acquiring customers through a Digital Channel and can think through how to measure monetization strategies linked to plans, pricing, visitors, etc. You have experience with measuring Experimentation results from various visitor and member tests through the acquisition flow in a Digital Channel.  You are able to partner with Data Science and Engineering teams to help ensure we measure the right things well with high-quality data. You have a repertoire of learnings and experience in working with product teams and designing data that informs good digital product decisions and strategies. You are curious, place an emphasis on team performance, and work hard to craft a high-performing team that supports the business goals and each other. You are forward-looking and have a strength in business acumen that you use to be able to anticipate the investments Netflix should be making to improve efficiency, innovation, and alignment. You identify areas for continuous improvement and persistently advocate for action to address them. As a leader you prefer to give context, delegate, coach, and watch amazing people exceed their roles, going beyond your expectations. You have an impeccable eye for technical talent, and influencing hiring decisions across organizations. You understand both the importance and the effort required in building and maintaining an additive and diverse high-performing team. You’re not afraid of hard conversations and are gifted at coaching your colleagues through difficult situations. You are comfortable sharing your perspective on challenging people dynamics. You seek to de-escalate tense situations and are creative & flexible in finding balance with partners to maximize impact. You are a strong communicator, and self-aware about how others perceive your comments. As someone in a leadership role, you aim to be assertive, not passive nor aggressive, in providing input, support, and feedback. You have strong beliefs that are weakly held: you can argue, and hear, all sides of a debate and adapt to new perspectives that emerge from it You have experience in either leading people or projects that build data and software for product analytics, and data science or machine learning A role model for integrity: you have great judgment and can make tough decisions without agonizing. You enjoy working on hard problems with new tech, but what really drives you is creating levers for making a big impact.  You are skilled at guiding your team through and fostering adaptability in the face of different magnitudes of change and ambiguity. You know what good and great data architectures look like and you are able to help your team succeed in making a great strong data architecture for acquisition and monetization. What will you do? Build a vision and strategy for your team, and use your natural intuition and curiosity in understanding business and technology to guide a team by providing relevant context and inspiration. Engage, coach, and guide a team of high-performing engineers to be a high-performing team with a winning reputation for helping the business succeed. Create strong relationships across product, data science, analytics, and engineering leaders and partners that foster collaborative success toward Netflix’s highest priorities Grow and mentor individual team members to reach their full potential through thoughtful observation and courageous, honest feedback What (ideally) do you know? You are passionate about the customer and have worked to provide impactful data that influence product direction or customer experiences You know how to work with data science and analytics practitioners in various contexts You are passionate about data as a product You have expertise with a variety of Big Data tech (S3, Spark, Elasticsearch, graph databases), and know what it means to work in large-scale data environments You have experience in Growth, Acquisition, Experimentation, and Monetization teams/strategies, or similar that help companies achieve global growth You have seen large-scale data architectures with high volume and low latency You have many years of experience leading digital data teams and understand the nuances of data needs that come with making good product strategy decisions. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $480,000 - $1,200,000. search_text:
Los Gatos, California Data Science and Engineering Senior Manager, Growth Data Engineering Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 235+ million memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages increasing our accessibility to Global markets around the world. Growth Data Science and Engineering is part of our product organization within Data & Insights. We power insights to make all the impactful decisions around what countries we launch and grow our membership in, what plan and pricing strategies we employ in those countries, and how we vary our signup flow to make Netflix more accessible and appealing to more potential members.  We also partner in various countries to bring Netflix to life on various devices and subscriptions. Lastly, we take great care and consideration to ensure our customers globally have their payment of choice so that all of our members have a great experience signing up and renewing Netflix monthly.  The Growth Data Engineering team sits at the core of building an analytics and data ecosystem that powers Netflix’s understanding and decision-making about how our product is performing and maximizing global member growth. We provide insights and data that help measure the customer experience from acquisition through to recurring subscriptions.  It is part of a larger vertical organization for Growth, with a strong sense of our Netflix product and a data community that fosters technical, and personal growth.  Growth Data Engineering is seeking a senior manager to lead a team of seasoned engineers building analytical data sets that help drive product, research, and data decisions in its Growth & Acquisition strategies  (Monetization, Commerce, and Experimentation) Who are you?
  • You are a natural people leader who also demonstrates humility. You care deeply about growing and coaching your team toward success. You invest in your relationships so that you have an understanding of the whole person and their perspective.
  • You have experience in measuring and acquiring customers through a Digital Channel and can think through how to measure monetization strategies linked to plans, pricing, visitors, etc.
  • You have experience with measuring Experimentation results from various visitor and member tests through the acquisition flow in a Digital Channel.  You are able to partner with Data Science and Engineering teams to help ensure we measure the right things well with high-quality data. 
  • You have a repertoire of learnings and experience in working with product teams and designing data that informs good digital product decisions and strategies.
  • You are curious, place an emphasis on team performance, and work hard to craft a high-performing team that supports the business goals and each other. 
  • You are forward-looking and have a strength in business acumen that you use to be able to anticipate the investments Netflix should be making to improve efficiency, innovation, and alignment. You identify areas for continuous improvement and persistently advocate for action to address them.
  • As a leader you prefer to give context, delegate, coach, and watch amazing people exceed their roles, going beyond your expectations.
  • You have an impeccable eye for technical talent, and influencing hiring decisions across organizations. You understand both the importance and the effort required in building and maintaining an additive and diverse high-performing team.
  • You’re not afraid of hard conversations and are gifted at coaching your colleagues through difficult situations. You are comfortable sharing your perspective on challenging people dynamics.
  • You seek to de-escalate tense situations and are creative & flexible in finding balance with partners to maximize impact.
  • You are a strong communicator, and self-aware about how others perceive your comments. As someone in a leadership role, you aim to be assertive, not passive nor aggressive, in providing input, support, and feedback.
  • You have strong beliefs that are weakly held: you can argue, and hear, all sides of a debate and adapt to new perspectives that emerge from it
  • You have experience in either leading people or projects that build data and software for product analytics, and data science or machine learning
  • A role model for integrity: you have great judgment and can make tough decisions without agonizing.
  • You enjoy working on hard problems with new tech, but what really drives you is creating levers for making a big impact.  You are skilled at guiding your team through and fostering adaptability in the face of different magnitudes of change and ambiguity.
  • You know what good and great data architectures look like and you are able to help your team succeed in making a great strong data architecture for acquisition and monetization.
    • What will you do?
  • Build a vision and strategy for your team, and use your natural intuition and curiosity in understanding business and technology to guide a team by providing relevant context and inspiration.
  • Engage, coach, and guide a team of high-performing engineers to be a high-performing team with a winning reputation for helping the business succeed.
  • Create strong relationships across product, data science, analytics, and engineering leaders and partners that foster collaborative success toward Netflix’s highest priorities
  • Grow and mentor individual team members to reach their full potential through thoughtful observation and courageous, honest feedback 
    • What (ideally) do you know?
  • You are passionate about the customer and have worked to provide impactful data that influence product direction or customer experiences
  • You know how to work with data science and analytics practitioners in various contexts
  • You are passionate about data as a product
  • You have expertise with a variety of Big Data tech (S3, Spark, Elasticsearch, graph databases), and know what it means to work in large-scale data environments
  • You have experience in Growth, Acquisition, Experimentation, and Monetization teams/strategies, or similar that help companies achieve global growth 
  • You have seen large-scale data architectures with high volume and low latency
  • You have many years of experience leading digital data teams and understand the nuances of data needs that come with making good product strategy decisions.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Role The Media Strategy Manager is responsible for working with our local marketing teams across Japan to develop best practices, connect paid social channels to our overall marketing strategy, explore and leverage key media partners, build learning agendas, and to scale campaigns and ideas. A successful Media Strategy Manager will be responsible for the strategy, planning and execution of paid social and programmatic campaigns for our film and series title launches, as well as brand initiatives. The role involves a high degree of stakeholder consultation and partnership, and requires an appetite to build scaled strategies while also balancing the need to tailor campaigns and learnings towards the local market priorities. It is expected that a successful candidate will be developing detailed media plans and guiding our partner on operational specifics related to smooth campaign execution, so a knowledge of platform setup is required for the role. Responsibilities: End to end strategy, planning, and managing activation partners for execution of paid social campaigns across multiple channels, including Meta, YouTube, TikTok and X (formerly Twitter). Work hand in hand with the marketing team on title level paid social strategy and goals in order to make informed recommendations around targeting, platforms, creative formats and budget allocation Partner with the marketing strategy team on campaign success evaluation as well as strategic principles and guidelines that are in line with our marketing goals Serve as a platform expert across established and developing paid social channels with the ability to advise cross functional teams on audience demos, targeting capabilities and creative formats Work with key stakeholders at digital platforms on ways to best leverage their products and opportunities for scalable digital innovation Act as a resource to the country marketing teams to provide paid social creative best practices and recommendations with a focus on ways to execute breakthrough creative concepts Provide feedback to partner teams on tooling needs for campaign planning & execution efficiency Understand, advocate, and embody the company’s values and team goals Qualifications: 8+ years managing and developing strategy for paid media campaigns in Japan Experience with upper funnel campaign tactics and success evaluation Proficiency in Meta, Tiktok, X (formerly Twitter) and YouTube’s ad management platforms Well versed in paid social best practices, including channel specific creative formats and the latest strategies resonating with consumers. Highly detail oriented with an ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast paced, high volume environment Strong communication skills in both English and Japanese, and the ability to work cross functionally with multiple stakeholders A startup/scale up mentality, experience building solutions from scratch and an excitement for the unknown/untested. Familiarity with integrating organic and paid social elements into holistic strategies Strong grasp of the overall marketing ecosystem and specifically the role that digital media and paid social plays within it Up to date with new and emerging social platforms and innovative industry trends We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: Netflix's mission is to bring joy and delight to our customers by providing the best content and streaming experience possible. There is no better way to do this than through the Netflix iOS application on Apple's iPhones and iPads. iOS devices are used by millions of users across the world to stream high-quality content and are loved by creatives, producers, and filmmakers for their capabilities. Marrying Netflix's exceptional engineering capabilities with Apple's world-class technology brings unparalleled viewing quality to the millions of Netflix users who stream on iOS devices. The Netflix iOS Player Team is responsible for building the best streaming experience for our iOS customers. We are an intrepid group of highly skilled engineers who self-navigate through various problems to deliver complex solutions quickly and with extremely high quality. Our team works on various aspects of playback for the Netflix application, ranging from playback mechanism to integration with UI. We are looking for a talented Software Engineer to join our small team and help us build the next wave of innovation on the Netflix iOS App. As a team member, you will be responsible for building robust and scalable solutions for new features and optimizing existing player experiences. You must self-organize project delivery, work with engineers cross-functionally to gather and define requirements and execute complex projects. What Sets You Apart Curious about a broad range of new or unfamiliar technologies, our consumer base, and product vision Seek different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to continuously grow and improve Maintain strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication Take a thoughtful and practical approach to problem-solving that considers tradeoffs and avoids over-engineering Comfortable asking questions and seeking knowledge in unfamiliar or ambiguous situations Endeavor to elevate the knowledge, skills, and abilities of yourself and others that fosters an inclusive and collaborative environment Must have skills and experiences A proven track record of delivering quality player capabilities within the iOS or tvOS ecosystem Proficiency in Swift and Objective-C Experience with Apple's software development tools (Xcode, Instruments, etc.) Experience with UIKit, AVFoundation, and other relevant frameworks Experience with video and audio streaming technologies (HLS, DASH) Strong understanding of software architecture and design patterns Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong ability to communicate cross-functionally Knowledge of media formats and codecs (AAC, H.264, HEVC, etc.) While on the team, you can expect to: Design, develop, and maintain high-quality features for Netflix’s iOS player Work to collaborate with cross-functional teams to define app features and user experiences Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code Continuously improve app performance and user experience Nice to have Experience with unit tests and automated testing frameworks Experience writing automation tests Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: Interested in working with the team that influences ⅓ of the Internet traffic , shapes the playback experience at Netflix , and brings studio-quality audio to Stranger Things ? Read on to learn more! Who We Are We obsess over great playback experiences. We want playback to start immediately, at great quality, and we never want playback to stop unexpectedly. To provide the best possible streaming experience, we design algorithms that adapt audio and video qualities to ever-changing network conditions, encoding profiles, UI features, and device capabilities. Our team comes from diverse backgrounds, has an equal gender ratio, and has a wide range of expertise in computer networking, video streaming, data analysis, embedded systems, and software engineering. Beyond the subscription-based video-on-demand service, we help Netflix expand into Live Streaming and Advertisements. We work highly cross-functionally and jointly develop our algorithms with Netflix CDN, Encoding Technologies, Data Science & Engineering, Consumer Insights, and UI Engineering. Who You Are We are looking for a senior engineer to help us further improve the streaming quality of experience (QoE) on browsers, game consoles, Smart TVs, mobile and other devices. In this role, you would be responsible for improving Netflix’s Live streaming experience and developing tools that help innovate streaming algorithms for millions of devices. You will also help evolve system architecture and conduct controlled experiments in the field to validate improvements. It’s an exciting time to join this team! The business is expanding, the science is new, and we’re making big progress at a rapid pace. More about you: Comfortable developing software on multiple platforms Comfortable with algorithm-focused software development Proven ability to design tools to improve software performance Proven ability to communicate complex technical issues cross-functionally Bias to action and take strategic approaches to solve technical problems Nice to have skills: Experience in statistics and data analysis Experience with audio or video Knowledge of streaming protocols Knowledge of data engineering Knowledge of encoding technology Experience with shipping software on behalf of a major brand at scale What you will do: Improve Netflix Live playback experience through adaptive streaming designs Design tools and systems to facilitate adaptive streaming algorithm designs and improve the playback experience Design metrics that capture the viewer’s experience as well as the system performance Run controlled experiments on millions of streaming sessions to validate improvements Work cross-functionally with Netflix CDN, Encoding Technologies, Data Science & Engineering, Consumer Insights, and UI Engineering To learn more Read about the Netflix culture which values freedom and responsibility, enabling us to do our best work Watch the video to learn how Netflix streaming works and how we design adaptive streaming algorithms Watch the video to learn how we improve the experimentation methodology with Bayesian Optimization Read the tech blog to learn how we launch the high-quality audio experience at Netflix Read this paper to learn how we make Netflix traffic friendlier on the Internet while improving the quality of experience Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Netflix is revolutionizing the media and entertainment industry. Underpinning this revolution is our continued investment in leading-edge technology that spans from the member experience to Netflix employee productivity. We are looking for a manager to join our Product Strategy & Analytics team focusing on our security, privacy, and enterprise technology engineering teams (called SPACE) in our Los Gatos office. You will be partnering with senior leaders and engineers to identify and refine organizational strategies, find actionable insights, and drive operational analytics. A role is as exciting and challenging as the problems being tackled. What are our partnering teams’ challenges? On the member side, staying ahead of the dynamic security & privacy global landscape that impacts our 238M+ members and our business around the world. On the employee side, creating & maintaining an innovation-focused environment that is scalable and secure. This work includes: - Identifying and refining the primary strategies and the related key metrics that define SPACE’s work - Go-to analytics support for the entire enterprise technology engineering organization Candidates are expected to be highly analytical, self-directed, and effective communicators. They have a proven track record of cross-functional project management and analytics experience. Since Netflix is a self-service data organization, previous experience with query languages (e.g. SQL), visualization tools (e.g. Tableau), and light data manipulation experience is preferred. In addition to intellectual curiosity and aptitude, we seek candidates who are excited by technology, either from a professional or personal standpoint. Since we are closely intertwined with the engineering organization and our analytics dig deeply into technical areas, having the ability to connect Netflix’s macro business to engineering projects and the corresponding member benefits is critical for success. The ideal candidate thrives in an ambiguous, highly complex environment focused on generating results while upholding the highest personal and professional integrity and ethics. This position has no direct reports but operates at a senior level, leading cross-functional projects/teams composed of software engineers, analytics engineers, and technical program managers while collaborating with engineering leadership. This position will report directly to the Director, Strategy & Analysis, Products & Technology, and sit in our Los Gatos offices. RESPONSIBILITIES Partnering with SPACE engineering leaders to help define and refine their top objectives, including establishing comprehensive key metrics Driving a metrics review process that spans a 600+ engineering organization. Acting as an analytics engineer for the enterprise technology engineering organization for their top data asks Collaborating closely with Engineering and Data Science teams to drive timely and high-impact work. QUALIFICATIONS 6+ years of experience in an analytics and/or strategy role – worked in a consulting firm, strategy & operations or analytics at a technology company, or similarly demanding functions in which strategic analysis, partner management, and operational optimization are essential. Experience working as a business partner with technical engineering teams or a strong interest and understanding of the tech industry. Experience in the information security industry is highly preferred. Ability to present and context switch between peer groups and senior leadership, especially in technical topics. Excels at working on highly ambiguous, cross-functional projects. Ability to independently explore and understand high-volume datasets - familiarity with SQL or other query languages. Working knowledge of visualization tools (i.e. Tableau). Undergraduate degree in finance, economics, mathematics, engineering/computer science, or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative competence. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $470,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
